Job Summary:

About Huawei
With 194,000 employees and operating in more than 170 countries and regions, Huawei is a leading global creator and provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. Integrated solutions span across four key domains - telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services. Huawei is committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

About Huawei Canada
Huawei Canada focuses on fundamental research and development aimed at solving complex technical problems in emerging technologies like 5G, AI, Human Computer Interaction and Autonomous Driving. With ongoing research initiatives with 10 Universities across Canada and strategic collaboration agreements with several Universities, we support Canada's rich research community. In 2020, Huawei Canada ranked among the Top 20 corporate R&D investors in the country with a huge 40% increase in R&D investment year over year. Huawei Canada was established in 2008 and now has a total workforce of 1,200 in our six research

Job Responsibilities:

Huawei Canada has an immediate 8-month co-op opening for a Test Engineer.

About the team:
Huawei Canada's Advanced Optical Technology Lab focuses on advanced R&D in high-performance optical communications and networking. Our expert team specializes in transmission algorithms, systems, physics, and optical network management. The lab engages in projects ranging from deep research to developing key product features, actively participating in standards organizations and collaborative research with partners. Our multicultural environment fosters innovation, mentorship, and a passion for learning. If you thrive on solving complex technical challenges, this lab is your ideal place.

About the job:

Configure and operate a custom high-speed optical test platform (e.g., coherent transceivers, optical amplifiers, etc.)
Validate DSP algorithms through rigorous experimental testing
Document test procedures and results
Design Python-based automation scripts to streamline instrument control and data logging
Optimize test sequences for reliability and speed (e.g., parallelizing measurements with multithreading)

Required Skills:

About the ideal candidate:

Bachelor's student pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field
Proficiency in Python
Hands-on lab experience (e.g., coursework with optical components or measurement equipment)
Knowledge of optical communication concepts is an asset
Familiarity with machine learning is an asset

Compensation and Benefits:

To be discussed with students

Job Summary:

Join OpenText's Digital Organization
Be part of the OpenText's Digital Organization - IT and Cloud Operations team, where you'll work with leading technologies to keep our cloud running smoothly. In this fast-moving, innovative environment, your ideas and contributions will help power the systems that keep global business running.

Your Impact
Join us as a NOC Intern in our Global Network Operations Command Centre in Waterloo-a modern hub designed to drive innovation through advanced technologies and automation. You'll play a hands-on role in monitoring and supporting applications, systems, and networks, helping keep our services running smoothly for customers around the world. This is your chance to gain real-world experience, learn from experts, and contribute to improving processes, optimizing operations, and delivering exceptional experiences. If you love problem-solving, learning new technologies, and finding ways to make systems better, this role is for you!

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do

Monitor system components, software, networking infrastructure, and hardware to ensure availability, reliability, and performance.
Assist with triaging and resolving issues reported by internal and external monitoring tools.
Support communication of planned and unplanned service interruptions to internal teams and customers.
Contribute to process improvements, documentation, and knowledge sharing within the NOC team.
Help manage access for internal SaaS applications and cloud environments like AWS.
Collaborate with engineers and other teams to implement solutions that enhance system performance and customer experience.

Required Skills:

What It Takes

You're currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT, or a related field.
You're curious, analytical, and enjoy digging into problems to find clear, practical solutions.
You're comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-energy environment where your work makes a real impact.
You're collaborative, proactive, and eager to learn from experienced professionals.
You have strong communication skills and confidence interacting with different teams and stakeholders.
Familiarity with SaaS applications and cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plus.
One Last Thing
This is your opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a cutting-edge network operations environment while contributing to a world-class team. If you're ready to learn, grow, and make an impact-we can't wait to meet you.

Compensation and Benefits:

Dependent on work term number and program of study.

Job Summary:

Join OpenText's Digital Organization
Be part of the OpenText's Digital Organization - IT and Cloud Operations team, where you'll work with leading technologies to keep our cloud running smoothly. In this fast-moving, innovative environment, your ideas and contributions will help power the systems that keep global business running.

Your Impact
As a Project Coordinator Co-op within the Chief Digital Office (CDO) Project Management Office (PMO), you'll support initiatives that power the organization's digital strategy and technology transformation. You'll work alongside experienced project managers and digital leaders, gaining hands-on exposure to how large-scale digital projects are planned, executed, and delivered. This role offers a front-row seat to the inner workings of a modern digital organization-giving you practical experience, in-demand skills, and a strong foundation for a future career in project coordination, project management, or digital operations.

Supporting project planning and scheduling by helping define scope, timelines, and key milestones

Collaborating with teams by participating in meetings and supporting communication across stakeholders
Maintaining project documentation, including plans, reports, and process documentation
Assisting with risk identification and learning how mitigation strategies are developed

You don't need to know everything-we're here to help you learn. You'll thrive in this role if you bring:

This internship is designed to help you grow. You'll receive mentorship, real responsibility, and exposure to tools and processes used by professionals every day. Join OpenText's Digital Organization
Be part of the OpenText's Digital Organization - IT and Cloud Operations team, where you'll work with leading technologies to keep our cloud running smoothly. In this fast-moving, innovative environment, your ideas and contributions will help power the systems that keep global business running.

Your Impact
As a Salesforce Developer Co-op Student, you'll be part of a dynamic team that designs, builds, and enhances OpenText's Salesforce ecosystem-supporting critical business functions and improving user experience. You'll gain hands-on experience developing and configuring Salesforce applications while learning how enterprise cloud systems are built, scaled, and optimized. This role offers an opportunity to apply your classroom knowledge to real-world challenges and make a tangible impact on how our teams work and connect with customers.

Assist in developing, testing, and deploying custom Salesforce applications using Apex, Lightning Web Components (LWC), and Flow.

Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and daily stand-ups to learn agile delivery practices.

Contribute ideas to improve system performance, usability, and user experience.

Real-world experience building and supporting enterprise-grade Salesforce solutions.
Mentorship from experienced Salesforce developers and architects.
Exposure to CI/CD pipelines, DevOps tools, and integration frameworks.

Join us and be part of a collaborative tech community, surrounded by mentors who want to see you succeed, in a culture that celebrates curiosity, creativity, and continuous learning - while giving you the opportunity to solve real problems, explore new ideas, and launch your career in cloud technology.

Job Summary:

CGI has a unique and challenging opportunity for a proactive leader with strong organizational ability, a keen analytical mind, who is relationship savvy, and has a desire to work with CGI's senior leaders to help to plan and support CGI as we continue to grow.

Supporting four GTA business units, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to display their solid academic background combined with an ambitious entrepreneurial spirit and an affinity to work closely with CGI's senior level management.

This role requires the incumbent to work within tight timelines, with competing priorities and evolving requirements.

Perks of Being a CGI Co-op:
• Participate in monthly socials to meet co-ops across the country.
• Access professional development workshops hosted by domain experts on topics ranging from how to be a top consultant, how to apply the agile methodology, data & analytics and more!

To learn more about CGI and hear from our Co-ops and New Grads, visit www.cgi.com/startmycareer

Job Responsibilities:

Your future duties and responsibilities:
• Extract and analyze data from multiple sources and present results for BU strategy decisions. Material must be streamlined, accurate and presented so management can action as needed.
• Prepare and distribute data analysis with a focus on the effective representation of quantitative information
• Manage CRM system and ensure compliance with CGI's best practices.
• Local Account Representative on CRM (MS Dynamics) for GTA. The representative would resolve issues with updating accounts, creating accounts and providing support to members on CRM.
• Provide sales support to management teams including opportunity tracking, forecasting, deal reviews, advanced sales metrics and reporting, account planning and sales force management.
• Co-ordinate material and feedback from multiple sources including the senior leadership team, Finance, Communications and Human Resources to ensure complete and accurate account from all parties.
• Educate and assist members in the proper use of CGI systems and processes.
• Collaborate with Directors, and PCOs to ensure business operations is running smoothly while all processes are followed for audit purposes.
• Lead off shore teams to ensure quality deliverables that meet the needs of the BU.
• Take initiative to ensure the BU meets CGI targets for initiatives as required.
• Develop, prepare and present weekly Business Unit Review meetings for directors and senior management.
• Support the team by running/participating in various internal mini-projects that bring value to our members
• Subject matter expert for CGI CRM (MS Dynamics), PSA Finance 9.2, Intellx, RM, and Ensemble

Required Skills:

Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
• Experience working in an Operations role
• Proactive Leader
• Analytical with Financial acumen
• Understanding of data analysis, Financial analysis and financial management (budgeting, estimating, financial analysis)
• Attention to detail is imperative as data must be accurate and explainable for management decision making.
• Advanced MS Office Skills with a focus on PowerPoint and Excel experience with macros an asset
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• A keen interest/understanding in technology is an asset
• Quick learner who is flexible and able to multi-task while still adhering to detail
• Confident and comfortable interacting with senior leaders at all levels in the organization
• Performs well under pressure
• Strong problem-solving skills
• Positive attitude with a strong desire to learn
• Excellent organizational and time management/prioritization abilities.

Skills:

Administrative Support
Operations Management

Compensation and Benefits:

CGI is providing a reasonable estimate of the pay range for this role. The determination of this range includes factors such as skill set level, geographic market, experience and training, and licenses and certifications. Compensation decisions depend on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $18-32/hour. This role is an existing vacancy.

Job Summary:

Market Making, Automated Trading Strategies - Global Equity Derivatives

Automated trading is a growing trend in the Canadian market place, and working first-hand with TD's systems will give you a wealth of experience for future work in this field, or any field involving intelligent, real-time systems. Our desk currently trades several billion dollars in notional value daily through proprietary principal algorithms and is the largest market maker in Canada in single stock equities.

We are looking for an individual who is technically strong, enjoys programming and is solid at solving problems. Traditional finance experience is not required but interest in learning about markets is crucial.

You will have the opportunity to work in the front office with modern trading technologies and learn how technological advances impact the equity markets. You will use your high-level thinking and problem solving skills to make our automated trading systems smarter, faster, and more profitable. You will be exposed to the extremely fast paced and demanding environment of a trading floor as a valued member of our trading desk. In this position you will assume considerable responsibility and have a direct impact on the profitability of the group.

This role is part of the larger Global Equity Derivatives team that has a global presence across regions with offices in: Singapore, London, New York and Toronto. This is a unique learning opportunity to work closely with market experts in the ETF, Single Stock, Options and Equity Swap trading desks.

Job Responsibilities:

This position will provide you with in-depth knowledge of equity trading and market microstructure. The team is close-knit and will take the time to answer your questions, develop your skills, and help advance your career. The software development and design work will reinforce the problem solving and critical thinking skills you already have, but will provide a daily challenge that will keep you both busy and engaged.

Required Skills:

Required skills:

Solid software development skills, preferably in Python (we do not use Excel or VBA)
Proven ability to work with large datasets (SQL / Parquets)
Ability to build and extend software components on a multi-faceted infrastructure
Beneficial skills:
Software design patterns
Scripting in Python
Fluency in operating on Unix / Linux based systems
Other requirements:
Interest in Equity Markets and Trading
Work efficiently under pressure, often with near-term deadlines
Take pride and stand behind your work

Compensation and Benefits:

We're committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with your recruiter and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.

Job Summary:

At CGI we are committed to investing in the next generation of women leaders. Diversity of thought and experience are integral to pushing the boundaries of emerging technologies. Join our WiSE (Women in STEM Excel) co-op program designed specifically to prepare and equip future women leaders through mentorship, vast networking opportunities and professional development workshops.

The WiSE (Women in STEM Excel) co-op program accelerates the development of future women leaders by providing a customized experience for participants

We are looking for a motivated and curious AI Co-op Student to join our team and support our ongoing efforts to explore, develop, and integrate Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) into our IT solutions. The individual will work closely with team members to analyze use case, experiment with AI tools, and contribute to innovation in a real business context.

This role requires the co-op student to work within tight timelines, with competing priorities and evolving requirements. In an effort to foster collaboration and partner with clients, co-op students will be required to be in the office multiple times a week at our 150 Commerce Valley Drive West office in Markham.

Job Responsibilities:

Your future duties and responsibilities:
- Assist in identifying AI/ML use cases within our organization (e.g., predictive analytics, intelligent automation, natural language processing).
- Explore and prototype AI solutions using tools such as Python, Azure/OpenAI, HuggingFace, Gemini, CoPilot, LLMs etc.
- Support data preprocessing, cleaning, and analysis to feed models or evaluate feasibility.

Job Summary:

Position: Facilities Coordinator, Research (Co-op)
Site: Princess Margaret Cancer Research Tower
Department: Research Laboratory Services
Reports to: Manager, Research Laboratory Services
Term: 8-month Co-op

University Health Network (UHN) Research Laboratory Services supports the safe, compliant, and uninterrupted operation of biomedical research laboratories across UHN. This includes laboratory infrastructure, specialized research equipment, environmental controls, and the regulatory requirements needed to support world-class cancer and life-sciences research.

The Facilities Coordinator (Research) Co-op Student will support the day-to-day operations of active research laboratories within the Princess Margaret Cancer Research Tower and other UHN research facilities. Working closely with scientists, laboratory staff, facilities teams, and external service providers, the student will help ensure that research environments remain safe, functional, and ready to support critical experiments and clinical research.

The student will be assigned projects and operational tasks within the Laboratory Operations team, including collecting and organizing laboratory and equipment data, tracking service and maintenance activities, preparing summaries, reports, and presentations, and supporting ongoing initiatives to improve how research facilities are managed and supported. This role also includes assisting in the development and rollout of new processes and tools used by UHN Research Facilities & Operations to support a large, complex research environment.

The student will work across multiple research buildings on the UHN campus, gaining hands-on exposure to how large-scale hospital-based research laboratories are supported, maintained, and continuously improved.

Job Responsibilities:

The student will support the day-to-day operations and improvement of biomedical research facilities within UHN. During this 8-month co-op placement, the student will contribute to projects related to laboratory renovations, relocations, and operational readiness, helping ensure that research spaces remain safe, compliant, and fully functional.

Key responsibilities include:

Supporting the planning and implementation of laboratory renovations, moves, and space reconfigurations, including tracking requirements, schedules, and impacts to active research programs.
Collecting, validating, and organizing data related to laboratory spaces, infrastructure, and research equipment, including maintaining Excel-based inventories, asset lists, and floor plans.
Assisting with the preparation and updating of CAD drawings and space records to reflect current laboratory layouts and equipment locations.
Developing and updating operational documentation, including procedures, guides, and department process manuals used by Research Laboratory Services.
Creating clear, professional communication materials such as posters, signage, and informational tools to support laboratory users and operational initiatives.
Preparing summaries, reports, and presentations to support project tracking, decision-making, and communication with stakeholders.
Working with laboratory staff, facilities teams, and external vendors to support service requests, equipment installations, and facility-related activities.

Required Skills:

Currently enrolled in a co-op or internship program in engineering, life sciences, health sciences, building sciences, or a related field.
Strong organizational, analytical, and project coordination skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced, regulated environment.
Interest in or exposure to research laboratory facilities and equipment, including mechanical, electrical, and environmental systems supporting biomedical research (asset).
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), with experience organizing and analyzing data in spreadsheets and preparing professional reports and presentations.
Experience using design and communication tools such as Canva or similar platforms to create clear, user-friendly materials.
Familiarity with Copilot or other AI/LLM tools to assist with drafting, data organization, or documentation is an asset.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, particularly when working with technical data, space records, or equipment information.
Demonstrated customer-service mindset when working with researchers, technical staff, and external vendors.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate clearly in a scientific and operational environment.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a multidisciplinary team.
Comfortable working in active laboratory environments and performing light physical tasks, including walking through facilities and lifting items up to approximately 30 lbs.

Transportation and Housing:

Student is responsible for their own transportation and housing.

Additional Information:

Security Clearance Required


Compensation and Benefits:

Salary: $25 per hour, 37.5 hours per week.
Location: Toronto, multiple sites in the downtown core.
This position is for 100% on-site work.

Job Summary:

VelocityEHS differentiates its offering in the marketplace by providing service and support that is unparalleled in its industry. From manufacturing to food & beverage, from chemicals to pharmaceuticals, our customers use our best-in-class software solutions for Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) and Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) to make workplaces safer and more sustainable.

Our Customer Experience (CX) Interns collaborate with multiple teams throughout the department, including Services, Success, Support, and more. You will contribute to the department's objectives and success through project work to streamline processes, execute deliverables, and bridge gaps between teams. We encourage exposure to a broad range of initiatives, and so you may also be asked to support cross-departmental initiatives with Sales, Product, Development, and Marketing. This internship provides a great opportunity to understand the intricacies of delivering a global customer experience.

Job Responsibilities:

We're looking for interns who will above all bring a positive attitude and a critical take on problem solving. An ideal candidate has excellent people skills, strong attention to detail, the drive to execute efficiently, and the willingness to contribute to a team-focused dynamic. If you want to make a difference by being part of a solution that improves the workers' lives across environment, health, safety, and sustainability, this may be the right opportunity for you.

In this role, you will support our Customer Experience department alongside a mentor, a manager, and a core group of other interns on a daily basis. You will also work with multiple teams across the department over the course of your internship, and have opportunities to give presentations, manage projects, and set your own goals. You will complete onboarding and performance reviews similar to a full-time employee to gain experience and valuable feedback. Additionally, you will have access to Managers, Directors, and VPs on a regular basis.

In a typical week, you will manage various projects and deadlines. Project work varies from independent to collaborative, short term to long term. Past projects for interns in the CX department have included: contributing to the content and design of our customer Help Center, reaching out to customers as part of our User Conference campaigns, maintaining regulatory lists for chemical management, and testing the effectiveness of motion capture technology for ergonomics.

We are offering remote or hybrid work for this position. We have offices in Oakville, Ontario and Ann Arbor, Michigan. If you are a collaborative, positive, and detailed worker and this internship appeals to you, consider applying.

Required Skills:

Qualifications:

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in a science-related field. For example: Kinesiology, Engineering, Public and Occupational Health, Safety, Environmental Science
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Experience working independently as well as in a team setting
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Organized, thorough, and attentive to detail
Preferred Skills and Qualifications:
Knowledge and experience in either/both Software and Environmental, Health & Safety industries is a plus
Previous related internship/work term experience preferred.

Transportation and Housing:

Remote in USA or Canada.

Compensation and Benefits:

$20-$25 hourly
Competitive hourly rates + a $100 monthly work-from-home stipend intended to help offset the costs of working remotely. In addition, our interns have access to wellness resources including Modern Health- a mental health care platform.

Job Summary:

Join OpenText's Digital Organization
Be part of the OpenText's Digital Organization, IT and Cloud Operations team, where you'll work with leading technologies to keep our cloud running smoothly. In this fast-moving, innovative environment, your ideas and contributions will help power the systems that keep global business running.

Your Impact
As an AI Enablement & Governance Co-op, you'll be part of the team shaping how OpenText responsibly adopts and scales Artificial Intelligence across the organization. Your work will help ensure that AI is implemented safely, ethically, and effectively, driving innovation while maintaining trust and accountability. You'll support both the strategic and hands-on sides of AI, contributing to frameworks, tools, and real-world AI solutions that make an impact.

Job Responsibilities:

What You Will Do

Evaluate AI use cases: Partner with business and technical teams to document, assess, and track AI initiatives to ensure they align with OpenText's goals and responsible AI principles.
Support governance frameworks: Help design and refine processes that balance innovation with accountability, ensuring AI use meets ethical and regulatory standards.
Create tools and documentation: Assist in building templates, dashboards, and process materials for AI intake, evaluation, and lifecycle management.
Maintain the AI Use Case Inventory: Contribute to tracking and updating enterprise AI initiatives across departments.
Collaborate on AI innovation: Join brainstorming and design sessions to identify new opportunities for AI-driven value creation.
Develop and test AI pilots: Work alongside technical experts to build proof-of-concepts that integrate AI into real workflows.
Share your insights: Prepare and present demos, findings, or recommendations to leadership teams.
Build community: Help plan and support internal AI learning events, hackathons, and community meetups that bring teams together to explore new ideas.

Required Skills:

What It Takes

You're currently enrolled in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Business Technology Management, or a related field.
You have a foundational understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts such as NLP, generative AI, and supervised learning.
You're a strong communicator who can explain complex ideas in a clear and approachable way.
You're analytical, detail-oriented, and curious about how technology and governance work together.
You're collaborative, proactive, and eager to learn in a fast-evolving area of tech.
What You Will Learn
How large organizations operationalize AI responsibly balancing innovation with governance.
The inner workings of AI enablement frameworks, from intake and evaluation to implementation.
How to design, prototype, and test AI solutions that make a measurable business impact.
The art of communicating technical ideas and presenting to senior stakeholders.
How to contribute to enterprise-level AI strategy and culture, including community building and events.
One Last Thing
This is your chance to be at the forefront of responsible AI adoption at a global technology leader. You'll gain real-world experience in both the strategic and technical sides of AI-and see firsthand how your work helps shape OpenText's digital future. If you're passionate about the intersection of innovation, ethics, and technology, we'd love to have you on our team.

Job Summary:

CNA is the 8th largest U.S. commercial property and casualty insurance company. Founded in 1897, CNA has over 6,000 employees, serving businesses and professionals in the U.S., Canada, and Europe.

At CNA, every person plays an important role in bringing nothing but the best to our customers. If you're looking for a career in a company that's evolving, has a great culture and amazing opportunities within the Insurance Industry, CNA is the clear choice. As part of the CNA team, you'll work with motivated team members who have pride in - and passion for - what they do. Guided by our core values, we remain steadfast to our commitment to career growth and development for all levels of team members so they may navigate their own future and grow with the company. We are deeply rooted in our history and bringing together the best minds in insurance.

This role provides high level support to our Actuary Department.

THE RIGHT CHOICE FOR YOUR WORK TERM / INTERNSHIP

As a commitment to our student hires, all responsibilities, performance, goals and professional development are reviewed by team members both at the beginning and end of the semester.
All students will be involved with teams of professionals at all levels who serve as both instructors and mentors - within this environment, ideas are continuously shared, and creative thinking and individual initiative are encouraged.
Our co-op students will be given set day-to-day activities, as well as large projects, that they can cite as concrete achievements upon the end of their semester with us.

Job Responsibilities:

OBJECTIVES

Use actuarial techniques to support the Actuarial Department in analyzing, pricing and monitoring risks; the risks will include Property, Casualty, Auto, Marine and Specialty lines.
Continually improve existing processes throughout program.
RESPONSIBILITIES - WHAT YOU WILL DO
Learn about actuarial pricing and assist in pricing reviews of large accounts and programs.
Assist in producing monthly pricing metrics, portfolio dashboards and branch P&L.
Updated existing pricing and portfolio management tools and find ways to improve current processes.
Assist in collecting data and producing analytics for portfolio reviews, planning and year-end reporting.
Prepare, validate and analyze exposure, premium and claims data as basis for actuarial analyses.
Collaborate with Underwriting, Finance, IT, Claims and Risk Control on ad-hoc projects.
In all responsibilities and interactions, all employees are expected to adopt and align with CNA's Winning Behaviours - to be externally focused, accountable, collaborative, innovative, inclusive, and continuously learning.

Required Skills:

QUALIFICATIONS

Current Bachelor's degree co-op student with a history of strong academic performance.
Proven track record in customer service with excellent interpersonal skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as strong analytical, organizational and time management skills; must be detail-oriented.
Ability to conceptualize details and develop action plans for problem solving and decision making.
Ability to work both independently and within a team environment with limited supervision.
Personal integrity, initiative and leadership qualities.
Experience with Alteryx, SQL, VBA is considered an asset.

Compensation and Benefits:

Our Total Rewards philosophy reflects our commitment to building a high-performing, inclusive culture where every team member is empowered to grow, contribute, and thrive. We value the unique strengths and perspectives each individual brings to our business, our clients, and our communities. For this Co-op position, the hourly rate is $25 to $33.50, and is determined by the number of work terms the student has completed.

Please note that this posting is for an existing vacancy.

Job Summary:

Titan is building the first AI-native registered investment advisor (RIA). Backed by some of Silicon Valley's best (a16z, GC, Sam Altman), we manage the wealth of tens of thousands of clients, with billions in assets. Consumer finance is approaching its graduation, from the era of fast-money trading to thoughtful wealth management. The problem is that most are rightfully skeptical of the "old white guy" charging exorbitant fees to help you navigate all your wealth's complexities. Good news: this can be completely disrupted with humans & AI working in tandem. You will help build Titan into the first jaw-dropping experience in the advisory space.

Why Join Titan
For the right person, we believe Titan will be one of the most rewarding jobs they ever have.

World-Class Investors: We're backed by top investors who share our bold vision, including a16z, General Catalyst, Sam Altman.
Critical Why Now: The advent of LLMs enables Titan to be the first AI-native advisor in history (if you needed a peek at our roadmap, here you go)...right on time for new generations reaching adulthood.
Disproportionate Impact: Because we're still a small team, you'll help define the entirety of the product, not parts of it.
Vibrant in-person culture: We thrive on being a high-collaboration team, bouncing ideas off each other, working together every day in person.
Big Vision, Big Risks: We believe in taking bold opportunities. You'll find we're a high courage team, seeking asymmetric product experiences.
Now let's talk about you. We're highly selective with who we choose to bring onto the team, but if you resonate with the above, we'd love to meet you.

Job Responsibilities:

As a Fullstack Software Engineering Intern based out of our New York HQ you'll be responsible for building across the stack to support and delight tens of thousands of our clients.

From our award-winning mobile app (written in React Native) to our content generation and admin tools (written in React) to our backend systems that transact millions of dollars a day (node.js) all the way to our DB (mongo) you'll work on whatever part of the stack is necessary to deliver projects quickly, efficiently and securely. You'll develop innovative AI-powered features and systems, working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure they align with our product vision and user needs.

You'll work closely senior members of the engineering team to ensure the continued stability, scalability and security of Titan's systems. You'll also work cross-functionally with our design, product and customer experience teams to deliver delightful experiences that have never before been seen in a financial product.

Required Skills:

We're looking for someone who has:

A strong technical background (with 2 or more internships experience) and has experience building applications using JavaScript / TypeScript.
Experience working across the stack from browser tweaks to get the rendering just right to storing new data in the database and everywhere in between.
A desire to get better everyday. Titan's best days are still to come and so are yours.
An ability to work in a fast paced environment with subject matter experts from across the company.
A strong sense of responsibility and integrity. We're a fiduciary of our clients and we always act with their best interests at heart.
Ability to work out of our NYC HQ

Transportation and Housing:

No housing and no transportation provided.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation:

Anticipated hourly salary range: $40 to $45 USD + rent assistance - Estimated 40 hours per week
At Titan, we are committed to offering competitive compensation package for our valued team members, as well as attract and retain a top talent pool that is aligned with our culture, mission, and values. This salary range represents Titan's reasonable estimated possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting.
The final salary for this position will be determined in sole discretion of Titan, depending on applicable laws, and based on a variety of factors, such as employee's work experience, skills, qualifications for the role, and location, and may differ from the amounts listed above.
Benefits/Perks
Work with a passionate, diverse, smart team on a product that helps tens of thousands of people
NYC Townhouse HQ to work out of
Backed by top-tier VCs (Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst, Sound Ventures, Scribble VC, Y Combinator, BoxGroup, and others)
MacBook / PC laptop provided
Lunch 3 times a week @ our headquarters

Job Summary:

Join OpenText's Digital Organization
Be part of the OpenText's Digital Organization-IT and Cloud Operations team, where you'll work with leading technologies to keep our cloud running smoothly. In this fast-moving, innovative environment, your ideas and contributions will help power the systems that keep global business running.

Your Impact
Join us as an AI & Business Intern in our Cloud Platforms & AIOps organization, in Waterloo, a modern hub designed to drive innovation through advanced technologies and automation. You'll play a hands-on role in supporting a strategic program injecting AI into our IT systems and operations, helping OpenText accelerate, scale, and outperform. This is your chance to gain real-world experience, learn from experts, and contribute to enhancing software, systems and processes, and delivering transformative AI-augmented outcomes. If you love bridging technology and business domains, learning new technologies, and applying planning, analysis, and technical skills to help introduce new and enhanced capabilities, this role is for you!

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do

Support a major program of work introducing transformative AI capabilities into our Global Command Center in Waterloo HQ, and wider IT organization
Review incoming AI agent development opportunities (new, enhancements) and help run the demand pipeline
Capture high-level requirements and surrounding process from business stakeholders, produce outline business case, review technical and financial feasibility
Assess requirements against known AI agent development patterns, perform gap analysis, feature and user story definition
Help plan and manage the agile backlog of AI agent development work within the wider program
Contribute to development of AI software components (agents, patterns, MCP Server tools) and related data products
Contribute to AIOps process improvements, documentation, and knowledge sharing within the Cloud Platform & AIOps team.
Collaborate with engineers and other teams to implement agentic AI solutions that enhance performance and deliver transformative business outcomes.

Required Skills:

What It Takes

You're currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT, or a related field.
You're curious, analytical, and enjoy digging into problems to find clear, practical solutions.
You're comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-energy environment where your work makes a real impact.
You're collaborative, proactive, and eager to learn from experienced professionals.
You have strong communication skills and confidence interacting with different teams and stakeholders.
Familiarity with AI principles and agent development approaches and tooling are an advantage.
Familiarity with business analysis frameworks, and techniques such as requirements engineering, gap analysis, business case development, workshop facilitation, are an advantage.
Familiarity with program and project management frameworks, and stakeholder management approaches are an advantage.
Familiarity with agile development practices (SAFe), product ownership, and backlog management is a plus.
Familiarity with data governance and data management principles, data-flow diagrams and entity-relationship models, are a plus.
Familiarity with SaaS applications and cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plus.
One Last Thing
This is your opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a cutting-edge cloud platforms and AI environment while contributing to a world-class team. If you're ready to learn, grow, and make an impact-we can't wait to meet you.

Dependent on work term number and program of study.

Job Summary:

Student, Digital Transformation
At Fidelity, we've been helping Canadian investors build better financial futures for over 35 years. We offer individuals and institutions a range of trusted investment portfolios and services - and we're constantly seeking to find new and better ways to help our clients. As a privately owned company, we boldly embrace innovation in all areas as we continue to grow our business into the future.

Working with us means you'll be part of a diverse and dedicated group of people who make a real difference for our clients and communities every day. You'll have a wide range of opportunities to grow and develop your career in an inclusive environment where you'll feel valued and supported to be your best - both personally and professionally.

What we do:
Fidelity offers you the chance to build a career, develop professionally and explore different career paths throughout the company. Students are placed into an area of interest and will be provided with a mentor to support them throughout their journey. We offer our students an extensive training program to help enhance skills in communication, public speaking, networking, business etiquette and emotional intelligence. Fidelity proudly supports various non-profit organizations and provides students with the opportunity to volunteer to make a difference in their community. You've worked hard to prepare yourself for a great career. No matter what your undergraduate degree is in, there is an opportunity for you at Fidelity.

How you'll make an impact:
As a Student, Digital Transformation, you will be working as part of the Digital Transformation team within Client Services to support a company-wide initiative leading to a client-centric and highly digital organization. You will have the opportunity to work with stakeholders across the company to support the overall initiative.
You will have the opportunity to:

Gather and analyze information to help track initiatives
Participate in planning and execution of digital initiatives
Be part of a team and contribute to an important strategic initiative
Learn about and interact with various divisions across Fidelity

You like working with a team as well as autonomously
You know when to take initiative and when to ask for clarification or help

The candidate will work closely with team members to analyze use case, experiment with AI tools, and contribute to innovation in a real business context.

Perks of Being a CGI Co-op:

• Access professional development workshops hosted by domain experts on topics ranging from how to be a top consultant, how to apply the agile methodology, data & analytics and more!

To learn more about CGI and hear from our Co-ops and New Grads, visit www.cgi.com/startmycareer

Your future duties and responsibilities:

• Familiarity with AI/ML concepts such as supervised/unsupervised learning, NLP, or computer vision.

What You'll Gain:

Job Summary:

Leading the charge of developing cutting edge hardware systems.
Shaping the future of computing in key industries, turning ideas into reality.
Collaborative and highly skilled cross-functional team.
That is what we do and who we are at J-Squared.

Are you passionate about using disruptive technology to solve problems previously unachievable? Are you excited about the latest innovations that are allowing us to create more powerful hardware in smaller form factors? Do you like getting your hands dirty while driving results and collaborating with colleagues? If this interests you, then we have an opportunity waiting for you!

What will your typical day look like?
J-Squared specializes in providing rugged computing solutions for the most physically demanding environments. These include markets such as Smart Mining and Military Autonomous Vehicles. As a member of our Engineering team, you will be responsible for researching the needs, relevant technologies and potential products for next generation solutions serving these markets. This includes fundamental research to understand the needs of these markets, how those needs are being addressed today, emerging technologies in AI, Edge Compute and thermal solutions that would better address these needs and ultimately proposing a product roadmap to drive the next generation of business at J-Squared. You will work with a cross-functional team, including AI software and data scientists, engineering and product managers to help define our growth opportunities and future product direction.

About Our Team
J-Squared has over 30 years of experience excelling in operationally demanding performance environments. Our ruggedized products and solutions are innovative, needs driven, and focused on quality and reliability. Our Octagon Systems line of products is a global leader in rugged computer systems built for use in extreme environments such as mining, defence & military, transportation, and marine. We architect and manufacture systems that work no matter what. J-Squared's significant growth has resulted in the company expanding its team to meet this increased demand.

Job Responsibilities:

Specifically, you will be responsible for

Focussed Market Research
Within an assigned market (Smart Mining or Autonomous Vehicles), perform detailed technical analysis on the needs of these markets. Who are the major players? What problems are typically encountered? How are these problems addressed?
Determine what competitors are currently serving these markets and develop a detailed understanding of their solutions.
Technology Review and Analysis
Develop an understanding of the technologies and system architectures that are being used today to address the needs of the target market or could be used in the future to better address these challenges
Understand the alignment of these technologies with the current capabilities of J-Squared
Determine and document any technology gaps
Engage with industry technology partners to determine how best to close these gaps
Solution Proposals, Roadmap and Feature Specifications
Define and document a roadmap of products and/or services that could be developed by J-Squared to address the needs of the target market with the identified technologies.
Develop a high-level product specification with sufficient detail to provide to the engineering department to begin product development.

Required Skills:

Enough About Us, Let's Talk About You
For a candidate to be successful in this role, the key qualifications include:

You should be a senior student in a current Engineering or Math-and-Business program
Ideally, you would have some cross-functional experience or familiarity with both relevant technologies like Edge AI and computer vision, plus some experience in the identified target markets
Product Management experience, or a strong interest in a career in Product Management would be ideal.
Additionally, we are looking for someone who is:
Highly motivated and energetic
Strong problem-solving skills and strategic thinking ability
Excellent team player with strong communication and collaboration skills

Compensation and Benefits:

Monthly salary range of $5,100 - $5,700/month, depending on student's seniority, program, and past experience.

Flexible/hybrid work arrangements possible. Free parking at all locations.

Job Summary:

Tangam is a small and rapidly growing company, with double digit annual sales growth, that is at the cutting edge of developing data analytics and visualization software. Our flagship product Table Games Yield Management (TYM) helps casinos optimize their table games operations in order to increase profitability and enhance the player experience. Our software takes the complexity out of data analytics and makes data understandable and actionable to ordinary users. Many large, medium and small casinos in the U.S., Canada, and Australia already use TYM successfully to enhance their business and better satisfy their patrons. Our patented products have won numerous industry awards and recognitions. We continue to push the envelope on what is possible in the area of data analytics software, and we are always seeking new talent to join us on our exciting journey.

We are seeking software developers to be an important part of our core product development team.

Job Responsibilities:

What we're hoping you will achieve ... (circa end of work term)

Your potential story, 4 months from now....We'd like to thank you for your contributions that helped the company launch a new software module for one of our flagship business intelligence products, create a new line of revenue, and win two more industry awards. Here are some of your contributions as a member of our core software development team:

You developed features/bug fixes for a new module that helped our customers maintain a pulse on key business performance indicators and trouble shoot operations problems ten times faster than what was possible before
You utilized efficient algorithm design and modern web technologies such as Angular, TypeScript, d3, ASP.NET (C#) to create dashboards that have beautiful design and instant, magical response time
You coded up prototypes for experimental products or modules in the company's long term roadmap, in collaboration with product managers and co-developers
You participated fully in the software development life cycle - seeing code through from an idea through to completion complete with unit tests and satisfied QA partners
You challenged yourself, learned from your peers, advanced your knowledge of new software tools, agile programming methods and business intelligence technologies.
You finish your work term with concrete achievements that help you be more effective in your career

Now Back to Today. If you'd like this story to be yours, apply now!

Required Skills:

Strong communication skills and demonstrated ability to work in a team environment
Proficient with C# (or similar), JavaScript / TypeScript, HTML, CSS and SQL
At least 8 months software development experience in industry (including co-op terms and internships)
Understanding of object oriented/functional programming concepts and patterns
Proficient in at least TWO of the following:
Web UX design/development experience
Database design/programming experience
Modern Web technogies e.g. HTML5/CSS3, Web sockets, ...)
.NET / C# (can be either .NET Framework or .NET 6-9)
Angular

Compensation at competitive rates. Exact values will be available when ranked.

Job Summary:

This position is for a software developer/AI automation Analyst to work as a member of the Delivery/Operations team in the Toronto Financial Services business unit (Insurance Sector).

The WiSE (women in STEM excel) co-op program accelerates the development of future women leaders by providing a customized experience for participants

Perks of Being a CGI Co-op:
• Participate in monthly socials to meet co-ops across the country.
• Access professional development workshops hosted by domain experts on topics ranging from how to be a top consultant, how to apply the agile methodology, data & analytics and more!

To learn more about CGI and hear from our Co-ops and New Grads, visit www.cgi.com/startmycareer

Job Responsibilities:

Your future duties and responsibilities:
Working closely with the Operations team, the incumbent will:
• Review manual processes within the Delivery/Operations team and replace with automation to make our processes more efficient/effective.
• Assist in identifying AI/ML use cases within our organization (e.g., predictive analytics, intelligent automation, natural language processing).
• Work with various groups (operations, new product development, test automation) to define requirements for automation opportunities.
• Use strong analysis and development skills to determine appropriate tools (Python, Java, RAG) to deliver required automation.
• Follow the SDLC cycle and CGI processes to ensure development, quality and delivery standards are met.
• Provide stakeholders transparency on automation tasks and status.
• Explore and prototype AI solutions using tools such as Python, Java, RAG , LLM etc
• Support data preprocessing, cleaning, and analysis to feed models or evaluate feasibility.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams (IT, business analysts, developers) to define AI requirements and evaluate outcomes.
• Prepare documentation, reports, training material and presentations on AI findings and recommendations.
• Stay current on AI trends, tools, and best practices relevant to our industry.

Duties & Responsibilities:
• Document processes under review for automation.
• Prepare and review requirements documentation for proposed automation.
• Implement POCs (proof of concept) and solutions based on automation requirements.
• Deliver solutions using the agile methodology.

Key Skills:
• Proficient in one or many programming/scripting languages (Java/Python)

Required Skills:

Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
Qualifications:
• Working towards a Bachelor's Degree preferably in Computer Science/IT or related IT discipline or equivalent experience.
• Familiarity with AI/ML concepts such as supervised/unsupervised learning, NLP, or computer vision.
• Knowledge of Python and libraries like Pandas, TensorFlow, or PyTorch + Java.
• Ability to quickly understand the insurance industry and our related products.
• Should have excellent interpersonal, communication and organizational skills.
• Experience working with APIs, Java and web services.

Skills:

Artificial Intelligence
Artificial Neural Networks
Java
Python

Compensation and Benefits:

CGI is providing a reasonable estimate of the pay range for this role. The determination of this range includes factors such as skill set level, geographic market, experience and training, and licenses and certifications. Our expertise in a wide range of technologies and platforms allows us to maximize the benefit of each and deliver the most fitting solution. With our strong technological background, continuous investment in the latest tech, agile development approaches, and lean operational practices, we deliver great solutions for our clients.

You will be working in a fast pace environment where solving complex problems using simple solutions is the prime objective. You will be in a constant learning environment where each project will be a new challenge and each challenge will be a great learning experience. You will also get to work on a SaaS product under DealerAI.com, where you will design and develop AI-based chatbot applications.

Experienced with mobile app development

Job Summary:

Primary Purpose
The Systems team at the Centre for Extended Learning (CEL), designs, develops, tests, implements, supports and maintains web-based enterprise business systems driving online learning at the University of Waterloo. These are functionally and technically complex systems which integrate with University-wide ERP systems such as the student information system (SIS) and the LMS. This complexity encompasses all aspects of the technical infrastructure supporting these applications' life cycles including network and operating systems layer, database layer, programming languages, delivery methods, as well as implementation and support methodologies. Reporting to an Information Systems Specialist and working in conjunction with each unit in CEL as necessary, the Junior Application Developer will be accountable for the following:

Key Accountabilities

Application Design, Development and Support
Continue development of CEL's enterprise systems using React.JS, .NET technologies, MS SQL Server etc.
Continue development and documentation of other CEL systems as requested throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC).
Write clean and scalable code.
Revise, update, refactor and debug code.
Understand and translate planned and design specifications into executable code.
Must be able to work effectively with others in a team environment.
Physical and Sensory Demands: Much of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position with frequent opportunity to move about. There is a frequent need to give close attention to various communications such as email and chats on MS Teams.

Job Responsibilities:

Application Design, Development and Support
Continue development of CEL's enterprise systems using React.JS, .NET technologies, MS SQL Server etc.
Continue development and documentation of other CEL systems as requested throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC).
Write clean and scalable code.
Revise, update, refactor and debug code.
Understand and translate planned and design specifications into executable code.
Must be able to work effectively with others in a team environment.
Physical and Sensory Demands: Much of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position with frequent opportunity to move about. There is a frequent need to give close attention to various communications such as email and chats on MS Teams.

Required Skills:

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

Experience in server-side programming languages such as C# or Python.
A good understanding of database concepts.
Experience in one or more database systems such as MS SQL Server, MySQL, Postgres or MariaDB.
Skills in frontend design principles, especially for web applications, such as HTML, JavaScript, CSS etc. is required.
Experience with JavaScript library such as React.JS
Awareness of the software development life cycle.
A solid foundation in OOP & design patterns.
Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills are required.
Experience in MVC frameworks such as ASP.NET will be an advantage.
Strong attention to detail.
Working knowledge of Git, Jira and Confluence is desirable.
Contacts: CEL's Systems team, IST, ITMS, CTE, SIS support staff.
Level of Responsibility: Design, develop, test, implement, support and maintain web-based enterprise business systems executing full systems development lifecycle (SDLC) activities adhering to industry/CEL standards and best practices. Must be able to work independently with minimum supervision while collaborating effectively in a team environment.
Day-to-day usage of MS 365 tools such as MS Teams, Word, Excell, OneDrive, Share Point
Knowledge of tools such Confluence, Jira and/or Trello are desirable
Working Environment: Must be able to work from the office at University of Waterloo's East Campus 3 (EC3) at least three days a week. Must be able to effectively work from home and have all the necessary equipment such as a Windows computer capable of application development, high-speed internet access and video conferencing facilities. There are deadline pressures, while at the same time there is a demand for thoroughness and accuracy as well as shifting priorities from time to time. As we work in a production environment that thousands of users depend on hourly, occasional "crisis" events which require immediate attention and action might be required.

Compensation and Benefits:

We are following the average posted on the co-op earning page, which depends on the student program and the number of previous co-ops completed.

Job Summary:

About Base
Base is America's next-generation power company. We're rebuilding the foundation of modern civilization-electricity-by deploying a vast network of distributed batteries that is transforming today's fragile, centralized grid into a resilient and abundant system. We are engineers, operators, and creatives solving some of the most complex, interdisciplinary challenges of our time.

About the Role
At Base, we're building the operating system for American power. Our software is the brain that connects batteries, homes, neighborhoods, and the grid - and it's also the engine that runs Base itself.
As a Software Engineering Intern, you won't just watch from the sidelines. You'll ship real code that runs in production, on systems that keep power flowing to real homes. You'll help us solve problems that touch the entire company: balancing electrons in milliseconds, scaling operations across new markets, and automating processes that utilities still handle by hand.

This is an opportunity to work on one of the few systems where every line of code has real-world impact: in homes, on the grid, and in how we grow.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do

Build Production Systems: Design, build, and deploy production-grade software across our stack, from embedded software to backend infrastructure to user-facing products.
Ship Under Constraints: Write code that runs under real-world conditions, with real physical consequences if it fails. Reliability isn't an afterthought: it's the mission.
Scale Base's Operations: Contribute to the internal tools that let us expand into new markets quickly, handle permitting and deployment complexity, and orchestrate field operations at scale.
Work Across Domains: Collaborate with hardware, deployment, and operations teams to solve problems that span software and the physical world.

Required Skills:

What We're Looking For

Strong foundation in software engineering fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, systems design).
Demonstrated ability to build and ship working software -- through side projects, coursework, or prior internships.
Clear, concise communicator who thrives in collaborative, fast-paced environments.
Builder's mindset: curious, self-directed, and eager to work on problems that actually matter.

Areas You Can Work In (Please indicate your area(s) of interest when applying)
Fleet Software - Build the edge software that keeps our batteries reliable and connected.
Internal Software - Write the automation, data pipelines, and APIs that run Base as a company.
Market Infrastructure - Design backend systems that power real-time algorithms and control our distributed fleet.
Product Engineering - Build intuitive mobile and web experiences that let people see and control their energy in ways utilities never could.

Transportation and Housing:

We are fully on-site in Austin TX. Candidates will be expected to find their own housing and transportation. Stipends are not provided.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required


Compensation and Benefits:

Salary specified between $35-40 per hour depending on experience level.

What We Offer

Hands-on experience with cutting-edge software technologies.
Mentorship from experienced engineers and the opportunity to work on meaningful projects.
A dynamic and supportive work environment.
Potential for full-time opportunities based on performance.
Lunch catering every weekday
Dinner catered Monday - Thursday
Lunch and Dinner meal credits on weekends
Visa sponsorship covered.

In this role, the student will contribute to application development, AI feature integration, data workflows, and technical research to support ongoing product or engineering initiatives.

The role involves developing web applications and backend services in Python and JavaScript, contributing to document processing systems, integrating AI into customer-facing products, and improving system reliability and performance.

We love hiring Waterloo engineers to work on hard problems. And so do they. Here is what our last intern had to say about the opportunity (link).

The intern will collaborate with product designers, engineers, and customers to refine product design and functionality, prototype AI-driven features, and test and debug applications. Candidates should be pursuing a degree in software engineering (or related field), with some experience building Python-based web applications.

Key qualities include initiative, adaptability, strong communication, user empathy, and a high personal performance standard. The internship offers compensation between $60,000-$80,000 CAD, depending on skills and experience. Integrate cutting-edge AI for automation use cases and work with ML engineers to build systems that make human-level decisions in construction projects

Job Summary:

About Voltera
Voltera is a rapidly scaling technology company that has been driving change in the additive electronics industry since 2013. Our tools help the world's most innovative minds solve previously unsolvable problems. Our customers, across the board, are changing the way we think about electronics and its applications.

Our flagship product, the V-One, is a multi-functional desktop PCB printer that was designed for rapid prototyping and education in traditional, rigid electronics.

Our newest product, NOVA, is the world's first direct-write printer for soft, flexible, and stretchable electronics. It's designed to push the limits of what's possible, bridging the gap between what we can do and what we wish we could do with electronics.

We're a tight-knit company looking for ambitious, talented individuals. We value the importance of team culture, and strive to create a work environment where you feel empowered through knowledge, supported by your colleagues, passionate about your work, and motivated to drive the growth of the company.

Working Conditions

Works full time out of our office in Waterloo

Job Responsibilities:

Creation of samples requested by the sales team, and creating content (pictures, videos, technical spec. sheets) for those samples.
Assisting in brainstorming, design, creation and content for various applications that use our technology (primarily circuit design) - research ways our new product NOVA can be used in various fields.
Testing various materials (conductive inks and substrates).
Assisting with projects related to testing and applications.
Record data from applications, sample and testing work, and compile into data sheets that can be shared internally and externally.
Troubleshooting of hardware.
Communicating and collaborating with sales, marketing, software and customer support.

Required Skills:

Aptitude for clearly presenting data and summarizing results to be shared both internally and with customers
Drive to learn and contribute in a fast-paced environment.
Attention to detail, documentation, and critical thinking skills.
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and roadblocks.
An understanding of the fundamentals of engineering and the scientific method.
Ability to multitask and prioritize work.
Nice to haves:
CAD Experience (Solidworks, EAGLE, AutoCAD)
Material science knowledge
Some programming knowledge (Javascript, Node, Python, C++)
An understanding of how 3D printers' function, and the ability to troubleshoot problems that arise
Arduino programming
Test design experience
Data analysis experience

Compensation and Benefits:

We're a scaling company - you're hired to have a voice, not to be a cog.
Flexible work hours.
Family-friendly work culture.
Collaborative work environment.
Our office is located in the growing tech hub of Waterloo, Ontario, close to restaurants and easily accessible by public transit.
Salary is determined using average earnings data from the University of Waterloo and will depend on the work term and program the student is in.

Job Summary:

We're excited to open an opportunity to join our firm in its earliest phases, working closely with Tom Tunguz (tomtunguz.com) at Theory Ventures. Regarded as the author of one of the most read and insightful blogs in venture capital, Tom founded Theory in early 2023 to invest in early-stage software companies that leverage technical discontinuities into go-to-market advantages. The firm has $688m AUM and invests in companies across our core data thesis, including the modern enterprise data stack, machine-learning enablement, and blockchains as databases.

We are looking for a data science engineer to help build the data systems for the firm, as well as participate in due diligences on machine learning and other relevant companies. The first core responsibility for this role is to build, deploy, own, and maintain data systems that inform investing (e.g. sourcing, pipeline, company & market research), thesis & macro research, and other core firm activities (e.g. portfolio company performance). The other core responsibility is to participate in the investing workflow through contributions on due diligences.

There is also an opportunity to conduct similar data science engineering work with our portfolio companies (theoryvc.com/portfolio) if there is high demand and the spot at our firm is filled. Please let us know during the interview process if a placement at one of our startups is of interest to you.

Potential to extend to 8-month work term

Job Responsibilities:

Build and extend key systems, including prioritizing bugs/features and roadmaps:

Sourcing - building a streamlined engine & workflow around sourcing including clear attribution
Pipeline - optimization of deal flow, setting and reviewing weekly / monthly / annual targets
Market Research - leveraging internal data assets for nuanced market insights, including company benchmarking data collection, call transcripts (internal, external, and secondary research (e.g. Tegus))
Diligence Summarization - ensuring leads are qualified for sourcing engine with the highest level of automation / leverage as possible
Additional responsibilities:
Identify and drive opportunities for differentiation for the firm with regard to leveraging best of breed tools and innovative workflows
Join diligence calls with CTOs to assess data science strategies, differentiation, and likelihood of success for potential investments
Identify new and high-impact opportunities by way of using new tools in market / staying plugged into data science / developer communities

Required Skills:

Experience with scraping & leveraging APIs
Front end engineering: building websites
Data analysis & engineering: comfort leveraging machine learning, experience building a modern data stack

Transportation and Housing:

None - we expect our candidate to find suitable housing and transportation that works for them.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary: $10,000 USD per month

Benefits: Significant mentorship and development opportunities working closely with leading venture capitalist

At Maxima, we're eliminating the pain of enterprise accounting through powerful integrations, intuitive design, and AI-driven automation. By consolidating processes into a single, easy-to-use platform and automating repetitive tasks, we free accounting teams to focus on strategic, high-impact work-achieving more with fewer resources.

Our team is led by top engineers and finance professionals from companies like Robinhood, Bolt, EY, Facebook, Twitter, Netflix, Amazon, Google, Airbnb, Rubrik, and more. Together, we're using our extensive industry experience to transform the way businesses manage their finances.

Maxima is backed by leading Silicon Valley investors. We raised the largest seed round in our category, with support from top-tier VCs such as Kleiner Perkins and Audacious Ventures. This funding has allowed us to launch a fully operational product and onboard several major customers.

Job Summary:

Snapwise Inc is the team behind Ground News. Ground is a powerful news platform. We use automated and manual processes to identify and combine articles on the web that are talking about the same news story. We put these sources side by side to let you see how all sides are covering it by annotating each source with metadata such as bias reviews, factuality reviews as well as ownership information. We have topped Product Hunt (and done well a few other times), we're frequently featured in the Apple App Store and our site has even been retweeted by the POTUS.

Your position, should you choose to accept it, will be that of a Front-end / Full-Stack Co-op Engineer. You'll work directly with our engineering team to shape fast, modern, and scalable web experiences for millions of readers. This is an opportunity to gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge frameworks, including Next.js App Router and React Server Components (RSC), while learning how performance and UX meet at production scale.

You'll be mentored and led by senior engineers, gaining exposure to real-world development workflows, caching strategies, and performance metrics. This role will give you exposure to impactful web features that help readers access balanced news faster and more smoothly.

Co-founded by a former NASA engineer and Bain consultant, a position with Ground News provides an unparalleled learning experience both personally and professionally. At Ground, we prioritize growth: both for our business and team members. You'll have the freedom to work remotely and play a key role in the development of Ground News products.

Ground news takes pride in being a harassment- and discrimination-free space for everyone, regardless of age, disability, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, nationality, neurotype, personal appearance, political affiliation, professional background, race, religion, or sexual identity or orientation. Our culture is one of collaboration, creativity, and diverse perspectives. If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding accessibility needs, please contact talent@ground.news, and a member of our team will be happy to help.

Job Responsibilities:

Develop and refine components using React Server Components (RSC) and Next.js App Router
Build efficient data-fetching patterns for SSR, SSG, and ISR workflows
Integrate APIs and optimize edge caching and revalidation strategies
Improve Web Performance Vitals (LCP, CLS, FID, TTFB) through profiling and optimization
Collaborate with backend engineers to ensure seamless data delivery
Contribute to UI/UX consistency, semantic HTML, and accessibility best practices
Participate in GitHub PRs, code reviews, and sprint discussions
Explore emerging techniques in streaming, parallel rendering, and caching.

Required Skills:

Must have:

Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
Strong understanding of React 18+, TypeScript, and Next.js fundamentals.
Familiarity with fetching patterns (fetch caching, use hooks, server actions).
Basic knowledge of REST APIs, Node.js, and Git workflows.
Curiosity for performance, SEO, and how rendering decisions affect user experience.
A collaborative attitude, willingness to learn, and attention to detail.


Nice to have:
Experience with NextJs, Vercel, or Caching.
Exposure to A/B testing, feature flags, or analytics tools (Lighthouse, Web Vitals, GA4).
Familiarity with Edge Functions, Server Actions, or Cache revalidation.
Prior exposure to content-driven or consumer web apps.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary will follow the Co-op Earnings sheet provided by UW per program and co-op term number.

https://uwaterloo.ca/hire/how-to-hire/co-op-student-earnings

Special Job Requirements:

This job is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP) or Canada Summer Jobs. These programs require that candidates be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

Job Summary:

Grey Matter Neurosciences, a Toronto-based company developing revolutionary interventional medical devices, is seeking a Mechatronics Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary environment. This broad-based role is ideal for a self-starter with strong hands-on abilities and the initiative to drive progress across multiple fronts.

Job Responsibilities:

In particular, the Mechatronics Assistant will play an instrumental role in five key areas:

Benchtop testing: Participate in bring-up, testing and troubleshooting of printed circuit board assemblies and collaborate with the other members of the R&D team to translate findings into actionable changes.
3D Printing: You'll be responsible for printing all prototypes for the R&D team using a collection of FDM and resin printers. Parts range from mm-scale to full helmets. You'll need to tweak printing parameters, troubleshoot failed prints, and finish parts manually, as needed.
Assembly of Electromechanical Prototypes: Once you've brought-up the electronics and printed the mechanical parts, you'll be putting it all together for a variety of prototypes and test fixtures.
Assembly of Ultrasound Transducers: Using a variety of equipment, including a robotic dispensing system, manually assemble and test ultrasonic transducer modules.
Mechanical and Electrical Design: Using Solidworks and Altium Designer, you'll update existing designs and assist the rest of the team with mechanical and/or electrical design activities.

Required Skills:

This is a hands-on role with broad exposure and real impact. If you're highly organized, resourceful, and eager to help shape next-generation therapies, we'd love to consider your candidacy.
Necessary Qualifications:

Hand soldering and PCB re-work
Mechanical assembly
3D printing experience (hobby level is okay)
Nice-to-have Qualifications:
Solidworks design experience (or other mechanical CAD system)
Altium Designer experience (or other E-CAD system)

Transportation and Housing:

We are conveniently located on the subway - right at St Clair subway station.

Compensation and Benefits:

$25-$27/hr based on skills and qualifictations
This is an opportunity to get into a thriving startup (just started in February 2025) with an experienced team of innovators, engineers and scientists working in one of the hottest area of medical devices: transcranial focused ultrasound.
This is also a very hands-on role and all hardware. If you can solder and are a quick learner, we can teach you the rest.
