Job Summary:

At AXIBO, we are building advanced humanoid robots trained using large-scale reinforcement learning and simulation-to-real pipelines. Our robots learn locomotion, balance, and manipulation skills in simulation and deploy them on real hardware.

We are seeking a Reinforcement Learning Intern (Humanoids) to support training, evaluating, and deploying learning-based control policies for humanoid robots. This role offers hands-on experience with modern simulators, GPU-accelerated training, and real robotic systems.

This position is ideal for students interested in robot learning, reinforcement learning, and embodied AI.

Job Responsibilities:

Reinforcement Learning for Humanoid Control

Train reinforcement learning policies for humanoid locomotion, balance, and whole-body control
Implement and evaluate common RL methods (e.g., actor-critic, policy gradient approaches)
Design and tune reward functions and training curricula
Support simulation-to-real transfer of learned policies to physical humanoid robots
Simulation & Training
Run large-scale training experiments using simulators such as Isaac Lab and MuJoCo
Configure training runs, monitor learning progress, and analyze policy performance
Evaluate learned behaviors in simulation and assist with real-robot testing
Evaluation & Debugging
Visualize and analyze policy behavior, training metrics, and failure cases
Help diagnose instability, poor generalization, or unexpected behaviors
Document results and present findings to the robotics and AI teams
Collaboration
Work closely with reinforcement learning, robotics, and controls engineers
Contribute ideas that improve training pipelines and humanoid performance
Stay current with relevant research in robot learning and humanoid control

Required Skills:

Technical Skills

Strong programming skills in Python
Familiarity with reinforcement learning or deep learning concepts
Experience with an ML framework (e.g., PyTorch)
Basic understanding of robotics or physics-based simulation
Comfortable working in Linux and GPU-based environments
Soft Skills
Strong problem-solving and debugging skills
Curiosity and willingness to experiment and iterate
Clear communication and documentation ability
Comfortable in a fast-paced startup environment

Compensation and Benefits:

The range is $25-$35 per hour, depending on experience, skill level, and academic term
Hands-on experience with humanoid robot hardware, sensors, and AI systems
Mentorship from engineers across AI, robotics, perception, and controls
Opportunity for future co-op terms or full-time employment at AXIBO

Job Summary:

The Instructional Support Group (ISG) is seeking an enthusiastic and dependable person to assume the valuable role of Instructional Support Assistant (ISA) in the CS 240 teaching team. The teaching team consists of course instructors, ISAs, graduate Instructional Apprentices (IAs), graduate Teaching Assistants (TAs) and an Instructional Support Coordinator (ISC).

You can read more about the impact of working as an ISA on Co-operative Education's feature about the ISG.

Job Responsibilities:

ISAs provide the primary student contact, supplying guidance for course-related material through consulting hours, tutorials, and on-line communication. ISAs also provide feedback (design, wording, difficulty, etc.) to instructors on assignments and other course materials. There is an opportunity to gain and/or improve teaching, teamwork, time management, programming, and communication (verbal, written, interpersonal) skills. In addition, ISAs gain organizational experience by co-ordinating the assignment marking activities of the graduate teaching assistants assigned to the course. Other duties include helping in the refinement of assignment marking schemes and creation of solution sets, hand-marking assignments, program auto-marking and correctness test determination and setup, assisting in exam proctoring and marking; maintaining the course web page (html and scripting); and performing various other tasks to ensure the smooth operation of the course. Overall, they contribute to a quality learning experience for students. ISAs must also work cooperatively and closely with other CS 240 ISAs, as well as instructors for the course.

This position may be of particular interest to students who are considering graduate school and/or ultimately teaching at the post-secondary level. It may also be of interest to students wanting to further their mastery of the material for future educational study and work.

Required Skills:

The successful candidate will have good communication, interpersonal and time management abilities, attention to detail, a proactive work attitude, good judgement, and the ability to work independently and as part of a team within the spirit of course goals and philosophies.
Student Leadership Certification or courses in the Student Leadership program (Student Success Office) are an asset.
Training, team building, resiliency, adaptability, mentoring and other resources are provided all term and there is the opportunity for growth in many areas -- technical, personal and interpersonal --depending on the individual. Since the ISA job is not a permanent position, we strive to ensure that those employed as ISAs learn many skills transferable to any career they choose to pursue.
Familiarity with Linux and C++ is required.
Students who have successfully completed CS 240 or are currently enrolled in the course are encouraged to apply.

Compensation and Benefits:

Monthly range of $3060-$4540.

Salaries are based on education level, work term experience, and number of previous work terms with the ISG at the time of applying.

Job Summary:

In this role you will work with the software department within Cognichip and collaborate cross-functionally with AI Science and Chip team.
You will be mentored by senior software with 10-20 years of experience. You will contribute to building cutting edge software and AI tools for semiconductor industry.

Job Responsibilities:

Assist in deploying machine learning models for real-world applications.
Support data collection, cleaning, transformation, and feature engineering processes.
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends, patterns, and potential model improvements.
Implement and test ML algorithms using frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Scikit-learn.

Explore and implement AI agent architectures using open-source frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, or LlamaIndex.
Integrate LLM-based solutions into applications, including retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), tool usage, and workflow orchestration.
Collaborate with data engineers and software developers to deploy ML/LLM models into production systems.
Document methodologies, experiments, and results for reproducibility and team knowledge sharing.
Stay up-to-date with recent advancements in machine learning, deep learning, LLMs, and agent frameworks.

Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field.
Solid programming skills in Python (experience with libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn).
Basic understanding of machine learning concepts (supervised/unsupervised learning, model evaluation, overfitting/underfitting).
Familiarity with at least one ML/DL framework (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras).
Exposure to LLM development and usage (e.g., OpenAI, Hugging Face Transformers, Anthropic).
Hands-on experience (coursework, projects, or internships) with LangChain, LangGraph, or similar open-source agent frameworks is a strong plus.
Understanding of retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS), and prompt engineering is an asset.
Knowledge of SQL or other query languages for working with structured data.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and debugging skills.
Good communication and teamwork abilities, with willingness to learn and adapt quickly.

Students are responsible for transportation and housing. The office is located at MaRS center.

Special Job Requirements:

This position is located outside of Canada. It is the student's responsibility to ensure they are eligible to work in the destination country, and that they have/obtain the necessary documentation required to participate in this co-op work term. The University may provide procedural guidance and a Letter of Support to support a student's application for this documentation, but cannot provide specific immigration advice or arrange for this documentation on a student's behalf. Ensure you have read and understood the eligibility requirements outlined here: https://uwaterloo.ca/co-operative-education/work-abroad/before-you-go/co-op-requirements/

Job Summary:

The Institute of Vehicle Concepts researches, develops and evaluates new vehicle concepts and technologies in the light of future demands on transportation systems.
As a systems institute, we develop and demonstrate innovative, application-based solutions for road and rail vehicles, thereby contributing to the design of a sustainable and cost-effective, user-oriented, secure and networked mobility concept. Our contributions range from design and planning to construction, calculation and simulation through to the manufacture of research demonstrations, components and vehicles.
The Institute's guiding vision is one of successful scientific cooperation for efficient vehicle concepts where the fields of energy and transportation meet. The development of future technical systems based on regenerative energy carriers and energy conversion/storage in the vehicle of the future as well as progressive architectures and fuel technologies for road and rail vehicles is supported by a prospective, comprehensive vehicle system analysis and technology evaluation.

Various models for the simulation of rail vehicles and powertrain components (e.g., batteries, fuel cells) have been developed at DLR and in collaboration with partners. These models are available at several levels of detail and address different aspects such as longitudinal dynamics and energy management. They are integrated into an overarching simulation framework that enables co-simulation between different parties.
The aim of this work is to enhance the simulation framework and to conduct simulations for optimizing the operation of battery-electric and hydrogen rail vehicles. In addition, the overall data processing chain should be improved with a user-friendly interface and further developments.

Job Responsibilities:

Your responsibilities will include further developing a vehicle simulation framework that integrates various sub-models of vehicle components through different interfaces. The framework simulates the physical behavior of rail vehicles, with a particular focus on powertrains based on hydrogen and batteries. It is used to generate simulation datasets, which are then compared with measurement data for model validation. In the next step, the framework can be applied to analyze optimization potentials, reducing the need for costly physical experiments.
The aim of the work is to enhance this overall data processing chain with a user-friendly interface and additional functionality.

Your detailed tasks may include the following:

Processing vehicle measurement data via database access and visualizing the results
Integrating various simulation models into a co-simulation framework
Performing simulations for battery-electric and hydrogen rail vehicles using the framework
Comparing simulated data from the framework with measurement data

Required Skills:

Required: Knowledge in simulation tools; programming skills (python)
Nice-to-have: Previous experience with self-organized projects, experience with widely used python packages for data analysis, numerical simulation, and data visualization (NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, etc)
Previous experience with Battery and Fuel-Cell Systems, Physical and Thermodynamic Modeling
Education: Enrolled student in following programs (Bachelor or Master): Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering, Systems Design Engineering

Compensation and Benefits:

If you are matched to a job outside of Canada, you may apply for international travel awards/scholarships via SAFA. Please see more information at https://uwaterloo.ca/student-awards-financial-aid/undergraduate-awards/international-experience-awards

Salary: 992,00 € monthly
Workplace meals are subsidised and a standard lunch meal is available for about 5,50 €
International student community organizes frequently events (movie theater, sports)
Possibility to contribute to relevant scientific conferences will be provided

Include insight into local average monthly costs for:
Food: 200 €/Month
Housing: 380 €/Month Student accommodation (University of Stuttgart)
Housing Prices outside of student housing can typically vary from 350 - 750 €/Month
Local transportation: Public transport 50 €/monthly or bicycle (100 -200 € for a second-hand bicycle)

Job Summary:

The Company:
GTS is a collection of financial services companies spanning a wide array of asset classes and investment approaches, all powered by the combination of market expertise with innovative, proprietary technology. With roots as a quantitative trading firm continually building for the future, the GTS family of companies are able to leverage the latest in artificial intelligence systems and sophisticated pricing models to bring consistency, efficiency, and transparency to today's financial markets. GTS's electronic market maker GTS Securities accounts for 3-5% of daily cash equities volume in the U.S. and is a leading Designated Market Maker (DMM) at the New York Stock Exchange, responsible for nearly $13 trillion of market capitalization. For more information on GTS, please visit http://www.gtsx.com.

Job Responsibilities:

GTS is recruiting for our satellite office located at the Communitech hub in Kitchener. You will have the opportunity to work alongside experienced members of the teams located in-person at this office and virtually with those from our other offices.

Technology co-ops & interns at GTS get the opportunity to learn about technology in a fast-paced and complex environment, while gaining real world and hands-on experience with guidance from senior leaders. Our teams utilize a variety of programming languages (primarily C++) and come from a diverse set of backgrounds both in and outside of the financial sector.

We are looking for talented Junior C++ software developers with a passion for solving complex problems to intern on one of our Technology Teams:

Core Engineering: Work alongside the team committed to developing and maintaining the firm's low latency platform and real-time applications.
Risk, Booking & Clearing: Help to augment, improve, and redesign software systems that support and monitor our live trading activity.
Compliance Technology: Work on a very high-volume data-processing solution, which performs daily analysis of the firm's trading activities across all asset classes.
We are a technology-driven firm that looks for individuals who share our passion for technology.

Examples of co-op projects include:
Building a new C++ application for processing and translating real-time options market data for integration with a new trading team. This application continues to be a critical component in our production system.
Developed initial version of a stateful stream processing framework in C++ that has spread significantly in use over the last couple of years.
Rewrote networking code in a large part of the real-time risk system using coroutines and boost::asio.

Required Skills:

The ideal candidate will have:

Strong C/C++ programming skills
Educational background in computer science, computer/electrical engineering or related field
High degree of organization and follow-through with meticulous attention to detail
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, verbally and in writing
3rd or 4th year preferred
Previous internship experience working with a large code base is a plus
Any of the following is also a plus: Linux knowledge, SQL experience, scripting skills, database experience
We're proud to employ some of the leading talent in the industry, and we work to ensure our employees enjoy a high quality-of-life
.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Job Summary:

The Grand River Regional Cancer Centre is seeking Co-op students to work as a Physics Technician in support of Radiation Oncology.

The successful candidates will join a team of Medical Physicists and technical support personnel collectively responsible for commissioning and maintaining of radiation therapy equipment including linear accelerators, treatment planning systems, and CT simulators. The Physics Technician positions are available for a 4 month (extendable to 8 month) term.

Job Responsibilities:

The Physics Technician will be working with modern dosimetry equipment and will be responsible for performing rotine Quality Assurance (QA) testing of medical linear accelerators and an orthvoltage radiotherapy machine. Other related work may include the quality assurance of diagnostic (CT), therapeutic (EPID) imaging equipment, and any other system as needed. Students will be expeted to participate in research activities, which will include aspects of optimization of various beam modeling for treatment planning; development and evaluation of dosimetric techniques for patient specific pre-treatment QA; development of computer programs for various applications using Python, Matlab, C# or C++ programming languages. There are opportunities for students with relevant experience to help with SQL database scripting.

The work plan will be for students to engage in both the QA of treatment systems and in assigned research project(s).

Required Skills:

This is an exciting opportunity for students to explore a career in medical or life physics and to make a significant contribution to the Radiation Therapy Program. Linac operator and dosimetry equipemnt handling training and radiation safety training is provided at the beginning and during the work term.

NOTE:

Students will be expected to provide a report and a short oral presentation at the end of the work term.
Evening hours will be expected.
Knowledge and experience in one or more of the following programing language will be an asset
Programing language: Python, C#, C++, Matlab and SQL scripting.

Compensation and Benefits:

Pay Period: Bi-weekly

Wage: $19.94 per hour plus 4% in lieu of vacation payable bi-weekly, less statutory deductions.

Job Summary:

Innovate With Purpose
Do you want to work for a company that is innovating and making a difference to the health and wellbeing of people all over the world? We're not about selling meaningless, unnecessary products for corporate profitability. You'll be working on technology that will revolutionize global health systems so that we can finally get the healthcare we all want - a basic human right.

We like to think of ourselves as a community of start-ups where you can be your true, genuine self. Each of our product teams has the autonomy to decide how they operate and contribute towards our mission of providing each person with the right care at the right time and in the right place.

Orion Health is excited to be expanding our galaxy by recruiting for a number of stellar individuals to join our team to help us deliver to our global customer base. If you want to climb aboard the rocketship and help us revolutionize global health systems, astronomical opportunities await.

Position Purpose:
Responsible for executing and maintaining automated and manual test suites. Has a good understanding of testing techniques and approaches and is comfortable with contemporary software development practices and dealing with constant change. Provides constructive feedback to others and assertively challenges assumptions on a per occasion basis.

As part of a project team, the Associate Test/Quality Assurance Engineer will interact with project team members to ensure the solution is fully tested, meeting all customer requirements, and passing all acceptance criteria. The Quality Analyst plays an essential role in helping the project team, meeting the customer's expectations. Works on fast iteration cycles and tight deadlines using an agile/scrum methodology.

The Associate Test/Quality Assurance Engineer works collaboratively with our internal teams and product owner on design, development, and delivery of our business solutions contributing towards the execution of manual and automated tests and ensure our code is of the highest quality; tackles complex infrastructure challenges with creative automation and configuration management solutions; helps improve, expand the coverage of deployment automation.

Success in this Role looks like:

Give suggestions on improvements of the application
Report, track, investigate and manage defects
Takes input from leaders and critically evaluates product and testing requirements and decisions
Consistently takes responsibility for delivery of quality outcomes in a sustainable fashion.
Develops healthy relationships in the team

Business Unit: North America Professional Services.

Key Relationships: Internal: Project Manager, Solution Architect, Test/QA Lead. External: Client, Third Party Vendors

Job Responsibilities:

Essential Functions:

Coordinates and performs tests at the quality control stage of the solution implementation lifecycle
Gathers and studies information regarding the business problem, solution requirements and customer expectations
Translate business/system requirements into effective test scenarios and test cases that will provide assurance of the quality of the system
Maintain requirements traceability so it is clear what requirements are being validated with test cases
Execute manual and automated test cases according to plan and document testing results. Confirm solution meets requirements; identify, qualify, and document any defects
Studies data collected during testing and evaluates the validity of the results
Perform exploratory testing to identify potential issues/defects that may not be documented in the requirements
Create and develop appropriate data for the test scenarios and test cases that enables the effective execution of test cases
Support project team and be an advocate for the quality of the solutions
Advise Test Lead of potential issues, risks and impacts associated with the solution
Identifies and analyses issues, bugs, defects and other problems, particularly when problems recur in multiple software solutions/products; recommends and facilitates solutions to issues
Continues testing and analysis until results are within acceptable product requirements and specifications

Required Skills:

Behavioural and Technical Capabilities: Task-focused: Perseveres and drives for results when faced with difficulties and setbacks. Displays a strong task driven focus
Analytical and Critical Thinking Skills: Develops logical ideas, approaches, and solutions to typical, unusual, or difficult situations or problems; demonstrates attention to detail
Time Management: Efficiently develops and implements plans to accomplish goals and deliverables. Manages time effectively
Technical ability: Demonstrates a sound understanding the IT industry, development languages and has advanced problem-solving skills
Communication skills:

Speaks, writes and presents effectively.. Gets points across clearly, concisely and quickly
Applies an understanding of how the software will be used in the real world to evaluate its fit for purpose
Considers non-functional requirements and finds creative ways to break software in order to help build robust, reliable applications
Produces easily understandable testing objectives and test artefacts
Designs test suites using understanding of how products fit into solutions for a customer
Understands that automation increases product quality and productivity. Develops automated tests conforming to industry standards
Interprets security, clinical safety and privacy policies and contributes to team standards and guidelines that comply with the policy. Evaluates and uses advice and guidance on security strategies to manage identified risks
Keeps up to date with relevant technologies, testing techniques and test approaches. Pro-actively shares their knowledge within the team and actively participates within the wider testing and software development communities
Works under minimal supervision. Has good self- awareness and exercises personal responsibility. Plans own work to meet objectives in a timely and efficient manner
Relevant Experience:
1-4 years in software testing in relevant technologies
Experience with testing and configuration management tools and techniques a plus
Experience testing web-based solutions and data integration solutions
Experience using testing tools and issue/defect tracking tools
Preferred understanding of technical concepts including HTTP, HTML, web services, XML, javascript, messaging, Linux, Oracle DB, and SQL
Software development experience preferred-programming on java, javascript, cucumber, selenium, etc
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and continuous integration tools
Experience in designing test plans, test scenarios and test activities
Exposure to big data technologies a plus - Apache Spark, Elastic search, Cassandra
Healthcare domain expertise working with data/analytics technologies is a bonus
Education and Qualifications:
Working towards a Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science or engineering

$26.45/hr CAD.

Given the cross-disciplinary nature of the role, more days in office is better for learning and cross-pollination.

4 month work term

Job Summary:

At Cognichip, we're building the next generation of AI-powered design tools for the semiconductor industry. Our intelligent IDE helps engineers build, simulate, and optimize chip designs faster than ever before. As part of this journey, we're expanding our Quality Engineering team - and we're looking for a curious, hands-on Quality Engineering Intern who's passionate about learning how to test cutting-edge AI systems and developer tools. We are looking for a senior (4A/4B) candidate currently pursuing a bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or related field.

During this co-op term, you'll learn:

Modern automation and CI/CD workflows in a production-scale AI software environment.
How to test desktop applications, Web-based Applications, cloud-native APIs, and microservices.
The fundamentals of shift-left testing, TDD, and risk-based test design.
Techniques for API mocking, contract testing, and test data management.
Collaboration in an agile team with developers, AI researchers, and product engineers.

Job Responsibilities:

Collaborate with senior Quality Engineers to design and execute functional, integration, and regression tests for both the Cognichip IDE frontend and backend APIs.
Help build automated test suites using Playwright, Cypress, or Pytest.
Develop and execute API tests using tools like Postman, ReadyAPI, or REST Assured to validate endpoints and data flows.
Support the setup and maintenance of continuous integration pipelines (GitHub Actions, AWS).
Assist in performance and reliability testing across multi-platform builds (Linux, macOS, Windows).
Document and track test results using TestRail, GitHub, and other QE tools.
Participate in sprint ceremonies, bug triage, and code reviews to understand the complete development lifecycle.
Contribute ideas to improve test coverage, automation efficiency, and CI/CD quality gates.

Required Skills:

Strong foundations in software development principles with strong academic record
Experience using agentic utilities to develop functional code
Basic understanding of Python or JavaScript/TypeScript.
Familiarity with REST APIs, HTTP methods, and JSON structures.
Comfortable using version control (Git) and eager to learn automation frameworks.
Strong analytical skills and a detail-oriented mindset.
Enthusiasm for AI, semiconductors, or backend testing - curiosity counts more than experience.
Exposure to Playwright, Cypress, or Selenium.
Some experience testing APIs, databases, or cloud functions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Nice to have
Some experience with Linux environments.
Interest in AWS, Docker, or CI/CD pipelines.

Transportation and Housing:

Students are responsible for transportation and housing. The office is located at MaRS center.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation range $40-$50 CAD/hr depending on prior coops and graduation year. We value relevant prior coops and near-graduation students.

Job Summary:

Do you want to make an impact on the greatest technological transformations of our time? Are you looking to learn more about the Government of Canada's key investments driving AI research, commercialization and infrastructure?

The Science Programs Branch (SPro) at Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada (ISED) is looking to hire a co-op student as an Analyst to support Canada's artificial intelligence (AI) research policies and programs.
Through program and policy development, SPro ensures that science programs align with the Government of Canada's priorities, contribute to growing a thriving research ecosystem within Canada, and strengthen the country's capacity to address both Canadian and larger global challenges through scientific innovation.

The Government of Canada is collaborating with various partners across the country to secure Canada's AI advantage. By working at SBP, you will contribute to advancing the following initiatives:

Pan-Canadian AI Strategy (PCAIS): with an investment of $443.8 million over ten years, the PCAIS launched in 2021 is strengthening Canada's talent base and global competitiveness in AI research while fostering responsible adoption and commercialization of AI.
Canadian AI Safety Institute (CAISI): working with the Canadian Institute for Advanced Research (CIFAR), a globally known Canadian research organization, to implement the Applied and investigator-led research stream of the CAISI launched in November 2024. Through CIFAR, the Government of Canada funds Canadian and international experts to conduct research on critical questions related to AI safety.
Canadian Sovereign AI Compute Strategy: working with several key players on a national scale, the Strategy is looking to boost access to powerful, affordable, cutting-edge compute resources right here in Canada to drive innovation, create new opportunities and ensure that Canada stays competitive in the global AI race.
This position will provide you with an understanding of the Government of Canada's decision-making processes related to federal research funding and priorities, knowledge of key federal AI policies and programs, exposure to key AI industry trends and challenges, and an overall understanding of Canada's AI ecosystem and key players. You can leverage this rich work experience for a successful career in any area of Canada's AI industry.

Job Responsibilities:

As an Analyst, you will be working under the guidance of a manager/project team lead to conduct research, analysis and provide advice to inform Government of Canada decisions regarding future investments in AI research. More precisely, you'll be responsible for:

Developing briefing materials, reports, research, and analysis related to AI science and research in a timely manner.
Researching qualitative and quantitative data, synthetizing information from diverse sources and utilizing research methodology to ensure work is sound and evidence based.
Identifying and discussing trends, challenges and possible solutions.
Building and nurturing collaborative relationships to advance AI policy development work.
Participating in working level discussions on the development of AI technologies at ISED.
Writing responses to corporate requests and ministerial correspondence.

Required Skills:

Data analysis and visualization
Conducting research and analysis
Communicating effectively orally and in writing
Managing priorities and meeting tight deadlines
Working effectively in a team environment
Judgement
Attention to detail
Reliability

Transportation and Housing:

No compensation nor allocation is provided for transportation and housing. There is no assistance available for finding transportation and housing.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required
Security Clearance Required
Hiring Preference - Canadian


Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation and benefits follow the Student Rates of Pay available for post-secondary students on the Treasury Board of Canada's website: https://www.canada.ca/en/treasury-board-secretariat/services/pay/rates-pay/student-rates-pay.html.

You will be assisting the team in identifying performance improvement opportunities and assisting the development team in identifying coding improvements and best practices

Job Responsibilities:

Develops performance/load tests to simulate customer use cases under a variety of test conditions e.g., network access type, peak vs. off peak, etc.
Installs and configures integrated system solution under test
Validates internal performance/load results against field data, in order to improve the performance of the EI releases
Engages with members of the R&D to ensure that the test cases conform to customer expectations.
Supports development of requirements and validates solutions containing products from different competence centres, including third party integrations by testing in a lab and production environment (first deployments)
Validates complex system/product workflows within an enhanced range of products applying profound specific technical or practical knowledge/ experience for supporting test techniques or disciplines
Decision advice to release solutions based on the results of the performance/load testing and according to the quality and regulatory standards
Enables continuous improvement using formal internal process improvement processes

Required Skills:

You understand the software testing process and requirements
Hands on experience in operating systems at admin level (Linux, Windows).
Knowledge of scripting and programming (Java, Python).
Interest in learning Performance testing tools, such as Jmeter, Selenium and automating the scenarios/workflows from Load and Performance System Tests perspective.
Interest in analysis of performance test results, metrics, identification of performance hot spots, potential bottlenecks, tuning parameters.

Compensation is in line with industry standards for coops

full_description:
JOB POSTING INFORMATION

2026 - Spring

Co-op Main

Software Engineering

Number of Job Openings:

1

Level:

Intermediate
Senior

Employment Location Arrangement:

Additional Employment Arrangement Location Information:

We are a hybrid company that has an office at a co-working space near Liberty Village in Toronto. We in the office 3 times a week. Students are welcome to use the office at anytime as we have 24 hour access.

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Job Summary:

The Problem
We're lazy. We hate doing the same thing over and over again. We hate doing work that can and should be automated. We've suffered through it. We don't even want to search for an answer - we want to be proactively told the solution.

The fastest growing technical companies have a critical group of people that are dealing with this problem - the sales engineers, solution architects, customer success engineers and everyone they serve on revenue teams.

They're inundated by questions from colleagues & customers. They are stuck filling out similar security questionnaires & RFPs. They spend hours writing "handoff" docs and "prep" for meetings. They're still waiting for an answer that they asked a colleague yesterday.

This wasted time is expensive and makes providing great experiences to customers and prospects unnecessarily challenging.

This is what we're solving. At Mash, we're building the tools to help revenue teams at technical B2B companies scale the tier-one service they provide to customers and prospects. From an encyclopedic knowledge engine that pulls in information from all the scattered, siloed and messy sources, to the automation agents that proactively help before they know they need it. Help us help them… be lazy!

About Mash
We're a dynamic team with experience at startups, and big tech including Google, Amazon, D2L, Ross Intelligence & Lazer. We don't use any seniority titles, and plan not to for as long as feasibly possible (learn more why).
Mash has ample runway having raised a US$6M seed round from top VCs and angels. The round was co-led by Whitecap Venture Partners and Castle Island Ventures, with participation from Maple VC, Strategic Cyber Ventures, Aquanow, Spacecadet Ventures, and angel investors including Amjad Masad, Balaji Srinivasan, Austin Hill, and John Pfeffer.

Cultural Fit
We treat your time as the scarce asset that it is. We respect people being heads down and having the time to get into a flow. Distractions and context switching are things we work to minimize. We have meetings for specific purposes, and leverage async channels as is often appropriate.
Mash has an open and direct culture. We believe that not making a decision is a decision - and a terrible one at that. We have strong conviction and a bias for action. We can agree to disagree and move forward after reviewing the details. As we learn, we will re-evaluate, iterate and push forward.

We're looking for an individual who -

Responds well to open-ended problems, thrives on autonomy, and is a self-starter and problem solver.
Excels in team environments and is focused on team goals.
Has great communication skills.

Job Responsibilities:

Role & Responsibilities

Build, test, and ship end-to-end product features.
Work closely with a cross-functional team (product, design, engineering).
Participate in system architecture and technical design discussions.
Manage infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
Examples of Problems We're Tackling:
Developing integrations to seamlessly connect diverse data sources, enabling the transformation and indexing of data into vector databases and full-text search platforms for efficient search and retrieval.
Leveraging Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and Large Language Models (LLMs) to provide accurate, timely, context-aware knowledge to sales and customer support representatives.
Our Stack
Application: TypeScript, Python, Tailwind CSS, NextJS, Postgres

Required Skills:

Skill Set

Skilled in 1 or more modern backend programming languages, such as Go, Java, C++, C#, Python, etc.
Skilled in web development (JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and frameworks such as React, Vue, etc.)
Experience with relational databases (such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, etc.).
Experience with cloud providers (such as Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, etc.).
Bonus: Data processing pipelines, LLMs and related tooling (such as OpenAI, Cohere, LangChain, vector stores, etc.)

Transportation and Housing:

Work Environment
Mash is a hybrid-remote company. We spend an average of 2-3 days per week in-office in downtown Toronto. We do this deliberately as a startup to balance impactful collaboration with effective heads-down time. We value in-person discussions and focused team sessions, but also understand the need for reasonable flexibility to work when/where it fits best into your life.

Compensation and Benefits:

Mash provides competitive compensation based on the average earnings posted by the University of Waterloo here. Take your work term and program you are in and we will target the upper end of average.

Example: If you are a Computer Science student going in into work term 5, the salary range will be $50 - 60 / hour

Job Summary:

Humber's Math and Writing Centre provides a welcoming learning environment to all Humber and Guelph-Humber certificate, diploma and degree learners seeking tutoring support in math, writing, liberal studies, English as a second language, and other academic skills. Our Centre operate on shared values such as using an inclusive, compassionate, and patient learner-centered approach to academic support. All staff are also expected to maintain a high level of service to align with the equity, diversity and inclusion priorities of the College, with a focus on addressing and removing barriers to access and education for learners of equity deserving backgrounds. Math Tutors are required to have a high level of technical knowledge in these areas to support learners with academic skills and content-related questions, in areas including but not limited to statistics, business math, calculus, algebra, and physics. The Centre is run by Student Learning Services - Student Success and Engagement and offers learners one-on-one tutoring as well as group workshops, in-person and online. The Centre aims to provide multiple ways for learners to access and use our services by making the best use of existing technology, social media and other tools and resources as they become available to us. This position supports the North and Lakeshore campuses.

Job Responsibilities:

Working with the Centre Coordinators, the incumbent will be responsible for leading tutoring sessions for an array of student learners from all programs offered at Humber College and University of Guelph Humber. The incumbent's role will include the following responsibilities:

Be available for one-on-one tutoring appointments and math drop-in sessions in person and online.
Deliver one on one or group workshops developed by the Math and Writing Centre, in collaboration with the Peer Assisted Learning Support (PALS) schedule of workshops.
Deliver program specific workshops as requested by faculties for math subjects.
Assist with promotion of the Math and Writing Centre services, including participating in class visits and regular Centre outreach and promotion.
Help build resources that enable the Centre staff to tutor more effectively.
Support the Centre's day to day, in person operation including opening and closing the Centres when needed, and maintaining a tidy work environment.
Support the day to day and front desk operation of the Centre when needed, including working closely with Peer Tutors and Writing Tutors to ensure continuity of service in person and online.
Participate actively in the assessment of the Math and Writing Centre services to collect relevant learner feedback and metrics.
Stay up-to-date with services on campus to be able to make timely and relevant referrals for learners in need.
Participate in on-going role-specific training and development organized by the Specialist Coordinators, Learning Services, the Manager, Student Learning Services, or other Humber leadership and departments.
Work closely with Specialist Coordinators, Learning Services and Manager, Student Learning Services to support learner needs when higher level issues, or personal/academic concerns are presented by a learner during a tutoring session.
Stay current on trends in the field, leading practice, technical skills, and substantial changes to course requirements that impact tutoring for learners who access our services.
Participate in and support the equity, diversity and inclusion trainings, practices, and policies of Student Learning Services to ensure equitable and accessible services for all stakeholders.
Other Duties:
Work closely with Student Life program initiatives such as Orientation, Co-Curricular Record, Leadership Programs, and other campus services to raise program awareness and increase student participation/involvement.
Assist with tabling at campus events and marketing initiatives, including Orientation, Service Fairs and Open Houses.
Support work on Special Projects assigned by the Manager, Student Learning Services.

Required Skills:

Required Skills:

A completion of 2A term with academic backgrounds in mathematics education, sciences, business, mathematics, statistics, health sciences, engineering are an asset.
The incumbent will possess, at minimum, one year of direct related experience such as working with students and/or experience working in a student services environment. Formal teaching experience is an asset, but not expected.
Other expected qualifications include excellent written and verbal communication skills, advanced knowledge of mathematics in the above-mentioned subjects, intermediate computer skills including working with MS Office (Word, Excel & PowerPoint), proven organizational skills, problem solving skills, strong presentation skills, and demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team and familiarity with various types of assistive technology.

**We are seeking Upper-Year or Master's level math tutors at the North campus to primarily support Humber Engineering Degree students, as well as other diploma and degree students based on needs of the Centre.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation: Hourly Wage Rate of $21.01 (x35 hours per week)

Career Development and Training
During the semester staff will receive ongoing training in all relevant fields. This includes, but is not limited to, focused math concepts, problem-solving strategies for math courses (technical math, business math, statistics, calculus and other), working with devices such as a BA II+ calculator, other mathematics applications, tools, and virtual manipulatives, as well as regular collaborative learning opportunities with the Coordinators and other staff. As part of this training staff also receive training on proper tutoring technique and more specifically tutoring in the Math Centre environment.

Job Summary:

Home Hardware has an exciting opportunity for an eCommerce Co-op Student to join our team based at our corporate office in St. Jacobs (just outside Waterloo). Home Hardware has been named one of Canada's Best Managed Companies and Waterloo Region's Top Employers and is one of Canada's most trusted and preferred home improvement retailers. Come join our winning team for you next co-op placement!

We are looking for an eager and a quick learning Co-op to join our eCommerce team. Reporting to the Manager, eCommerce Delivery, you will play an important role in assisting with the development of the technology and the data flows that power it, that helps elevate the customer experience on homehardware.ca into a world class eCommerce shopping experience.

You will have the opportunity to learn designing and writing high quality code to evolve the homehardware.ca. If you are looking to make a meaningful impact in your upcoming work term, we'd love to receive your application.

Please note: We have a preference for an 8-12-month co-op term

Job Responsibilities:

What you'll do:

Collaborate with UX, Designers, Developers and Business Units to contribute to new and existing frameworks.
Integrate with internal and external APIs and data sources to support data movement, validation, and reporting.
Support integration and ETL-style tasks, including troubleshooting failures and improving data quality.
Leverage Node.js, JavaScript, and JSON; work with HTML/CSS as needed; and query/transform structured data using SQL.
Identify bugs and errors and fix them before they become a larger problem.
Practice defensive programming and write production-grade code.
Work with Agile software lifecycle methodologies including daily scrums, collaboration, sprint reviews and code demonstrations.
Collaborate with peers and bring new ideas to the team.

Required Skills:

What we're looking for:

Currently enrolled in a Computer Science or Software Development program.
Exposure to building or integrating APIs and working with data (ETL-style processing); front-end frameworks are a plus. Experience in JavaScript, JSON (HTML/CSS is a plus).
Exposure to SQL and working with data files (CSV) is an asset
Understanding of Usability and Accessibility standards (WCAG) is an asset.
Experience with Responsive adaptive web design is an asset.
Ability and willingness to learn new technologies.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Strong oral and written communications skills.
The ability to work onsite 3 days a week at our corporate office in St. Jacobs, to accommodate our hybrid working model.

Compensation and Benefits:

What we offer:

This position has an expected hourly range of $19 - $23 per hour. The final offer will be based on the successful candidate's experience, education, and previous co-op completion.
Strong and caring culture that believes our Team Members are critical to our success.
Opportunity to gain meaningful work experience.
Flexible working options for work-life balance.
Staff discount card and WorkPerks discounts.
Onsite subsidized cafeteria.
Free onsite parking (also located on a bus route).
Fun corporate events.

Job Summary:

This role is with the Product Training and Information (PTI) department at Dematic. You will help configure, maintain, and enhance a toolset for authoring product documentation using DITA XML and publishing content to a delivery platform. This includes supporting a large team of Technical Writers who create documentation for Dematic's mechatronics, software, and solutions products.
Additional responsibilities include maintaining and enhancing the software plugins that transform technical documentation in DITA XML to a variety of delivery formats. You will help maintain and enhance our toolset for converting existing MS Word documents to DITA XML. Other tasks include converting content from MS Word to DITA, and editing content post-conversion to ensure accuracy and quality. You will also apply metadata to existing content to improve navigation and findability on a delivery platform.
Maintain and extend information architecture for the documentation web portal, leveraging metadata to enhance navigation, searchability, and improve user experience.
Familiarity with DITA XML and structured writing is an asset but not a requirement. HTML, CSS and XSLT skills are nice-to-haves but not required.

Job Responsibilities:

Configure documentation web delivery portal.
Apply metadata and publish documentation to delivery portal.
Troubleshoot publishing issues.
Maintain and enhance toolset for converting Word documents to DITA XML.
Convert content from Word format to DITA XML.
Enhance software plugins used to publish documentation in DITA XML to HTML and PDF.
Troubleshoot conversion errors.
Work closely with Technical Writers to verify conversions.
Apply metadata to Word and DITA XML documents.
Support Technical Writers with using a DITA CCMS, including troubleshooting errors and creating wiki content.
Research and define ways to use AI to streamline processes and increase efficiency

Required Skills:

Strong problem solving skills
A drive to improve processes
Good collaboration and interpersonal skills
Familiarity with XML, XSLT, Visual Basic, Javascript, and CSS would be beneficial but is not required.

Dematic offers competitive hourly wages, generally paying slightly more than the averages published by UW:

Job Summary:

Gore Insurance is entering an exciting new era where AI is at the core of everything we do. We're reimaging how data, artificial intelligence and technology can power our business and building a team that thrives on innovation.

If you are passionate about Generative AI and problem-solving skills in a dynamic business environment, then this is the role for you. We are looking for an energetic, enthusiastic student to join our Enterprise Data and Analytics team beginning May 2026 for a 4-to-8-month co-op term.

We're now at the boldest phase of our Next Horizon journey.
At Gore, we've completely transformed our business in under three years. By investing in top talent and leading technology, we've redefined what it means to be a modern mutual that does good.
Our path forward brings a sharper focus on our business' performance that's powered by innovation and an agile, high-performing culture - we're built for success.

We're well on our way to becoming a purpose-drive, digitally led national insurer. Come join us.

Job Responsibilities:

What will you do?
Design and implement generative AI apps and advanced multi-agent architectures to improve and automate business workflows and processes.
Enable interoperability between agents through A2A protocols and MCP servers for seamless data and tool integration.
Apply software engineering principles to build reliable, maintainable, and production-ready AI systems.
Collect, clean, and process structured and unstructured data from APIs and internal systems.
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify patterns and generate actionable insights.
Develop and deploy machine learning models using modern MLOps/GenAIOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines and model monitoring.
Collaborate with business teams to understand their needs and deliver AI solutions that create measurable impact.
Build interfaces and integrations for the business so teams can plug agents and models into their daily tools and processes.


Required Skills:

What are we looking for?
Currently enrolled in a quantitative or technical undergraduate program (Computer Science, Data Science, Math & Stats, Engineering, etc.).
Strong programming skills in Python (bonus for experience with open-source development)
Solid understanding of software engineering fundamentals (version control, testing, modular design).
Familiarity with AI/ML concepts (supervised/unsupervised learning, generative models, reinforcement learning).
Interest in Generative AI technologies (LLMs, prompt engineering, agent frameworks).
Ability to work with cloud platforms and ML tools (Databricks, MLflow, CI/CD pipelines).
Curiosity, creativity, and a passion for building solutions that matter.

Additional Information:

Security Clearance Required


Compensation and Benefits:

The offered hourly wage is based on the University of Waterloo's recommended hourly wage. This is based on your faculty & number of work terms completed (however, minimum hourly wage is $20/hr).

Job Summary:

This position presents a unique opportunity to gain experience across all aspects of investment operations (front, middle and back-office) at Hamblin Watsa Investment Counsel Ltd., the investment manager of Fairfax Financial. You will be interacting with portfolio managers, traders, system analysts, lawyers, compliance professionals, and accountants to support investment operations, research business & data requirements, support investment compliance matters, and will work closely with a small team to research, develop and deploy solutions accordingly.

Fairfax Financial and Hamblin Watsa
Fairfax Financial Holdings Limited is a holding company which, through its subsidiaries, is primarily engaged in property and casualty insurance and reinsurance and the associated investment management. Fairfax's corporate objective is to achieve a high rate of return on invested capital and build long-term shareholder value. Fairfax was founded in 1985 by the present Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, V. Prem Watsa. The company has been under present management since 1985 and is headquartered in Toronto, Canada. We encourage you to read our Guiding Principles at www.fairfax.ca.

Since 1985, investments have been centrally managed for all of the Fairfax group companies by Hamblin Watsa Investment Counsel Ltd. (www.hwic.ca), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Fairfax Financial. Hamblin Watsa emphasizes a conservative value investment philosophy, seeking to invest assets on a total return basis, which includes realized and unrealized gains over the long-term.

Fairfax Co-op Program
Fairfax Financial is apart of the Fairfax Co-op Program. The Fairfax Co-op Program is looking for innovative, talented and self-motivated University of Waterloo students who are interested in domestic and international work experience throughout the Fairfax group of companies. To learn more about the Fairfax Co-op Program, please visit co-op.fairfax.ca.

Who We Are:

Do you have a passion for innovation, desire to building world-class IT systems and most of all, a craving for food? Well, the Information Solutions Team at Maple Leaf Foods is the perfect fit! Think of Maple Leaf Foods as a billion dollar start up in the food industry with the resources to fuel your ideas

More On Maple Leaf Foods:

Maple Leaf Foods is Canada's leading consumer packaged meats company, headquartered in Mississauga, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf, Maple Leaf Prime, Maple Leaf Natural Selections, Schneiders, Schneiders Country Naturals and Mina. Our Company employs approximately 13,500 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.
We have a culture where people are high energy, take a stand, pursue excellence, and create the future. We balance fact-based discipline with the need for speed. We are incredibly supportive in working and sharing information with each other. We are driven by integrity.
For more information about Maple Leaf Foods, please visit the Maple Leaf website: http://www.mapleleaffoods.com

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do:

IS Analyst will participate in continuous improvement projects in various areas of Product Development, Document management including eCommerce Product Information/Digital Asset Management Systems and Sustainability - Carbon Management Platform. You will learn and configure simple SAP ERP, eCommerce, carbon management platform functionalities and you will also participate in creating and executing testing scripts for projects. You will also be involved in PowerBI development initiatives across various areas of responsibility.

Product Development (SAP PLM Recipe Development)

Action continuous improvement change requests including but not limited to configuration in SAP and connected systems related to Product Development business processes.
Participate to Business Analytics projects for Product Development Process Compliance metrics using SAP and Microsoft PowerBI
Create and execute Unit Testing and System Integration Test scripts as required for SAP PLM (Recipe Development) projects.
Work closely with the Information Solution Specialists and Analysts to provide support to end-users by troubleshooting issues, offering guidance, and resolving problems related to SAP PLM (Recipe Development)
Maintain and update system documentation, including system configurations and user How-to guides.
Manage product data within SAP PLM (Recipe Development), ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and integrity.
Help solve complex technical and functional issues related to SAP PLM and propose solutions.
E-commerce Systems (Salsify PIM/DAM)
Collaborate with the E-commerce team to analyze Salsify PIM and DAM processes and workflows, identifying inefficiencies and bottlenecks.
Work with stakeholders to gather functional requirements for the Salsify PIM/DAM system.
Assist in configuring and customizing the Salsify PIM/DAM system to meet business needs, including data structures and workflows.
Conduct testing and validation of system changes to ensure they align with business requirements.
Create and maintain documentation for system configurations, processes, and best practices.
Contribute to data governance initiatives, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with industry standards.

Sustainability - Carbon Management Platform (Altruistiq)
Collaborate with the sustainability team to gather and analyze data related to carbon emissions.
Create and execute testing scripts to ensure the platform's functionality and accuracy.
Provide support to end-users by troubleshooting issues, offering guidance, and resolving problems related to the Carbon Management Platform.

Required Skills:

Currently enrolled in IT or equivalent diploma, degree or certificate program. Preference for Computer Science or Engineering.
SAP experience (preferred but not mandatory)
Knowledgeable of Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks.
Good written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills

Job Summary:

What is the opportunity?

Maple Leaf Foods is looking for a Network CO-OP Support Analyst that will provide remote support to our various locations as well as local support to locations in the Winnipeg and Landmark area. We are a dynamic environment that works with various forms of networking and computing technology. The role will not only encompass support of day-to-day operations but project work as well. If you are chosen as our new analyst, you will work not only on or networks but also our plant systems that utilize virtualized computer environments. Most of our systems support our manufacturing plants and our key areas of effort around these facilities. You will be based out of our corporate office located at 6985 Financial Drive, Mississauga.

A co-op on this team may be a junior analyst but an analyst none the less and you will be given exciting opportunities that are second to none. If you love networking, infrastructure, engaging with people to come up with solutions this is a great opportunity for you!

Job Responsibilities:

What will you do?

Provide excellent customer service by execution of network technical projects and support operations that are designed to increase the business effectiveness of the Maple Leaf Foods infrastructure.
Support routine operations and problem resolution of network related issues. This will include the following network technologies
Local area networks across different locations in Canada, USA and Asia
Wide area networks that connect our locations together
Wireless infrastructure used by employees and guests
VoIP based communications systems such as MS Teams and Cisco Unified Call Manager
Assist in the support of SDWAN related projects.
Monitor and support networking protocols across multi-regions, Infrastructure (DHCP, DNS, switching, routing, etc.)
Monitor, manage the capacity of the network infrastructure through network utilization, QoS, IP allocation, port density, e
Help maintain an optimal network environment though data close cabling and asset inventory.
Adhere to Infrastructure architecture governance and standards.
Provide infrastructure analysis as required

Required Skills:

What do you need to succeed?

The successful applicant will possess a job experience in the data LAN/WAN networking field and systems experience via their COOP program in a College diploma with post-secondary education course(s)

Strong understanding of Layer 2 and Layer 3 networking knowledge
Eagerness to participate in the troubleshooting of security, networking, and application issues
Demonstrated ability to solve problems, and have a passion for problem solving and digging in to find the root cause
Design and quickly implement solutions.
Knowledge of Cisco, HPE Aruba, Meraki or other network technology
Strong technical aptitude, analytical, and problem-solving skills;
Strong written and verbal communication preferred.
Experience in supporting a Windows PCs/Stations.

Nice to Have:
If you have any certifications or education in IT technologies such as network, server, client or cloud are all an asset.

Compensation and Benefits:

What's in it for you?
Being a co-op student means making many tough decisions, but we want this to be one of your easy decisions by providing you with the opportunity to:

Network and build lasting relationships with team members from diverse backgrounds from across Canada
Make a difference and lasting impact
Mentorship and support from our leadership trainees and senior leaders
Training and development through Maple Leaf's Leadership Learning Hub and through our learning workshops
Opportunity to participate in Taste Testing allowing you to provide feedback on our products
Potential opportunity to be part of the Leadership Training program after graduation
Potential opportunity to attend tech events courtesy of Maple Leaf Foods
Enjoy a comfortable work environment with the option to dress casually
Volunteer at our Maple Leaf Center for Action on Food Security

Do you have a passion for innovation, desire to building world-class IT systems and most of all, a craving for food? Well, the Information Solutions Team at Maple Leaf Foods is the perfect fit! Think of Maple Leaf Foods as a billion dollar start up in the food industry with the resources to fuel your ideas.

About Capital One Canada

For over 20 years, we've been on a mission to change banking for good and build relationships by making credit accessible, simple, intuitive and rewarding. We want to help Canadians succeed with credit, because we believe in people - in our customers, in our associates, and in talent like you!

About the Team

Rescue Mission team is responsible for building and managing Canada Recoveries business functionality on Omega platform. We work in Agile with continuous build, testing and software delivery processes. If you believe in team work along with learning and fun, this role will definitely be exciting for you.

Job Responsibilities:

About the Role

As an engineer on the Rescue Mission team you will be working with a highly collaborative, diverse mix of engineers to enhance the product vision to deliver new credit card products to the market. Our team believes in inclusion and values everyone's thoughts, while supporting each other to deliver the business needs. As part of this team you will be able to work on AWS(Amazon Web Services), Serverless technologies, RESTful APIs, Microservices using Java, Spring, SQL Databases, Docker containers and continuous delivery processes. You will be involved in building infrastructure, feature development, testing (unit test, component test and integration test), deployment, monitoring and fixing cyber security and vulnerability fixes.

IDE: IntelliJ
Language: Java, Python
AWS: S3, Lambda, Route53, Security Groups, IAM roles
Monitoring Tool: Splunk, New Relic, Cloudwatch
CI/CD: Jenkins, Onepipeline (Capital One's innersourced CICD pipeline)
Databases: RESTful APIs, SQL Databases

Your Responsibilities:
Work as part of a dynamic team throughout the software development life cycle
Develop code to meet story acceptance criteria
Conduct design and code reviews to ensure high-level quality output
Ensure adherence to continuous improvement practices as required to meet quality, and time to market imperatives
Participate in Agile ceremonies, design and brainstorming sessions
Collaborate with Product and Analyst stakeholders to implement enhancements or new applications
Technical Documentation for analysis, test results and release.
Learn and build AWS cloud infrastructure on the job
Have fun with the team

Required Skills:

Basic Qualifications:

Will obtain a Bachelor's degree or higher from August 2026 or later
Familiarity with application development using any backend programming language, and JavaScript.
Good communication, presentation, and writing skills
Good understanding of testing fundamentals
Able to work within a team setting and actively participate and collaborate in team discussion
Please include your resume and unofficial transcripts in one PDF in the attachment section under Resume/CV when you create your profile to apply
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with backend technologies such as Java, Python, AWS Lambda, S3.
Experience with version control technology i.e. Git
Experience with Jenkins CI/CD, microservices, API design / integration

Compensation and Benefits:

$23 to $43 per hour

Please read our Privacy Statement.

Enjoy a hybrid work environment, with 3 days in the office. Build a comfortable workspace with our one-time, Work From Home allowance and enjoy our head office located conveniently across the street from Union Station.

Live well-physically, financially and emotionally. Receive support for you and those who are most important to you, with full coverage for spouses, domestic partners, and dependents. This job is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP) or Canada Summer Jobs. These programs require that candidates be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

Job Summary:

Company Description
At Data SEA Consulting, we help mid-sized businesses unlock the power of their data. Our clients - from private equity funds to independent business owners - rely on us to design and implement modern analytics solutions that drive measurable value. We develop tailored data strategies, then use cutting-edge tools to build infrastructure, dashboards, and AI-powered solutions that transform decision-making and fuel growth.

Learn more: www.dataseaconsulting.com/talent

If you're a student or recent graduate passionate about analytics, eager to learn, and ready to tackle challenging real-world problems, we'd love to hear from you.

Job Description
As an Associate Co-op - Data Analytics & Engineering, you'll join our consulting team to design, develop, and deploy high-quality data solutions for clients across multiple industries.

Job Responsibilities:

Why Join Data SEA

Work across the entire analytics lifecycle - from requirements gathering and data pipelines to dashboards, ML models, and interactive applications.
Present your work to senior client stakeholders (CEO, CTO and CFOs) and see your ideas in action.
Learn fast through hands-on mentorship, code reviews, and team collaboration.
Grow with us - many of our current consultants began as co-ops and advanced into leadership roles.
Enjoy our friendly, social culture - from team lunches to project celebrations.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with clients to implement analytics solutions and ensure a seamless user experience.
Design and develop data architectures that optimize flow, storage, and accessibility.
Build and maintain Lakehouse data pipelines using best practices and medallion architecture principles.
Support the deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
Help define and manage data governance standards for accuracy, security, and compliance.
Merge and visualize data from multiple sources to uncover key insights.
Contribute to prototypes and frameworks that help clients adopt modern data technologies.

Required Skills:

Qualifications

Should Have

Background in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Strong SQL and Python skills.
Quick learner with curiosity about data systems and problem-solving.
Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Excellent written and verbal communication.
Nice to Have
Familiarity with Databricks
Understanding of data architecture, governance, and medallion design.
Experience building in Dev/UAT/Prod environments.
Exposure to machine learning or AI development.

Transportation and Housing:

Our office is located in downtown Toronto. Students will be responsible for providing their own housing and transporting themselves to this location.

Compensation and Benefits:

The compensation for this role will be $1,400 per week.

What You Can Expect from Us
At Data SEA Consulting we are passionate about finding the right people and helping them grow so that they can help us solve the complex analytical problems that we tackle on behalf of our clients. We are looking for students who can join Data SEA Consulting in a full-time capacity after graduating from their studies so we will have a vested interest in your development during your internship. Since we are a small team, there are extensive opportunities to receive hands-on coaching both on the job and in a 1:1 setting. By working on multiple engagements for clients in different industries, the Data Engineering Co-op will gain invaluable hands-on experience.

Job Summary:

About Boomerang
At Boomerang, we're on a mission to revolutionize how employers stay connected with their former colleagues. We believe relationships matter and are here to provide a simple, affordable, and automated solution that keeps those connections alive.

We are a series-A-stage company (~ $12M in total venture capital from Tier 1 funds) that has assembled some of the best builders, designers, and product minds to reimagine the future of work.

We're seeking a Software Engineering Associate to join our Toronto office. This is an opportunity to join us on the ground floor, working alongside seasoned founders with a track record of successful companies. As a pivotal member of our growing team, you'll have the chance to make a significant impact and contribute to our collective vision.

Our Values
We believe values aren't just a top-down process but a collective effort. Our values: integrity, balance, growth, and results, guide us in decision-making and shape our behavior. We speak our truth, keep our promises, and trust each other. We embrace failure, curiosity, and continuous improvement. We ask questions without fear of judgment. We value harmony within ourselves, our team, and our community because we understand that it leads to better results. We look at outcomes over outputs and enjoy working hard (and having fun) together.

PLEASE NOTE: Boomerang uses Deel Canada strictly for payroll purposes as we are an organization incorporated in the US. You are being employed by Boomerang, not Deel.

Job Responsibilities:

As a Software Engineering Associate, you will work on our engineering team on a broad range of technologies, developing features on the entire stack. We are looking for a motivated self-starting person that is willing to take on big challenges. You must also be an empathetic team member, who works well in a team environment and values communication and collaboration. Here are some of the things you'll be doing:

Build reliable and scalable back-end functionality and APIs to power our front-end clients
Build beautiful front-end experiences
Make tweaks and improvements to our AI algorithms
Participate in the whole lifecycle of code, design, development, review, deployment, and testing

Required Skills:

Kotlin, Spring Boot
React
MySQL
Python
Docker
Note: Not all of these technologies are required, if you have a subset of these we would love to talk to you!

Compensation and Benefits:
