Job Summary:

Who we are:
Geotab ® is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified "Great Place to Work™." We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.

Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotab's open platform and Geotab Marketplace ®, offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.

Our team is growing and we're looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what it's like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram. Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news.

Who you are:
The Solutions Engineering Intern is responsible to develop solutions and documentation to support department initiatives. These solutions may require the development of tools and/or processes, technical project or program management, data mining and analysis, etc. The Solutions Engineering Intern will work closely with the Solutions Engineering teams and management, as well as communicate with other product or engineering departments as needed.

What you'll do:
To be successful in this role you will be a self-starter with strong written and verbal communication skills, and have the ability to quickly understand technical concepts. In addition, the successful candidate will have strong analytical and project management skills with an ability to identify needs, develop effective solutions and manage projects through to completion. The successful candidate will also be able to manage multiple timelines and contrasting priorities to ensure timely results.

The opportunity:
4-month work-term, beginning May 2026
Full-time, paid internship (Monday to Friday, 37.5hrs/week)
Your first week at Geotab begins with 'GEO Launch' - a one week Employee Orientation. Click here to learn more!

Job Responsibilities:

How you'll make an impact:

Collaborate with the Solutions Engineering team to design and develop solutions that leverage Geotab's ecosystem to our customer's challenges. This includes creating proof-of-concept models, identifying key features and assessing potential impacts to customer requirements.
Support and maintain team solutions through further development, documentation or cross-team training.
Provide technical project management support as needed for team projects. Prepare accurate and concise technical documentation, reports, and presentations related to sustainability initiatives and solution development. Communicate project progress, challenges, and outcomes to relevant stakeholders.
Assist in the coordination and execution of projects, including data collection, performance monitoring, and analysis. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project milestones are achieved within established timelines.
Stay informed about emerging trends, technologies, and industry standards. Identify opportunities for improvement in Geotab's ecosystem and propose innovative alternatives.

Required Skills:

What you'll bring to this role

1+ years experience with data science tools, SQL (Google Big Query preferred).
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, JS, HTML, React.
Familiarity with API integrations, some ability to develop, maintain and/or troubleshoot issues.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to problem-solve to well-judged decisions.
Strong aptitude for understanding technical and business requirements. Ability to understand reasoning for project requirements.
High accuracy and meticulous attention to detail.
Able to work well under pressure and respond to fast changing priorities and deadlines.
Strong project management skills; able to identify needs, develop effective solutions and manage projects through to completion.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Willingness to learn and a strong work ethic and passion for technology and innovation.
Self-motivated and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
Prior experience or exposure to telematics, connected vehicle technology, or related fields is a plus.

Compensation and Benefits:

$24.00 - $36.00 /hour CAD (Compensation can be discussed with the HR recruiter)
Free lunch at Oakville head office daily, and some days at our Waterloo and Toronto offices
Virtual and on-site intern socials
Lunch & Learns with Geotabbers
MyLearning - an online platform offering a variety of free courses and modules for you to choose from based on your interests
Intern Innovation Challenge (Summers only)

Job Summary:

The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC), North America's third largest transit system and
recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA has introduced its new 2024-2028 TTC
Corporate Plan - Moving Toronto, Connecting Communities which continues the TTC's legacy
of delivering service to hundreds of millions of customers a year. The TTC's new vision and
mission statements also help promote the many environmental, social equity and economic
benefits that the TTC provides:
Vision: Moving Toronto towards a more equitable, sustainable, and prosperous future.
Mission: To serve the needs of transit riders by providing a safe, reliable, efficient, and
accessible mass public transit service through a seamless integrated network to create access
to opportunity for everyone.
At the TTC, our Early Talent programs provide students with the opportunity to work alongside
experts on exciting projects, gain an understanding on the transit industry, develop in-demand
skills and experiences and get an early start to your career. This is your chance to make a
meaningful impact on Toronto's transit!
The full Plan can be viewed on ttc.ca.
Please note: We are pleased to announce now that our co-op roles are now open to all
students! You do not need to be enrolled in a co-op program to apply. Eligibility requirements
include being eligible to work in Canada & enrollment at an accredited Canadian postsecondary
institution
General Accountability
The Student Transit Planner is responsible for assisting the planning, design, and analysis of
transit services to determine the best possible service for customers. This includes undertaking,
with direction from the Transit Planner or Senior Planner - Transit
Service, statistical and economic analyses of new service proposals and the ongoing evaluation
of existing transit services.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities
The Student Transit Planner is responsible for assisting in the planning, design and analysis of
transit services. This involves:
• Undertaking statistical and economic analyses of the performance of transit service and
identifying means by which to make transit services more cost-effective and beneficial
to customers, and compiling and communicating findings to Transit Planners;
• Assisting the Transit Planner in developing recommendations with respect to new
routes and services and service improvements on existing routes, particularly in relation
to the Annual Service Plan;
• Analyzing ridership data and other information for monthly service changes on existing
routes and assisting Transit Planners in developing service designs for transit
operations;
• Undertaking special projects within the Service Planning & Scheduling Department or
the Commission, as requested by the Senior Planner - Transit Service or the Transit
Planner.
• Performing other related duties as assigned.

Required Skills:

Skills, Education & Experience
• Requires general knowledge of public transit services and principles, and of the
role of transit service in the community.
• Good knowledge of spreadsheet and word processing applications, and
experience with GIS, data processing skills, and familiarity with graphic design
and visualization applications such as Adobe Illustrator is an asset.
• Well-developed analytical and quantitative skills, with demonstrated
understanding on Microsoft Excel, is essential in this position.
• Candidates with strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communications skills
are preferred.
• These skills are normally obtained through at least two years of study towards an
undergraduate degree in geography, environmental studies, planning, statistics,
or engineering.

Additional Requirements
Students will be required to complete a criminal background check during the
onboarding stage, satisfactory results will be required.

Transportation and Housing:

PLEASE NOTE: Transportation will be provided via a TTC Employee Pass.

Additional Information:

Unrestricted Driver Licence
Security Clearance Required


Compensation and Benefits:

Salary Scale: $25.61 to $31.98 per hour

Job Summary:

Energy Aspects is seeking coop students for roles in the Energy Markets and/or Quantitative analytics to join our growing global team based in London. This is a fantastic opportunity to begin your analytics career by contributing to a well-respected and rapidly growing energy markets research consultancy.

As a passionate energy markets analyst, you will play a central role in our energy services, confidently understanding complex data and making market calls on rapidly changing markets. These responsibilities will span the full cycle of our work, from monitoring market developments, helping upkeep supply/demand/pricing models, and writing concise analysis.

Job Responsibilities:

Collecting data sets, then highlighting key changes in the data and providing insights on how it affects short term market balances.
Keeping updated on the latest developments in energy markets, including key changes to supply, demand, inventories, and prices.
Producing relevant and insightful fundamental research and models that help inform our client facing views.
Providing commentary on market movements through our publications.
Analysis of upstream and midstream companies earning reports (10Ks/Q2s), and reviewing financial performance.
Building and maintaining strong internal and external networks.

Required Skills:

Studying a degree in Engineering, Math, Computer Science, or some Quantitative discipline
Strong MS Excel skills are required. Programming skills are preferred (Python, SQL, Power BI).
The ability to communicate market views clearly and concisely to clients in English (written and verbal).
A strong eye for detail and drive to ensure content published is client-ready and follows the company's strong ethos.

Transportation and Housing:

We will support accommodation, visa and flight costings to the UK as well as guidance. The total package will be provided at the point of offer.

Compensation and Benefits:

With accreditation from Best Companies, we understand the importance of workplace engagement and holding sincere appreciation for our team. Our environment is characterised by its fast-paced, driven, collaborative, and dynamic ethos. Recognising and rewarding contributions that have played a part in our remarkable journey of growth.

Joining Energy Aspects, you become a part of our vibrant and sociable team. Here, you'll have the opportunity to participate in activities, from running and five-a-side football to joining our lunch gatherings and brand-new Chess club. Our in-house bar, the Nodding Donkey, offers a casual setting for Friday afternoon unwinding.

This will be a £3,000 monthly stipend with a £1,500 per month accommodation allowance and flights and visa costs supported by the business.

If you are matched to a job outside of Canada, you may apply for international travel awards/scholarships via SAFA. Please see more information at https://uwaterloo.ca/student-awards-financial-aid/undergraduate-awards/international-experience-awards

Job Summary:

Established in 1981, NUS-ISS nurtures digital talent for the industry through graduate education, executive education programmes, consultancy, applied research, and career services. NUS-ISS guides individuals and organisations to bridge future opportunities through a unique portfolio of multiple learning pathways such as blended learning and stackable programmes, leading the way in shaping the next curve of digital excellence.

NUS-ISS offers a wide spectrum of programmes in critical industry disciplines, such as digital leadership, software development, data science, artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, product management, smart health and digital innovation.

To date, over 173,750 digital leaders and professionals, 8,110 corporate client organisations, and 7,660 graduate programmes alumni have benefitted from NUS-ISS's suite of services. Its programmes are delivered by NUS-ISS staff with an average of more than 20 years of industry experience and supported by a strong network of partners.

NUS-ISS also works with industry partners and associations locally and globally to co-create a digital learning ecosystem that inspires and shapes solutions for the digital economy.

Purpose:
The intern will assist in enhancing the existing curriculum by integrating AI and Generative AI (Gen AI) technologies, providing hands-on and practical learning experiences. Additionally, the intern will support the management of capstone and internship projects by handling submissions, tracking progress, and assisting with grading processes.

Support the incorporation of AI and Gen AI concepts into existing courses.
Participate in building software tools and AI models for workshops, simulations, and demonstrations.
Facilitate the design and execution of workshops with coding examples and real-world applications, such as cyberattack simulations and AI in feature engineering.
Assist in organizing and tracking internship projects by developing a management system that supports the entire process, from submission to grading.

Cloud Computing: Proficiency in AWS.

Software Development Skills: Familiarity with Java, Spring Boot, and front-end frameworks such as Angular and React.

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Job Summary:

Boardy is an AI superconnector with a network of 70,000 professionals who connects people through natural conversation (texting, calling). We're building autonomous AI systems that understand human potential and make introductions that change lives.

We're looking for candidates with high agency, exceptional communication, and top technical expertise. People with unwavering curiosity and the conviction that any technical challenge can be overcome. You could call this type of person a "Superbuilder". (Learn more: apply.boardy.ai/superbuilder.)

Our stack is modern (TypeScript, Python, cutting-edge LLMs), our problems are novel (think autonomous AI agents, not CRUD apps), and we're tackling challenges most companies won't see for years.

Our team is small (~30 people and growing), well-funded ($11M), and you'll learn from people who have been exactly where you are. You'll work directly with our Founding Engineer Owen Gretzinger, and you'll get to learn the ins and outs of building successful companies from our CEO Andrew D'Souza, who scaled his last company Clearco to $2.5B, and our Head of Growth Swish Goswami, who co-founded Surf (acquired by Datacy) and has been recognized as a LinkedIn Top Voice with over 200M content views.

Want to see what we're building? Check us out at boardy.ai. If you want to ship code that matters and see firsthand how venture-backed startups are built, this is your chance. You'll have direct impact on our product and tech decisions from day one.

Job Responsibilities:

You will take ownership over one/some of the following:

Platform Integrations: Integrate Boardy into platforms where people already spend their time (think LinkedIn, WhatsApp, phone calls, etc., not another app to download)
Context Engineering: Engineer systems to provide Boardy with the precise, relevant information as needed
Memory Systems: Build systems that help Boardy understand and remember conversations with users
Matching Algorithms: Optimize systems that intelligently connect people based on goals, desires, and context
Growth Engineering: Build features that accelerate adoption and retention
Something else that you think needs to be worked on

Required Skills:

For specific information on the USA visa process that affects co-op employment, refer to our USA Work Permit/J-1 Visa webpage (opens in a new window).

Job Summary:

About Yugabyte
Yugabyte is the company behind YugabyteDB, the leading open-source distributed SQL database for building mission-critical, cloud-native applications. Many Fortune 100 companies trust YugabyteDB to power applications that demand global scale, high availability, and uncompromising consistency.

At Yugabyte, you'll work alongside world-class engineers who built databases and distributed systems at companies like Facebook, Nutanix, Oracle, Google, Microsoft, and VMware. Our engineering team is deeply involved in the open-source community and is advancing the state of the art in distributed databases, PostgreSQL compatibility, and cloud services.

Why Yugabyte is exciting for Waterloo students

You'll get to work on hard systems problems: distributed consensus, query planning & optimization, compactions, replication, connection management, and global deployments.
Exposure to open-source at scale: your contributions can land directly in one of the fastest-growing distributed SQL projects on GitHub.
Learn what it takes to run a database in the cloud era: high availability across zones & regions, automated failover, observability, and performance tuning on AWS, Azure, and GCP.
Impact: your work will power real-world use cases like online banking, global e-commerce, and even streaming the Super Bowl without a glitch.
Culture: small, collaborative engineering teams where mentorship is built-in and ideas matter more than titles.

Job Responsibilities:

What you'll work on
Depending on your team and interest, projects may include:

Enhancing PostgreSQL compatibility (query planner, new SQL features).
Advancing vector indexing techniques for semantic search and AI workloads.
Improving fault tolerance, replication, and distributed consensus in Yugabyte's DocDB engine.
Performance engineering at scale (query retries, cost-based optimizations, smart connection pooling).
Leveraging AI-based performance tuning to optimize queries and automate system reliability at scale.
Building tooling for observability, debugging, and automation in distributed clusters.
Role
As a software engineering intern working on the Core Database, you will be responsible for designing and implementing features in the heart of the database. This is logically split into two high level components, DocDB and YQL. The storage engine of Yugabyte (DocDB) is responsible for efficient data storage and retrieval, our raft consensus and distributed transaction layers, as well as overall stability and reliability of the database. On top of this layer, sits the query and language layer (YQL), which is responsible for efficient query handling, database security and visibility, as well as making the breadth of SQL functionality available to our users.
We are looking for students who are highly collaborative, driven and thrive in a fast-paced startup environment, and who are excited about building an internet-scale, globally distributed, SQL database.

Required Skills:

Minimum qualifications:

Currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related field.
Experience with CS fundamentals, algorithms and data structures and software design.
Experience in Software Development and coding in a general purpose programming language.
Preferred qualifications:
Working knowledge of C or C++.
Experience with distributed systems, operating systems, networking, compilers, database design or SQL.
Experience with concurrency, multithreading and synchronization.

Transportation and Housing:

If you temporarily relocate to California for the duration of your internship, you are eligible for

A housing allowance of up to USD $1,500/mo (reimbursed on actuals)
Reimbursement for one roundtrip trip to California up to USD $1,500 for self (on actuals)

Additional Information:

Security Clearance Required


Compensation and Benefits:

Our compensation will be comparable to other top Bay Area companies and will meet or exceed University of Waterloo guidelines.

Base salary of USD 9,000
A housing allowance of up to USD $1,500/mo (reimbursed on actuals)
Reimbursement for one roundtrip trip to California up to USD $1,500 for self (on actuals)
Free lunches on working days
Medical benefits after 90 days of employment. There would be some deductions based on the plan chosen.
Work alongside database and systems experts from Meta, Nutanix, Microsoft, Google, and other top tech companies-right in the heart of Bay Area innovation.

Job Summary:

YOUR NEXT CO-OP PLACEMENT

Work term: Summer 2026
Work term length: 4 months

From classroom to co-op to career, every step of your journey has an impact on your future. That's why it makes sense to choose a co-op placement with a company that offers truly rewarding work and real-life experience. At Definity®, your contributions, creativity, and energy will be put to good use, and you'll get to be involved with initiatives that support our strategic goals and use your skills in a supportive team environment.
If you're looking for a company that takes care of its people - full time, part time, and co-ops alike - and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here.

Job Responsibilities:

What can you expect in this role?

You will be responsible for turning data into meaningful insights and reporting. The key will be understanding the claims data and report the trends using visualization tools. This opportunity will place you at the forefront of leveraging data visualization tools and strategize the transformation of data into insights within Definity Claims Team.

Your Responsibilities

Discover opportunities to transform reports into dashboards to deliver more actionable insights and continuously improve the claims analytics environment
Gather reporting or dashboarding requirements from stakeholders; steer meetings with data management team to understand data and facilitate meetings with business stakeholders to accurately assess the analytical need for building reports/dashboards
Be passionate and creative in designing analytical wireframes and developing dashboards
Recommend effective visual analytical solutions which drive an analytical mindset within the organization
Conduct preliminary analyses on data involving basic statistical approaches and provides solutions to treat various data inconsistencies to support reporting integrity
Organize data for use by other analyst roles and business users within Claims
Support the business by developing and providing training and documentation on dashboards

Required Skills:

What you bring

Working towards a university or college degree in computer science, data analytics, big data analytics, business analysis or similar field
Intermediate familiarity with Tableau visualization tool to create dashboards and develop value-creating business insights from operational performance indicators and scorecards
Experience using SQL to transform data from applications to provide summaries and aggregates
Experience with MS Excel required - especially pivot tables, lookups, macros/VBA, PowerPivot
Experience with JIRA or Confluence is preferred
Knowledge or experience with BigQuery ang Google Cloud Platform for analytics an asset
Knowledge of agile methodology for analytics development; experience with JIRA & Confluence an asset
Experience in the P&C Insurance industry is a strong asset
Excellent communication and organizational skills; comfortable with ambiguity and ability to work independently with minimal supervision

Transportation and Housing:

Did you know?

We care about our co-ops: Definity's co-op students are considered the best pipeline of talent for our full-time, permanent positions.
We care about students: Definity distributes $85,000 in scholarships to students across Canada each year.
We care about our community: Definity donates more than $1 million every year to causes that drive true change in the neighourhoods in which we live and work.

What can Definity offer you
Meaningful work forwarding our purpose of building a better world by helping our clients and communities adapt and thrive in their hardest times of need.
Culture of accountability, empowerment, and collaboration.
Opportunities to support personal and professional growth through real-life experience and unique learning opportunities. Our Leadership Essentials program builds knowledge and skills to Team Leaders to Directors
Opportunity to join our employee groups - focused on women's empowerment, LGBTQ+, anti-racism and cultural equity, and environmental activism
Determined to create positive change for our environment, our people, and our communities, now and in the future. Check our ESG work!

Starting at $22.5 upto $30.60 (based on the work term)

Special Work Term Start/End Date Considerations:

Spring 2026 - May 4, 2026 to August 28, 2026

Special Job Requirements:

Hiring Preference given to Canadian Citizens and Permanent Residents. Security Clearance required. Fingerprinting is required.

Job Summary:

Research Assistant in Renewable Heat and Power as part of the Electrification and Energy Storage Program
If you are a dynamic, motivated and determined person, the Energy EfficiencyTechnology Sector (EETS) at Natural Resources Canada is for you! Our laboratory at CanmetENERGY-Ottawa is looking for students to work in Renewable Heat and Power as part of the Electrification and Energy Storage program.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values. We believe that diverse teams bring different perspectives and creative ideas that benefit our clients, the communities we serve and all of us as colleagues. We welcome application from individuals with diverse abilities and from all backgrounds and identities.

In support of achieving a diverse workforce, preference will be given to candidates who, at the time of application, self-declare* as belonging to one or more of the following designated Employment Equity groups: Aboriginal Peoples, Persons with Disabilities, Women, or Visible Minorities. In order to self-declare, please state the Employment Equity group(s) to which you belong in your cover letter. For more information on Employment Equity please see: https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/gc-jobs/employment-equity.html

Work Environment
EETS has a diverse and highly skilled workforce with 585 employees across the country. It is NRCan's third largest sector representing more than 15 percent of the department's workforce, with 50 percent of the staff located in three CanmetENERGY labs in Devon (AB), Ottawa (ON), and Varennes (QC), and one CanmetMATERIALS lab in Hamilton (ON).
In addition to being large and regionally dispersed, EETS exciting mandate offers a wide range of career choices including : Engineering (EN-ENG), Engineering and Scientific Support (EG), Scientific Research (SE-RES) occupational groups and others. Among the Executive Cadre at ETS, women hold 60% of the executive positions.

Our sector, EETS, is also committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage candidates to indicate voluntarily on their application if they are a woman, an Indigenous person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group.

Here at CanmetENERGY-Ottawa we promote work-life balance and a happier, healthier workforce. We offer a variety of physical activities for all ages and abilities. Our facilities offer four seasons of various activities from indoor yoga and HITT training, to outdoor activities such as hockey (ball and ice), volleyball, soccer, running groups and more. In addition, because we are located in the west end of Ottawa in the NCC Greenbelt, we have access to trails nearby for walking or cross-country skiing.

CanmetENERGY-Ottawa has been named one of Canada's Healthy Workplace Month® Great Employers (2019 - 2022, 2024)!

Job Responsibilities:

Position Description
The Renewable Heat and Power Group at CanmetENERGY-Ottawa is seeking to hire a co-op student for the summer 2026 term to advance various R&D initiatives, primarily supporting the Electrification and Energy Storage team. This team focuses on the interconnected challenges of decarbonization through electrification, and increasing the share of electricity generation from variable renewable sources. We conduct modelling at a range of scales, and work with a variety of partners, within and outside of government. The ideal candidate will be well versed in renewable energy, electric power grids, and database management and visualizations.

Primary duties of the position:
Integrate new technologies or scenarios into energy modelling tools, such as:

TRNSYS to model energy storage systems at the building scale,
Matlab Simulink to model grid integration of renewables at the plant scale,
and/or PyPSA to model the bulk power grid.
Data analysis: assist analysis and validation of data from renewable energy systems including studying time series data, reviewing system specifications, comparing data sources and creating visualizations

Literature reviews: writing technical reports and conducting literature reviews on various energy systems or power grid modelling topics, development of load profiles for buildings and transportation loads, and/or modelling of the use of renewable energy systems to provide grid services.

Assist the Electrification and Energy Storage team and other groups within the Renewable Heat and Power team in progressing their mandate as they see fit.

Required Skills:

Requirements of the position:

Knowledge of engineering concepts as they relate to power grids, power systems, renewable energy generation, energy storage, and/or electrical engineering
Exposure to building sciences, computer programming, data management, modeling and/or be broadly interested in renewable and low-carbon energy systems
Capable of manipulating and analyzing large datasets and writing custom algorithms to conduct data operations.
Capable of using or learning how to use data visualization tools such as PowerBI.
Proficiency in one or more programming languages is an asset.
Proficiency with one or more modelling tools is an asset.
Capable of learning and working independently; utilizing resources provided to accomplish tasks in a timely fashion.
Strong written and verbal skills (in English), capable of producing internal/external technical documents as well as presenting to various working groups and stakeholders
Must be available to work on site, five days a week (1 Haanel Drive, Ottawa, ON)
Must be able to obtain Reliability security status (only required if an offer is accepted)
Your new ideas and fresh perspective can make a difference in the clean energy that we develop. Learn more about CANMET and some of the research projects that you could contribute to:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iLzA6PP1Ln0
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-k3aa0HVGGk&feature=youtu.be (English)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xqQjXASAKRk&feature=youtu.be (French)

Additional Information:

Security Clearance Required
Hiring Preference - Canadian


Compensation and Benefits:

The salary range is between $21.60 to $28.30

We start at Step 3 of the student rates of pay - effective May 1, 2025

Payment based on federal government co-op rates (dependent on number of work terms completed, previous work experience and amount of course work completed/level of education)

Special Work Term Start/End Date Considerations:

Students are responsible for ensuring they are eligible for an 8-month work term before applying. Please discuss your work/study sequence flexibility with your academic advisor as soon as possible.

Job Summary:

About the Role

We're looking for a Software Engineering (Co-op) to join our engineering team and work on core product features used by some of the largest and most security-conscious organizations in the world.

This role is ideal for students who want real ownership, real users, and real impact. You'll contribute production code, work closely with experienced engineers and founders, and help build foundational components of a fast-growing product. We care more about trajectory and curiosity than perfect credentials. If you're excited to learn quickly and take responsibility, you'll thrive here.

About Coverbase

The modern global economy runs on a dense web of third-party relationships. Over the past 50 years, companies have gone from managing a handful of vendors to relying on hundreds of SaaS providers, cloud services, and contract partners. Each comes with its own security, compliance, and operational risk-leading organizations to spend millions of dollars and countless hours on due diligence.

Coverbase's mission is to streamline and modernize third-party risk management, reducing manual effort and enabling organizations to work together safely and efficiently. We use modern AI techniques to analyze large volumes of unstructured data and evaluate them against policies to surface meaningful, auditable risk insights.

We already serve Fortune 500 customers across financial services, insurance, and higher education, including five of the top 25 banks in the United States.

Team & Leadership

Our leadership team brings deep experience building and scaling high-impact systems:
Clarence (CEO): Co-founder and former CTO of Unit21, a Series C fraud detection company that raised ~$92M
Kao (CTO): Former engineering lead at Stripe, where he helped launch Banking-as-a-Service

We've raised $20M from world-class investors, and our team of ~12 engineers has built products at Google, Mapbox, Waymo, and Stripe.

Why Join Coverbase as a Co-op?

Real Product Impact
Your work will ship to production and be used by some of the most regulated organizations in the world.

Exceptional Learning Environment
You'll work closely with founders and senior engineers, gaining exposure to system design, product decision-making, and startup execution.

High-Growth Company
Coverbase is tackling a large, underserved market with strong early traction. Customers describe the product as:

"A revolutionary step forward in third-party risk management."
"We completed a risk assessment in 1.5 days that would normally take weeks."
"It's been a joy to work with this team."

Supportive, Kind Team Culture
We value empathy, curiosity, and clear communication just as much as technical excellence.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Work On

You'll take ownership of a meaningful subset of the following, depending on your interests and strengths:

Design, build, and iterate on end-to-end web product features used by real enterprise customers
Contribute across the stack, including:
Backend services in typed Python
Frontend applications in React / TypeScript
Postgres data modeling and query optimization
AWS infrastructure defined with Pulumi
Work on applied AI systems, including:
Document ingestion and parsing
Custom chunking and retrieval pipelines
Vector databases and private LLM workflows
Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and product planning
Learn how production systems are designed, shipped, monitored, and scaled in a real startup environment
This is not a "shadowing" role - you'll be writing production code and seeing your work shipped.

Required Skills:

What We're Looking For

Strong foundational software engineering skills
Comfortable in your dev environment
Confident using Git
Able to debug issues independently and ask good questions
Experience or strong interest in at least one of the following:
Frontend development (React / TypeScript)
Backend systems (Python)
AI / ML systems or data processing
Cloud infrastructure (AWS)
Ability to thrive in a fast-moving, early-stage environment
Curiosity, ownership, and a collaborative mindset
Formal education level or prior domain experience in security or finance is not required.

Transportation and Housing:

Transportation & Housing

This role is fully remote and does not require relocation. Work hours are flexible, with collaboration typically occurring within PST-EST time zones.
Approximately once every three to five months, the team gathers in person at a predetermined location for offsites or planning sessions. All travel, lodging, and related expenses are fully covered by Coverbase.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation is competitive and benchmarked at or above the 80th percentile for comparable co-op software engineering roles. Students receive paid time off (PTO) for the duration of the work term.
Coverbase provides fully covered travel and accommodation for required in-person team gatherings within the U.S. every 3-5 months, with advance notice.
Additional benefits include mentorship and professional development, team events and activities, and fully provided IT equipment, including macs and applicable stipends.
$40 to $65 USD per hour. Salary depended on level and experience.

Job Summary:

When you join Achievers as a co-op, you're treated from day one as a true member of the team, working on meaningful projects that make an impact. You`ll work with experienced engineering leaders who will provide you with comprehensive onboarding, mentorship, and real opportunities to work on complex and challenging projects.

And did we mention? We love to keep great talent. Many of our co-ops go on to join us full-time because we believe in their potential!

About Achievers

Our employee recognition and engagement platform serves 4 million users in 190 countries worldwide
Some of our clients include Air Canada, Scotia bank, CVS, Tesla, and McDonald`s.
Contribute to a product that makes a real difference - work on a platform that directly improves workplace culture
Check out this videoto learn more about our culture
Take an office tour when you view our feature on BlogTO
Visit our website: https://www.achievers.com/home/
Why work with us?
We love to have co-ops on board and to support their growth!
We offer competitive rates!
Many of our co-ops return for multiple terms and get full-time job offers with us after they graduate!
You`ll receive dedicated mentorship from experienced Engineers who are invested in your development and success!
We're a fun-loving, passionate, and highly collaborative team.
We believe in moving quickly, failing fast, and adapting to change.
We're committed to achieving technical excellence in everything we do.
We value teamwork, learning from failure, and innovation.

Job Responsibilities:

Build, own and maintain new innovative product features by building POCs and testing new ideas.
Collaborate with Senior Engineers, receiving regular mentorship, code reviews, and technical guidance.
Live in GitHub creating pull requests, reviewing code, merging branches, and generally be a team player by seeking out and providing feedback. We believe that every developer has lots to learn and lots to give!
Develop and test new features that help scale our user data and HR integration services.
Create automated test cases using Go and Python to improve reliability and speed up our release cycles.
Contribute to backend development using Go (Golang) - building APIs, fixing bugs, and integrating with microservices.
Assist with UI updates and enhancements, learning front-end fundamentals with React.
You will also gain experience with frameworks and services such as Docker, Kubernetes, Google Pub/Sub and more

Required Skills:

Proactiveness and enthusiasm to ask questions, seek feedback, and support the team with a variety of tasks.
Passion for Software Engineering and a drive to learn and grow.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Computer Science or related degree.
Prior co-op experience.
Advantageous but not required
Advanced prior co-op experience. Year 3 or 4.
Experience in the following programming languages or similar: Python, Go, React.
Experience working in an Agile environment using Jira
Prior experience with GitHub, Kubernetes, and GCP.
Prior exposure to microservices.

Compensation and Benefits:

$28 - $45 CAD per hour - depending on the level of experience and skills

Job Summary:

At Hebbia, we build AI-driven search and reasoning tools that help knowledge workers uncover insights from complex documents and data.
As a Software Engineering Co-op, you will own meaningful features end-to-end on both the frontend and backend, ship production code used by real customers, and learn from seasoned engineers in a high-growth early-stage environment.

What You'll Do
You will be embedded in our engineering workflow and contribute to shipped product work.
This may include:

Building and improving user-facing features using React and TypeScript
Writing backend services and APIs in Python
Collaborating on data workflows and UI/UX that connect customer needs with AI-driven systems
Testing, debugging, and refining features to ensure quality and performance
Participating in planning, design reviews, standups, and cross-team collaboration
We do not lock co-ops to a single team or narrow scope; you will work where impact is highest during your term.

Why Hebbia
Real ownership and meaningful impact from day one
Small, high-collaboration teams with direct access to senior engineers
Fast feedback cycles and learning embedded into the workflow
Work on problems at the intersection of AI, data, and productivity

Job Responsibilities:

Deliver customer-facing features that ship to production during your co-op term
Contribute meaningfully to both frontend and backend systems using React, TypeScript, and Python
Take ownership of scoped projects and drive them to completion with support from senior engineers
Work closely with cross-functional partners to solve real product problems
Improve code quality, performance, and developer experience as part of day-to-day work

Required Skills:

Who You Are - Must Haves

Strong working experience with Python
Strong working experience with React and TypeScript
Solid fundamentals in algorithms, data structures, and building reliable software
Comfortable working independently, asking good questions, and shipping code with guidance
Good communication skills to collaborate with engineering and product partners

Nice to Have
Experience with backend frameworks, databases, or service design
Exposure to large-scale data workflows, API design, or modern frontend tooling
Interest in AI/ML systems without needing ML research expertise

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive hourly compensation aligned with Waterloo co-op U.S. market data and role expectations
Pay rate based on experience and prior internships, range from $40-$50 USD / hour
Paid, full-time co-op position (40 hours/week)
Mentorship from senior engineers and close collaboration with product and design
Real ownership and production impact during the co-op term
Exposure to fast-paced, high-growth startup environment building AI-driven products

Job Summary:

Position: Actuarial, Intern
Job Type: Summer Internship (May to August)
Office Location: American National (Toronto)

Company Overview:
Brookfield Corporation (NYSE/TSX: BN) is a leading global investment firm focused on building long-term wealth for institutions and individuals around the world. We have three core businesses: Alternative Asset Management, Wealth Solutions, and our Operating Businesses which are in renewable power, infrastructure, business and industrial services, and real estate. Our objective is to generate attractive, long-term risk-adjusted returns for the benefit of our clients and shareholders.

Brookfield Wealth Solutions Ltd. ("BWS"; NYSE/TSX: BNT) is focused on securing the financial futures of individuals and institutions through a range of retirement services, wealth protection products and tailored capital solutions. Through our insurance subsidiaries, we offer a broad range of insurance products and services, including annuities, personal and commercial property and casualty insurance and life insurance.

Brookfield has a dynamic and strong 'promote from within' culture. We seek team members who have a long-term focus and whose values align with the Attributes of a Brookfield Leader, which are Entrepreneurial, Collaborative and Disciplined. Brookfield is committed to the development of our people through interesting work assignments and exposure to a diverse set of businesses.

The Opportunity:
We are looking to fill several Actuarial, Intern positions with Brookfield Wealth Solutions. The intern will be based out of our offices and will be paired with an actuarial team within Brookfield Wealth Solutions or one of our Operating Companies (American Equity, American National, Argo, Blumont Annuity, and North End Re).
An internship within Brookfield Wealth Solutions will provide the selected student(s) the opportunity to gain exposure to a variety of actuarial teams and product lines in a unique organization, contribute to real projects within different actuarial domains (i.e. pricing, modeling, analytics, and risk management), collaborate cross-functionally with different experts on initiatives as part of an organization supports your growth, and develops your skills to set you up for future success.

Why Brookfield?
Our internship program is available to students for a fall, summer or winter work term. Students have the opportunity to demonstrate their experience, aptitudes, leadership and teamwork towards potential full-time employment in a unique environment. Students will have the opportunity to thrive in a culture that values collaboration, entrepreneurial initiative, and teamwork. The opportunity allows candidates to work on diverse, high-impact projects across multiple business lines, learn directly from experienced professionals through hands-on mentorship, and provides access to training, networking, and professional development opportunities.

Job Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities:
Our Life, Health & Annuity operating subsidiaries focus on pension risk transfer, retail annuity, life insurance, and health insurance products. As an Intern, Actuarial, your responsibilities may provide exposure across pricing, valuation, modeling, analytics, capital management, and risk management:
Valuation:

Assist in the valuation of reserves across multiple product lines including life, health, annuities and Pension Risk Transfer (PRT)
Prepare analysis to explain changes in reserves quarter over quarter and key drivers
Monitor actual experience against expected over time
Modeling & Analytics:
Build and enhance actuarial models using Excel, Python, and actuarial modeling platforms such as Moody's AXIS and MG ALFA
Perform experience studies and assumption setting
Develop robust analytics on earnings emergence and key performance indicators
Leverage technology to automate and standardize processes
Pricing:
Support the pricing of new retail and institutional business
Prepare data analysis to evaluate the financial impacts of product features
Conduct competitive analysis to understand how our product offerings compare to peers
Capital Management & Risk:
Support capital adequacy assessments and risk analysis
Run and summarize sensitivities and stress tests

Required Skills:

Requirements:

Currently enrolled in a university program with a focus or major in Actuarial
Science, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
Progress toward FSA/FCIA/FIA designation preferred
Prior work term experience in pensions, insurance, or financial services is an asset
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, VBA, and Python
Experience using AXIS or ALFA actuarial systems is preferable
Strong analytical, oral, and written communication skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks effectively and efficiently
Motivated and resourceful team player with a proactive attitude
Required to be available to work in-person.

Compensation and Benefits:

52,000 to 69,500 CAD

ISARA is located in Waterloo, ON, just north of the University of Waterloo campus. This job is a hybrid of remote and in-office work. You will be expected to be present in the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays, and can choose to work from home or the office for the remainder of each week.

Job Summary:

You will join the team that is building the ISARA Advance® Cryptographic Inventory and Risk Assessment Tool. This software allows customers to fully understand the cryptography in use on their infrastructure, as they prepare for the upcoming migration to new quantum safe security standards. As a member of the product development team, you will be responsible for design, implementation, and testing of a full stack web application. Your work will allow large enterprises to understand their current cryptographic posture and achieve crypto agility.

Job Responsibilities:

Development: Adding features and fixing bugs in the following tech stack:
TypeScript
React
Node.js
GraphQL
PostgreSQL
ElasticSearch
Docker
Testing: using a combination of our QA Automation framework and manual actions to explore and assess product quality
Delighting our users with the high performance and scalability of the product

A keen eye for UI design and usability

Our Life, Health & Annuity operating subsidiaries focus on pension risk transfer, retail annuity, life insurance, and health insurance products. As an Intern, Actuarial, your responsibilities may provide exposure across pricing, valuation, modeling, analytics, capital management, and risk management:
Valuation:

Assist in the valuation of reserves across multiple product lines including life, health, annuities and Pension Risk Transfer (PRT)
Prepare analysis to explain changes in reserves quarter over quarter and key drivers
Monitor actual experience against expected over time
Modeling & Analytics:
Build and enhance actuarial models using Excel, Python, and actuarial modeling platforms such as Moody's AXIS and MG ALFA
Perform experience studies and assumption setting
Develop robust analytics on earnings emergence and key performance indicators
Leverage technology to automate and standardize processes
Pricing:
Support the pricing of new retail and institutional business
Prepare data analysis to evaluate the financial impacts of product features
Conduct competitive analysis to understand how our product offerings compare to peers
Capital Management & Risk:
Support capital adequacy assessments and risk analysis
Run and summarize sensitivities and stress tests

Required Skills:

Requirements:

Currently enrolled in a university program with a focus or major in Actuarial
Science, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
Progress toward FSA/FCIA/FIA designation preferred
Prior work term experience in pensions, insurance, or financial services is an asset
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, VBA, and Python
Experience using AXIS or ALFA actuarial systems is preferable
Strong analytical, oral, and written communication skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks effectively and efficiently
Motivated and resourceful team player with a proactive attitude
Required to be available to work in-person.

Compensation and Benefits:

52,000 to 69,500 CAD

At BetterUp, we give people the coaching, support, and push they need to reach peak performance and unlock their limitless potential, in all they do, personally and professionally. We work with world-class experts and Coaches, pioneer innovative technology, and foster human touch at scale to fuel the BetterUp experience, and make growth and development achievable for all. We believe that practicing strong mental fitness is a never-ending practice of maintaining and building the strengths that proceed to health, happiness, and success.

What we believe:

Do Less, Deliver More - We focus on the work that will contribute the most to our mission and then execute to the best of our abilities.
Extreme Ownership - We are fully responsible for our work. When things go poorly, we relish the opportunity to learn from it and improve.
Work to Learn - We're curious, willing-to-be-wrong, agile learners. This means we engage with work as a playscape on which to discover, learn, and realize our full potential.
Bias Towards Action - We prefer to act rather than wait and see. When we identify an opportunity to make a difference, we move on it.
Be yourself! We're a diverse group of thinkers, doers, and innovators. And we invest in our people through coaching and training to fuel our ability to revolutionize personal and professional growth and help our members live better lives.

Designing and implementing GenAI architectures and workflows using state-of-the-art LLMs and foundation models.

Developing core capabilities that enhance our AI-powered user experiences.
Experimenting with novel approaches to model orchestration, prompting, and context utilization.
Creating data pipelines and tooling to support rapid GenAI development and iteration.

Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Job Summary:

Company Overview:
LiftWerx is a specialized wind energy contractor, offering creative and innovative lifting solutions to perform repairs on wind turbines. Based in North America and Europe, LiftWerx provides turnkey services for major corrective repairs and major component replacements using up-tower crane technology. As a young company, we are always looking for opportunities to find driven, talented, and ambitious professionals who can contribute to the growth, optimization, and improvement of our business.

Role Description:
In this role you will assist with the creation of LiftWerx's next generation training program. You will drive LiftWerx's goal of developing better, more engaging training methods for new wind turbine technicians. Your primary responsibilities will include virtual reality application development (designing, coding, debugging, quality assurance and documenting) of virtual reality (VR) games and training modules, which are representative of real-life tasks and work processes.

Typical tasks for this role include the design and development of new features for the VR Engineering Sandbox and mobile viewer games, development of VR training modules, automation of repetitive software tasks, modelling of equipment in Blender, and quality assurance of automated E-Learning modules.

On a voluntary and occasional basis, the student will have the opportunity for field work, where they will learn how up-tower cranes are assembled and operated within wind turbines.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities
The candidate will have the following primary responsibilities:

Development of VR training modules based on new and existing work procedures.
Design and development of new features for existing games.
Automation of training module development tasks.
Thorough documentation of all new development.
Running demos / tutorials to test new tools with field technicians, engineers, and others.
Quality assurance of automated E-Learning modules.
Occasional visits to work sites across North America to gather field knowledge and survey processes in order to produce VR games.

Required Skills:

The ideal candidate will have the following skills:

Experience in the development of virtual reality software applications (Blender, Unity, C#)
Motivated and self-driven
Creative vision
Excellent ability to collaborate?with people, both internal and external
Technical writing skills
Oral communication skills
SolidWorks 3D CAD skills a benefit
Valid driver's license

Transportation and Housing:

Transportation and Housing:
The candidate will be expected to arrange their own transportation and housing. LiftWerx is located in Cambridge, at 135 Werlich Dr, Cambridge, Ontario, N1T1N7. This role is an office-aligned position.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required


Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation will be a weekly salary based on the median salary range as indicated by the University of Waterloo. https://uwaterloo.ca/hire/how-to-hire/co-op-student-earnings

In this role, the successful candidate will have the following opportunities:

Occasional / optional site visits to work sites across North America.
Work in a fast-paced team with career advancement opportunities.
Work with an enthusiastic young team
Opportunity to pursue areas of interest and develop role / scope of projects during course of term
Work package, with LiftWerx gear and clothing
Offsite training days to gain certifications for working at heights and in wind turbines

Job Summary:

Web Application Developer Co-op
At Kenna, one of our core philosophies is Customer First Thinking. It's how we help our clients' turn customers into their biggest fans. That philosophy is echoed in the way we treat our employees. By putting people first, we attract some of the marketing industry's brightest minds, and we're proud of our sterling track record of hanging onto them. Join Kenna as a co-op student, and not only will you help build our clients' businesses - you'll grow your own potential. Whether your true calling is in Client Service, Creative, Data Solutions, Digital Design, Insights & Strategy, Finance, Application Development, IT Services or Social Media, you'll find it all under one roof at Kenna. So if you're looking to make a meaningful impact on one of these diverse teams, this could be a great opportunity for you. And us.

Description
Kenna is looking for brilliant, talented, and passionate individuals to join our team of over 25 experienced professional web developers. We want to enable you to discover your passion for web development in a new and exciting environment designed to foster creativity and innovation.

Career Development
Kenna is devoted to helping students succeed in their future career. We will help you learn the concepts, technologies, frameworks, and tools for a career in web development by providing hands-on training and professional development tailored to students' needs and capabilities. Work with industry veterans and other students to build professional relationships, contacts and friendships for your future career. Don't believe us? Ask all the developers we've hired that were former co-op students.

Testimonials
Surajpratap Goraya (2B Computer Science)
Working at Kenna has been sincerely wonderful, and I truthfully couldn't have asked for a better first CO-OP experience. Everyone I've worked with at Kenna has been nothing less than welcoming, kind, and especially patient with me as I learned the ropes around how of some of their older systems worked. Kenna's social events and employee benefits (such as the Kenna Café) are truly great and are the cherry on top to their great working environment. Last but not least, Kenna allows you to grow as a developer, and the managers are very receptive your suggestions and individual goals as a dev. Overall, Kenna is a wonderful place to work, and although some of their older systems are somewhat frustrating to get used to and work with, the overall environment, support and people at Kenna are nothing less than amazing.

Kenneth Matira (5A Actuarial & Financial Mathematics)
I've been at Kenna for quite a while (three terms as a BI/SQL Developer and two terms as a Web Developer) and I can safely say that my time here has been wonderful. Despite my non-cs background and very limited experience in web languages, all my supervisors have been very patient and helpful with me and my journey to learn as well as all developers being very easy to approach when stuck on a problem. During my time here, I have been able to work on many different projects and work on different parts of web development (front-end, back-end, sql), sharpening my learning/experience along with learning on what I like and prefer versus what I don't. Overall my experience at Kenna has only been positive and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Hybrid Working Model
This position follows a hybrid work model, with students required to work in-office at Kenna Mississauga three days a week (Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays) and work remotely from home for two days (Mondays and Fridays).
Students will frequently be required to attend organizational, departmental, team, and project meetings requiring the use of both their microphone and their camera.

Job Responsibilities:

Responsibilities
Develop new and innovative web solutions that adhere to industry standards and best practices
Utilize analytical and problem-solving skills to overcome challenges and provide unique solutions
Provide meaningful suggestions, feedback, and insights to support business goals
Update, enhance and maintain existing web solutions

Required Skills:

Required Skills
Strong programming background including relevant experience or course work
Strong understanding of fundamental programming principles (object-oriented programming, data structures, algorithms)
Proficiency in fundamental web languages (HTML, JavaScript, CSS)
Non-essential Skills
NodeJS
React, JQuery, KendoUI, Materialize
SQL, MySQL
Web Services/APIs (RESTful/SOAP), XML, JSON, AJAX
AWS (CloudFormation, Stacker, Runway)
Visual Basic, VBA, Domino, Lotus Notes
JavaScript concepts (ES6, prototyping, SPAs, concurrency frameworks)
CSS concepts (CSS Grids, flex box, transitions, keyframes, animations, pseudo elements, media queries)
Responsive design
Version control (Git, GitHub, Bit Bucket)
Continuous Integration Tools (Jenkins)

About You
Passionate about web development
Self-motivated
Strong desire to learn new skills and apply them in real world settings
Strong problem solving and decision-making skills
Ability to work both as part of a team and independently
Excellent written & verbal communication skills
Ability to engage and share new ideas with the team

Compensation and Benefits:

Benefits
Fun, positive and professional environment to learn and develop
Team building events, social events, company events, and virtual events
Hybrid working model with the flexibility of working two days remotely (Mondays and Fridays)

4 month work term

Special Work Term Start/End Date Considerations:

May 4, 2026 - August 14, 2026

Job Summary:

Sheridan College and the Faculty of Applied Science and Technology (FAST) seek a motivated individual passionate about education to serve as a Tutor. This role involves assisting students and faculty in learning and teaching Math at both the degree level (Calculus, Linear Algebra, Differential Equations, and Physics) and for skilled trades (Welding, Plumbing, Electrical, etc). Tutors participate in class sections, collaborating with faculty to enhance Sheridan's interactive small-class model. Tutors focus solely on aiding students' learning journeys without the responsibility of grading. Tutors will engage with Math from an applied perspective, be part of a supportive community, and develop valuable teaching, leadership, and communication skills.

Job Responsibilities:

The Tutor's primary responsibilities include collaborating with students in various capacities:

Hosting and participating in weekly tutorial sessions for Math students in the skilled trades programs; organizing and leading collaborative study sessions; and providing extra examples/practice as needed.
Offering appointments and drop-in sessions for individual or small group tutoring.
Working closely with faculty and coordinators to enhance the student learning experience by providing feedback and advice.
Secondary duties involve keeping track of student progress, maintaining statistics, and engaging in marketing efforts for tutoring services.

Required Skills:

Essential Attributes:
The successful candidate will possess an in-depth understanding of Math at the degree level - CALCULUS, LINEAR ALGEBRA, DIFFERENTIAL EQUATIONS and PHYSICS. It is important that the Tutor is engaging, patient and an attentive listener with excellent spoken & written communication. The ability to work independently, to take initiative, and to collaborate with others while being effective without the need for constant direct supervision is important in this role.

Desirable Attributes:
Previous experience in tutoring with adolescent or adult learners is beneficial. A background in Applied Engineering, Physics, Computing, Chemistry, or Geometry is helpful but not necessary.

Sheridan offers an informal, welcoming and motivating work environment that allows its staff to function independently as part of a small team of professionals, and to work with students of various ages and backgrounds in a wide range of academic programs. Tutors have the opportunity to collaborate with faculty members with tremendous experience, various teaching styles and methods.

Transportation and Housing:

You are responsible for securing suitable housing if needed, as well as arranging your commute to your assigned campus. I encourage you to explore Sheridan's Off-Campus Housing website for helpful resources: https://www.sheridancollege.ca/student-life/student-services/off-campus-housing

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation: $21/hr

Work week: Mondays to Fridays for 35 hrs/week. Typical work day is from 8:30 am to 4:30 pm // 9am to 5pm // 10am - 6pm with an one hour lunch break. Will be required to work a 11:00 am to 7:00 pm // 12:00 pm to 8:00 pm shift once or twice a week, depending on the needs of the centre.

This position is located at Sheridan's Davis campus in Brampton.

Job Summary:

About Ideogram
Ideogram's mission is to make world-class design accessible to everyone, multiplying human creativity. We build proprietary generative media models and AI native creative workflows, tackling unsolved challenges in graphic design. Our team includes builders with a track record of technology breakthroughs including early research in Diffusion Models, Google's Imagen, and Imagen Video. We care about design, taste, and craft as much as research and engineering - shipping experiences that creatives actually love.

We've raised nearly $100M, led by Andreessen Horowitz and Index Ventures. Headquartered in Toronto with a growing team in NYC, we're scaling fast, aiming to triple over the next year. We're a flat team with a culture of high ownership, collaboration, and mentorship.

Explore Ideogram 3.0, Canvas, and Character blog posts, and try Ideogram at ideogram.ai.

Job Responsibilities:

About The Role
As a Full Stack Engineer, you will build a simple yet elegant product that helps millions of users experience the magic of image and video generation with AI. You will help shape the future of creative applications in the age of AI. You will be a key participant in defining Ideogram's roadmap and product strategy, which will transform and expand the creative economy.

Required Skills:

What We're Looking For

Experience with design and development of novel, scalable solutions for challenging problems
Strong data structure and algorithm fundamentals
Experience in writing scalable and reliable code (e.g., experience with gRPC, Protobufs, MapReduce, an obsession for simplicity).
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Amazon Web Services (AWS), or similar cloud platforms
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Self-starter - able to come up to speed on complex, difficult concepts with minimal assistance
Experience communicating complex technical issues to technical and non technical team members
Excitement about generative AI technology and its impact on the creative economy.
Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field

Nice to Have Skills
Have prior experience working closely with ML engineers to developing and deploying machine learning models
Proficiency in Python, JavaScript, and React
Passion for building simple and self-explanatory user interfaces
Possess a track record of rapidly prototyping ideas and bringing them to life
Exhibit strong people and presentation skills
Company Culture
We're a single flat team that transcends engineering, research, product, and operation roles. Everyone is willing to do whatever is necessary to make our company and customers successful. We believe that a small, dedicated team with a collaborative culture can move faster and build better and more coherent products than large hierarchical organizations. At Ideogram, we provide mentorship and support to help our employees grow with the company and achieve their ambitious career goals.
Ideogram is committed to welcoming everyone, regardless of gender identity, orientation, or expression. Our mission is to remove exclusivity and barriers and encourage new thinking and perceptions in a space of belonging. It is not about race, gender, or age, it is about the people.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation is over $50/hr, depending on the student and the number of work terms completed.

Job Summary:

About Atomic Semi
Atomic Semi is building a small, fast semiconductor fab.

It's already possible to build this with today's technology and a few simplifications. We'll build the tools ourselves so we can quickly iterate and improve.
We're building a small team of exceptional, hands-on engineers to make this happen. Mechanical, electrical, hardware, computer, and process. We'll own the stack from atoms to architecture. Our team is optimistic about the future and we want to continue pushing the limits of technology.

Smaller is better. Faster is better. Building it ourselves is better.

We believe our team and lab can build anything. We've set up 3D printers, a wide array of microscopes, e-beam writers, general fabrication equipment - and whatever is missing, we'll just invent along the way.
Atomic was founded by Sam Zeloof and Jim Keller. Sam is best known for making chips in his garage, and Jim has been a leader in the semiconductor industry for the past 40 years.

About the role
We're hiring electrical engineering interns. The internship begins in May, with the option for preferably a 4 to 8-month commitment. We're rebuilding the chip fabrication process from the ground up, so you'll be exposed to some really interesting and impactful work. Our engineering projects are highly interdisciplinary and span domains such as structures, optics, robotics, heat transfer, physics, and chemistry. As a startup, we offer interns a ton of ownership and mission-critical work.
The ideal candidate has hands-on experience working in at least one of these areas and broad exposure across other domains. Our philosophy is to get things built and tested in days or weeks, not months. Because of this, a portfolio is required to apply: show us the things you've actually built! If you've shipped a medium-to-high complexity system through a personal project or previous internship, you'd be a good fit here.

Job Responsibilities:

Designing, prototyping, and building semiconductor fabrication equipment
Writing mechanical drawings and documentation
Circuit design and electrical engineering
Performing detailed analysis and simulations to evaluate electromechanical designs
Working with vendors to source components and materials

Required Skills:

Required qualifications

Pursuing a Bachelor's Degree or higher in engineering
Ability to learn quickly and troubleshoot technical problems
Hands-on prototyping experience and the ability to move through design cycles quickly
Hands-on experience with electromechanical assembly design and analysis from coursework, internships, or personal projects
Strong foundation in electrical engineering (KiCad/Altium, microcontrollers, embedded systems, digital circuits, etc.)

Desired qualifications
Familiarity with semiconductor processing- ALD, CVD, PVD, photolithography, etc.
Strong foundation in mechanical engineering (Solidworks/Onshape, simulation, materials selection, etc.)

Transportation and Housing:

Round trip flights to SF and a $1,000 housing stipend

Compensation and Benefits:

Working at Atomic Semi
We're an early-stage hardware startup with solid funding, world-class advisors, and a lab/office in San Francisco, CA. Atomic Semi is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. Hardware Interns are paid an hourly rate equivalent to an annualized range of $105,000-126,000, depending on experience and education level. This range assumes a 40-hour workweek and includes up to 10 hours of pre-approved weekly overtime, paid at 1.5x the base hourly rate. Actual earnings will vary depending on internship length and hours worked.

Internship Benefits:

Housing Stipend to help with first month expenses
Lunches daily, Dinners 3x per week, Stocked Office Kitchen with Snacks and Spindrifts
Weekly Learning & Development opportunities
Commuter Benefits including Parking and Late Night Uber rides from the office
Paid Time Off inclusive of Holidays and Sick Time
Visa Sponsorship
Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
401(k) retirement plan
Life and Disability Insurance
We are an equal-opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability or other legally protected statuses.
