Job Summary:

Alumni Relations Associate

About the Role
This is a funded work placement opportunity with the Environment Advancement team. As the Alumni Relations Associate, you will play a key role in connecting Faculty of Environment alumni, donors, prospects, and students to support and advance the mission of the Faculty and the University of Waterloo.
We have two openings this term, focused on the Alumni Digital Wall Project, donor stewardship, and alumni relations. This position involves significant data analysis, and the Alumni Digital Wall Project would benefit from a student with technical expertise to collaborate with our IT team.

Key Responsibilities:
Support the Alumni Digital Wall Project, working with the IT team to ensure smooth development and implementation.
Analyze alumni and donor data to enhance engagement strategies.
Coordinate and support exciting alumni and donor events.
Lead a special project, gaining valuable project management experience.
Develop professional communication skills and expand your professional network.

What We Offer:
Hands-on experience in alumni relations and donor stewardship.
Professional development opportunities.
A fast-paced, collaborative, and supportive work environment.
Exposure to multiple projects and the chance to work with a friendly and dynamic team.

This is an excellent opportunity to sharpen your technical and communication skills while contributing to the success of the Faculty of Environment's alumni and donor engagement efforts.

Job Responsibilities:

There's no 'typical day' on our team, but here's what a dynamic week could look like:

Connect with alumni - Draft and send targeted emails to engage alumni as volunteers for a Leadership Series event.
Showcase your creativity - Design and execute a social media campaign to promote Alumni Weekend and increase engagement.
Make an impact - Write a stewardship report to show a scholarship donor the real difference their support has made.
Bring events to life - Help run the Faculty's donor appreciation dinner and coordinate catering for the Grad Sendoff.
Drive innovation - Collaborate with the IT team to update and enhance the Alumni Digital Wall, using your technical skills to ensure smooth functionality and an engaging user experience.
Enhance engagement - Research prospective donors to identify new opportunities for connection and support.
Be creative - Create a fun trivia quiz for an alumni class dinner to build connections and spark conversation.
Strengthen systems - Update and manage the volunteer database to keep engagement efforts running smoothly.
Take the lead - Plan and execute an alumni or donor event, from start to finish, gaining valuable project management experience.

This is a hands-on role where you'll gain real-world experience in alumni relations, donor stewardship, and event coordination - all while sharpening your communication, data analysis, and technical skills.

Required Skills:

This role might be right for you if:
You're a strong writer - You know how to craft a compelling message and can adapt your tone for different audiences.
You're a relationship builder - You're comfortable communicating with a variety of stakeholders, including donors, alumni, students, faculty, and staff.
You're highly organized - Your calendar is color-coded, and you've got a system for everything (bonus points if post-it notes are involved).
You're a strategic thinker - You approach challenges with a solutions-focused mindset and are always looking for ways to improve.
You're a natural leader - You're comfortable stepping up to lead a project but also work well in a supportive role.
You're a host at heart - When friends come over, you make sure everyone feels welcome, fed, and taken care of.
You value authentic connections - You go the extra mile to leave a positive impression and strengthen relationships.
You're creative but detail-oriented - You can think outside the box while staying focused on execution and deadlines.
You care about making a difference - You have strong personal values and are motivated by the opportunity to contribute to meaningful change.
You are OSAP eligible.

For the Alumni Digital Wall Project:
Technical skills give you an edge - Programming knowledge (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or similar) is highly beneficial for working with our IT team to enhance the Alumni Digital Wall.
Problem-solving mindset - You can analyze complex issues, suggest improvements, and help bring creative technical solutions to life.

You might also stand out if you have:
Experience in event planning, professional communications, marketing, and/or donor relations.
Knowledge of the Faculty of Environment and the University of Waterloo.
Creative skills in social media, digital design, and photography/video editing (Adobe skills are a plus!).
Strong and genuine customer service skills - You're approachable and solutions-focused.
A strong desire to develop, grow, and contribute to the Faculty's mission and vision.
Experience working with data analysis or technical projects - particularly in an engineering or technical environment.

Open to ALL Students
This position is open to all students from across University of Waterloo programs, including engineering, computer science, business, arts, and environment. Whether you're a creative communicator or a data-driven problem solver, this is an opportunity to apply your skills in a real-world setting.
We're looking to invest in a student who is eager to grow and become part of our community even beyond this co-op term. If you're curious, motivated, and excited to make an impact, we want to hear from you!

Why Environment?
We are Canada's largest Faculty of Environment, founded nearly 50 years ago to address the most pressing sustainability challenges facing humanity. Our integrative approach combines the study of natural and human environments by bringing together ecologists, geographers, knowledge integrators, and planners, along with experts in green business, spatial technologies, environmental governance, and economic development. Every day, our talented researchers and passionate students generate new ideas, mobilize knowledge, and drive action across sectors to tackle critical global challenges.
The Advancement team plays a vital role in this work by raising awareness, connecting alumni and students, building strategic partnerships, and increasing philanthropic support. This is your opportunity to contribute to a meaningful mission while developing valuable skills and professional connections.
Note: This position will require some evening and weekend work (with advanced notice).

Compensation and Benefits:

$3,000 monthly salary

Equity Statement
The University of Waterloo acknowledges that much of our work takes place on the traditional territory of the Neutral, Anishinaabeg, and Haudenosaunee peoples. Our main campus is situated on the Haldimand Tract, the land granted to the Six Nations that includes six miles on each side of the Grand River. Our active work toward reconciliation takes place across our campuses through research, learning, teaching, and community building, and is co-ordinated within the Office of Indigenous Relations.

The University values the diverse and intersectional identities of its students, faculty, and staff. The University regards equity and diversity as an integral part of academic excellence and is committed to accessibility for all employees. The University of Waterloo seeks applicants who embrace our values of equity, anti-racism and inclusion. As such, we encourage applications from candidates who have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including applicants who identify as First Nations, Métis and/or Inuk (Inuit), Black, racialized, a person with a disability, women and/or 2SLGBTQ+.

Positions are open to qualified candidates who are legally entitled to work in Canada.

To be eligible for this position, you must meet the Work Placement eligibility requirements Please review them on the Work Placement Program webpage (opens in a new window) before applying to this job.

Job Summary:

About Faire

Faire is an online wholesale marketplace built on the belief that the future is local - there are over 2 million independent retailers in North America and Europe doing more than $2 trillion in revenue. At Faire, we're using the power of tech, data, and machine learning to connect this thriving community of entrepreneurs across the globe. Picture your favourite boutique in town - we help them discover the best products from around the world to sell in their stores. With the right tools and insights, we believe that we can level the playing field so that small businesses everywhere can compete with these big box and e-commerce giants.

By supporting the growth of independent businesses, Faire is driving positive economic impact in local communities, globally. We're looking for smart, resourceful and passionate people to join us as we power the shop local movement. If you believe in community, come join ours.

Role Description

We are seeking a highly motivated student to join our team as a Data Engineering Platform Co-op to help build the tools and infrastructure that power our Data and Analytics Systems. Faire's Data Infrastructure provides technology capabilities for data storage and movement. The Analytics Platform is the suite of tools and capabilities that drive how data is analyzed/worked with at Faire - an opinionated platform that embeds best-practices with a strong focus on our internal user experience. Some of the tools we use are Airflow, Terraform, Snowflake, Flink, and other tools.

We are tackling challenges in areas such as:

Creating AI tooling / interfaces to enhance how users work with / develop data
General user experience and interfaces / frameworks for working with data
Data governance
Data observability / quality monitoring / anomaly detection
Security / access controls
Management of core data assets
Optimizing query patterns for performance and cost effectiveness
Ensuring data transfer and storage systems are optimal and performant
As a co-op, you will gain hands-on experience with industry-standard data pipeline tools, data design and optimization best practices, building internal-user facing experiences for working with data (frameworks in Airflow / Airflow operators / other applications), building tools that leverage AI for data and analytics, data governance, and security.

The ideal candidate will be curious about data, show an independent drive, be capable of taking full ownership of a project and its execution, and have a passion for curating a user experience with the tools and capabilities they build.

Why you'll love working at Faire
As a Faire co-op, you'll have the opportunity to:
Take on responsibilities of a full-time engineer and be treated like a permanent Faire employee from day one
Work alongside talented engineers and engineering leaders, product managers, and designers on a daily basis to contribute to real projects with real impacts
Be challenged to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment with supportive team members
Own projects from scoping to shipping and see how your work directly impacts our customers and drives data-focused results
Learn more by checking out the internships section of Faire's The Craft blog or watching this videoby a former Faire co-op.

About our selection process
If your application is selected, our Talent Team will reach out to you via email to invite you to:

Step 1: Co-op Event (1 hr)
By invitation only, join us at this exclusive event to connect with our Talent and Engineering team members and learn more about why you'll want to work at Faire.

Step 2: Technical Interview (1 hr)
Meet 1:1 with an experienced engineer and work through a pair programming exercise together. Use this CodeSignal link to prep for the technical interview (this is entirely optional).

If you're selected to advance beyond the technical interview, our Talent Team will follow up with you via email to invite you to:
Step 3: Phone Call with Recruiter (15 mins)
Chat 1:1 with a Faire recruiter to get your questions answered. Our recruiter will also share some additional details, including what to expect in terms of compensation.

Job Responsibilities:

As a Data Engineering Platform Co-op you will:

Assist & lead in the development of, maintenance of, and changes to internal data tools & frameworks. Languages used at Faire include Python and Kotlin
Write SQL queries to transform raw input data into clean and actionable tables
Build and operate various workloads in Airflow orchestrator
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and design solutions
We're looking for exceptional co-op students who love building quality experiences and would jump at the opportunity to take ownership of entire features and help guide teams to improve the quality of their deliveries. You can shadow our world-class engineers (former Google, Square, and Shopify) and learn from the best. You will gain hands-on experience with our data warehouse Snowflake, as well as architecting and deploying infrastructure-as-code with Terraform, further developing our data processing orchestration platform Airflow, and designing, implementing, and deploying data pipelines using Python on AWS.

We recognize the value that co-op students bring and we're looking to help mentor for the future and build lasting relationships that will extend past graduation.

Required Skills:

Technical Requirements

Strong understanding of Python (OOP, functions, DS&A, etc)
Strong understanding of SQL (joins, aggregations, window functions, advanced querying)
Some experience with ETL (extract transform load) is valuable
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to navigate ambiguity
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Experience with GitHub, Terraform, Snowflake, Spark, and Airflow is a plus

Transportation and Housing:

About our work model

This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule. All office employees will be expected to come into the office every Tuesday, Thursday, and an Employee-chosen 3rd in-office day (Monday, Wednesday, or Friday) and must live within a 56 km radius of the KW or TOR offices.

Our offices are centrally located at 85 Willis Way in Uptown Waterloo and 420 Wellington Street West in Toronto's Fashion District.

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive Pay & Perks That Go Beyond
At Faire, our co-op salaries range from $32-$52 CAD per hour, consistently exceeding the University's average earnings (check out the average co-op earnings here). But that's just the beginning! Here's what else you can look forward to:

3 Paid Time Off (PTO) Days - Because we know rest matters.
Commuter Stipend - Helping you get to and from the office stress-free.
Phone & Internet Stipend - Stay connected, on us.
80 Hours of Sick Time - Your well-being comes first.
Catered Meals & Snacks - Enjoy delicious food and an impressive selection of drinks in the office.
Community & Fun - Connect with fellow co-ops and Faire employees through Slack channels, game nights, and exciting social events.

Join us for an experience that's more than just a job- it's a launchpad for your future!

Job Summary:

Novocol Pharma is a growing contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO), specialized in sterile injectable cartridges and combination product manufacturing. We strive for excellence and customer-centricity to deliver value to global pharmaceutical clients through contract services for drug development and commercial manufacturing. With over 40 years in operation, our team of 500 employees and modern facilities, located in Cambridge, Ontario provide a personalized and responsive experience for our customers. We are focused on serving our strategic partners and patients with quality, integrity, and value.

We are a proud member of the Septodont group of companies. Septodont is a pharmaceutical and medical device company with a global leadership position in dental pain management. The group counts over 1900 employees worldwide and has remained a 100% family-owned company. We are celebrating our 90th anniversary this year! Our Cambridge facility serves as a significant manufacturing site within the Septodont group with high volume dental anesthetic production for a global customer base.

We are looking for an 8 Month Co-Op Student to join our IT Digital Workplace team!

The IT Digital Workplace Co-op reports to the IT Leader, Digital Workplace & IT Systems and assists in the implementation and configuration of identity management and security, collaboration tools, device management, application, and database services.

This is a hybrid role, working from the office 3 days a week, with the option to work from home 2 days a week. This is a standard 8-hour day shift (between the hours of 7:00am and 5:00pm, based on preference).

Job Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for:

Assisting in the implementation and configuration of some or all of the following Digital Workplace areas:
Identity management via Active Directory (on premise and in cloud), including identity, access, and sign in security technologies such as MFA, SSO, PIM, PAM
Management of the Microsoft 365 suite of applications (i.e., Exchange, Teams, SharePoint etc.)
Automation by way of APIs, PowerShell, and the M365 Power Platform
Implementation and management of email security technologies including filtering
Supporting the other I&O teams by ensuring tools and technologies are properly documented and required IT staff are trained.
Participating in continuous improvement activities related to the Digital Workplace and IT Systems functions, collaborating with the appropriate IT Infrastructure & Operations and IT Security teams.
Providing excellent customer service to internal customers by way of hands-on end-user support
(Level 2 and 3 support)
Escalating issues internally and/or with external vendors when required to ensure timely resolution.
Ensuring end user hardware and software assets are tracked, and software license compliance is maintained.
Responsible for compliance with GxP guidelines and ensuring that all GxPs and SOPs are followed
Observing and supporting all safety guidelines and regulations
Performing other related duties and/or special projects as required in the department.
Responsible for assisting in applying security patches to mission critical applications to prevent identified cyber security vulnerabilities

Required Skills:

Our Ideal candidate:

College or University students enrolled in a bachelor's degree or diploma program in Computer Science or another relevant area.
Capable of producing high quality specification and documentation.
Strong team player with the ability to work in both local and remote cross-cultural teams.
Self learner with the ability to follow and understand system changes and roadmaps.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with diverse teams.
Demonstrates the company's Mission, Vision and Values Statements, policies, and current standard business practices.
Models expected behaviours within the team, driving a service excellence culture:
Seeing everything through the lens of the customer.
Paying attention to the physical environment because everything speaks.
Providing service delivery that will create service wows.
Proficiency in French is an asset.
Knowledge in the following areas is an asset:
Microsoft 365 including power apps and power automate,
Software Development and/or Scripting and automation.

Interested? Apply Now!
We are committed to diversity and inclusion and thank all applicants in advance; however, we will be corresponding only with those selected for an interview.
In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, we are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment and selection process.

Compensation and Benefits:

$24.82

Deliver core customer-facing features of our website
Work closely with the product team to create a delightful user experience
Work closely with the backend team to design APIs
Share ownership of our product and our customers' happiness
Write unit and integration tests for everything
Leveraging AI Tools to work more efficiently

Required Skills:

We're excited about you because you have...

A passion for programming and solving problems with code
A love for technology, and an insatiable curiosity for new tools to solve real problems
Technologies we use and teach:
Typescript, Javascript
React, React Hooks, React Server Components (RSC), Next.js., styled-components
Jest, Playwright

We're looking for exceptional co-op students who love building quality experiences and would jump at the opportunity to take ownership of entire features and help guide teams to improve the quality of their deliveries. By supporting the growth of independent businesses, Faire is driving positive economic impact in local communities, globally. We're looking for smart, resourceful and passionate people to join us as we power the shop local movement. If you believe in community, come join ours.

Role Description
Our mobile app is crucial to our vision: Empowering entrepreneurs to chase their dreams. We see monthly engagement of our mobile customers in the hours - they love to run their business from their pocket. We want our app to be so frictionless, so fast, and easy to use. We care about stunning design, great UX, and good engineering practices -- we love to write secure, tested, easy to maintain, responsive, and performant software. Our tech stack includes Kotlin for backend and application logic, Jetpack Compose for modern declarative UI development, RxJava for reactive programming and asynchronous data streams, and Hilt for dependency injection and lifecycle management. We're looking for co-op students who would love the opportunity to take ownership over entire features and get their code into production.

Why you'll love working at Faire

As a Faire co-op, you'll have the opportunity to:
Take on responsibilities of a full-time engineer and be treated like a permanent Faire employee from day one
Work alongside talented engineers and engineering leaders, product managers, and designers on a daily basis to contribute to real projects with real impacts
Be challenged to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment with supportive team members
Own projects from scoping to shipping and see how your work directly impacts our customers and drives data-focused results
Learn more by checking out the internships section of Faire's The Craft blog or watching this videoby a former Faire co-op.
About our selection process
If your application is selected, our Talent Team will reach out to you via email to invite you to:
Step 1: Co-op Event (1 hr)
By invitation only, join us at this exclusive event to connect with our Talent and Engineering team members and learn more about why you'll want to work at Faire.
Step 2: Technical Interview (1 hr)
Meet 1:1 with an experienced engineer and work through a pair programming exercise together. Use this CodeSignal link to prep for the technical interview (this is entirely optional).

If you're selected to advance beyond the technical interview, our Talent Team will follow up with you via email to invite you to:

Step 3: Phone Call with Recruiter (15 mins)
Chat 1:1 with a Faire recruiter to get your questions answered. Our recruiter will also share some additional details, including what to expect in terms of compensation.

Job Responsibilities:

As an Android engineer, you'll collaborate with us to:

Be a part of a team of 15+ Android engineers
Get to work with the latest mobile libraries and technologies
Deliver core customer-facing features on our app
Work closely with the product team to create a delightful user experience
Work closely with the backend team to design APIs
Share ownership of our product and our customer's happiness
Write unit and integration tests for everything

Required Skills:

We're excited about you because you have...

Some experience with Android development
A passion for mobile development and eagerness to learn

We're looking for exceptional co-op students who love building quality experiences and would jump at the opportunity to take ownership of entire features and help guide teams to improve the quality of their deliveries. You can shadow our world-class engineers (former Google, Square, and Shopify) and learn from the best.

We recognize the value that co-op students bring and we're looking to help mentor for the future and build lasting relationships that will extend past graduation.

Transportation and Housing:

About our work model

This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule. All office employees will be expected to come into the office every Tuesday, Thursday, and an Employee-chosen 3rd in-office day (Monday, Wednesday, or Friday) and must live within a 56 km radius of the KW or TOR offices.

Our offices are centrally located at 85 Willis Way in Uptown Waterloo and 420 Wellington Street West in Toronto's Fashion District.

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive Pay & Perks That Go Beyond

At Faire, our co-op salaries range from $32-$52 CAD per hour, consistently exceeding the University's average earnings (check out the average co-op earnings here). But that's just the beginning! Here's what else you can look forward to:

3 Paid Time Off (PTO) Days - Because we know rest matters.
Commuter Stipend - Helping you get to and from the office stress-free.
Phone & Internet Stipend - Stay connected, on us.
80 Hours of Sick Time - Your well-being comes first.
Catered Meals & Snacks - Enjoy delicious food and an impressive selection of drinks in the office.
Community & Fun - Connect with fellow co-ops and Faire employees through Slack channels, game nights, and exciting social events.
Join us for an experience that's more than just a job- it's a launchpad for your future!

Job Summary:

About Faire
Faire is an online wholesale marketplace built on the belief that the future is local - there are over 2 million independent retailers in North America and Europe doing more than $2 trillion in revenue. At Faire, we're using the power of tech, data, and machine learning to connect this thriving community of entrepreneurs across the globe. Picture your favorite boutique in town - we help them discover the best products from around the world to sell in their stores. With the right tools and insights, we believe we can level the playing field so that small businesses everywhere can compete with these big box and e-commerce giants.

By supporting the growth of independent businesses, Faire is driving positive economic impact in local communities, globally. We're looking for smart, resourceful and passionate people to join us as we power the shop local movement. If you believe in community, come join ours.

Role Description
The AI Platform team's mission is to make machine learning and AI at Faire fast, accurate, and accessible to all. Its goal is to enable teams at Faire to seamlessly develop and deploy a wide variety of machine learning and AI models that power Faire's two-sided marketplace. The team's work spans systems such as feature store, model training and fine-tuning platform, model store, model inference service, model evaluation and model monitoring. More recently, we are also exploring the space of AI tools, agents in order to drive customer impact.

Why you'll love working at Faire

Job Responsibilities:

Job Summary:

Quantitative Equity Research, Intern
Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management Ltd.
Vancouver, BC

We are looking for a Quantitative Research Intern to join our fast-paced and entrepreneurial Quantitative Equity team for 4-8 months starting in May or September 2026! We are a high-performance team embedded in a top-performing quant fund that manages over 58 billion in financial assets. We combine leading edge quantitative research with state-of-the-art technology to develop our unique algorithmic investment strategies. A culture of innovation, growth and success through collaboration has enabled us to deliver top tier performance for over two decades.

About Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management

Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management is a global institutional asset management firm established in 1982 and based in Vancouver, Canada. Our strong, stable team of investment professionals manages a broad range of investment solutions that includes traditional mandates such as developed and emerging market equities and fixed income, as well as alternative strategies such as portable alpha, market neutral and absolute return. As of August 2025, we manage $58B in client assets.

CPP Investments recently published a case study highlighting CC&L Investment Management's innovative and collaborative approach to quantitative investing in Canada. Read the full article here: Pioneering the Quant Frontier.

Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management Ltd. is part of the Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group Ltd. (CC&L Financial Group), a multi-boutique investment management company whose affiliates collectively manage over $167 billion in financial assets. Our affiliation with the CC&L Financial Group allows us to best deliver on the mission to provide superior performance and service to our clients.

Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or age.

We welcome applications from candidates with different academic disciplines, including but not exclusive to Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Physics. Students in their final internship term are preferred and the monthly salary for this position is $11,000.

To apply for this position, please submit your resume, cover letter and transcript. Please note, this posting is specifically for the quantitative research group and a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.7 or experience in academic research is required.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, but only those candidates shortlisted for interviews will be contacted. No telephone calls or recruitment agencies will be accepted.

Job Responsibilities:

What You Will Do

As an intern on the quantitative research team, you will help tackle a broad array of challenges at the Intersection of finance, data science, and technology. We seek to identify novel predictors of business outcomes and model complex inefficiencies in constantly evolving financial markets. Our focus is on developing cutting edge and uniquely powerful investment insights.

This is an exciting role for an individual who is passionate about quantitative research and wants to apply a disciplined and scientific approach to investing. You will work with key decision makers on the team and have a broad range of responsibilities, including:
Research and development of new investment models
Generating ideas for new investment insights
Apply a variety of skills and techniques in finance, data science and statistics
Collaborate with our technology, portfolio management and investment process teams to deliver exceptional investment performance

Required Skills:

What You Bring

Domain Expertise - You have a deep understanding of the drivers of business success, securities valuation, and markets. You can effectively apply both creativity and discipline to sourcing and evaluating novel data sets that are useful for predicting the performance of companies and securities.
Analytical Mindset - You have experience with producing rigorous quantitative research, particularly in finance, and are adept at balancing intuition with statistical validation.
Academic Training - Working towards an undergraduate degree in finance, mathematics, statistics, computer science or a related discipline. Exceptional achievements and recognition (e.g., research or awards) are helpful in demonstrating your abilities.
Collaborative Approach - You thrive in a collaborative environment and value shared success. You proactively solicit and provide input and excel at communicating complex and technical concepts.

Additional Information:

Other	3.7 GPA

Compensation and Benefits:

We welcome applications from candidates with different academic disciplines, including but not exclusive to Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Physics. Students in their final internship term are preferred and the monthly salary for this position is $11,000.

Compass Data & AI (CDAI)drives innovation for Compass Group, a $46B food and hospitality leader serving more than 5 billion meals annually across restaurants, corporate cafés, sports and entertainment venues, schools, and more. At CDAI, we apply data and AI to enable smarter decisions and build technology that operates at enterprise scale.

We're hiring a Data & AI Engineering Co-op to join one of our high-impact AI teams. Our work spans AI engineering, applied machine learning, computer vision, and AI-powered applications that help Compass Group operate more efficiently. As a co-op, you may work on projects ranging from automating unstructured data extraction with AI, building ML models, to developing internal platforms and infrastructure that support faster, data-informed decisions.

This is a hands-on opportunity to contribute to both proof-of-concept and production-grade data and AI solutions in a fast-paced environment. You'll collaborate closely with experienced engineers, data scientists, and product partners, gaining real-world experience building and deploying cutting-edge solutions.

Job Responsibilities:

Project scope and focus may vary based on your skill set and business needs, but you may work on any combination of the following:

Prototype and scale AI and data-driven solutions that empower business teams
Work with LLM-based tools, including prompt engineering, retrieval-augmented generation, and production AI workflows
Build and maintain data pipelines and services using Python, SQL, and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS)
Support the development and integration of applied machine learning solutions (e.g., recommender systems, forecasting, computer vision)
Contribute to the deployment, monitoring, and continuous improvement of data and AI systems
Experiment with emerging AI technologies and tools to evaluate how they can be applied to real business problems.
Collaborate closely with engineers, data scientists, and product partners across the organization

Required Skills:

You are pursuing a STEM degree and have:

Strong Python skills
Experience building or consuming APIs and backend services
Experience working with LLM-based tools and frameworks (e.g., agent frameworks, prompt design, retrieval-augmented generation)
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS or GCP)
Comfort working with data, including analysis, pipelines, and data modeling
Working knowledge of SQL
Experience in any of the following is a plus
Frontend engineering skills
MLOps practices (e.g., model deployment, monitoring, reproducibility)
Data engineering or analytics infrastructure
Web scraping or working with unstructured data
Machine learning model development and exploratory data analysis

Compensation and Benefits:

We offer highly competitive compensation, typically around 60% higher than average rates for senior engineering and computer science students, listed in the Co-op Earnings chart.

Job Summary:

An opportunity exists in the C5ISR group for a creative software developer who has a passion to invent, design, implement and test embedded software along with a curiosity and desire to learn.

As a member of this team, you will have an opportunity to participate in the development of Firmware, Board Support Packages (BSPs), device drivers for Wind River's VxWorks real time operating system, Linux, Fastpath-based network switches and automated test of our software using state of the art tools in both Linux and Windows development environments.

The developed software is for use on our single board computers, graphics and video capture modules, switch and security products based on industry standards such as CompactPCI, VMEbus and VITA46 (VPX). These products feature high performance embedded processors (Intel, ARM, PowerPC, graphics processors from AMD/ATI and Broadcom communications processors), Ethernet, USB and serial communication interconnected using high speed parallel and serial bus technologies such as PCI Express.

You will be part of the product development team, including hardware, mechanical and test engineers, engaged in the design, integration and testing of our next generation products - some in development and others in the sustaining phase. There will be ample exposure to all aspects of the software development process from requirements definition to release in an AS9100 certified environment.

Job Responsibilities:

Experience in the following is an asset:

Experience with source code control management tools such as GIT, Bitbucket, and Gitkraken.
Experience with Jira and Confluence.

Curtiss-Wright Defense Solutions is a long-established technology leader in the development of rugged electronic modules and systems for defense applications. Curtiss-Wright serves as a technology and integration partner to its customers, providing a full range of advanced, highly engineered solutions from modular open systems approaches to fully custom optimized solutions. Our unmatched capabilities and product breadth span from industry standard based COTS modules to complete electronic subsystems. The company's modules and systems are currently deployed in a wide range of demanding defense and aerospace applications including C5ISR systems, unmanned subsystems, mission computing, fire control, turret stabilization, and recording and storage solutions. Additionally, the company's broad engineering capabilities combine systems, software, electrical, and mechanical design expertise with comprehensive program management and a broad range of life-cycle support services.

If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Human Resources and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

This position may require exposure to information that is subject to US export control regulations such as the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must meet eligibility requirements of the ITAR and of the Controlled Goods Directorate (CGD).

Job Summary:

Summer Work Term: May 2026 - December 2026

Ready to shape the future of banking?
Join the purpose-driven, tech-forward team at Equitable Bank where your ideas matter and your growth is accelerated. We're not just another bank-we're Canada's Challenger Bank™, lean, agile, and built for the digital age. If you're passionate about challenging the status quo, driving meaningful change, and gaining hands-on experience in digital financial services, our Engineering Graduate Program is the opportunity you've been waiting for!

Starting in May 2026, you'll begin your journey as a Full Stack Software Engineer Intern through our Engineering Graduate Program, designed to accelerate your development through immersive, hands-on experience within Digital Banking.

At EQ Bank, we're building the future of banking in Canada, and we want you to be part of it! Our teams work in agile, cross-functional pods where collaboration, creativity, and innovation drive everything we do. We put customers at the heart of every decision, using research, data, and feedback to create products that truly make an impact.

We're not just building software, we're reimagining banking. If you're passionate about solving real-world problems, learning from experienced engineers, and working in a supportive, dynamic environment, this program is for you!

Job Responsibilities:

What You Will Do:
Over the course of this 8-month term, you'll have the opportunity to work with frontend and backend tools and projects.
Your responsibilities will include:

Backend:

Assess and clarify user experience and requirements to deliver customer-centric solutions.
Analyze functional requirements and provide technical solutions, including API designs and Microservice architecture.
Develop and support RESTful/SOAP APIs and Microservice applications.
Participate in SCRUM meetings to ensure smooth Sprint delivery and issue resolution.
Conduct unit testing and assist with automated testing where applicable.
Participate in code reviews and manage merge requests for various release branches.
Collaborate with incident management teams to troubleshoot and resolve production incidents.
Contribute to technical documentation and assist with ongoing application support
Frontend:
Design and develop user interfaces following modern best practices and technologies (e.g., Angular, Java/Kotlin for Android, SwiftUI for iOS).
Write clean, maintainable, and performant code using the relevant programming languages and frameworks for web and mobile platforms.
Make key technical and design decisions to ensure effective and efficient user interfaces.
Develop and integrate frontend applications with RESTful APIs and GraphQL.
Collaborate with senior developers to implement performant, scalable solutions for both web and mobile platforms.
Provide application support and perform code reviews to maintain quality standards

Required Skills:

Let's Talk About You!

Must be a student currently enrolled in school or recently graduated
Undergraduate/Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering
Experience in Java and Spring Boot in a professional environment or internship.
Microservices development experience, including designing, implementing, and maintaining microservice-based architectures.
Basic knowledge of REST API and Microservices architecture patterns.
Experience with MSSQL or other relational databases.
Development experience with JUnit and Spring integration tests.
Basic knowledge of Git for version control.
Self-starter who can take a concept and drive it through to design and implementation.
Ability to carry out other technical-related duties as needed.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and tools to automate the development, testing, and deployment process.
Experience with Angular, Java/Kotlin for Android, or SwiftUI for iOS in a professional environment.
Android development with tools like RxJava, Coroutines, Flow, and Compose
iOS development using SwiftUI, RxSwift, Swift Concurrency, and some familiarity with Objective-C.
Proficiency in JavaScript, with experience in Angular, CSS, HTML, and writing cross-browser compatible code for web development.
Understanding of RESTful Architecture, GraphQL, and web services.
Familiarity with security frameworks, standards, and practices.
Knowledge of Micro Frontend architecture (preferred).

Compensation and Benefits:

What's in it for you?
If you're a 4th year student looking to launch your career in a dynamic, purpose-driven environment, this is your opportunity to build a strong foundation and make a real impact.

At EQ Bank you will receive:

Mentorship & Coaching: from senior leaders and subject matter experts. Our Mentorship program is structured to provide regular touchpoints, feedback, and personalized guidance to help you thrive. Be a part of leadership round table discussions and hear from experts across Engineering to help you network and build connections.
Empowerment and Impact: Opportunities to make a difference and create lasting impact through meaningful work, empowering you to contribute directly to business outcomes while developing the skills and confidence to grow your career in Digital Banking.
Chart your Career Path: Final year students who perform successfully in this program will have the opportunity to achieve a full-time role at the end of their work term!

Come Join Our Team!
As an Axonify co-op, you'll gain valuable experience, not only through your role but through the community we offer, where all members of the Axonify team are eager to help you develop your skills and succeed, at Axonify and beyond. Check out our Lifewithaxonify Instagram page to learn more about our culture and hear from our previous co-op students on their work term experiences.

Axonify is the frontline operations platform for customer-facing businesses. We began by reinventing frontline learning and earned unmatched engagement with global brands. Now, we're evolving into an automated frontline ops excellence solution that connects people, tasks, communication, and outcomes to deliver consistent, brand-building experiences.

More than 4 million employees across 160+ countries rely on Axonify today. It's an exciting time to join as we transform the company and build what's next

We're a team that thinks deeply, moves with intention, and embraces new ideas. We learn quickly, keep a sharp focus on real-world impact, and take meaningful action to drive progress. And we do it as one team, with openness, creativity, and a shared drive to keep pushing what's possible

At Axonify, we embrace a hybrid-flexible work environment. Most days, you choose the location that best supports your work, your home office or our Waterloo or Toronto offices. On Wednesdays, Axonifers within commuting distance come together for Work from Work Wednesdays, a day designed for collaboration, connection, and meaningful in-person moments. You'll have the tools, resources, and support you need to succeed.

Wednesdays hold a special place in our calendar as Axonifers gather together in one of our offices for "Work from Work Wednesdays." These face-to-face interactions energize our week with meaningful connection and foster collaboration and innovation. Let's chat more about our flexible working arrangement!

Job Summary:

You are as unique as your background, your experience and your point of view. At Sun Life, you will be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best. You will work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you will have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Role Summary

We're in the need of an eager, self-motivated developer who is ready to use their education as a foundation to grow their skills into something more special. This role sits at the forefront of innovation at Sun Life and is focused in delivering APIs to market in a way no other insurer in Canada is doing it. You will be a developer and a key member of the team defining the next generation of delivery for the insurance industry.


What's in it for you?

Augmenting your current studies with real and practical application of what you have learned to date.
Working with one of the most cutting edge and innovative teams within Sun Life
Being part of our journey in developing the next greatest digital experience
A 'dress for the day' dress code, where you dictate how you dress based on your day
Flexible work arrangements that will allow you to work from home while collaborating with our globally disbursed team
At Sun Life, you will be joining a purpose driven organization focused on helping Canadian's achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives.
As a student, you'll make a real impact by contributing to meaningful work, gaining valuable experience and actively working towards your team's goals.
You'll join our unique student culture, designed to help you grow both personally and professionally beyond your role. We offer professional development workshops, student awards, socials and many more exciting opportunities.
We are honored to be recognized as Canada's Best Employers for Recent Graduates and Canada's Best Workplaces by Great Place to Work in 2025.
Your student journey is just the beginning and we're proud to help many who choose Sun Life to transition into permanent roles after graduation.

Job Responsibilities:

What will you do?

Reporting to the Director, API Platform Engineering, the API Developer (Co-op) is responsible for design, development, deployment and implementation of the API Platform and Enterprise Event Hub Components.
The individual in this role will grow their own skill set by working very closely with a team of cutting-edge software engineers to introduce new innovations to Sun Life.
The responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

Participate in the design, development, deployment and rollout of components involved in API Platforms both in the cloud and on premise.
Participate in the construction, maintenance and continuous improvement of core infrastructure that underlies API development including a gateway/service-mesh, runtimes, security, logging, exception handling, etc. in partnership with rest of ES.
Participate in the design and development of the CI/CD Pipeline for API lifecycle
Participate in the design and implementation of an Enterprise Event Hub with Kafka
Identifying defects in the platform modules, debugging issues being faced and provide effective solutions to resolve the same
Develop an understanding of project best practices around continuous integration and delivery

Required Skills:

What will you need to succeed?

Must Have

Currently pursuing a Bachelors' Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related area with a graduation date of August 2026 or later.
Previous experience with programming in Java is required
Understanding of APIs, Event Driven Solutions, DevOps, containers, Kubernetes and cloud
Self starter with tenacious inquisitiveness and a desire to learn who will proactively find and explore solutions and provide recommendations.

Nice to Have
Previous experience with programming in C#, Python and/or JavaScript are nice to have
Experience with scripting languages to automate operations tasks is a nice to have
Knowledge of API development in AWS Serverless environment working with AWS Lambda and AWS API Gateway etc.
Awareness of how to deploy components on Kubernetes
Knowledge of CI/CD solutions (like Jenkins, Ansible, CDD Continuous Delivery Director)
Proficiency in building and deploying solutions with frameworks like Spring Boot, including secure coding practices, load-testing and performance optimization
Awareness of modern event-based architectures and patterns (event sourcing, choreography-based SAGA Pattern)
Exposure to building solutions using Apache Kafka, Confluent Platform
Awareness of Kafka technologies, Kafka Connect, Schema Registry, Kafka Broker, Zookeeper, KSQL, KStream
Awareness of Financial Services and Insurance

Competencies
Ability to establish and maintain a good team environment, develop a culture of innovation, collaboration within the team.
Demonstrated problem solving, communication and organizational skills, a positive attitude coupled with the self-awareness to seek help when needed
Ability to effectively communicate both internally and externally.
Mature, confident, and performance-oriented
Capable of developing strong relationships with peers
An excellent communicator, team player and someone who is intellectually honest.
Ability to adapt thinking and response to the geographic differences across our global operations.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary Range: Based on experience and location

Toronto - $55,000 - $65,000
Waterloo - $53,000 - $63,000

Job Summary:

The Student, Site Reliability Analyst works within the Event and Performance Management practice to drive excellence and innovation to support project and operational delivery priorities. The role combines software and systems engineering to ensure applications and infrastructure are stable and performing optimally. SRA ensures critical internal and external digital services maintain reliability and uptime appropriate to client's needs while keeping an ever-watchful eye on identifying capacity and performance concerns.

The SRA mindset uses engineering principles to constantly find ways to improve applications, systems and services. The role understands the big picture of how systems relate to each other to put in value add end to end monitors, identifies optimization opportunities and improves productivity through automation. Using a breadth of monitoring and development tools the SRA will limit the amount of time spent on operational work, provide data to prevent future incidents and take proactive actions to prevent potential outages. This mindset will help Event and Performance Management on the journey towards Artificial Intelligence for Operations. Working in a dynamic agile environment intellectual curiosity, problem solving, collaboration, valuing diversity and openness is key to success. As with many IT services, there is an expectation of availability off hours for client impacting changes or troubleshooting activities; Event and Performance Management provides services globally and therefore requires 24x7 support.

Term Length: 4-months, 8-months

What is in it for you?

At Sun Life, you will be joining a purpose driven organization focused on helping Canadian's achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives.
As a student, you'll make a real impact by contributing to meaningful work, gaining valuable experience and actively working towards your team's goals.
You'll join our unique student culture, designed to help you grow both personally and professionally beyond your role.
We offer professional development workshops, student awards, socials and many more exciting opportunities.
We are honored to be recognized as Canada's Best Employers for Recent Graduates and Canada's Best Workplaces by Great Place to Work in 2025.
Your student journey is just the beginning and we're proud to help many who choose Sun Life to transition into permanent roles after graduation.

Job Responsibilities:

What you will do?

Collaborate with other teams for the consultation, design, implementation and management of monitoring tools, dashboards and reports.
Analyze metrics, identify trends and execute processes and strategies to address any risks to reliability.
Collaborate with internal business partners, such as our IT Support Teams, System Architect, IT Security and Enterprise Account Management for operational execution and service delivery of technology needs.
Create and implement knowledge documents, focusing on usability, content verification and accuracy.
Participate and contribute to industry related developments and training to be shared among team members while continuously contributing to our roadmap strategy

Required Skills:

What do you need to succeed?

Currently enrolled in University degree/College diploma in computer sciences, information systems or information technology
with a August 2026 or later graduation date
Prior experience in supporting technology in an operational role.
Prior working experience with all stages of systems development and implementation efforts, including requirements elicitation, architecture, design, development, testing, training, support, and maintenance.
Prior experience working with Enterprise delivery methodologies such as Agile (ITIL knowledge welcomed)
Experience with operational monitoring & performance management tools such; Broadcom Monitoring Suite (APM, DX APM), xMatters and other similar technologies.
Experience with , Autosys Batch Job Scheduler suite of tools or similar.
Experience or familiarity with Release Management tools (i.e. Broadcom CDD or similar)
Experience with Splunk or other software for searching, monitoring, and examining machine-generated Big Data.
Experience with CyberArk on any other similar security tool used for the security of privileged accounts through password management.
Strong written and verbal communication, organization, strategic thinking and planning skills.
Ability to analyze and present data using a variety of tools and techniques in the areas of business analysis and business intelligence principles to create executive dashboards and reports.
Strong collaboration skills, self-starter, strategic thinker, negotiator and consensus builder.

Salary Range = $53,000 - $63,000

Job Summary:

AT NDI, THE WORK YOU DO HERE MAKES A DIFFERENCE.
Every day, we help shape the future of healthcare. We design and build 3D tracking systems that equip medical devices with advanced spatial navigation technology, delivering greater accuracy, performance, and confidence in procedures where precision is critical. Since 1981, we've partnered with leading OEMs and research institutes to push the boundaries of surgical navigation. Our optical and electromagnetic technologies are trusted in procedures ranging from orthopaedics and spine surgery to cardiac interventions and radiation therapy.

Whether you're designing systems, supporting customers, or enabling the teams behind them, your work matters. It brings clarity to healthcare and helps improve outcomes for patients around the world.

We are looking for an energetic and innovative Software Developer co-op student to join our R&D team in the development of application software that enables configuration, demonstration, and deployment of our 3D measurement tracking systems. You will be given a high degree of independence, while receiving the resources and support necessary to succeed at a variety of challenging and interesting projects. You will be a key contributor in the engineering and development of 3D Tracking applications. The applications involve the combination of real-time tracking data, 3D visualization, system configuration, modeling, workflow management and human factors engineering. You will have the opportunity to gain exposure to everything from real-time embedded systems, measurement analysis, application design, and medical device development.

Job Responsibilities:

Reporting to, and working directly with the Team Lead of Software Development, the Software Developer Intern will play a key role in the design and development of software applications written in Java and C/C++. The systems will be deployed in OS X, Linux, and Windows environments.

Required Skills:

Experience programming in Java and C/C++.
Familiarity with Windows, Linux, and OS X operating systems.
Familiarity with Atlassian tools such as Bitbucket, Bamboo, Jira, Confluence.
Experience with real-time programming and communication protocols would be an asset.
Creative problem-solving and proven software design skills.

Transportation and Housing:

Must be able to commute to the Waterloo Office for hybrid work model.
Conveniently located near GRT and ION transit stops, with free on-site parking available.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required


Compensation and Benefits:

THE BENEFITS OF JOINING OUR TEAM

A 37.5-hour work week with a hybrid work model available where responsibilities allow.
A calendar full of employee social events and engagement activities to keep us connected.
Work where your contributions are valued - as a multi-year winner of Waterloo Region's Top Employers and the 2025 Chamber of Commerce Business of the Year, we're recognized for putting people first and fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.
Part of a growing global company with offices in Waterloo, Vermont, Germany, and Hong Kong.

Job Summary:

About us
Trexo Robotics (YC W19) is enabling mobility by building powered wearable robots (https://youtu.be/WkaRcPCNhZw). Our first product is a robot for children with movement disorders such as Cerebral Palsy and it allows kids to walk, in many cases for the first time in their lives. The device is currently being used by families and the best hospitals across North America.

Our work doesn't stop here, we are constantly working towards building mobility solutions for all. At Trexo Robotics you will find a flat organization where you can work with highly optimistic, low ego, and exceptionally talented individuals who look forward to solving hard problems.

We love hiring interns (over 40 so far) and also have interns who eventually join us full-time!

About the Job
We are currently transferring a new design to production, expanding into new jurisdictions and ramping up our production. We are looking for a Manufacturing Engineering intern who can help us improve our design documentation and build better quality and production processes.

This position is on-site at our Mississauga office.

We are open to terms between 4 and 16 months.

Job Responsibilities:

About You
You want to work in a small team solving a big problem while helping an underserved community. You love taking things apart and building them back. You are detail oriented and a fast learner.

What you'll do

Support manufacturing activities for existing products and help transition to new products.
Design and build fixtures used for assembly and testing.
Make changes to parts/processes for DFM and DFA.
Update part drawings, part specifications, BOMs and other design documentation.
Update Process Mapping and PFMEA files.
Help develop inspection criteria for suppliers and incoming inspection.
Update documentation for regulatory approvals (ISO 13485, ROHS, Reach).
Design new packaging
Implement changes as part of the change management processes
Assemble and test prototypes.
Support QA investigations of customer and supplier issues.

Required Skills:

Required Skills

Previous experience working in a assembly environment of electromechanical systems.
Previous experience with manufacturing processes (Machining, Injection Molding, Assembly).
Previous experience with technical writing of process documents (PFMEA, Process Flow, Control Plan, Work Instructions, and Checklists).
Nice to have
Ability to create mechanical and electrical drawings.
Hands on experience with Solidworks.
Interest in exoskeletons.
Knowledge of ISO 13485.

Compensation and Benefits:

CA$25 - CA$34
Office snacks
Dog friendly office environment

Trexo's work doesn't stop with children. We are working towards building mobility solutions for all. At Trexo Robotics, you will find a flat organization where you can work with highly optimistic, low ego, passionate and talented individuals who look forward to solving hard problems.

Read more about us at https://www.trexorobotics.com/.

About the Job
As more and more devices are being used we need to strive to make sure they all work perfectly and reliably. We are looking for a Robotics software developer intern to continue the development of new features across our robotics software stack and infrastructure.

You will work on designing and developing new features with a focus on long-term reliability while fixing existing bugs.

The ideal candidate will have experience working with controls, real-time Linux, and C/C++/Python. Previous students have told us this is the best robotics coop position out there!

This position is on-site at our Mississauga office.

Job Responsibilities:

About You
You want to work in a small team solving a big problem while helping an underserved community. You love when products just work and can't believe how some bugs make it out in the wild. You are detail-oriented and love asking why many times till you understand something from first principles.

What you'll do

Develop software in C/C++/Python for our robotics software stack.
Fix software bugs and participate in code reviews.
Improve our infrastructure software (Trexo updater software, CI/CD, Linux operating system).

Required Skills:

Required Skills

Strong debugging and troubleshooting skills.
Extensive experience developing software in C/C++ and Python.
Hands of experience developing software running in Linux environment.
Knowledge of multithreading, concurrency and real time safe software development.
Interest in exoskeletons.

Nice to Have
Experience reading PCB schematics and PCBA troubleshooting.
Hands on experience modifying/building Linux kernels.
Experience working with Rust.
Experience with control systems.
Experience with Go.

Compensation and Benefits:

CA$28 - CA$37
Office snacks.
Dog friendly office environment!

About us
Trexo Robotics is enabling mobility by building powered wearable robots. Our first product is a robot for children with movement disorders such as Cerebral Palsy, and it allows kids to walk, in many cases, for the first time in their lives. The device is currently being used by hundreds of families and the best hospitals across North America.

We are constantly working towards building mobility solutions for all. At Trexo Robotics, you will find a flat organization where you can work with highly optimistic, low ego, and exceptionally talented individuals who look forward to solving hard problems.

About the job
We currently have Trexos all over North America and an ever-growing backlog of Trexos we need to ship! As more and more devices are being used we need to ensure they all work perfectly and reliably.

This position is in-person at our office in Mississauga.

About you
You enjoy turning messy data into trusted, documented datasets. You ask "why" until the metric definition is crystal clear, and you care about reproducibility, testing, and clear communication. You're conscientious about handling sensitive data and are eager to learn healthcare privacy expectations.

Job Responsibilities:

What you'll do

Build and maintain a lightweight data warehouse (e.g., Postgres/Redshift/BigQuery/Snowflake) as a single source of truth.
Build and schedule ELT/ETL pipelines from sources like Salesforce, product telemetry (AWS S3, RDS), support tools, and marketing platforms (FB, Instagram).
Model data (e.g., star schemas, data marts) and write transformations in SQL and/or dbt.
Build and iterate BI dashboards (e.g., QuickSight, Tableau, Power BI, Looker Studio) for teams across the company.
Implement basic data quality checks (freshness, completeness, validity) and alerting.
Prepare curated datasets that support AI use cases (de-duplicated, well-labeled features) for ML team.
Use Sprinto to manage privacy and compliance workflows, ensuring data handling follows HIPAA/PHIPA/PIPEDA standards through encryption, access control, and secure, auditable practices.

Required Skills:

Required Skills

Must be enrolled in a co-op program.
Proficient with SQL (joins, window functions, CTEs) and relational data modeling.
Experience with building or maintaining a data warehouse (e.g., designing schemas, managing ETL jobs, or optimizing queries in platforms like Redshift, BigQuery, or Snowflake) ideally from the ground up.
Experience with Python for data work (pandas, simple scripts/CLI tools).
Experience building dashboards in at least one BI tool.
Comfortable with CSV/JSON, APIs, and Git/GitHub.
Awareness of handling sensitive data (PII/PHI) and a willingness to follow privacy/security SOPs; strong attention to detail and documentation.
Strong communication; can translate stakeholder questions into precise data requirements.

Nice to Have
Experience with dbt, Airbyte/Fivetran, Airflow/GitHub Actions, or similar tooling.
Familiarity with a cloud platform (AWS/Azure/GCP), object storage (e.g., S3), IAM concepts, and key management.
Experience optimizing data warehouse performance (e.g., partitioning, caching, cost control, query tuning).
Exposure to data quality/validation (e.g., Great Expectations) and lineage/catalog tools.
Understanding of de-identification techniques (masking, tokenization, k-anonymity concepts) and DLP scanning (e.g., Macie).
Familiarity with compliance frameworks or audits (HIPAA, PHIPA/PIPEDA, SOC 2, ISO 27001, HITRUST).

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation and Benefits

CA$28- CA$37
Office snacks
Dog-friendly office environment

About Dyna Software Inc.
Founded in 2018, Dyna Software Inc. is a software development company that specializes in custom business and IT solutions leveraging the ServiceNow platform and IoT capabilities. We are a proud, recognized Technology Partner of ServiceNow, bringing together over 12 years of platform expertise. Our mission is to develop innovative, practical, and valuable solutions for the betterment of our customers and technology partners.

Key Products

GuardRails: A governance application for the ServiceNow platform that protects your investment by providing proactive insights on product-related known errors, customizations, and future functionality-along with preventative measures and remediation paths.
Platform Copilot: An innovative AI application designed to transform business requirements into actionable configurations in ESM tools (ServiceNow, Zendesk, Freshdesk, etc.), harnessing the power of modern language models and AI-driven automation.

Position Summary
We are looking for a Software Engineer - L0 (Intern/Coop) to work on our new AI-driven product, Platform Copilot, and with supporting our existing product, GuardRails, as needed. In this role, you will gain hands-on experience with a modern technology stack and make a direct impact on our AI-driven solutions.

Job Responsibilities:

What You Will Do

Develop Front-End Features: Implement and enhance features in our growing backlog using technologies like React, TypeScript, and modern JavaScript frameworks.
AI Prompt Engineering: Update and optimize prompts to enhance the performance and accuracy of our language models.
Back-End & Performance Optimization: Contribute to back-end services in Python, ensuring scalability, reliability, and improved performance.
Integration & Testing: Write and maintain unit, integration, and functional tests to guarantee quality. Collaborate with the team to troubleshoot and resolve issues.
Collaborate & Innovate: Bring fresh ideas to the table, stay on top of emerging technologies, and look for ways to continuously improve our products.

Required Skills:

Who We Are Looking For

Current Student (3rd year and above) or Recent Graduate in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
Proficiency in JavaScript and Python: A solid understanding of these languages is a must.
Experience with AI/LLMs: Familiarity or hands-on experience using AI frameworks, LangChain, or large language models in a development environment.
React & TypeScript Knowledge: Comfortable building front-end components and features with React and TypeScript.
Git & Agile Experience: Familiarity with version control and agile software development practices.
Strong Communication & Time Management: Able to work effectively in a remote, fast-paced environment while meeting deadlines.
Self-Driven & Motivated: Thrives in independent work settings, takes initiative, and proactively identifies opportunities for improvement.

Skills That Will Help You Stand Out
Experience with NoSQL databases
Understanding of Software development lifecycle and Software testing life cycle
Knowledge of API testing using any tools (Postman)
Experience with different testing types (unit testing, integration testing, functional testing, end-to-end testing, automation testing)

Explore how people, process, technology, and the environment must be combined for each project to enable successful integration solutions to realize business goals
Use project delivery assistance tools such as Revit, AutoCAD, MicroStation, Microsoft Office, and Bluebeam
Opportunity to be involved in discussions with Contractors, Architects, Planners, Electrical, Mechanical, Civil and Structural Engineers to gain knowledge & experiences

Required Skills:

Is this role right for you?

Pursuing a bachelor's degree in system design, Electrical, Electronics, Mechatronics Engineering, or relevant engineering focus
Excellent communication skills needed for team-based working
Keen curiosity about pursuing a career in the field of ITC, Electronic Security, and/or Audio-Visual through technology infrastructure and systems design and consulting in the built environment
Detail oriented with excellent planning and organization skills required for our fast-paced environment
Must be highly motivated, proactive, collaborative, and willing to handle new challenges
Previous internship experience advantageous
Experience with: Microsoft Word, Excel, Teams
Candidate must be eligible to work in Canada without the need for employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future
Preferred
Experience with: AutoCAD, Revit MEP, Bluebeam, MicroStation, Microsoft Visio, PowerPoint, or Project
Eligible to become a member of the PEO/OIQ/APEGA
Internship experience in an engineering design consulting firm
History of technical presentations and writing, knowledge sharing with peers
Academic research or testing with relevant focus
Confirmed ability to perform in a deadline driven environment
Evidence of teamwork, and leadership such as professional accomplishment or honor society
We're looking for:
Changemakers: A passion for sustainable development and creating a better world is key.
Innovative minds: We're looking for critical thinkers who embrace new ideas and challenge the status quo.
Growth seekers: You have a growth mindset, always eager to learn and explore new ways of working.
Adaptable adventurers: You're ready to take on any challenge that comes your way.

Compensation and Benefits:

What we offer you
At Arup, we care about each member's success, so we can grow together.
Our intern experience offers you:

Purpose-driven work: Join an employee-owned team tackling climate, biodiversity, and social challenges, aligned with the UN's Sustainable Development Goals.
Create remarkable outcomes: We trust you to explore challenges, drive change, and create lasting outcomes for our clients, climate and communities.
Inclusive culture: Your unique perspective matters. We celebrate diversity and foster a supportive, social environment where everyone belongs.
Career growth: Grow your skills through innovative projects, training, and mentoring in a supportive environment. We invest in your future.
Work-life balance: Our hybrid model offers flexibility to balance work with your life. We balance your needs with our clients and communities

Toronto Hiring Range - The good faith base salary hiring range for this job if performed in Toronto is $21 to $38 per hour. This range is commensurate with experience, educational background, and skill level.Benefits are not included in the base salary. Please note hiring ranges for candidates performing work outside of Toronto will differ.

This job posting represents an active vacancy within our organization and is open for immediate recruitment.

Next Steps
We will be reviewing our candidates for this position on a rolling basis. Once you've submitted your application, we'll invite you to showcase your skills through a pre-recorded video interview if you've met the minimum requirements. After reviewing your submission, a member of our team will get in touch with you to discuss the next steps.

Arup is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, spouse of a protected veteran, or disability.??
Stay safe online. Recruitment fraud is on the rise, and Arup's name, logo, and branding have been used in fraudulent job advertisements. Arup will never ask for bank information as part of our recruitment process.

Different people, shared values
Arup is an equal opportunity employer that actively promotes and nurtures a diverse and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of age (within legal limits), gender identity or expression, marital status, disability, neurotype or mental health, race or ethnicity, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you're pregnant or on family leave. We are an open environment that embraces diverse experiences, perspectives, and ideas - this drives our excellence.??

Guided by our values and alignment with the UN Sustainable Development Goals, we create and contribute to equitable spaces and systems, while cultivating a sense of belonging for all. Our internal employee networks support our inclusive culture: from race, ethnicity and cross-cultural working to gender equity and LGBTQ+ and disability inclusion - we aim to create a space for you to express yourself and make a positive difference. Discover more about life at Arup at www.arup.com/careers/your-life-

Our Toronto office is located on ceded and unceded lands of many nations including the Mississaugas of the Credit, the Anishinabewaki, and the Haudenosaunee (hoe-dee-no-SHOW-nee).?We acknowledge this land and its people to build a shared understanding of how our collective past brings us to where we are today. Through our ever-developing commitments, we strive to strengthen our relationships with this land, its people, and its treaties to shape a better, more inclusive world.

Job Summary:

The Instructional Support Group (ISG) is seeking an enthusiastic and dependable student to assume a valuable role on our teaching team for CS251.

This position may be of particular interest to students who are considering graduate school and ultimately teaching at the post-secondary level.

You can read more about the impact of working as an ISA on Co-operative Education's feature about the ISG.

Job Responsibilities:

The Instructional Support Assistant (ISA) provides the primary student contact, serving as a consultant for course-related material through office hours and answering student questions via e-mail or Piazza. They may also have the opportunity to gain teaching experience by helping deliver tutorial sessions and organizational experience by coordinating the activities of the graduate teaching assistants assigned to the course.

Other duties may include development of tutorial materials, reviewing course materials including lectures, assignments, quizzes, and exams, creation of model solutions and marking schemes, and assistance in proctoring and marking.

Required Skills:

A potential ISA must have:

Good communication skills
Critical thinking
Ability to successfully interact with a wide range of people (undergraduates, graduate TAs, graduate IAs, academic staff, professors).
Students who either have taken the course or are currently enrolled in the course are encouraged to apply.
Student Leadership Certification or courses in Student Leadership through the Student Success Office an asset.

Compensation and Benefits:

Monthly range of $3060 - $4540.

Salaries are based on education level, work term experience, and number of previous work terms with the ISG at the time of applying.
