Job Summary:

Conduct various data engineering and analytics functions, including the design and development of customized data sets, operational and management reports and/or dashboards and using various programming languages and Business Intelligence (BI) Tools, aiding data-driven decision making. Gathering and documenting business requirements, participating in various divisional projects and initiatives, including the coordination and tracking of project deliverables. Assist management with briefing and presentation materials on a regular or ad hoc basis. Provide technical support and advice on various databases/data-marts/mainframe applications, as well as assist in the extraction, transfer and load processes of data using multi-platform programs. Respond and execute on data requests from internal and external clients and assist other Analysts in the preparation and delivery of products and services.

About the Workplace Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB)
We're here to help. When an injury or illness happens on the job, we move quickly to provide wage-loss benefits, medical coverage and support to help people get back to work. Funded by businesses, we also provide no-fault collective liability insurance and access to industry-specific health and safety information. We are one of the largest insurance organizations in North America, covering over five million people in more than 300,000 workplaces across Ontario. For more information, visit?wsib.ca.

At the WSIB, you'll have the opportunity to:

explore many career paths and follow your passion
continuously learn and grow professionally
be recognized for the great work you do
participate in programs that support your health and wellbeing

Job Responsibilities:

Build queries and/or write programs/jobs to extract, compile, and structure data using software tools such as: Azure (Synapse, Data Factory, or Delta Lake), SQL, Python, Power BI, R, and/or SAS, to merge and analyze data from various sources to develop and aide in the development of canonical and semantic data sets for use in business and statistical analysis.
Create, develop, and produce comprehensive data flows, extracts, products, reports, dashboards, enabling WSIB to analyze claims and cost utilization, employer and worker profiling, in response to data requests from internal business areas and external clients. This includes selecting the most appropriate data source, executing data requests by creating data requirements, writing programs/queries from multiple data sources, building data sets, validating data, analyzing, designing, building and enhancing reports; providing basic explanations of data findings, analysis and statistical methodologies and measurements.
Conduct data profiling of existing data and source-to-target mapping to ensure data integrity and quality. This includes gathering, leveraging and documenting meta data for business values; defining, developing and documenting business rules and definitions for data attributes in WSIB Warehouse and ODS. Ensure data and information are valid and reasonable before releasing to the business.
In collaboration with the business, define/develop business and technical requirements, conduct analysis and participate in technical and business testing of data sources and data products.
Work collaboratively with the business and IT to maintain, enhance and support the utilization of existing and future data marts through the Incident and Defect Management and Change Request process managed through scheduled releases which include business and technical requirements, development, user acceptance testing, implementation and communication to users.
Ensure data quality and integrity of data in our centralized data store by matching or comparing data to appropriate data sources, validating accuracy, identifying, analyzing and investigating root causes to data issues or problems.
Assist in the maintenance and improvement of internal processes including the creation of process maps, user guides, as well as identify and implement solutions to increase automation and increase efficiencies.
Develop and maintain comprehensive end user documentation and reference materials/guides and ensure it is current and accurate including initiating appropriate updates of definitions.
Assist Business Analysts with the compiling of data, ensuring data validity and accuracy to understand the overall performance of the business to support decision-making.
Participate in key Branch projects, forums and working groups varying in scope and complexity including the gathering and writing of requirements, creating project and work plans and completing progress reports.
Perform other related duties as assigned or required.

Required Skills:

Technical Skills

Data Engineering: ETL/ELT pipeline development, Data Profiling, Source-to-Target Mapping.
Cloud & Tools: Azure (Synapse, Data Factory, Delta Lake), Spark, SQL, Python, R, SAS.
Analytics & BI: Power BI Service (MS Fabric), Dashboard Design, Semantic Data Modeling, Statistical Analysis.
Data Governance: Data Integrity Validation, Metadata Management, Root Cause Analysis.

Professional Skills
Business Analysis: Requirements Gathering (BRD/TRD), User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
SDLC/Agile: Change Request management, Defect Management, Version Control.
Documentation: Process Mapping, User Guides, Technical Data Dictionary creation.
Collaboration: Bridging communication between IT and Business stakeholders.

Compensation and Benefits:

Work term 3: 29.22$

Spring 2026 - Thursday, May 7, 2026 - Friday, August 21, 2026

Job Summary:

The Centre for Work-Integrated Learning (Centre for WIL), is part of Waterloo's Co-op and Experiential Education (CEE) portfolio. Centre for WIL fosters excellence in the pedagogy and practice of work-integrated learning (WIL) as a thought leader and key provider of curriculum, courses, and programs in this field. We proudly design and deliver high-quality online courses and programs for Waterloo students including the suite of undergraduate PD courses,the EDGE Certificate Program, the WE Accelerate program, and graduate WIL initiatives.

The eLearning Developer Assistant will play an integral role within the curriculum development team in the design and development of online learning media to support the creation and revision of our courses and programs. The eLearning Developer will be responsible for creating webpages, multimedia, learning materials, and interactive interfaces. In this position, you will apply knowledge of web development and digital design with user experience and web accessibility best practices.

Our team and department are dedicated to providing a supportive environment and dynamic work experience that will allow you to further develop existing skills and acquire new knowledge. We also encourage our student staff to identify an area for improvement or a passion project they would like to pursue during the term.

We are proud to have a diverse team of full-time staff and student staff from various backgrounds, faculties, and experiences; through various events and initiatives, we create a collaborative work environment that values both productivity and enjoyment. We care about the work we do and are committed to consistently improving our courses, programs, and student services.

The Centre for WIL is platinum certified through the University's Green Office program, and our co-op students' contributions make a significant impact toward maintaining this certification each year.

Job Responsibilities:

Create responsive course pages and custom interactions using a combination of Bootstrap, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and new e-learning technologies (e.g. Storyline) to create interactive multimedia learning materials.
Upload, organize, prepare and test content within LEARN (our Learning Management System) including conducting user testing, QA Testing and Term Prep functions
Troubleshoot interfaces and multimedia components and ensure accessibility requirements (e.g. WCAG 3.0) are met.
Complete simple post-production tasks to edit audio, video recordings, imagery and/or create new images using adobe creative cloud (e.g., Photoshop, Illustrator).
Create lo-fi prototypes and wireframes using Figma and revise these iteratively to meet requirements.
Collaborate with team members to develop and revise code using GitHub.
Support curriculum development process tasks including conducting stock imagery searches, preparing visual design boards for approval, and tracking and documenting for copyright purposes.
Bring the student lens to when providing feedback to improve processes, training enhancements, and/or when proposing new or innovative tools for the team to consider.
Apply resourcefulness and creative problem-solving skills to resolve technical problems.
Backup course development files and create documentation of work as need to support succession planning
Brainstorm concepts, share ideas, and at times create graphic depictions, to minimize written content.
Contribute to project team discussions and ensure that projects are on track to be completed on time.
Communicate with Team members in a virtual environment using Microsoft 365 tools.
Participate in meetings with various stakeholders including staff, student staff and other partners and integrate input from internal and external stakeholders as pieces evolve.
Collaborate with other Curriculum Development team co-ops to translate ideas into visual representations.
Assist with other curriculum development and Centre for WIL projects and initiatives as required.

Required Skills:

Web development experience using languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Experience developing digital media such as web design, graphic design, audio, and video editing.
Knowledge of web accessibility (e.g., WCAG 3.0), or a willingness to learn.
High attention to detail and ability to evaluate technical work for errors.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with a demonstrated ability to interpret and translate the ideas of others into meaningful interfaces.
Proven ability to quickly grasp, adapt, and advocate for the use of new technology.
Demonstrated ability to creatively brainstorm and problem-solve to achieve solutions.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively to support a team in a virtual environment.
Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time to ensure projects meet deadlines.
Continuous improvement mindset and willingness to receive and incorporate feedback.
Demonstrated ability to make decisions autonomously and identify when to proactively seek the support, opinions, ideas and expertise of others.
Ability to plan and achieve learning goals and explore how personal interests align with workplace responsibilities and goals.
Comfortable using Adobe Acrobat and Microsoft Office Suite including Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.
Experience using LEARN or other Learning Management Systems (LMS) is an asset.
Experience with prototyping, digital design, and developer tools such as GitHub, Figma, and Adobe Creative Suite is an asset.

Compensation and Benefits:

Depending on the number of work terms you have completed, salary ranges from $750-$990 per week and is based on a 35-hour work week.

Job Summary:

Job Summary:
***PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE ELGIBLE FOR THIS UK YOUTH MOBILITY SCHEME VISA***
https://www.gov.uk/youth-mobility/eligibility

***ON-SITE WORK ONLY (NO HYBRID OR REMOTE OPTIONS)***

An international company operating in over 145 countries that continues to have unparalleled growth, Randox Laboratories has been the heartbeat of the UK's National COVID Testing Programme throughout the pandemic. In early 2020 Randox recognised the threat from COVID-19 and, based on over 40 years of diagnostic experience, quickly developed a test to accurately identify the virus. Testing at scale commenced within weeks to support the UK's National Testing Programme and private clients alike.

Randox Laboratories (County Antrim) are currently seeking Agile Developers who will have the unique opportunity to work at the cutting edge of medical device research and development for a term here in the North of Ireland. The successful candidates will develop and improve the software of existing manufacturing apps as well as bespoke industrial automation systems with the key goals to be improve system reliability and consistency with robust software development execution. This role is a challenging, but also a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, to maintain and make continual improvements resulting in a more efficient automation systems and improved productivity for Randox. More about our Co-Op programme can be found here How Randox turned "mission impossible" into a win with Waterloo co-op talent | Hire Waterloo | University of Waterloo

The successful Agile Developer candidate(s) will report to the Chief Technical Officer for Systems Improvement. This exciting full-time temporary position will be based at the cutting-edge R&D Centre of Excellence - Redlands in Crumlin about 15 minutes south of Antrim - as this site is remote and generally relies on a car a company bus can provide transportation to and from this site.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities:
Our Agile Developers:
1) Develop design concepts based on User Requirements by liaising with product owner and key stakeholders.
2) Contribute to the development of Functional Requirements Specifications based on User Requirements and approved concept designs
3) Contribute to the development of Software Requirements Specifications based on User Requirements and approved concept designs
4) Working within a multi-disciplinary team, clearly communicate requirements to other team members to ensure all development and testing is co-ordinated appropriately
5) Work alongside other engineering disciplines, scientists, and Software Test Engineers to ensure designs are rigorously tested, verified and validated
6) Identify appropriately specified COTS products / software for use within a system as and when required
7) Generate and maintain technical documentation, specifically, but not limited to, code review documentation, work instructions, FMEA, BOM etc.
8) Contribute to risk analysis for products under development and released
9) Report on status of projects / designs, both orally and in written format, to direct and senior management
10) For both products under development and released products, contribute to design change when necessary, ensuring that design change is managed in a controlled way
11) Ensure all systems are designed to a high quality, ensuring compliance with appropriate internal procedures and European and International standards
12) Adherence to company Positive Work Environment policies, health & safety procedures, and the maintenance of a safe working environment

Please note that this job description is intended as a guideline - new duties and responsibilities will be incorporated as a matter of custom and practice as the role evolves

Required Skills:

Required Skills:
Agile Developers:
1) Experience of programming React / typescript front end & Python / Go backend, VScode for IDE and devOps
2) Experience of programming in an object orientated programming language such as VBA, C#, C++, Delphi
3) Experience using SQL Server or similar relational database
4) Possess excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
5) Ability to adhere to deadlines
6) Excellent team working ability
7) Be self-motivating and possess a positive attitude
8) Ability to work with large datasets
9) Desire to learn and explore new technologies and innovations
10) Experience with User Interface development and UI Design patterns such as MVVM
11) Experience designing software applications and UML modelling
12) Experience with DevOps or another source control toolset
13) Experience in all stages of a SDLC such as Agile, V-Model or Waterfall SDLC
14) Experience in Django, Flask, JavaScript, Angular or similar Web Development Frameworks

Compensation and Benefits:

If you are matched to a job outside of Canada, you may apply for international travel awards/scholarships via SAFA. Please see more information at https://uwaterloo.ca/student-awards-financial-aid/undergraduate-awards/international-experience-awards

Salary offered will be depending on experience and candidate selected and will be in in line with latest UWaterloo Salary Survey.

$21.08 - $33.64. Payable in GBP, exchange rate converted at time of offer and not adjusted for any fluctuations during work term.

£1,500 towards UK Youth Mobility Visa including Health Surcharge + £250 towards return flights

Securing housing and meals will be entirely the responsibility of the employee.

All Randox staff within the UK and Ireland can avail of Randox Health's full-body MOT Health Check, the Everyman | Everywoman at a reduced price of £125. Payment can be arranged via payroll for £25 over 5 months and for partners £35 over 5 months. Reporting on up to 150 data points, identify warning signs of poor health or illness at the earliest most preventable point and eliminate the need for treatment later. 'Prevention is better than cure' - Department Of Health & Social Care (2018)

Job Summary:

About the Role
In this Software Engineer, Co-op role, you'll join our Engineering team to support our Scrum teams working to deliver solutions to problems in an AI-first mindset. You will have the opportunity to work on problems that directly impact our customers - just like the rest of your team. We don't believe in co-op specific tasks; instead, we mentor you so that you can dive in deep, deliver high-quality software and push it to production - maybe all on the same day! This means that you will be working alongside your team to solve complex issues and make a huge impact on the healthcare ecosystem.

You will
• Design and build high-quality software in a cloud native environment (MS Azure).
• Regularly releasing your work to our Azure-backed production environment.
• Experience working with first class AI tooling - GitHub Copilot, Copilot, Azure AI Foundry, etc
• Use technology to solve real-world problems using an AI-first mindset

Work Location: This is a hybrid role, based out of our Mississauga Office.
Mississauga Location: 5570 Explorer Dr, Mississauga, ON L4W 0C4

4 Months: May 4, 2026 - August 21, 2026 (Mississauga Office)

Job Responsibilities:

What's in it for you?

Make an Impact: Work on meaningful projects that improve millions of lives in the health tech space.
Learn from the Best: Gain mentorship from passionate experts and top engineers who care about your growth.
Innovate with Cutting-Edge Tech: Build cloud-native software and leverage AI-first tools like GitHub Copilot and Azure AI Foundry.
Flexibility & Balance: Enjoy hybrid work options and a culture that blends innovation with fun through learning sessions and social events.
Connect & Grow: Join a vibrant community of interns and co-ops, with opportunities to network and collaborate.

What you'll learn at PointClickCare:
The Big Picture: How technology, data, and AI come together to transform healthcare and improve patient outcomes.
Modern Ways of Working: Experience agile, cross-functional teamwork and sharpen your collaboration, communication, and problem-solving skills.
Building at Scale: Learn to develop enterprise-level software and own cloud services; from deployment and scalability to security and disaster recovery.
AI as Your Ally: Discover how to leverage AI as a peer to innovate, solve complex problems, and become a more efficient engineer.
Future-Ready Skills: Gain knowledge that lasts beyond your co-op term - from leadership and industry insights to shaping the future of digital health.

Your Impact:
Help create software that improves the lives of seniors and care providers every day.
Be part of projects that support healthcare professionals delivering exceptional care.
Contribute your ideas and perspective - innovation starts with fresh voices.

Required Skills:

Who are we looking for?

Passionate Learners: Curious, creative students eager to kick-start their software engineering career.
Technical Foundations: Pursuing an undergrad degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field with experience in object-oriented programming and modern UI frameworks.
AI-Driven Innovators: Comfortable exploring AI tools like Generative AI and agentic code generation to solve real-world problems.
Collaborative Self-Starters: Team players who take initiative, thrive in fast-paced environments, and deliver with minimal supervision.
Strong Thinkers: Organized, critical thinkers with personal leadership skills and a drive to learn continuously.

Own Transportation Required
Security Clearance Required

Compensation Range: [$26-$32 per hour], aligned to your level, program, and term length.

Job Summary:

The Centre for Work-Integrated Learning (WIL), a unit within Waterloo's Co-operative and Experiential Education (CEE) department, proudly designs and delivers high-quality online courses and programs for Waterloo students including the suite of PD courses,the EDGE Certificate Program and the WE Accelerate program.

The Instructional Design & Writing Assistant will play an integral role within the curriculum development team in the design and development of course content through research, writing, editing, proofing, visual depiction, and integration of feedback from colleagues and stakeholders. In this position, you will also develop your voice as a writer by creating content that resonates with a student audience and enhance your attention to detail skills.

Our team and department are dedicated to providing a supportive environment and dynamic work experience that will allow you to further develop existing skills and acquire new knowledge. We also encourage our student staff to identify an area for improvement or a passion project they would like to pursue during the term.

We are proud to have a diverse team of full-time staff and student staff from various backgrounds, faculties, and experiences; through various events and initiatives, we create a collaborative work environment that values both productivity and enjoyment. We care about the work we do and are committed to consistently improving our courses, programs, and student services.

The Centre for WIL is platinum certified through the University's Green Office program, and our co-op students' contributions make a significant impact toward maintaining this certification each year.

Job Responsibilities:

Write content for a variety of online learning materials.
Review course content and make recommendations for improvement
Conduct research, summarize findings and make recommendations
Diligently proof-read and edit
Coordinate and apply input from internal and external stakeholders as pieces evolve.
Brainstorm concepts, share ideas, and at times create graphic depictions, to minimize written content.
Assist with other curriculum development and Centre for WIL projects and initiatives as required.

Required Skills:

Advanced written communication skills. Proven ability to read and evaluate written text for grammatical and typographical errors.
High attention to detail.
Research skills and academic and/or technical writing experience.
Strong organization and time management skills.
Continuous improvement mindset and willingness to receive and assess constructive feedback.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a virtual workplace.
Comfortable using Microsoft Office Suite including Word and PowerPoint.
Keen eye for visual and graphic appeal. Experience using Adobe Suite, or similar graphic design programs is an asset.
Experience using LEARN is an asset.

Compensation and Benefits:

Depending on the number of work terms you have completed, salary ranges from $670-$890 per week.

Job Summary:

Every day, our software is used by millions of people around the world, and we are looking for students who share in our excitement and passion for transforming the way the world learns. At D2L, we believe that learning should be accessible and engaging. Our goal is to create easy, flexible, and smart software that ignites the desire to learn in everyone. To do this, we need to give talented, enthusiastic, and passionate people, like you, opportunities to create, develop, and collaborate on projects that revolutionize the learning environment.

Software Test Developers at D2L are passionate about building quality, secure, high performing software. They tackle tough technical and non-technical testing challenges. You will contribute to technology that will transform teaching and learning for millions of people. Improving education for millions of people provides a rare opportunity to make a real and significant difference in the world!

What will you get out of working at D2L?

You will work on an Agile development team which includes Developers, Testers, Designers, a Product Manager, and a Development Manager
Teams can tackle any problem in any area, ensuring exposure to a variety of problems and technologies
All members of the team contribute to the definition, requirements, development, and testing of the problems we are solving
Our testers are flexible, and can adapt how they spend their time according to the needs of their team and projects

Why we're awesome

We offer our Co-ops monthly internet reimbursement and monthly co-op events. Plus, we're always hiring superstar New Grads, so get a step ahead of the rest by networking within D2L on your work term.
Check out our social media sites and follow us on Instagram, Twitter and LinkedInto learn more about why applying to D2L is a great choice.

This position is to fill an existing vacancy

Job Responsibilities:

How will you make an impact?

Take charge of your team's overall quality strategy; help the team to adapt and optimize for quality up front, rather than providing a safety net to catch failures
Leverage your strengths to help your team improve quality in various ways: perhaps you'll contribute to product code, participate in code reviews, design and write automated tests, plan and execute exploratory testing, implement reliability engineering strategies, or take on any other activities that will help your team increase confidence in what they're building
Coach other members of your team about how to approach quality-related activities, and foster a mature quality culture within the team
Be a compelling communicator of quality concerns
Bring familiarity and interest in AI tools (e.g. ChatGBT, Copilot, etc.)

Required Skills:

What is D2L looking for from me?

Your experience is important, but most of all we are looking for people who are quick to learn, passionate about what they do, and are eager to collaborate with others to create innovative products that will delight and inspire our users. In general we are looking for:

You thrive at finding defects and design issues in software during all phases of the software development process
You have a high bar for quality, software performance, and security
You create and nurture feedback loops to provide information for continuous improvement of testing
You have coding (C++, C#, Java) and/or scripting skills (JavaScript, Python, Perl, PowerShell) to enable you to read production code and contribute to test automation
You identify risks and gaps in analysis and test coverage through sound critical thinking
You design effective automation tests and contribute to automation frameworks
You collaborate effectively, helping your team to develop testable features, and identifying test tasks during design
You are passionate about our users and are their advocates in the development process
Education Recommendations

Currently completing a degree/diploma in computer science, computer engineering or similar technical discipline at a Canadian university or college.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary will be paid based on experience/number of co-op terms completed, $850 - $1350/week
Monthly home internet reimbursement up to $75
Team building activities and lunches
Opportunity to join the co-op social committee to plan fun activities, competitions and events for D2L co-op students
Monthly sessions with senior leaders to grow and develop your network, connections and skills
Network and be the first to know about new grad opportunities by getting your foot in the door!

Job Summary:

FPGA Engineering Intern (4 to 16 months available)

Location - Burlington, ON (On-site)

Looking for an internship with great learning opportunities and meaningful work?

Join our team - https://youtu.be/8wmfn9B07F0

Located in Burlington, Evertz is a worldwide leader in the design and manufacture of leading edge multimedia products for the film & television broadcast industry. Recognized as one of the top 50 best-managed companies in Canada, Evertz has gained Canadian corporate success through its vision, stakeholders' values, and excelling in the global economy. Evertz is proud to have worldwide client base that includes the largest global media and entertainment companies (e.g. Warner Bros. Discovery, Disney, NBC, Universal, Paramount, Sky, and Mediaset), sports leagues (e.g. NBA, NHL, MLB, Dorna, RBFA, and MLSZ) and other media organizations (e.g. Microsoft Studios, Amazon Studios, Apple, and YouTube).

Our employment philosophy is simple.

Hire extremely talented people, give them opportunities to make a positive impact and nurture their need for challenge and growth.

Our work philosophy is simple, too.

We emphasize teamwork, promote creativity and enjoy being at the leading edge of high-tech in our industry.

As an integral member of our hardware design team, you will contribute to the development of advanced FPGA-based systems, working with cutting-edge devices and high-speed digital logic. This role offers hands-on experience in designing, optimizing, and debugging FPGA architectures using VHDL, with applications spanning signal processing, data pipelines, and communication protocols. You will also support low-level software integration through C++ and collaborate closely with other engineers in a dynamic, feedback-rich environment. This position is ideal for someone eager to learn, solve real-world problems, and grow alongside a team of experienced engineers.

Job Responsibilities:

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Requires work in-office at our Burlington location.
Designing high-speed digital logic in VHDL:
State Machines (ex: IP packet dissection)
Signal Processing (ex: video up- and downscaling)
Data Pipelines (ex: Ethernet/IP, PCIe, DDR4/5 SDRAM, DMA, Video, Audio)
Analyzing and resolving FPGA static timing violations
Optimizing FPGA designs for speed and size
Testing and debugging FPGA designs through simulation and in-system
Writing low-level C++ code to configure and control FPGAs
Using Git for revision control
Supporting other engineers in hands-on debug

Required Skills:

APPLICABLE SKILLS:

Understand the fundamentals of digital logic design.
Some experience with programming languages (preferably C/C++).
Desire to contribute in a meaningful way to a team project.
Self-motivated to find root causes when debugging.
Eager to learn and accept feedback.

Many internships lead to full-time permanent opportunities upon graduation.

Compensation and Benefits:

In addition to a competitive salary, Evertz offers the following:

Flex start time
Work-life balance
Employee Assistance plan
Employee Support Program
Shuttle Reimbursement Program
Employee Discount Platform
Career progression and working on real projects
Casual work environment
Social events and sports teams

The successful candidate will be expected to work from D2L's HQ in Kitchener for the duration of the term

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Job Summary:

Every day, our software is used by millions of people around the world, and we are looking for students who share in our excitement and passion for transforming the way the world learns. At D2L, we believe that learning should be accessible and engaging. Our goal is to create easy, flexible, and smart software that ignites the desire to learn in everyone. To do this, we need to give talented, enthusiastic, and passionate people, like you, opportunities to create, develop, and collaborate on projects that revolutionize the learning environment.

We are looking for passionate developers to help influence and advance future versions of our Brightspace software. You'll thrive in our agile culture, where teams speak freely and collaborate to solve interesting problems, and will be constantly learning and looking for ways to innovate. If you get stuck, you can work with your assigned mentor to figure out the best way to proceed.

This position is to fill an existing vacancy.

Job Responsibilities:

What you'll get out of working at D2L

The challenges and responsibilities given, ability to learn new things, and work on meaningful product that reaches over 15 million learners daily, are just a few of the things that set D2L apart as a student employer. With an open office concept and overall work environment (not a single employee has their own office, including our CEO), we are located in the Catalyst137 building in Kitchener.
At D2L, you will have the opportunity to work with the latest technologies to build highly scalable and fault tolerant systems. On the backend, our product is built on the .NET stack, but we have a growing ecosystem of cloud-native services built on the AWS platform leveraging technologies such as Node.js, SNS, SQS, Kinesis, DynamoDB, Serverless (Lambda), etc. On the front-end we use Polymer and other web frameworks to build engaging and responsive web apps. We also build native mobile apps in Kotlin and Swift. Ultimately, we strive to use the most appropriate technologies to achieve our goal of changing the way the world learns. You don't need to know how to use these yet, we'll help you learn!

Required Skills:

What is D2L looking for from me?

You have a strong entrepreneurial drive, an enthusiastic and dedicated mindset and a thirst for a challenge. The ability to think on your feet and work successfully both in independent and team-settings is essential. At D2L, our co-ops have a voice and are able to quickly contribute to their team's objectives (we don't have "co-op projects", you'll be working on real deliverables).

Education Recommendations

Currently a candidate for Bachelor's degree or diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field with the co-op option.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary will be paid based on experience/number of co-op terms completed, $850 - $1350/week
Monthly home internet reimbursement up to $75
Team building activities and lunches
Opportunity to join the co-op social committee to plan fun activities, competitions and events for D2L co-op students
Monthly sessions with senior leaders to grow and develop your network, connections and skills

Job Summary:

About the Role
In this Software Engineer, Co-op role, you'll join our Engineering team to support our Scrum teams working to deliver solutions to problems in an AI-first mindset. You will have the opportunity to work on problems that directly impact our customers - just like the rest of your team. We don't believe in co-op specific tasks; instead, we mentor you so that you can dive in deep, deliver high-quality software and push it to production - maybe all on the same day! This means that you will be working alongside your team to solve complex issues and make a huge impact on the healthcare ecosystem.

You will
• Design and build high-quality software in a cloud native environment (MS Azure).
• Regularly releasing your work to our Azure-backed production environment.
• Experience working with first class AI tooling - GitHub Copilot, Copilot, Azure AI Foundry, etc
• Use technology to solve real-world problems using an AI-first mindset

Work Location: This is a hybrid role, based out of our Kitchener Office.
Kitchener Location: 137 Glasgow St Unit 210, Kitchener, ON N2G 4X8

4 Months: May 4, 2026 - August 21, 2026 (Kitchener Office)

Job Responsibilities:

What's in it for you?

Make an Impact: Work on meaningful projects that improve millions of lives in the health tech space.
Learn from the Best: Gain mentorship from passionate experts and top engineers who care about your growth.
Innovate with Cutting-Edge Tech: Build cloud-native software and leverage AI-first tools like GitHub Copilot and Azure AI Foundry.
Flexibility & Balance: Enjoy hybrid work options and a culture that blends innovation with fun through learning sessions and social events.
Connect & Grow: Join a vibrant community of interns and co-ops, with opportunities to network and collaborate.

What you'll learn at PointClickCare:
The Big Picture: How technology, data, and AI come together to transform healthcare and improve patient outcomes.
Modern Ways of Working: Experience agile, cross-functional teamwork and sharpen your collaboration, communication, and problem-solving skills.
Building at Scale: Learn to develop enterprise-level software and own cloud services; from deployment and scalability to security and disaster recovery.
AI as Your Ally: Discover how to leverage AI as a peer to innovate, solve complex problems, and become a more efficient engineer.
Future-Ready Skills: Gain knowledge that lasts beyond your co-op term - from leadership and industry insights to shaping the future of digital health.

Your Impact:
Help create software that improves the lives of seniors and care providers every day.
Be part of projects that support healthcare professionals delivering exceptional care.
Contribute your ideas and perspective - innovation starts with fresh voices.

Required Skills:

Who are we looking for?

Passionate Learners: Curious, creative students eager to kick-start their software engineering career.
Technical Foundations: Pursuing an undergrad degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field with experience in object-oriented programming and modern UI frameworks.
AI-Driven Innovators: Comfortable exploring AI tools like Generative AI and agentic code generation to solve real-world problems.
Collaborative Self-Starters: Team players who take initiative, thrive in fast-paced environments, and deliver with minimal supervision.
Strong Thinkers: Organized, critical thinkers with personal leadership skills and a drive to learn continuously.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required
Security Clearance Required

Salary:

Compensation Range: [$26-$32 per hour], aligned to your level, program, and term length.

Job Summary:

Hospital Profile
St. Michael's Hospital is a large teaching hospital, covering 2 million square feet in the heart of downtown Toronto. St. Michael's Hospital is an academic health sciences center founded by the Sisters of St. Joseph in 1892 to care for the sick and poor of Toronto's inner city. As downtown Toronto's adult trauma center, our hospital is a hub for neurosurgery, complex cardiac and cardiovascular care, diabetes and osteoporosis care, minimally invasive surgery and care of disadvantaged populations. We are also one of the province's major resources of care for critically ill patients.

Our relentless commitment to provide exceptional patient care, with compassion and dignity for all, is woven into the very fabric of St. Michael's and can be seen in the spirit and dedication of our people staff, leaders, physicians, researchers, educators, learners and volunteers. Together, we are privileged to be known as Toronto's Urban Angel.

St. Michael's vision is world leadership in urban health and our mission is to provide exemplary physical, emotional and spiritual care for all of our patients and their families.
Job Summary
We have an exciting opportunity for an independent self-starter, reporting to Manager, Project Engineering in the Engineering and Plant Services Department. The Engineering and Plant Services department is responsible for maintaining a physical facility that is safe, comfortable and functional for the staff, patients and visitors of the hospital as well as all construction and renovations within the facility. The department uses many state-of-the-art systems in maintenance management, building automation, security surveillance, fire alarm monitoring and utility demand.

St. Michael's Hospital is continually upgrading the facility and expanding departments. As part of this, the Project Coordinator would take on a lead role in numerous projects to help achieve St. Michael's Hospital's vision of being recognized as a world leader in urban health.

The hospital requires all employees to complete a work related health assessment by Corporate Health and Safety Services to establish your ability to perform the essential duties of the position offered and provide regular attendance.

Job Responsibilities:

As a member of the Engineering and Plant Services Team, your duties would include:

Manage various construction projects, including design, cost estimate, materials and service procurement, contract administration and site coordination.
Assist with major construction project coordination - may include consulting with architects, structural engineers, electrical engineers and mechanical engineers.
Act as a liaison between internal clients (Doctors, Nurses, etc.) and external contractors.
Ensure high customer satisfaction among internal and external clients through proper communication and execution of projects.
May be assigned to lead or support climate resilience work and sustainability initiatives

Required Skills:

Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously with competing priorities.
Knowledge of building systems and equipment and preferable some knowledge of hospital equipment.
Excellent communication and organization skills.
Critical thinking and problem solving skills.
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salaries will be discussed during the interview period.

Our goal is to work with students to enhance their skillsets and professional development through motivation and teamwork through a wide range of projects. Job Summary:

In this Process Engineer, Co-op role, you'll join the Service Delivery Management team within SaaS Engineering & Operations. You'll collaborate closely with our Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) and Software Engineering teams to revolutionize our service delivery processes. Your role is pivotal in enhancing efficiency and ensuring the highest quality in our SaaS offerings, directly impacting the success and satisfaction of our users.

Embracing modern Agile methodologies, DevOps practices, and the principles of SRE, you'll help transform traditional IT service management into a streamlined, automated powerhouse. You'll engage in incident prevention and rapid response strategies, drive IT change management with automated workflows, optimize cloud expenditures through FinOps, and contribute to capacity planning and business continuity-all crucial for delivering exceptional SaaS solutions in today's fast-paced tech landscape.

Work Location: This is a hybrid role, based out of our Mississauga Office
Work Term Length:

Work Term: 4 months
Planned Start Date: May 4, 2026
Planned End Date: August 21, 2026

Role Eligibility:
Please note that if you are a co-op student that requires a final term co-op in your final academic term, we can consider you for this role.
If you are a co-op student, please apply as you normally would.
If you have graduated or are graduating, feel free to apply to the 4-month role, performance pending, after the 4 months you may receive a full-time offer.

Job Responsibilities:

What's in it for you?

Innovate and Implement Best Practices: Identify, document, and champion cutting-edge best practices in SaaS service delivery, encouraging modern culture, practice and technology
Drive Automation Initiatives: Collaborate on gathering requirements and defining user stories to build automations and integrations
Analyze and Optimize with Data: Utilize advanced analytics to assess process performance, extract actionable insights, and spearhead continuous improvement opportunities.
Lead Cultural Transformation:?Influence and guide engineering teams toward adopting emerging best practices, fostering a culture of innovation, agility, and excellence.
What you'll learn at PointClickCare:
How technology, data, and AI come together to improve healthcare outcomes.
What it means to work in an agile, cross-functional team environment.
How to collaborate, communicate, and problem-solve like a pro.
Skills that go beyond your co-op term - from industry knowledge to leadership and innovation.
A peek into the future of digital health (and how you can help shape it).
Your Impact:
Help create software that improves the lives of seniors and care providers every day.
Be part of projects that support healthcare professionals delivering exceptional care.
Contribute your ideas and perspective - innovation starts with fresh voices.

Required Skills:

Who are we looking for?

Educational Background: Currently a 3rd or 4th year student, enrolled in a degree program in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, Business, or a related field.
Technical Proficiency: Experience with programming and scripting languages such as Python, Go, or Bash.
Process Modeling Skills: Familiarity with process modeling techniques and tools like BPMN, UML, or workflow automation platforms.
Foundational Engineering Knowledge: Exposure to systems or software engineering concepts; experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is highly advantageous.
Methodological Familiarity: Understanding of Agile Software Development, DevOps, SRE, FinOps, Lean practices.

Nice to Haves:
Agile and Product/Project Management Acumen: Experience with Lean/Agile principles, product development cycles, product or project management principles.
Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: Exceptional ability to conduct root cause analysis and devise innovative solutions. A passion for process improvement and efficiency.
Communication and Collaboration: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a strong ability to work collaboratively within cross-functional and remote teams.
Passion for Technology: A keen interest in emerging technology

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary:

Compensation: [$25 per hour], aligned to your level, program, and term length.
This is a paid co-op/internship position.

Founded in 1973, RGA celebrates its 50th anniversary in 2023.
RGA's culture stresses high performance and collaboration, and the company hires the smartest people in the industry. RGA values creativity and curiosity. Job Summary:

At Astera Labs, we seek motivated SI/PI and System Validation Engineers to work on our game-changing portfolio of connectivity products for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning applications.

Job Responsibilities:

In this role, you will execute the SI planning, design, modeling, simulation, and lab validation with various system configurations.
You will also formulate a comprehensive system validation plan and design experiments to root cause unexpected behavior, report results and specification compliance.

Required Skills:

Basic Qualifications:

Pursuing a bachelor's in electrical engineering
Strong background in electrical engineering
Self-starting, strong initiative, and can-do attitude.

Preferred Experience:
Familiar with SI and PI design challenges for high-speed interconnects
Hardware product design experience in networking, compute, or RF.
2D and 3D simulation experience with Cadence/Mentor/Ansys/ADS/etc. toolsets
EM modeling of connector structures
High-speed SERDES measurement, channel simulation, and equalization
Working knowledge of PCB fabrication limits and trade-offs
PI experience a bonus.
Working knowledge of key, high-speed design blocks such as PLLs, DFE, Tx EQ
Experience in system testing, characterization, margin analysis, and optimization of high-speed PCIe/CXL data links over long and short channels
In-depth understanding of DDR 4/5 protocols and JEDEC Standard.
Strong debugging, analysis, and problem-solving skills with experience leading root cause and correction action teams. An inherent sense of urgency and accountability. Must have the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.

Job Summary:

As a First Year Engineering Tutor, you will be involved in creating an environment in which students are comfortable seeking help/guidance related to their academic subjects, student life or work term concerns.
First year engineering tutors provide instructional support to a range of first year courses, this job would focus on providing academic and administrative support for the 1B circuit analysis course offered to ECE and SE students. This includes supporting students in their labs and tutorials, and providing extra help to individuals, small groups, and entire classes. This is a good position for anyone interested in teaching or pursuing graduate studies in the future.

Job Responsibilities:

Course Duties

Tutor students in Electric Circuits (ECE 140)
Facilitate the delivery of ECE 140 Labs
Meet deadlines and work requirements set by the Engineering Instructional Support Coordinators
Design and deliver material for help sessions
Hold occasional extra help sessions and exam help sessions
Proctor exams (various courses)

General Duties
Participate in weekly mandatory training sessions.
Run class representative elections, post schedules etc.
Perform other duties as assigned by the Engineering Undergraduate Office.

Required Skills:

Must be an intermediate or senior engineering student.
Must possess a good background in electromagnetism and electric circuit theory.
Have strong interest in teaching
Have strong verbal and written professional-communication skills.
Able to model good time management.
Prior work experience with analog circuits and/or common lab equipment (function generators, oscilloscopes, etc.) preferred.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary*:

WT	Monthly ($)
WT 1	3360.00
WT 2	3430.00
WT 3	3500.00
WT 4	3570.00
WT 5	3640.00
WT 6	3710.00
*Flexible hours required
Develop professional communication, active listening, question forming, and explanatory skills.
Develop your ability to effectively work in a team, while strengthening your organizational and time management skills by managing multiple tasks.
Learn to teach and engage students with different learning styles, personalities, and motivations.
Receive coaching from an Engineering Instructional Support Coordinator to work towards personal and professional goals.
Further develop your skills with analog circuits and especially lab testing equipment.
Develop troubleshooting skills.

Job Summary:

Spring 2026 - May 11 to August 21, 2026

Join a team that is changing millions of lives.
Transforming smiles. Transforming lives. Transforming an industry.

At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person's life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever's next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

Align Technology is seeking a talented and innovative Machine Learning Engineer Co-op student. We are excited to offer students opportunities that can launch big careers. With a global reach beyond 1 million consumers, we're the team that's changing lives and making the world a better place through more smiles. We view interns as essential to the ongoing growth and innovation of our company.

Job Responsibilities:

What kinds of roles are Co-op candidates hired into?
As a co-op student in one of our Machine Learning Engineer groups, you'll work on projects essential to the future of our organization. These projects are designed to provide rich, real-world experience as a window into each career field. Machine Learning Engineers are available in a variety of groups, including:

Model Development & Training: Work on developing and training machine learning models to solve complex problems. Responsibilities include feature engineering, data pipeline development, model experimentation, and optimizing model performance.
Model Validation & Evaluation: Focus on ensuring machine learning models meet quality and performance standards. This includes developing evaluation metrics, testing model accuracy and reliability, and validating models against real-world data.
ML Infrastructure & Deployment: Support the deployment and optimization of machine learning models. Work on building scalable data pipelines, model deployment workflows, and infrastructure that enables efficient ML operations.
Our recruitment team will assess where you may be the best fit based on your CV and the preferences you indicate during the application process.

How long is the program?
Our co-op program starts in May 2026 and runs through August 2026. You'll contribute to challenging projects with high impact during this 12-week paid co-op program.

Role Expectations:
Be agile, accountable, and customer-centric - These are the values we are built on!
Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced environment
Grow with the support of your team and help others grow by providing meaningful insights and feedback
Build relationships and deliver measurable results within your department
Be given opportunities for tangential learning
Perform additional responsibilities based on the specific role or group

Required Skills:

What we're looking for:

Must be currently enrolled at an accredited college or university pursuing a bachelor's degree with at least one quarter/semester to complete after co-op.
Must be available to work full time during the summer months (May-August)
This position is in the Toronto office and requires in-person attendance at the office 5 days a week from May-August 2026 **Relocation assistance is not provided*.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to work in a team environment
Detail-oriented and well-organized with great time management skills
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to tackle novel challenges that don't have established solutions
Complimentary skills:
Involved inside and outside of the classroom
Strong desire to expand skillset and experience
Experience with machine learning projects or coursework
Knowledge of linear algebra, analytical geometry, or theory of algorithms
Familiarity with data pipelines and feature engineering
Understanding of 3D geometry
Exposure to reinforcement learning concepts
Ability to assess and review code written by others

Transportation and Housing:

Align Technology does not provide any transportation or housing support

Working at 100 Queens Quay East

Key Amenities:

Complimentary Shuttle Service: A convenient shuttle bus is available to help employees commute with ease, connecting key transit points to the building.
Secure Bike Room: For those who cycle to work, the building provides a secure, card-access bike storage facility located on the East Mezzanine level. This space includes bike racks and lockers, ensuring your equipment stays safe.

Compensation and Benefits:

$30-32/HR - no benefits

Job Summary:

About Tegus by AlphaSense:
The world's most sophisticated companies rely on Tegus by AlphaSense to remove uncertainty from decision-making. With market intelligence and search built on proven AI, Tegus by AlphaSense delivers insights that matter from content you can trust. Our universe of public and private content includes equity research, company filings, event transcripts, expert calls, news, trade journals, and clients' own research content.

The acquisition of Tegus by AlphaSense in 2024 advances our shared mission to empower professionals to make smarter decisions through AI-driven market intelligence. Together, AlphaSense and Tegus will accelerate growth, innovation, and content expansion, with complementary product and content capabilities that enable users to unearth even more comprehensive insights from thousands of content sets.

Our platform is trusted by over 4,000 enterprise customers, including a majority of the S&P 500. Founded in 2011, AlphaSense is headquartered in New York City with more than 1,500 employees across the globe and offices in the U.S., U.K., Finland, India, Singapore, Canada, and Ireland. Come join us!

About Our Team:
Our Engineering organization is part of the well-established core of the business and we're growing at pace with the needs of our internal and external clients. Growth in our Engineering organization means opportunity for career development - we'll help you get there, and won't hold you back. It's important to us that we maintain focus on our goals, work well together and look forward to engaging with our work and team everyday. There are regularly scheduled learning opportunities (like software and finance related reading groups, and market recaps from senior analysts) and social events (like coffee in the afternoon, and snacks in the evening) to keep things interesting. It's commonplace for people to host demo presentations inside Engineering, and some that the rest of the company enjoys too (show off stuff you've built or learn about businesses that analysts have researched), which are good opportunities to learn and practice new skills. We highly value mentorship and coaching and work hard to support every member of our team with what they need to be successful.

We're looking for motivated co-op students who have a strong foundation in Computing Sciences or a related degree, and are eager to be challenged working on a variety of problems in support of our internal and external users. Be prepared to engage with web applications or APIs (third-party and internal) and Windows desktop environments.

Job Responsibilities:

Some of the things you might do will include:

Software development in C# or Python.
Learn about some common development tools and skills, such as git source control management, integrated development environments or code editors, Continuous Integration and Delivery platforms, effective code review practices and code release ownership
Work on internal or client-facing Web applications with an API or graphic user interface
Work on internal or client-facing Microsoft Excel-related tools
Contribute to team growth and culture

Required Skills:

Your background includes:

2 or more years of Undergrad experience toward a Computing Science or related degree
Working knowledge of at least one Object Oriented Programming language (we use Python and C#)
A history of being organized and working collaboratively toward a common goal
Excellent spoken and written communication skills
It would be great if you had:
Knowledge of Finance, Financial Technology, or Equity Markets
Advanced knowledge of, and experience with, Microsoft Excel

Compensation and Benefits:

$4,000/month CAD

Job Summary:

RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT (R&D) SUPPORT (temporary, full time).

Job id: 005.

Position title: Research and Development (R&D) support. (Temporary, January 2026 onwards or ASAP.).
Responsible to: The chief scientific officer (Dr SR Kharche).


Company description.
MVT in Silico Corp (MVTiS), is a life sciences company located in London Canada. We are a deep technology company in search of life saving medical treatments using its new ways of deploying non-animal methods which include proprietary physics driven software (CM&S), R&D devices, and experimental development. See: https://www.mvtinsilico.ca for more information.


Position purpose.
The Research and Development (R&D) position will assist the project lead to implement prototypes of hardware devices & science software for validation readiness.

Job Responsibilities:

Duties and responsibilities.

Assist and eventually lead a project within the term of the contract.
Programming in C, Python in a Unix/Linux environment.
CAD modelling.
Assist data collection for knowledgebases.
Perform literature & market research for the assigned projects.
Code & business documentation.
Regular biweekly (twice each week) written reporting as part of laboratory notebook entries.

Required Skills:

Qualifications and essential skills.
• Advanced (4th year) undergraduate or graduate (1st/2nd year Master) in a STEM subject with excellent numeracy skills is essential.
• Ability to organize external and internal scientific/engineering data.
• Knowledge of programming languages such as C, Python.
• Knowledge of Linux operating systems.

Additional Information:

Other	Must have permission to work.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation. This position will be compensated at market rates (between $18 to $23 per hour) at FTE (35 hours per week) commensurate with the candidate's skills. The start date will be negotiated. Applicants will be supported in their Mitacs (e.g., Business Strategy Internship), BioTalent and similar scholarship applications. Employment is not contingent on the outcome of the scholarship applications.

Working conditions.
Standard workweek is 35 hours (FTE).
Standard hours per workday are 7 hours.

High pressure due to work volume, numerous competing demands, time sensitive schedules, dynamic priorities, regular interruptions and an overall fast pace.
Sitting, sometimes for long periods with occasional walking and standing.
Exposure to computer screens, sometimes for long periods.
Adherence to all health and safety procedures, policies and legislation at all times.
Adherence to quality procedures, policies and standards at all times.


Application and selection process.

Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position: applicants should send their cover letters, detailed CVs, list of referees, and a one page statement of how they will perform duties. The three part selection process entails an interview, a take home exercise, followed by a second interview & documents verification. You should send your applications to Dr. SR Kharche at sumus@mvtinsilico.ca.

Only those applicants that suit the role at each stage will be contacted for progression to the next stage. In accordance with our company policy, employment is conditional upon the receipt of all necessary documentation.

As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, MVTiS fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other and live the MVTiS values to continue advancing science to serve the therapeutics industry. Together, we compete in the fight against serious disease.

MVTiS is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Job Summary:

About Huawei
With 194,000 employees and operating in more than 170 countries and regions, Huawei is a leading global creator and provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. Integrated solutions span across four key domains - telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services. Huawei is committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

About Huawei Canada
Huawei Canada focuses on fundamental research and development aimed at solving complex technical problems in emerging technologies like 5G, AI, Human Computer Interaction and Autonomous Driving. With ongoing research initiatives with 10 Universities across Canada and strategic collaboration agreements with several Universities, we support Canada's rich research community. In 2020, Huawei Canada ranked among the Top 20 corporate R&D investors in the country with a huge 40% increase in R&D investment year over year. Huawei Canada was established in 2008 and now has a total workforce of 1,200 in our six research

About the team
The Human-Machine Interaction Lab unites global talents to redefine the relationship between humans and technology. Focused on innovation and user-centered design, the lab strives to advance human-computer interaction research. Our team includes researchers, engineers, and designers collaborating across disciplines to develop novel interactive systems, sensing technologies, wearable and IoT systems, human factors, computer vision, and multimodal interfaces. Through high-impact products and cutting-edge research, we aim to enhance user experiences and interactions with technology.

Job Summary:

This employer is an Employer Impact Awards (EIA) winner for Student Experience.

The Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (OICR) is seeking a candidate with strong bioinformatics, biostatistical and software development experience to join the Diagnostic Development program. The program focuses on advancing personalized medicine approaches to maximize the chances of positive outcomes for those experiencing cancer. Our team includes internationally recognized experts in biomarker discovery and validation and actively works with diagnostics industry and biotech companies. Our current work includes the use of next generation sequencing (DNA and RNA), spatial proteomic and transcriptional data to discover biomarkers that stratify risk in early cancers including breast and prostate cancer, and the development of the methods needed to translate those biomarkers into the clinical laboratory. Working under the direction of the senior staff you will have the opportunity to work with large datasets to address problems that have direct impact on clinical needs and patient care.

OICR is a collaborative, not-for-profit research institute accelerating the development of new cancer research discoveries for patients around the world while maximizing the economic benefit of this research for the people of Ontario. We are dedicated professionals who bring expertise to each of our roles. We are looking for individuals who share our values of excellence, innovation, collaboration, impact, responsibility and community.

Learn more about working at OICR here.

Job Responsibilities:

- Perform advanced bioinformatic analysis on diverse data sets, including, genome and transcriptome sequencing data, spatial biology data
- Implementing and applying algorithms for the analysis of NanoString-based gene expression and traditional next generation sequencing data;
- Automating data analysis and reporting tasks;
- Integrate diverse datasets in multiple platforms and conduct unified meta analyses;
- Perform downstream data analysis, including visualization, pathway, drug response analyses and clinical association studies.

Required Skills:

· R programming experience is required;
· Knowledge of basic statistical tests is required;
· Linux experience, cluster computing experience is required;
· Shell scripting and an understanding of software engineering principles is an asset;
· Exposure to molecular biology and/or sequencing data is an asset;
· Knowledge of basic concepts in molecular biology is an asset.

Compensation and Benefits:

OICR is an Employer Impact Awards (EIA) winner for Student Experience. OICR pays according to the average of the department and work term the student is positioned in, plus an inflation adjustment. As a temporary employee, you will receive 4% in lieu of vacation.

Job Summary:

At GPTZero, we ensure that machine learning models are created for the benefit of humanity, not the other way around.

In this role, you'll build the next-gen platform to verify the origin, quality, and factuality of the world's information. The ideal candidate is someone who has a history of ML research, possesses a great product sense, and is also an excellent software engineer. You'll be working on a fast-paced team of passionate builders, creating industry-defining software that has attracted over 9M users globally. Past intern projects have been the focus of demos to VCs and state-level policy leaders.

GPTZero is the world's leading platform for verifying the origin, quality, and factuality of the world's information. GPTZero has been used by over 9M people around the world and is depended on by thousands of consumer and enterprise customers. We've been covered on the front page of the NYT, BBC, WSJ, WaPo, Fox, NPR, and CNN.

We have raised $13.5M to date, from top VCs including Footwork VC, Reach Capital, Uncork Capital and Neo. Our $10M series A was on the front page of Techcrunch, and also included angel investments by Sam Altman, the former CEOs of NYT, BBC, and Reuters, as well as other unicorn CEOs. We're solving novel, challenging problems in NLP and ML, and deploying cutting-edge solutions to detect the origin and veracity of the information on the web.

We've built a team from Meta, Uber, Microsoft, Affirm, Bloomberg, and Robinhood, as well as AI research labs from Princeton, Vector, MILA, Waterloo, and Caltech. To continue our rapid growth, we're looking for people who are passionate about this mission to join us!

Who you'll be joining
You will be working directly with

Alex (our CTO) R&D at Uber self-driving division and Facebook, 3 patents in ML
George (our AI research lead) PhD from University of Toronto and ex-AWS research.
Olivia (our head of design) on translating your research into outputs for millions of users.
Edward (our CEO, ex-Bellingcat, Microsoft, BBC investigative journalism) to craft the messages we send to our community, and shape the GPTZero brand.
Jacob (full stack engineer, SYDE at Waterloo, ex-Lime, ex-Affirm) as an engineering mentor
Additionally, you will be working with an experienced (eg. ex-Google, Meta, Microsoft, Uber, Vector, MILA), diverse (eg. an engineering team with both Y-combinator and Obama scholarship recipients, a designer with art featured in the Met), and driven (eg. an operator who has scaled a company to 100M+ revenue and is committed to doing it again) group of individuals, described by one investor as one of the strongest founding teams seen in their career.

Together, we are committed to making a permanent impact on the future of writing, and on humanity.

Our Angels and Advisors
Tom Glocer (Legendary Reuters CEO)
Mark Thompson (Legendary NYT CEO and current CNN chief executive)
Jack Altman (CEO of Lattice, brother of Sam Altman)
Karthik Narasimhan (Princeton NLP Professor, co-author of OpenAI's original GPT paper)
Emad Mostaque (CEO of Stability AI)
Doug Herrington (CEO of Worldwide Amazon Stores)
Brad Smith (President of Microsoft)
Tripp Jones (Partner at Uncork Capital)
Ali Partovi (co-founder of Code.org, early investor in Dropbox and Airbnb)
Russ Heddleston (CEO of Docsend)
Alex Mashrabov (Snapchat, Director of AI)
Faizan Mehdi (Affinity, Director of Demand Generation)

Build and deploy high-impact, intuitive, AI-driven web apps in React, Node, and Tailwind
Develop top-requested features from our users on our dashboard, chrome extensions, and API
Utilize product analytics to make data-driven product decisions

Wear multiple hats and work across the product stack

Job Summary:

The Instructional Support Group (ISG) at the Cheriton School of Computer Science is seeking an enthusiastic and dependable person to assume a valuable role as an Instructional Support Assistant (ISA) in CS 136(L). As a member of the course staff, ISAs report to the Instructional Support Coordinator (ISC) and work with and support the instructional staff, Instructional Apprentices (IAs), Teaching Assistants (TAs), and the students in the course.

You can read more about the impact of working as an ISA on Co-operative Education's feature about the ISG.

CS 136 builds on the techniques and patterns learned in CS 135 while making the transition to use an imperative language. It introduces the design and analysis of algorithms, the management of information, and the programming mechanisms and methodologies required in implementations. Topics discussed include iterative and recursive sorting algorithms; lists, stacks, queues, trees, and their application; abstract data types and their implementations.

CS 136L introduces students to tools and techniques useful in the software development lifecycle. Students learn to navigate and leverage commands and utilities in the Linux Command Line Shell. Students gain experience in version control software, writing scripts to automate tasks, and creating effective test cases to identify bugs. Tracing and debugging strategies are discussed. Students also gain experience in using built-in support for version control, testing, debugging, build automation, etc. in integrated development environments (IDEs).

Job Responsibilities:

ISAs are asked to provide course support in numerous areas, including serving as the primary contact for students; holding consultation/office hours; preparing assignments, including the development of grading schemes and automated grading scripts; providing feedback to students through the grading of assignments; assisting in laboratory sessions or presenting tutorial sessions; and exam proctoring and grading.

Required Skills:

Successfully completed three university-level Computer Science courses including CS 136/146 and successful completion of CS 136L
Experience with writing programs in Scheme and C.
Experience with working in Linux Command Line Shell and writing scripts in Bash.
Communication skills, critical thinking, and the ability to successfully interact with a wide range of people will be crucial.

Compensation and Benefits:

Monthly range of $3060-$4420.

Salaries are based on education level, work term experience, and number of previous work terms with the ISG at the time of applying.

Calculations (voltage drop, grounding, lighting, etc.)

Previous co-op or work experience in control systems or electrical and power engineering design and execution will be considered an asset.
Technical experience with electrical design calculations, power system modeling tools and software, ability to use data-centric design tools, and proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (SharePoint, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) will be preferred.

Job Summary:

At GPTZero, we ensure that machine learning models are created for the benefit of humanity, not the other way around.

In this role, you'll build the next-gen platform to verify the origin, quality, and factuality of the world's information. The ideal candidate is someone who has a history of ML research, possesses a great product sense, and is also an excellent software engineer. You'll be working on a fast-paced team of passionate builders, creating industry-defining software that has attracted over 9M users globally. Past intern projects have been the focus of demos to VCs and state-level policy leaders.

GPTZero is the world's leading platform for verifying the origin, quality, and factuality of the world's information. GPTZero has been used by over 9M people around the world and is depended on by thousands of consumer and enterprise customers. We've been covered on the front page of the NYT, BBC, WSJ, WaPo, Fox, NPR, and CNN.

We have raised $13.5M to date, from top VCs including Footwork VC, Reach Capital, Uncork Capital and Neo. Our $10M series A was on the front page of Techcrunch, and also included angel investments by Sam Altman, the former CEOs of NYT, BBC, and Reuters, as well as other unicorn CEOs. We're solving novel, challenging problems in NLP and ML, and deploying cutting-edge solutions to detect the origin and veracity of the information on the web.

We've built a team from Meta, Uber, Microsoft, Affirm, Bloomberg, and Robinhood, as well as AI research labs from Princeton, Vector, MILA, Waterloo, and Caltech. To continue our rapid growth, we're looking for people who are passionate about this mission to join us!

Who you'll be joining
You will be working directly with

Alex (our CTO) R&D at Uber self-driving division and Facebook, 3 patents in ML
George (our AI research lead) PhD from University of Toronto and ex-AWS research.
Olivia (our head of design) on translating your research into outputs for millions of users.
Edward (our CEO, ex-Bellingcat, Microsoft, BBC investigative journalism) to craft the messages we send to our community, and shape the GPTZero brand.
Jacob (full stack engineer, SYDE at Waterloo, ex-Lime, ex-Affirm) as an engineering mentor
Additionally, you will be working with an experienced (eg. ex-Google, Meta, Microsoft, Uber, Vector, MILA), diverse (eg. an engineering team with both Y-combinator and Obama scholarship recipients, a designer with art featured in the Met), and driven (eg. an operator who has scaled a company to 100M+ revenue and is committed to doing it again) group of individuals, described by one investor as one of the strongest founding teams seen in their career.

Together, we are committed to making a permanent impact on the future of writing, and on humanity.

Our Angels and Advisors
Tom Glocer (Legendary Reuters CEO)
Mark Thompson (Legendary NYT CEO and current CNN chief executive)
Jack Altman (CEO of Lattice, brother of Sam Altman)
Karthik Narasimhan (Princeton NLP Professor, co-author of OpenAI's original GPT paper)
Emad Mostaque (CEO of Stability AI)
Doug Herrington (CEO of Worldwide Amazon Stores)
Brad Smith (President of Microsoft)
Tripp Jones (Partner at Uncork Capital)
Ali Partovi (co-founder of Code.org, early investor in Dropbox and Airbnb)
Russ Heddleston (CEO of Docsend)
Alex Mashrabov (Snapchat, Director of AI)
Faizan Mehdi (Affinity, Director of Demand Generation)

Job Responsibilities:

Responsibilities

Build and deploy high-impact, intuitive, AI-driven web apps in React, Node, and Tailwind
Develop top-requested features from our users on our dashboard, chrome extensions, and API
Utilize product analytics to make data-driven product decisions
Collaborate with our ML, design, and business teams to develop new product initiatives
Wear multiple hats and work across the product stack

Required Skills:


Qualifications

Comfortable building end-to-end experiences from backend to CSS
+2 years of experience with modern web frameworks (Express, Next.js, Typescript, and React)
+2 years of experience with databases (PostgreSQL, AWS RDS)
Highly motivated to make positive societal impact
Bonus:
strong open-source portfolio
experience working in an early-stage startup environment
experience as a peer-edited writer

Compensation and Benefits:

Our benefits

Competitive salary 10,500 USD/month
