territories in what is now known as Canada. We recognize that Indigenous Peoples have been the caretakers of this land since time immemorial, nurturing its resources and preserving its natural beauty. We acknowledge this land is still home to many First Nations, Inuit, and Métis Peoples, who continue to maintain their deep connection to the land and its sacred teachings. We humbly acknowledge that we are all Treaty people, and we commit to fostering a relationship of respect, collaboration, and stewardship with Indigenous communities in our shared goal of reconciliation and environmental sustainability.

Job Responsibilities:

As a Software Engineering intern in the Strategy, Risk & Transactions (SR&T) Innovation Centre of Excellence, you will focus primarily on designing, building, and deploying software solutions, while also gaining exposure to other aspects of the software development lifecycle such as analysis, testing, and project coordination.

As an intern on our team, you will:

Build and deploy GenAI solutions-including RAG workflows, intelligent agents, and dashboards
Integrate advanced AI capabilities such as document understanding, image analysis, and conversational agents to address business needs.
Participate in prototyping, testing, and optimizing AI-powered applications on the Azure platform.

Required Skills:

We are seeking candidates who have demonstrated exceptional performance in Computer Science, Engineering and/or Math majors who possess the following capabilities:

Strong academic performance (minimum 75% overall average) and at least one completed internship, graduating 2026 or later
Hands-on experience or strong interest in building GenAI solutions (e.g., RAG, agents, workflows) using Microsoft Azure services such as OpenAI, Azure AI Vision, Azure AI Document Intelligence, and Azure AI Search
Proficiency in developing cloud-based applications and integrating AI services with Python (backend) and/or React (frontend)
Experience with SQL databases in cloud environments, especially Azure SQL
Familiarity with deploying, managing, and optimizing AI models and data pipelines on Azure
Analytical, innovative mindset with a passion for emerging technologies
Strong knowledge of Microsoft products (Power Platform, Power BI, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, etc.)
Experience in business requirements gathering, systems analysis, project coordination, and software testing
Collaborative, adaptable, and action-oriented with leadership potential

Compensation and Benefits:

The salary range for this position is $40,000 - $60,000 and individuals may be eligible to participate in our bonus program. Deloitte is fair and competitive when it comes to the salaries of our people. We regularly benchmark across a variety of positions, industries, sectors, targets, and levels. Our approach is grounded on recognizing people's unique strengths and contributions and rewarding the value that they deliver.

Our Total Rewards Package extends well beyond traditional compensation and benefit programs and is designed to recognize employee contributions, encourage personal wellness, and support firm growth. Along with a competitive base salary and variable pay opportunities, we offer a wide array of initiatives that differentiate us as a people-first organization. On top of our regular 15 paid vacation days for new grads, some examples include: $4,000 per year for mental health support benefits, a $1,300 flexible benefit spending account, firm-wide closures known as "Deloitte Days", dedicated days of for learning (known as Development and Innovation Days), flexible work arrangements and a hybrid work structure

Job Summary:

At Index Exchange, we're reinventing how digital advertising works-at scale. As a global advertising supply-side platform, we empower the world's leading media owners and marketers to thrive in a programmatic, privacy-first ecosystem.
We're a proud industry pioneer with over 20 years of experience accelerating the ad technology evolution. Our proprietary tech is trusted by some of the world's largest brands and media owners and plays a crucial role in keeping the internet open, accessible, and largely free.
We process more than 550 billion real-time auctions every day (in comparison, Google processes 8.5 billion searches per day) with ultra-low latency. Our platform is vertically integrated from servers to networks and runs primarily on our own metal and cloud infrastructure. This end-to-end infrastructure is designed to provide both stability and agility, enabling us to adapt quickly as the market evolves.
At the core of it all is our engineering-first culture. Our engineers tackle internet-scale problems across tight-knit, global teams. From moving petabytes of data and optimizing with AI to making real-time infrastructure decisions, Indexers have the agency and influence to shape the future of advertising. We move fast, build thoughtfully, and stay grounded in our core values.

Job Responsibilities:

What We're Looking For:
Team Player: You will work in an agile team to help accomplish the team's goals while interacting with other teams. How do you work with others to find the best solution?
Curiosity: Do you enjoy asking questions, learning, and creating solutions?
Problem Solvers: You don't stop until the problem gets solved, and you find more than one way to solve it. What problem have you solved recently?
Passion: You love tech and top-notch code, and plan to make it better. What tech are you passionate about?
Knowledge Hungry: Learning new systems, designs, patterns and languages is exciting to you. Which elegant design do you admire?
Well-rounded: Love to learn about the business domain as much as you love technology. What business excites you?
Driven: You are looking to grow your career quickly and to support those around you while you do it. Do you have what it takes?

Here's What You'll be Doing:

Solve challenging problems in a high-scale, low-latency environment
Develop our foundational platform that enables other engineers to build upon
Provide standards, templates
Experiment with new technologies
Contribute to code reviews, testing and deployments into our containerized environment
Participate in agile ceremonies
Opportunities to work with Golang, K8S, Ansible, Grafana and Kafka

Required Skills:

Here's What You Need:

Currently enrolled in a BSc/MSc in Computer Science or a related field/equivalent degree
You are talented, a fast learner and embrace change
Exceptional problem-solving skills, the ability to think differently, and an understanding that compromise, negotiation and practicality are important qualities
Self-motivated with a go-getter attitude
Proficiency in Golang, Python, Java, Scala or other high-level languages
A good grasp of SQL and NoSQL databases
Basic fluency using Linux/Unix command line
The ability to push our product to the max, inspire those around you and have fun doing it
A desire to work with and learn from the people around you - we greatly value people and interactions
Team player, receptive to feedback and learn by doing
Why You'll Love Working Here:
Mental health first aid program that provides an in-the-moment point of contact and reassurance
Bi-weekly town halls and regular community-led team events
Multiple resources and programming to support continuous learning
A workplace that supports a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment - learn more here
Equal employment opportunity

At Index Exchange, we believe that successful products are built by teams just as diverse as the audience who uses them. As such, we are committed to equal employment opportunities. We celebrate diversity of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Additionally, we realize that diversity is deeper than any status or classification-diversity is the human experience. For those who show grit, passion, and humility-Index will welcome you.
Accessibility for applicants with disabilities

Index Exchange welcomes and encourages individuals with disabilities to apply to work with us.
If you require an accommodation, please share the details of your request and any information how we can assist you with the hiring recruiter when they contact you. Index Exchange will make reasonable efforts to ensure accommodation requests are met throughout the recruitment process.

Index Everywhere, Index Anywhere
Our corporate headquarters are in Toronto, with major offices in New York, Montreal, Kitchener, London, San Francisco, and many other global cities. As a major global advertising exchange, we are committed to operating as a tightly knit global team and embracing and empowering talent wherever our colleagues may be.

#LI-ONSITE

$34/hr based on experience and skill set

Job Summary:

About AXIBO
AXIBO is a robotics company building world-class robotic systems, from concept to production, all in-house. Our multidisciplinary team designs, prototypes, tests, and manufactures both the hardware and software that power our products. From mechanical actuation to embedded firmware and advanced AI, we're pushing the limits of robotics with innovative, tightly integrated systems.
We value curiosity, ownership, and execution. We're looking for passionate developers who want to work across the full robotics stack and thrive in a fast-paced, hands-on engineering environment.

We are hiring a General Robotics Developer Intern to join our engineering team. This role is ideal for experienced developers comfortable writing high-performance software in C++, Python, and C, with experience building multi-nodal, real-time systems. You will work on everything from hardware control loops to high-level coordination software across distributed robotic systems.

Job Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain software in C++, C, and Python for real-time control, coordination, and telemetry across robotic systems
Architect and implement multi-nodal codebases that manage communications between robotic components, edge processors, and control dashboards
Design robust inter-process communication using protocols like ZeroMQ, DDS or custom WebSocket layers
Integrate sensors (IMUs, encoders, vision) and actuators with real-time safety and performance constraints
Contribute to simulation, calibration, and testing infrastructure for validating new algorithms and hardware
Collaborate with embedded engineers and mechanical designers to ensure seamless system integration
Contribute to continuous integration pipelines and debugging/testing frameworks
Participate in design reviews, bring-up, and field testing of new robotic platforms

Required Skills:

Required Skills and Qualifications

Strong experience with C++ (modern standards), C, and Python
Deep understanding of real-time, embedded, and low-latency software systems
Experience building distributed or multi-nodal systems with inter-process communication
Comfortable working in Linux environments and using command-line tools
Familiarity with build systems such as CMake, Make, and scripting with Bash
Experience using version control (Git) in collaborative environments
Strong problem-solving ability and a hands-on, detail-oriented approach
Ability to read schematics, interpret datasheets, and debug hardware/software integration
ROS1/ROS2 experience
Experience with microcontroller platforms (STM32, ESP32)
Exposure to AI/ML in robotic applications
WebSocket/REST API development
Familiarity with CAN, SPI, UART, and other hardware protocols
Exposure to simulation tools like Gazebo, Isaac Sim, or custom rigs

Compensation and Benefits:

The range is $25-$35 per hour, depending on experience, skill level, and academic term
Hands-on experience with humanoid robot hardware, sensors, and AI systems
Mentorship from engineers across AI, robotics, perception, and controls
Opportunity for future co-op terms or full-time employment at AXIBO

Job Summary:

At AXIBO, we are building a new generation of humanoid robots powered by advanced Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models. These models allow robots to understand scenes, follow instructions, reason about tasks, and perform complex manipulation in real industrial environments.

To accelerate our development, we are expanding our team with a VLA Model Development Intern. In this role, you will help build the high-quality datasets and evaluation pipelines that train and validate our humanoid robots' AI systems. Your work will directly support real deployments in manufacturing environments.

This is an ideal role for students interested in AI, robotics, computer vision, data engineering, or human-robot interaction.

Job Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Dataset Development

Operate AXIBO's multi-camera capture systems, sensors, and teleoperation rigs to gather high-quality VLA datasets.
Capture demonstrations of robotic manipulation, mobility, and bimanual tasks.
Collect synchronized RGB, depth, IMU, force, audio, and action traces from both human operators and robots.
Create structured dataset components: video clips, action labels, instructions, trajectories, and contextual metadata.
Annotation & Dataset Engineering
Annotate tasks, object interactions, intentions, and robot behaviors.
Organize and preprocess data for VLA training pipelines.
Assist in designing data schemas, train/val splits, filtering rules, and dataset quality metrics.
Build small tools/scripts to automate dataset cleaning and extraction.
VLA Model Testing & Benchmarking
Run VLA models in simulation or on robot hardware to evaluate task performance, comprehension, and consistency.
Execute scenario tests and measure:
Instruction following
Visual grounding
Safety & collision behavior
Action success/failure outcomes
Identify edge cases, failure modes, and missing data patterns that affect model performance.
Document results and propose improvements to the dataset or test procedures.
VLA Software & Tool Development
Develop utilities to support VLA workflows, such as:
Visualization tools for trajectories and predictions
Data loaders or preprocessing pipelines
Evaluation scripts for automated testing
Tools for replaying demonstrations or generating synthetic data
Contribute small features or improvements to AXIBO's internal VLA training codebase (Python-based).
Help prototype new interaction modes between the robot and the VLA system.
Collaboration & Experiment Support
Work with AI, perception, and robotics engineers to diagnose model issues and refine training loops.
Participate in regular data collection, testing, and model deployment sessions.
Present findings and make recommendations that influence AXIBO's VLA roadmap.
Help document best practices for data collection, dataset building, and model evaluation.

Required Skills:

Technical Skills

Python (required for development tasks)
Familiarity with machine learning or computer vision workflows
Basic understanding of neural networks (PyTorch preferred but not required)
Experience with robotics, ROS, OpenCV, or sensor data is a plus
Strong attention to detail when working with large datasets
Soft Skills
Reliable and organized during data collection sessions
Curious, proactive, and excited to work on real robots
Strong communication skills and ability to document findings
Comfortable adapting to a fast-paced startup environment

Compensation and Benefits:

The range is $25-$35 per hour, depending on experience, skill level, and academic term
Hands-on experience with humanoid robot hardware, sensors, and AI systems
Mentorship from engineers across AI, robotics, perception, and controls
Direct impact on VLA models powering industrial robotic deployments
Opportunity for future co-op terms or full-time employment at AXIBO

PC Financial offers unprecedented value to Canadians through payment products. Proudly serving over 3 million customers, PC Financial continues to grow by offering payment solutions and services that reward our customers every day. As a subsidiary of Loblaws Company Inc., we share the CORE values of Care, Ownership, Respect and Excellence. We are dedicated to helping Canadians Live Life Well. Join us on our journey.

With more than 65 years of business and technical expertise in mining, energy, and infrastructure, our 10,000 colleagues in 150 countries tirelessly work toward bettering the industries in which we operate. With practical solutions that are safe, innovative and sustainable, we think globally while acting locally. Are you looking for an opportunity to join a diverse group of professionals who are committed to remaining exceptional? We look forward to hearing from you.

Our expertise in infrastructure includes aviation, highways and bridges, planning and advisory services, ports, rail and transit, tunnels, and water. Want to be part of the creation and construction of our cities? Then the infrastructure team is for you!


Looking to get the most out of your upcoming internship?

Hatch is currently seeking a dynamic Electrical Engineering Student to join our Water team in Oakville, Ontario who will apply knowledge of engineering principles and practices to the organization's products and services. The student will plan, schedule and conduct technical engineering assignments requiring judgment, independent evaluation, selection and significant adaptation and deviation from standard techniques and procedures.

Be given opportunities to contribute to complex projects around the world in meaningful ways.
Work on problems and gain experience relevant to your field of study in an office environment.

Participate in local Lunch and Learns, Hatch Charity Events, the triannual Student Showcase, and more to develop your skills.
Join in charitable, social, and sports activities with other Hatch employees.

We're entrepreneurs with a technical soul. Our flat organizational structure creates an atmosphere of openness and participation. We build practical solutions that are safe, innovative, and sustainable. Our ultimate goal is to achieve no harm for our people, our clients, and our communities.

Assist engineers and technologists with project execution during all project phases.
Assist with the preparation of electrical bid and construction drawings and documents for various projects.
Apply fundamentals and engineering tools to design normal and emergency power distribution, communication, life safety, lighting, instrumentation, and control systems.
Accompany staff during visits to construction sites and report on observations.
Coordinate with other engineering disciplines, architects, and subconsultants on multidisciplinary projects.

Ability to work efficiently and demonstrate effective organizational skills

Good understanding of engineering and business fundamentals as they apply to engineering problems and projects.

Collaborative team player with excellent interpersonal skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Shows critical and creative thinking and problem solving and brings forward solutions for our clients' toughest challenges.
Adapts and embraces change.

Your individual compensation within this range will depend on factors such as skills, experience, qualifications and location. In addition to base pay, our total rewards package may include performance-based incentives, comprehensive benefits, and other programs designed to support your well-being and growth.

Job Summary:

Verily's co-op position is a paid opportunity for students in a cooperative education program who are interested in working at the intersection of technology, data science and healthcare.

Verily is a subsidiary of Alphabet that is using a data-driven approach to change the way people manage their health and the way healthcare is delivered. Launched from Google X in 2015, our purpose is to bring the promise of precision health to everyone, every day. We are focused on generating and activating data from a variety of sources, including clinical, social, behavioral and the real world, to arrive at the best solutions for a person based on a comprehensive view of the evidence. Our unique expertise and capabilities in technology, data science and healthcare enable the entire healthcare ecosystem to drive better health outcomes.

Check us out at verily.com!
You can also learn more about our most recent external engagements.

Verily Canada operates from offices in Kitchener-Waterloo and Toronto, and is home to many data science initiatives. Co-ops collaborate with cross-functional teams to conceptualize, develop, and implement AI solutions tailored to diverse healthcare applications. We develop cutting-edge healthcare AI Agent workflows using large language models (LLM) for participants and clinicians, and develop NLP and ML models to unlock information from structured and unstructured clinical data for life sciences, pharma, and biotech.

This role is hiring for the Kitchener-Waterloo office.
Applicants will be expected to work from the office at least 3 days per week (typically Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday).
Start and end dates to align with recommended UW dates(Monday May 11th - Friday August 21st, 2026), although could start earlier or end later upon request.

Job Responsibilities:

Work closely with core Applied AI & Data Science team members to design and create longitudinal datasets integrating multiple data sources.
Build and evaluate highly accurate machine learning models / AI tools using sparsely labeled healthcare datasets.
Implement, build on and augment existing LLM/NLP tools to maximize the value of using unstructured medical data across a range of research and care applications.
Explore difficult, non-routine analysis problems and identify potential solutions, handling data challenges from a real-world setting.
Effectively communicate complex technical methodologies and results through clear, well-structured reports and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.

Required Skills:

Minimum Qualifications

Expected graduation date in 2026 or 2027
Currently enrolled in university as a full-time Bachelors, Masters, or PhD student in quantitative discipline (e.g., data sciences, statistics, biomedical informatics, computer science, applied mathematics, or similar).
Authorization to work in Canada.
Experience working with advanced machine learning and AI techniques (supervised and unsupervised methods, LLMs, NLP).
Creative and methodical problem solving: understand needs, identify options, form hypotheses, generate robust results, make informed decisions, and learn faster through feedback.
Strong proficiency in Python.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with clinical data, including EHR data, claims data, or other real-world health data sets, including an understanding of the complexities of structured and unstructured clinical data.
Familiarity with software engineering practices and experience developing production software.
Ability to work cross-functionally on teams, with a tolerance for ambiguity.

Additional Information:

Security Clearance Required


Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation Range: $40 - 43 CAD / hour

Benefits: Standard Verily employee benefits i.e. dental; medical; vision, etc.

Job Summary:

Make APIs Fall in Love -- Full Stack Developer (Co-op)

About Us
At NewPath Consulting, we help associations, clubs, and nonprofits work smarter by connecting systems, automating workflows, and building applications people actually enjoy using.

One of our flagship products is AccountBridge -- a cloud-based integration that connects WildApricot (membership management) and QuickBooks Online (accounting software). It automates financial data transfer, eliminates manual data entry, reduces errors, and saves time.

Position Overview

We're looking for a Full Stack Developer Co-op who loves learning and enjoys making technology click for users. You'll get hands-on experience with React, Vite, Node.js, and Make.com (formerly Integromat) while working on real production code and automation scenarios.

4 or 8 months available.

Job Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities

Develop, test, and maintain web applications using React, Vite, and Node.js.
Integrate REST APIs and handle JSON data to connect various platforms.
Design, build, and optimize multi-step automation workflows in Make.com using multiple connectors, filters, and error-handling processes.
Contribute to AccountBridge feature development and bug fixes.
Use GitHub for version control and collaborate via Google Meet and Slack.
Follow best practices in software development, continuous integration/deployment, testing, and documentation.

Required Skills:

Required Skills & Qualifications

Currently enrolled in a Bachelor or Masters degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related program.
Experience with TypeScript, React, Vite, and Node.js.
Solid understanding of REST API principles.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work independently in a remote environment.

Nice to Have

Experience with QuickBooks, WildApricot, or similar CRM/accounting platforms.
Experience with Make.com, n8n.io or other API automations platforms
Familiarity with MySQL
Experience with GitHub, Docker (DigitalOcean hosting)
Accounting systems especially related to revenue management
Generative AI LLMs and SLMs such as Mistral AI, ChatGPT, Gemini, Perplexity, Llama and others

Compensation and Benefits:

This role is compensated at $20CAD/hour. A bonus for performance will be granted for Outstanding contribution based on formal performance management evaluation.

What You'll Gain

Practical, full-stack development experience on real-world products.
Exposure to low-code/no-code automation tools like Make.com.
Hands-on experience integrating cloud applications via APIs.
Knowledge of financial data workflows for nonprofits and associations.
Mentorship from experienced developers and product managers.

Job Summary:

Job Summary
Do you like logic and puzzles? Do you love helping customers? Do your friends/relatives come to you for tech support? Do you often think about your dream-car garage and can rhyme off stats of almost any car?

QQuote is looking for a someone like you to join our fast-growing team as Software Coop. Ideal candidates have a diverse range of technical proficiencies, are detailed oriented and have demonstrated the ability to learn new things quickly. They are strong analytically and can persevere to independently solve problems and deliver working solutions.

We need someone who can assist the engineering department in designing and implementing enhancements to our software and/or processes that benefit the Sales, Customer Success, and Operations departments. This may include monitoring server vitals, working with our database & API integrations, PowerBI, system requirements definition, new function design, UI/UX screen design, or other related software responsibilities.

About QQuote
QQuote is a rapidly growing software startup in the automotive category. We are a small, but very passionate team that deeply cares about the success of our customers, quality of our data, and wellbeing of our intimate team. QQuote's market leading software was developed by a talented team of software developers and tire experts. Our vision is to take over the automotive industry by being the must-have piece of software for every car dealership. We have car dealers from coast-to-coast across Canada utilizing our software to easily sell tires, wheels, and accessories both in-store and on the web.

If you have an interest in the automotive world and are excited by the opportunity to join a company with a bright future, we want to meet you! If truly doing a job right and learning from your mistakes is more important to you than simply having the right answer, we want to meet you! If you persist through ambiguous or difficult tasks with resolve, we want to meet you!

Job Responsibilities:

Software Testing and Documenting

Extensively test and use QQuote to become proficient in all areas of the application
Work with the software and security teams to understand the full stack of the application
Create written and visual representations of the key functionalities and requirements of QQuote (both from a functionality perspective and from a practical perspective)
This includes working with the developers to map out algorithms and processes within the software
Monitor key metrics of the servers, noting patterns and exceptionalities
Provide recommendations to the software and security teams based on your observations
Special Projects Engineering
Assist in the exploration and implementation of AI, business intelligence tools, or other tools
Observe the Sales, Customer Success, and Operations departments to identify operational inefficiencies and pain-points
Provide recommendations and then develop processes / automations / tools to address the inefficiency
Take on a significant responsibility in the creation of an API that allows 3rd party access to our tire quoting data

Required Skills:

Key Critical Competencies

Eagle-eyed attention to detail
Results oriented (get-stuff-done mindset)
Comfortable looking at data, identifying insights, and proposing direction
Determined problem solving
Independent and quick learner
Can be focused and positive in an ambiguous startup environment
Key Technical Knowledge and Skills
Analytical skills, extremely comfortable working in Excel
Process improvement skill set
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Software programming (full stack is ideal, but not necessary)
MySQL databases
Testing / QA, and automated testing tools
Hardware and servers
AI models and training
MS office/Google Suite
BONUS: PowerBI, Tableau, or similar experience
BONUS: Graphic design, website design, SEO, e-commerce, WordPress
BONUS: French language skills

Compensation and Benefits:

Remuneration:

Full-time coop position, 16w total (May 11 - Aug 28)
Remuneration: $18/h - $25/h, depending on experience
Location: Permanently remote
Working hours: flexible, but generally M-F, 8am-5pm (occasional need for extra hours or shifted hours)
Address your cover letter to Nathan Hufnagel. QQuote welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Job Summary:

RF Engineering Intern (4 to 16 months available)

Location - Burlington, ON (On-site)

Looking for an internship with great learning opportunities and meaningful work?

Join our team - https://youtu.be/8wmfn9B07F0

Located in Burlington, Evertz is a worldwide leader in the design and manufacture of leading edge multimedia products for the film & television broadcast industry. Recognized as one of the top 50 best-managed companies in Canada, Evertz has gained Canadian corporate success through its vision, stakeholders' values, and excelling in the global economy. Evertz is proud to have worldwide client base that includes the largest global media and entertainment companies (e.g. Warner Bros. Discovery, Disney, NBC, Universal, Paramount, Sky, and Mediaset), sports leagues (e.g. NBA, NHL, MLB, Dorna, RBFA, and MLSZ) and other media organizations (e.g. Microsoft Studios, Amazon Studios, Apple, and YouTube).

Our employment philosophy is simple.

Hire extremely talented people, give them opportunities to make a positive impact and nurture their need for challenge and growth.

Our work philosophy is simple, too.

We emphasize teamwork, promote creativity and enjoy being at the leading edge of high-tech in our industry.

This position is a great opportunity for students to gain hands-on experience in advanced electronics design. You'll work closely with experienced engineers on real projects, learning how to simulate, design, and verify analog and digital circuits, create high frequency printed circuit boards, and tackle challenges like power distribution and RF performance optimization. You'll also support debugging and testing, building practical skills that complement your coursework and prepare you for a career in hardware design.

Job Responsibilities:

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Requires work in-office at our Burlington location.
As a valued team member, you will be working hands-on with all aspects of custom board development, including: Simulating, designing and verifying analog and digital circuits
Designing high-frequency printed circuit boards through:
Schematic design and capture
High frequency and high power PCB layout
Resolving board-level power supply and distribution issues
Characterizing and optimizing RF performance
Supporting other engineers in hands-on debug

Required Skills:

APPLICABLE SKILLS:

Possess a foundation in electronic theory.
Self-motivated to find root causes when debugging.
Eager to learn and accept feedback.
Understand the fundamentals of RF design.

Job Summary:

Plan Group Inc. is currently looking for an Junior Electrical Designer Co-op to join their Pursuits & Design team. As a Junior Electrical Designer Co-op, you will be required to assist Electrical Engineers on the Pursuit team in completing P3 (Public Private Partnerships), Design-Build and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery) Project Bids from their onset to their success.

As part of the Pursuits team, you will gain knowledge in developing design solutions that:
· Incorporates constructability at the forefront by ensuring the design is efficient and economical with respect to system fabrication & installation.
· Implements best available industry knowledge, to bring current technologies and solutions to the table.
· Considers alternate solutions. Solutions that can add additional functionality or reduce costs.
· Includes design consideration for operational performance, potentially lowering OPEX costs of the final solution.

Job Responsibilities:

· Review the project specifications and client requirements.
· Assist the Lead Engineer with design activities including load calculations and design of systems (power distribution, lighting systems, fire alarm, security, and other low voltage systems).
· Participate in internal pursuit team meetings with the pursuit manager and the estimating team.
· Participate in budget development.
· Provide input and ideas to team decisions & strategies with the intent to improve the bid.
· Coordinate with the project team (Architect, Engineers, Clients, contractors, and suppliers) to achieve an optimized design proposal.
· Contribute to the improvement of the team engineering and pricing tools.
· Participate in interdepartmental / cross-functional team initiatives.

Job Summary:

Whether shopping for your favourite foods, daily essentials, or little indulgences, the PC Optimum loyalty program helps Canadians live life well by delivering unparalleled customer value and utility through personalized offers, rewards, and experiences. As part of the Loyalty Team at Loblaw, you will be part of a group that drives the future direction of Canada's largest and most loved loyalty program. Reporting to the Manager, Loyalty Program & Member Experience Insights, you will leverage your passion for customers and analytical skills to provide insights on the health and performance of the PC Optimum program. These insights will empower our leadership to make data-driven decisions to set PC Optimum's strategy.

Job Responsibilities:

What you'll do

Uncover insights relating to the PC Optimum program and its members, using a variety of data (e.g., transactional, digital, & survey sentiment) to inform PC Optimum's strategy
Support ongoing measurement of program performance with a focus on progress against objectives and key results (OKRs) (e.g., partnerships, digital engagement, member growth)
Prepare recurring and ad hoc reporting for a variety of audiences, ranging from functional teams to leadership
Project-manage and support consumer research executed through ad-hoc surveys deployed to the PC Optimum emailable member base
Aggregate and analyze customer feedback and sentiment from a variety of sources (e.g., first party surveys, social media, customer support) to elicit a pulse on the member experience
Build dashboards based on requirements collected from business stakeholders to democratize access to insights
Across all of the above responsibilities, collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders including but not limited to Loyalty Partnerships, Technology & Analytics, Loyalty Operations, Loblaw Digital, & Marketing

Required Skills:

Does this sound like you?

Hands-on experience. You have at least 4 months of experience in an analytical role, including with demonstrated SQL skills (a must have).
Customer focused. Customers are core to what we do.
Exceptional Excel and SQL skills with an analytical mindset. Strong strategies are grounded in data-led insights and you'll be expected to extract, analyze, and summarize data from a variety of data sources.
Comfort thinking critically and strategically. You'll be a part of the team that crafts the strategy for PC Optimum, tackling complex and ambiguous customer and business problems.
Effective communication and synthesis skills. You will often be called upon to present your findings and recommendations. Comfort with storytelling and presenting will be key.
Strong intangibles. Time management, problem-solving, critical thinking skills, and the ability to work independently come natural to you.

Bonus qualifications
Experience using BigQuery to extract data for reporting and insights
Experience building data visualizations in Looker and / or Looker Studio
Experience with Voice Of Customer platforms (e.g., Medallia)
Experience in the retail and/or loyalty industry

Compensation and Benefits:

$25-$35/hour

Job Summary:

The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC), North America's third largest transit system and
recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA has introduced its new 2024-2028 TTC
Corporate Plan - Moving Toronto, Connecting Communities which continues the TTC's legacy
of delivering service to hundreds of millions of customers a year. The TTC's new vision and
mission statements also help promote the many environmental, social equity and economic
benefits that the TTC provides:
Vision: Moving Toronto towards a more equitable, sustainable, and prosperous future.
Mission: To serve the needs of transit riders by providing a safe, reliable, efficient, and
accessible mass public transit service through a seamless integrated network to create access
to opportunity for everyone.
At the TTC, our Early Talent programs provide students with the opportunity to work alongside
experts on exciting projects, gain an understanding on the transit industry, develop in-demand
skills and experiences and get an early start to your career. This is your chance to make a
meaningful impact on Toronto's transit!

institution

Employment Location Arrangement:

Additional Employment Arrangement Location Information:

This is a hybrid work environment. All Fellows are expected to show up in person in downtown Toronto (Union Station area) for the Bootcamp week, weekly Expert workshops and Group Office Hours. Given that learning is generally more effective in person, we recommend Fellows being in the office at least 3 days per week. Some Fellows may have additional on-site requirements for clients in the Toronto area. Some projects may involve occasional (optional) travel to the US for meetings.

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Special Work Term Start/End Date Considerations:

4-month and 8-month placements are available.

Job Summary:

Ascendance Foundry is built on two beliefs: 1) apprenticeship belongs at the centre of education, and 2) winning with AI demands the fastest workforce retraining in history. We help companies across many industries learn how to leverage modern AI tools to transform their businesses through a unique consulting model that incorporates structured learning, opening up new revenue opportunities while gaining operational efficiency. Ascendance Fellows are recruited from amongst the top students who have completed 2 years of University or less, and are paired with clients on focused transformation projects, while both receiving structured mentorship from seasoned founders, executives, and technical leaders.

Program Overview:
The Ascendance Fellowship is a fully paid, elite apprenticeship where you dive into real-world projects from day one. Fellows train with AI tools, deliver impact inside top companies, and learn from industry leaders. With expert mentorship, an ambitious peer network, and no tuition, it's a launchpad to an accelerated, high-impact career.

Week 1: Intensive AI-Bootcamp: Intensive training in AI tools and development workflows. Hands-on projects with LLMs, automation, and data pipelines.
Weeks 2-16+ (Client Project Placement). Apply AI-native practices to deliver high-impact results, embedded in a real-world role at a client company.
Weekly Expert Workshops. Learn directly from industry leaders and technical mentors from our Expert Network, which includes senior technical leaders, AI experts and business leaders from across several industries.
Weekly Group Office Hours: Get together weekly with peers and mentors to help debug each other's day-to-day work.
On-Demand Mentorship & Customized Training. Ongoing 1:1 mentorship throughout the term. Personalized support on tools, techniques, and project challenges. Customized training to match the scope of the project.

Types of projects available:
The types of projects available vary from term to term, depending on the needs of our clients, but generally fall into three broad categories: a) Strategy & Management Consulting, b) Analytics & Data Science, c) Custom Application Development. While not all projects available to Fellows will be finalized and contracted by Match date, here is a representative sample of projects we are working on now. In addition to the types of projects below, there will be at least one opening focused internally on improving our educational programming and expanding our reach with industry.

Project Examples:
1. Building an automation strategy for a large global legal process outsourcing firm: This project focuses on transforming a legal process outsourcing firm, into a Business Process Automation (BPA) firm through strategic AI adoption, through a combination of off-the-shelf software solutions and custom middleware. Fellows will play a key role in developing and implementing AI-driven solutions to enhance efficiency, expand service offerings, and build a comprehensive AI strategy for presentation to prospective buyers. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to a forward-thinking initiative at the intersection of legal technology and cutting-edge AI.

2. Building accounting and project management automations for a mid-sized construction company: This project is similar in scope to Project 1, except for a mid-sized Canadian construction company. We are helping the company develop and build out their automation strategy from the ground floor, focusing on their accounting and project management functions, enabling them to price and forecast projects more accurately, while delivering more efficiently.

3. Building and managing Ascendance Foundry's proprietary trading fund: We have launched a proprietary trading fund that our Fellows help us manage, which tests and executes several trading strategies (med-long-term bets on secular trends, event-based strategies, etc).

4. Building a sales and coaching agent for Ascendance Foundry: One of the consequences of mass AI adoption is that many more brick and mortar businesses will be able to design and build their own hyper-customized automations without having to hire large consulting firms or build large internal engineering teams. However, doing so requires mastering a whole new operating language and building small strike teams of SMEs and Forward-Deployed engineers with a different combination of skillsets. We are building an agent that helps teach prospective clients how to get started on this journey. This will be used to drive new sales as well as to guide our existing Fellow-client teams.

Job Responsibilities:

Responsibilities will vary somewhat with the type of project placement, but generally fall into three buckets:

Strategy & Management Consulting - support market analyses, research on specific companies, and conduct financial analysis to inform client recommendations. They will also assist in preparing decks, proposals, and business cases while collaborating with the team to evaluate strategic options and organize client meetings and workshops.
Analytics & Data Science - assist with data collection, cleaning, and analysis, while supporting the development of models and visualizations to extract insights. They will collaborate with the team to document findings, test methodologies, and apply statistical and machine learning techniques to real-world datasets.
Custom application development - support coding, testing, and debugging of application features while assisting with research, documentation, and deployment activities. They will work closely with the development team in an agile environment, gaining hands-on experience with modern tools, best practices, and real-world software engineering workflows.

Required Skills:

We don't expect our Fellows to come in with a long list of skills coming into the program (building foundational skills and a network is the whole point of the program), but we expect you to show up everyday with an attitude that lives up to our brand ideals:

"Driven, Agile, Resourceful AF. AI-First."

Some basic coding experience would be helpful for most projects.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation:
All Ascendance Fellows receive a non-negotiable stipend of $15,000 per 4-month term. All Fellows receive access to all the educational programming listed in the Job Summary free of charge.

Job Summary:

At High Q, we are on a mission to redefine the standard in protein structure determination, the future of drug discovery, and the development of novel therapeutics. Join the Quantum Revolution!

About High Q Technologies
Think Quantum. High Q Technologies is a fast-growing company that develops quantum-enabled scientific instruments for ultra-high sensitivity biophysical and chemical analysis. By applying modern microwave quantum optics techniques to electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) spectroscopy, High Q is on a mission to redefine the standard in protein structure determination, the future of drug discovery, and the development of novel therapeutics. Built upon over a decade of research and development, our patented technologies are derived from advances in experimental quantum computing, utilizing inventions created in collaboration with Professor David Cory's research group at the University of Waterloo. High Q is backed by Quantum Valley Investments and Blackberry co-founders Mike Lazaridis and Doug Fregin. The company is headquartered in Waterloo, ON.

Job Responsibilities:

Seeking an innovative, self-starting engineering student who enjoys working in a fast-paced start-up environment to join our growing team. Reporting to the Vice President of R&D, the Mechanical Engineering co-op will work with a team of highly skilled HW and SW developers to design, build and test the mechanical aspects of our product line.

Responsibilities

Working with High Q's scientists to develop the overall product design goals and specifications to meet quality, regulatory and customer requirements.
Assist other members of the team in the analysis, investigation, and solution of all engineering related items.
Contribute to the design of new parts, products, and systems, either starting with a blank sheet or existing models in a variety of formats - from internal components and wiring, to modules, interconnection, and power distribution, to full chassis architecture, user panel layouts and thermal management.
Design improvements to existing products.
Develop testing processes, and perform testing for reliability and validation of new designs.
Generate working prototypes for beta testing and customer demonstration.
Perform engineering calculations to support design work.
Create and review technical drawings, plans, and specifications using computer software.
Collaborate with multi-disciplinary engineering teams, and work with vendors and contractors.
Perform detailed documentation to track project development and design process.
Ensure project timeline is met and project stays within budget and that product cost targets are met.
Ensure product designs are manufacturable, develop tooling and assembly processes.
Supply chain management for all mechanical parts, including contract fabricators.
Design and manage CAD and drawing model file libraries, using SolidWorks PDM.

Required Skills:

Education & Qualifications

Undergraduate/Graduate student in Mechanical or Mechatronic Engineering.
Experience with mechanical design and manufacturing.
Experience in CAD for design and modeling; SolidWorks experience is a bonus.
Nice to have:
FMEA experience.
Experience with RF shielding enclosures.
Thermal analysis experience.
Experience with fabrication techniques, including CNC milling and TIG welding.
Experience with Cryogens and low temperature systems and materials
Experience working in an ISO-9000 environment
Essential Skills
Detail-oriented and have good written and verbal communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills with the aptitude to be a team player; setting a professional tone and establishing cooperative partnerships
Ability to demonstrate flexibility and manage multiple complex projects simultaneously.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Self-starter and independent critical thinker, with the aptitude to work autonomously.
Creative thinker, problem solver and continuous learner.

Compensation and Benefits:

The salary is competitive and commensurate with experience.

Location: Mississauga, Ontario - Hybrid (4 days/week in office)

Department: IT Enterprise Services, Mattamy Asset Management
Employment Type: Co-op Student (Contract); May 2026 start

At Mattamy Asset Management (MAM), everyone has an important role to play in our shared success. Developing thoughtfully planned communities is complex work and our diverse teams come together to deliver on that mission in every aspect. We are thoughtful planners, precise project managers and practiced subject matter experts. And in each area of our evolving business, we are trusted to drive results. Here, your opinion will be invited, and your contributions will count. You'll be surrounded by caring people who encourage you to be exactly who you are. You'll grow in your area of expertise, learning alongside committed colleagues. With a relentless focus on industry leadership and a deep commitment to sustainability, we've got big plans for the future - and for you.

Learn more about what makes working at Mattamy special and our award-winning culture.

What we offer
Mattamy is currently seeking result-oriented self-starters to join the team. This is an exciting opportunity with lots of visibility and the opportunity to make a real impact to our business. The role will report to the IT leadership and will have the opportunity to work across the IT organization including the functional and technical teams.

Who we are
Mattamy Asset Management (MAM) is the parent company of Mattamy Homes Canada and Mattamy Homes U.S., which together make up the largest family-owned homebuilding platform in North America.

Be yourself. We want it that way.
At Mattamy, we're passionate about creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important to the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues, and communities. From how we build our teams to cultivating our leaders, we're on a journey toward a welcoming, barrier-free culture for everyone.

Job Responsibilities:

What you'll do

Consult with the business to gather requirements to develop data analytics solutions.
Design, build and test new analytics reports, statistics (including MI/AL) models that will help inform our business.
Provide operational support for existing reports, models, and data configurations.
Collaborate with business and IT to maintain the data governance tools (e.g., data catalog and data quality).
Participate in Business process optimization projects;
Developing and reviewing business process documentation
Developing and reviewing training materials
Assist with qualitative and quantitative analyses and the interpretation of data.
Assist with project coordination tasks and activities.

Required Skills:

What you bring

Enrollment in a Technology, Math, Statistics and/or Finance program.
Proven academic success - transcripts required.
Experience in programming, preferably Python.
Experience in data analytics related technology such as dashboard, data lake and ML/AI.
Extensive knowledge of SharePoint, Word, Excel & PowerPoint.
Project management/coordination experience.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, are required.
Ability to work well independently or in a team environment.
Proven ability to build relationships and work in a fast-paced setting.
Excellent planning and organization skills.
Flexible, with the willingness and ability to travel to construction sites as needed.

Bonus points
1-2 relevant co-op work terms.

Compensation and Benefits:

Our compensation range falls within the guidelines provided on Waterloo's website. https://uwaterloo.ca/co-operative-education/about-co-op/co-op-earnings

TD Insurance is part of TD Bank Group, one of Canada's largest financial institutions. TD Insurance helps protect clients from the 'accidents of life' with a wide range of products including credit protection, life, health, travel, home and auto insurance. With more than three million clients, TD Insurance authorized products and services are available online, over the phone, and through a network of more than 1,000 TD Canada Trust branches.

In Canada, we have two lines of business, General Insurance and Life and Health. Our General Insurance business is one of the top home and auto insurance groups in Canada and the national leader in group insurance and affinity marketing. Our Life and Health business is the number one provider of critical illness insurance and direct life and health insurance in Canada.

At TD Insurance, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment. With a Canada-wide workforce of over 4,000 employees and offices in Atlantic Canada, Quebec, Ontario and Alberta, our company is always growing and can help you to grow. Job Summary:

FUEGO is building the world's most customizable and extensible mobile commerce platform, powering iconic brands like True Classic, Dolls Kill, Dossier, Kitsch, DRMTLGY, Cuts Clothing, Rainbow Shops, Comfrt and more. Our platform leverages the latest advances in generative AI to turn Shopify stores into fully native and customizable mobile apps packed with social commerce features in minutes!

Over 70% of all e-commerce transactions now happen on mobile devices, and having a mobile app allows brands to form deeper connections with their customers while improving retention and driving higher conversion rates.

We are seeking a talented Full Stack Developer (Forward Deployed) with expertise in React, NodeJS, and React Native to collaborate closely with our founders. This is a forward deployed engineering role working directly with customers-embedded with brand teams to enhance, maintain, and expand their mobile apps serving millions. You'll sit at the intersection of design and engineering, build flawless React interfaces in live storefronts, ship fast, and partner on-site and over calls to diagnose, prioritize, and solve high stakes problems in real time.

Working at FUEGO will give you the opportunity to shape how millions of people shop around the world everyday.

Job Responsibilities:

Responsibilities:

Develop Robust React Applications: Build and maintain scalable, component-based React applications used by millions of customers. Create reusable, performant UI components that form the backbone of our platform.
Solve Complex Engineering Challenges: Take ownership of challenging technical problems, designing and implementing solutions that significantly enhance user experience and platform performance.
Interface Design and Implementation: Directly design intuitive and efficient user interfaces. We empower our engineers to shape software design directly, rather than relying solely on external mockups.
Collaborate with Leadership: Engage directly with the founders and leadership, participating actively in decision-making processes and hands-on coding to drive forward critical initiatives.

Required Skills:

Qualifications:

Proven experience in building products and features from inception through deployment.
Deep expertise in React and React Native.
Familiarity and hands-on experience integrating AI tools such as Cursor, Aider, or Devin into development workflows.
Experience with OpenAI, Anthropic APIs and demonstrable projects built using it.
Your contributions will significantly enhance our platform's capabilities, enabling brands to deliver exceptional mobile experiences. Your code will be impactful, running on millions of devices and facilitating seamless product discovery and purchasing experiences.

Compensation and Benefits:

CAD 35 - 50/hr
Flexible PTO and Sick Time
One-time stipend of 500 USD to set up your remote work-station
USD 250 monthly shopping credit to shop on any mobile apps powered by FUEGO.

Job Summary:

We are Tuq. If you need an App built that you care about then you've come to the right place. We don't take on projects that we aren't passionate about and we're passionate about every project we take on! That means we pass on a lot of what other companies call "lucrative" work, and that commitment to quality and dedication to the products we create is the reason that we're willing to put in our time, energy, and life's blood into everything we build. The name's not just a catchy one-syllable word, it's an affirmation of who we are and what we stand for: Trustworthy Uncompromising Quality!

Do you want to work on REAL projects for REAL clients and make valuable contributions that make a REAL difference?

Job Responsibilities:

Come work for Tuq! Here are some of the things you can look forward to:

Work with companies BIG and small, and work with multiple teams, with different styles.
Difficult, real-world challenges to tackle.
Work on a variety of projects - from Text and Video Chat, to GPS, Gaming, and Internet of Things-connected devices.
Company dinners.
No Mornings!
Still not convinced? Just listen to these glowing testimonials:

"It's a fast-paced, self-driven workplace where you get the opportunity to work alongside some of the best developers in the industry." - Ernst Rullmann

"I got to work on a variety of real projects with a range of technologies and languages that I never would have expected. One co-op term at Tuq will teach you more than you could have thought possible in 4 months." - Daniel Mackenzie

"It's great, and Mike has a sword!" - Areal C. Oop

What we're looking for:

Someone who's smart, self-motivated, independent, and always looking to learn.
Must be willing and able to pick up new languages and technology, and not be afraid to fail early and often.
No specific previous experience necessary, but a familiarity with basic programming principles is a must.

Being able to work from home is also a plus!

Salary range: $18.00 - $22.00 per hour.

Job Summary:

History
CI Technologies has conducted business since March 1992, with the sole purpose of providing software solutions for public safety Professional Standards, investigative and criminal intelligence units. Since then, we have evolved into the leading provider of software that supports the integrity and reputations of police agencies in Australia, Canada, New Zealand and the United States.

Join Us
Are you interested in working in a close-knit team of developers? Are you interested in learning about enterprise/production ready frameworks? Do you want to see your work make a difference? If you answered yes to any of the questions above, you may want to consider a term with CI Technologies! We're looking for applicants who are self motivated, and have a drive for learning and developing great software. We value hard work and drive over experience so don't hesitate in applying even if this will be your first work term!

Job Responsibilities:

Selected applicants will spend a term working on developing and maintaining production software.
Responsibilities include all parts of the software development life cycle (i.e. feature design, requirements gathering, validation/QA).
Most importantly, selected applicants are expected to learn and take charge!

Required Skills:

The following are lists of skills and/or knowledge that applicants will learn/use during the work term. This is in no way a hardfast list of requirements but familiarity is definitely a plus! If you're not familiar with the terms/technologies, please be honest.. Nothing is worse than cramming and memorizing the buzz-words du jour!

Backend (Good to Haves)

Experience with Java and/or C# as well as their major web frameworks (e.g. Springboot, MVC, ASP.NET)
Experience with ORM Technologies (Entity framework, Hibernate, nHibernate)
Understanding of relational databases
Experience with RESTful APIs
Knowledge of security basics (SQL/Script injection, data sanitization)
Frontend (Good to Haves)
React, Vue and similar frameworks/libraries
Redux, Vuex
CSS, LESS, SASS
Eye for design
All applicants are also required to have a healthy dose of creativity, tolerance to receive and dish out constructive criticism, and a desire to learn!

Transportation and Housing:

Round trip flights between Vancouver and Toronto are covered to start and end the work term.
Maximum of 1400 per month reimbursed for housing for duration of co-op term (Taxable benefit).
Monthly public transit (Compass) pass reimbursed for duration of co-op tern (Taxable benefit).

Job Summary:

About HeyGen
At HeyGen, our mission is to make visual storytelling accessible to all. Over the last decade, visual content has become the preferred method of information creation, consumption, and retention. But the ability to create such content, in particular videos, continues to be costly and challenging to scale. Our ambition is to build technology that equips more people with the power to reach, captivate, and inspire audiences.
Learn more at www.heygen.com.

In 2025, we have achieve $100M ARR with over 24M users, 58M videos processed, and 2.7M paid videos created just in December.

The Opportunity
We're looking for a passionate Research Engineering Intern to join our cutting-edge AI Research Team. In this role, you'll work on advanced topics in generative AI, multimodal learning, and intelligent content interaction. This is a rare opportunity to bridge academic research with real-world impact and contribute to tools that redefine the future of video creation.

Open to 4 months or 8 months work terms

Job Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities

Research and prototype state-of-the-art generative models for video and avatar generation.
Design and implement algorithms for real-time video generation and multimodal interactions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate research into HeyGen's core platform.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning, computer vision, and generative AI.
What You'll Gain
Hands-on experience in applied AI research.
Mentorship from top experts in AI and generative modeling.
Real-world impact through contributions to widely-used products.
A fast-paced, collaborative environment at the forefront of innovation.
Potential pathway to a full-time role based on performance.

Required Skills:

Qualifications

We're looking for standout candidates with a proven ability to drive results in the field of AI. You should bring both academic rigor and real-world execution, with a focus on building impactful AI systems.
Enrolled in programs of Computer Science, AI, or a related field.
Experience with deep learning and generative models (GANs, diffusion, transformers, etc.).

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive salary: CAD $11,500/month.
In office snacks and meals provided for lunch & dinner.
Dynamic and inclusive work environment.
Opportunities for professional growth and advancement.
Collaborative culture that values innovation and creativity.
Access to the latest technologies and tools.

Job Summary:

Endex is a knowledge platform for cutting-edge financial firms. At Endex, we combine the latest advances in agentic LLM capabilities with deep financial specialization to automate and push the frontier of financial analysis. We're driven by a desire to streamline financial operations, improve existing workflows, and reduce errors to allow firms to capitalize on market opportunities with unprecedented speed and accuracy. We recently launched the first Excel-native AI agent for finance and announced a $14M funding round led by OpenAI.

To learn more about Endex please visit https://endex.ai and see our launch video here.

About us:

Well funded and backed by OpenAI
Close relationships with leading AI research labs
14 person team with a strong in-person work culture
Take strong bets and work very hard to validate them

Job Responsibilities:

We're open to hire & accommodate different roles for extraordinary individuals in design, product, data, research, ai/ml, or any other position the applicant demonstrates exceptional talent in.

What we're looking for:

Exhibit a high standard of technical excellence and attention to detail
Show a high degree of collaboration and a willingness to engage with both giving and receiving feedback
Driven by desire to learn new skills and potentially apply yourself in new technical situations that you may not have previous experience in

What you might work on with us:
Explore novel AI/LLM interfaces specific to financial domains
Researching novel reasoning paradigms to improve the intelligence of our agents
Architecting complex agentic workflows to answer industry-grade finance questions
Retrieval over tera-byte scale textual data
Building scalable LLM evals over real-world financial tasks
Something equally (if not more) exciting!

We're looking for candidates that exhibits:

A solid understanding of Computer Science/Software Engineering from both coursework and prior work experiences
Self-motivation with a drive to take ownership of projects end-to-end
A high degree of grit and hunger to learn new skills and concepts
A desire to take ownership over a given project and take it to/beyond the finish line
Preferred qualifications include any of the following:
Building performant & visually appealing UXs
Engineering robust and easy to use backend APIs
Working on scalable data engineering/pipeline projects
An interest in finance (but by no means required!)
Our current tech stack involves (but is not limited to) the following:
Typescript/NextJS (Fullstack framework)

Temporal (Workflow execution)

Job Summary:

Job Summary:
***PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE ELGIBLE FOR THIS UK YOUTH MOBILITY SCHEME VISA***
https://www.gov.uk/youth-mobility/eligibility

***ON-SITE WORK ONLY (NO HYBRID OR REMOTE OPTIONS)***

An international company operating in over 145 countries that continues to have unparalleled growth, Randox Laboratories has been the heartbeat of the UK's National COVID Testing Programme throughout the pandemic. In early 2020 Randox recognised the threat from COVID-19 and, based on over 40 years of diagnostic experience, quickly developed a test to accurately identify the virus. Testing at scale commenced within weeks to support the UK's National Testing Programme and private clients alike.

Randox Laboratories (County Antrim) are currently seeking Agile Developers who will have the unique opportunity to work at the cutting edge of medical device research and development for a term here in the North of Ireland. The successful candidates will develop and improve the software of existing manufacturing apps as well as bespoke industrial automation systems with the key goals to be improve system reliability and consistency with robust software development execution. This role is a challenging, but also a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, to maintain and make continual improvements resulting in a more efficient automation systems and improved productivity for Randox. More about our Co-Op programme can be found here How Randox turned "mission impossible" into a win with Waterloo co-op talent | Hire Waterloo | University of Waterloo

The successful Agile Developer candidate(s) will report to the Chief Technical Officer for Systems Improvement. This exciting full-time temporary position will be based at the cutting-edge R&D Centre of Excellence - Redlands in Crumlin about 15 minutes south of Antrim - as this site is remote and generally relies on a car a company bus can provide transportation to and from this site.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities:
Our Agile Developers:
1) Develop design concepts based on User Requirements by liaising with product owner and key stakeholders.
2) Contribute to the development of Functional Requirements Specifications based on User Requirements and approved concept designs
3) Contribute to the development of Software Requirements Specifications based on User Requirements and approved concept designs
4) Working within a multi-disciplinary team, clearly communicate requirements to other team members to ensure all development and testing is co-ordinated appropriately
5) Work alongside other engineering disciplines, scientists, and Software Test Engineers to ensure designs are rigorously tested, verified and validated
6) Identify appropriately specified COTS products / software for use within a system as and when required
7) Generate and maintain technical documentation, specifically, but not limited to, code review documentation, work instructions, FMEA, BOM etc.
8) Contribute to risk analysis for products under development and released
9) Report on status of projects / designs, both orally and in written format, to direct and senior management
10) For both products under development and released products, contribute to design change when necessary, ensuring that design change is managed in a controlled way
11) Ensure all systems are designed to a high quality, ensuring compliance with appropriate internal procedures and European and International standards
12) Adherence to company Positive Work Environment policies, health & safety procedures, and the maintenance of a safe working environment

Please note that this job description is intended as a guideline - new duties and responsibilities will be incorporated as a matter of custom and practice as the role evolves

Required Skills:

Required Skills:
Agile Developers:
1) Experience of programming React / typescript front end & Python / Go backend, VScode for IDE and devOps
2) Experience of programming in an object orientated programming language such as VBA, C#, C++, Delphi
3) Experience using SQL Server or similar relational database

Job Summary:

Mantle (Ten Key Labs Incorporated) is looking for talented Software Engineering Interns to join one of two teams of senior engineers building the next generation of software platforms for private companies and investments. Formed in 2022, Mantle is backed by several prolific VCs including Craft, Eniac, Relay, Sierra, M13, Leaders Fund, and more.

Mantle Equity is a capitalization table platform built to simplify equity management for companies. Our workflow automations simplify the lives of startup founders, investors, and lawyers directly involved in the financing process for companies in all stages of funding. Equity provides tools for visualizing cap tables, forecasting future funding and industry-leading due diligence tools.

Mantle Portal provides solutions for private investment management and streamlines investment workflows within one platform. Portal automates document collection and extraction, and transforms unstructured data into actionable insights. Both of our platforms are built from the ground-up to be AI-native, and we work on staying at the cutting edge by reviewing new models as they are released.

Our founding team has a wealth of entrepreneurial experience and has brought mobile apps to life at Xtreme Labs, cloud orchestration at Pivotal/VMware, and a connected car platform at Autonomic (acquired by Ford). In our shared history at previous startups, we have hired and retained hundreds of co-op students over the past 15 years. Several members of the founding team are Waterloo graduates and continue to stay engaged with the university. If you're interested in how startups are built, funded, grown, and more all in a single work term, you're looking at the right place.

The senior engineers at Mantle have well over a decade of experience working in a highly collaborative and fast-paced atmosphere with co-op students. We practice pair programming to encourage learning, improve code quality and expand test coverage. As a co-op student, you will accelerate your learning by pairing with our senior engineers across all parts of our application. Our co-ops always work on our main platforms alongside our senior engineers, and not some side project. Our past co-op students have learned a lot in a welcoming and supportive environment reflected in our average work-term rating of 9.8/10. You can review this blog post from one of our former co-ops who returned to Mantle after graduation and this blog post from a student during their work term to gain insight on our work culture and what you can expect from your co-op experience here.

Job Responsibilities:

In this role, you can expect to...

Be part of defining a multi-dimensional FinTech platform
Work on all aspects of the platform (e.g. frontend, backend, and infrastructure)
Design, implement, and test new features in a fast-paced environment
Collaborate with our product and design teams
Experiment with new tools and technologies to expand our knowledge base in company-wide hackathons

Required Skills:

You may be a good fit for our team if you...

Have interest in building out an ambitious FinTech platform that impacts startups, venture capitalist investors, law firms and limited partners
Have some proficiency in Go, React, Typescript, or similar programming languages
Have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Have the ability to work in a fast paced, team-based environment
Have the constant desire to grow, learn, and explore new things
Have great attention to detail and a customer-oriented approach

Transportation and Housing:

Our office is based in downtown Toronto right on Bay St, just a short walk from Union station with easy access to GO Transit and TTC. We work in-person 4 days a week to foster our highly collaborative environment, with Wednesdays being an optional WFH day.

Compensation and Benefits:

We pay $38-42 per hour, which is above the average co-op earnings listed under the Faculty of Engineering and Faculty of Mathematics. There is no stipend for relocation.

Job Summary:

About Huawei
With 194,000 employees and operating in more than 170 countries and regions, Huawei is a leading global creator and provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. Integrated solutions span across four key domains - telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services. Huawei is committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

About Huawei Canada
Huawei Canada focuses on fundamental research and development aimed at solving complex technical problems in emerging technologies like 5G, AI, Human Computer Interaction and Autonomous Driving. With ongoing research initiatives with 10 Universities across Canada and strategic collaboration agreements with several Universities, we support Canada's rich research community. In 2020, Huawei Canada ranked among the Top 20 corporate R&D investors in the country with a huge 40% increase in R&D investment year over year. Huawei Canada was established in 2008 and now has a total workforce of 1,200 in our six research

About the team
The Software-Hardware System Optimization Lab continuously improves the power efficiency and performance of smartphone products through software-hardware systems optimization and architecture innovation. We keep tracking the trends of cutting-edge technologies, building the competitive strength of mobile AI, graphics, multimedia, and software architecture for mobile phone products.

Job Responsibilities:

About the job:

Design, develop, and maintain robust, high-quality plugins for Unreal Engine using C++ to extend core engine functionalities.
Integrate external AI and Machine Learning libraries (e.g., CANN) into the engine, creating a seamless workflow for gameplay and character animation teams.
Integrate and maintain a wide range of third-party SDKs, including video, audio, networking, and analytics, ensuring stability and performance.
Contribute to the extension and optimization of Unreal Engine's core systems to meet the unique demands of our projects.
Develop tools and editor extensions within Unreal Editor to streamline workflows and enhance the productivity of designers, artists, and other engineers.
Diagnose and resolve complex, system-level bugs and performance bottlenecks, from low-level engine code to high-level integrations.
Provide expert-level technical support and documentation for the engine, plugins, and integrated systems to our game development teams.

Required Skills:

About the ideal candidate:

Currently enrolled in a university and registered with the school's co-op program in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Expertise in modern C++ and a deep understanding of Unreal Engine's programming paradigms (UObject, delegates, modules, build system).
Demonstrable experience integrating external C/C++ libraries into a large codebase.
Strong understanding of the internal architecture of Unreal Engine, including its rendering pipeline, task/threading model, and asset management system.
Proficient in debugging, profiling, and optimizing code for performance (CPU, GPU, memory) using tools like Unreal Insights, RenderDoc, and platform-specific profilers.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a multi-disciplinary team.
Familiarity with a scripting language like Python for tooling and automation is an asset.

Compensation and Benefits:

salary to be discussed directly with students during interview
