This employer is an Employer Impact Awards (EIA) winner for impact in Equity, Diversity & Inclusion

About Us
NPX partners with nuclear utilities and new reactor projects to unlock performance through innovation. We combine decades of nuclear operation expertise with AI, digital tools, and lean processes, to help plants run safer, smarter, and more cost-effectively. Our AI Products & Services team scales this expertise through NPX-developed AI products, delivering solutions to clients across Canada, the U.S., and globally.

The Role
NPX is seeking an AI Developer co-op to design, develop, and deploy AI agents and contribute to our AI products that revolutionize how work is being done in Nuclear. Your work will improve the efficiency of nuclear operations, contributing to safer, faster, and more cost-effective outcomes across the nuclear industry. This role is for someone who thrives on taking ownership of projects, juggling multiple initiatives at once, and quickly learning new tools and technologies, particularly in AI.

This role could be a mix of AI development & full-stack development depending on your interests and experience.

Design, develop, and deploy AI agents that solve real problems and enhance user experiences.
Own and develop new features for our products and build upon existing functionality.

Continuously and rapidly refine ideas through feedback, data, and ongoing experimentation.
Tech Stack: React, Next.js, Python, Azure, Minio, Weaviate, Ollama, Postgres, Redis

Results & Impact: you deliver measurable outcomes and business value.
Leadership & Influence: you elevate team performance and create influence without being asked.
Adaptability & Growth: you thrive in dynamic environments and embody a growth mindset.

Cultural Amplification: you strengthen our culture and role model our values.
Nuclear capacity is growing worldwide, and NPX is ready to lead as a SaaS-driven innovation partner. This global footprint empowers us to deliver greater impact for clients, strengthen the company, and create lasting career opportunities for our team.

Job Summary:

Who we are:
Geotab ® is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified "Great Place to Work™." We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.

Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotab's open platform and Geotab Marketplace ®, offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.

Our team is growing and we're looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what it's like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram. Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news.

Who you are:
As a Solutions Engineering GIS Specialist Intern, you will become familiar with all areas of the Geotab product suite, and contribute to pre-sales opportunities at all technical levels. You will be engaged from the start on exciting new opportunities and challenges to expand Geotab's footprint in the telematics industry. Day-to-day, you will be responsible for assisting the Geotab Sales team in pre-sales opportunities, running product pilots, and managing special strategic projects as required.

What you'll do:
You will leverage your knowledge in all aspects of the Geotab product suite to devise and build solutions to exceed end user expectations. This role will also support requests for both software and hardware product integrations. To be successful in this position, you will be a strong multi-tasker with excellent time management skills to properly monitor and prioritize various projects. You will work alongside the Sales, Software Development, Embedded Systems, Engineering Support, and Partner Account Management teams.

The opportunity:

4-month work-term, beginning May 2026
Full-time, paid internship (Monday to Friday, 37.5hrs/week)
Your first week at Geotab begins with 'GEO Launch' - a one week Employee Orientation. Click here to learn more!

Job Responsibilities:

How you'll make an impact

Assist the team in identifying methods to expand our use of geospatial data within the system.
Develop proof of concepts to analyze and address client environmental impacts related to Winter Maintenance activities.
Assist the team in pilot programs for new potential customers.
Participate in engineering product and integration projects.
Learn and maintain technical knowledge of the Geotab ecosystem.
Support end-user requirements in special projects.
Assist in developing, implementing, and maintaining new Geotab products.

Required Skills:

What you'll bring to this role

Completing a University degree in Geography, Environmental Studies, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field preferred.
Strong communication, organization, and time management skills, as well as a willingness to learn and strong work ethic.
Experience with Esri ArcGIS, QGIS and/or other GIS Applications is required.
Knowledge of various map publishing and hosting methods is an asset.
Technical experience using SQL, C#, JavaScript or Google BigQuery is an asset.
Passion for technology and innovation.
Ability to work well under pressure to meet deadlines in a team environment.

Compensation and Benefits:

$24.00 - $36.00 /hour CAD (Compensation can be discussed with the HR recruiter)
Free lunch at Oakville head office daily, and some days at our Waterloo and Toronto offices
Virtual and on-site intern socials
Lunch & Learns with Geotabbers
MyLearning - an online platform offering a variety of free courses and modules for you to choose from based on your interests
Intern Innovation Challenge (Summers only)

Job Summary:

About Sezzle:
With a mission to financially empower the next generation, Sezzle is revolutionizing the shopping experience beyond payments, blending cutting-edge tech with seamless, interest-free installment plans that make shopping smarter and more accessible. We're not just transforming payments; we're redefining how people discover, interact with, and purchase the things they love while driving real impact on merchant sales through increased conversions and higher order values. As we continue to shape the future of fintech and retail, we're building an innovative, dynamic team passionate about creating more than just a transaction but a truly unique shopping journey. If you're excited about pushing boundaries in tech and delivering a game-changing experience for consumers and merchants alike, come join us at Sezzle and help create the future of shopping!

About the Role:
Sezzle is seeking a talented and motivated Product Intern based in Canada who is best in class with a high IQ plus a high EQ. This role presents an exciting opportunity to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment within a rapidly growing team, with abundant prospects for career advancement. You will support testing and quality assurance across both our mobile app and web platform. In this role, you'll gain hands-on experience identifying bugs, validating features, and ensuring our digital experiences run smoothly for our users.

You'll work closely with Sezzle's product and engineering teams to support successful feature launches and elevate overall product quality. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to understand how quality assurance drives innovation at a fast-growing fintech company.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do:

Thoroughly test features on both mobile and web platforms before and after launch to ensure successful implementation and optimal functionality.
Report any bugs or issues to the appropriate teams with detailed, actionable information and potential solutions.
Evaluate user experiences and workflows on mobile and web interfaces, identifying areas for improvement.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product, design, and engineering to uphold quality standards.
Contribute to continuous improvement of QA processes and tools.

Required Skills:

What We Look For:

Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business, or a related field.
3.5 cumulative GPA or higher (required for consideration).
Interest in product operations and strategy, with a willingness to learn how to influence outcomes in a team environment.
Experience using qualitative and quantitative methods to understand customer needs.
Strong analytical and data visualization skills with a sharp attention to detail.
Ability to translate product issues and needs into technical requirements.
Preferred Knowledge and Skills:
Familiarity with the basics of product management and agile methodologies.
Experience with tools like Excel, Google Sheets, or introductory SQL knowledge.
Understanding of effective UX principles, gained through coursework or analysis of popular apps/websites.
Exposure to design platforms like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD.
Experience using agile project management tools such as Jira or the Atlassian suite.
About You:
You have relentlessly high standards - you strive for excellence and ensure issues are fixed right the first time. Many people may think your standards are unreasonably high. You are continually raising the bar and driving those around you to deliver great results. You make sure that defects do not get sent down the line and that problems are fixed so they stay fixed.
You're not bound by convention - you enjoy innovating and improving processes, and your success and much of the fun lies in developing new ways to do things.
You need action - speed matters in business. Many decisions and actions are reversible and do not need extensive study. We value calculated risk-taking. You're not afraid of taking calculated risks.
You earn trust - you communicate clearly and treat others with respect. You listen attentively, speak candidly, and treat others respectfully.
You have backbone; disagree, then commit - you advocate for the right decisions, even when it's tough. You can respectfully challenge decisions when you disagree, even when doing so is uncomfortable or exhausting. You have conviction and are tenacious. You do not compromise for the sake of social cohesion. Once a decision is determined, you commit wholly.
You deliver results - you focus on impact and deliver high-quality outcomes despite setbacks. You focus on the key inputs and deliver them with the right quality and in a timely fashion. Despite setbacks, you rise to the occasion and never settle.

Compensation and Benefits:

$20-25/hour

Job Summary:

SenezCo is an international engineering firm specializing in fire engineering, fire protection system design, code studies and technical-legal engineering. Our expertise spans every stage of a project, from initial design to post-incident investigations. We collaborate on diverse and dynamic projects across multiple industries including transportation (metros, trams, airports, tunnels), industrial facilities (nuclear power plants, petrochemical or Li-Ion battery plants, mining operations), and structures such as high-rise buildings, residential complexes, office towers, shopping centers, stadiums, hospitals and universities.

At SenezCo we are driven by innovation and a commitment to excellence, tackling complex challenges to create safer environments around the world.

Job Responsibilities:

Responsibilities include:

Preparing project documents including drawings, specifications, and calculations on a variety of potential buildings, structures, and equipment to address project requirements;
Preparing technical reports;
Interpreting and applying building codes and standards to new and existing buildings;
Participating in meetings with different disciplines;
Performing design calculations and ensuring plans are compliant with codes and standards.
Supporting engineers with design tasks, site visits, and project coordination

Required Skills:

The ideal candidate has completed 3A and is studying mechanical, electrical, architectural, or chemical engineering and will apply their experience and knowledge of engineering principles, theories, and concepts to advise and assist in preparing designs and evaluations of systems, products and procedures for the purpose of safeguarding life and property against damage caused by fires, explosions and related hazards.

The candidate must be proficient in AutoCAD and FDS, have the ability to work well independently and to interact with other industry professionals, and have exceptional verbal and written communication skills in the English and French language.

Note: You must also be fluent in the French language for this position with the Montreal Office.

Additional Information:

Other	Fluent in French

Compensation and Benefits:

$27 / hour + 4% vacation pay

Job Summary:

IFAB Engineering Partners Ltd. is seeking serious applicants to fill the role of Electrical Designer Co-Op. Work is performed in collaboration with a full complement of designers and engineers from a variety of disciplines, with a primary emphasis on efficient design of electrical systems. The ideal candidate for this position has a background in electrical engineering and responsibilities include preparing and modifying design drawings in AutoCAD/REVIT for electrical systems including power distribution, lighting (indoor and outdoor), standby power generation, controls, life safety systems, voice/data telecommunications and security/CCTV systems.

We are a local company with a global footprint that plans, designs, engineers, and builds food plants for major brands. We seek people who are proud of their work, and who go the distance to ensure both accuracy and on time delivery. In return, we offer an opportunity to work with a first-class group of professionals, in a vibrant modern office with a culture of openness, transparency, and work/life balance.

Job Responsibilities:

Work closely with designers, engineers, project managers, and technical specialists on projects that include the design of power distribution, lighting and lighting controls, standby power generation, fire alarm systems, telecommunication, and security systems, with designs to meet or exceed local building and electrical code requirements;
Assist with the development of electrical drawings and schedules, with drawings sets including preliminary, schematic, general arrangement, detailed design, tender and construction drawings for a wide range of clients;
Visit project sites to conduct assessments of existing electrical systems, and to inspect new installations;
Participate in design team meetings to achieve an optimal coordinated design;
Learn the specialty of design requirements for the food and beverage sector: and
Provide project coordination and administration services on projects, including shop drawing reviews, site reviews, responses to RFIs, and overall project documentation.

Required Skills:

Current enrollment in Electrical Engineering or similar program through a recognized college or university;
Demonstrated level of proficiency with REVIT and AutoCAD;
A working understanding of the Ontario Building Code and the National Building Code;
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;
Strong technical, organizational, coordination, and communication skills;
Demonstrated ability and interest to work as part of a team;
Desire to develop skills and expand career;
Proven experience with office software such as the MS Office Suite; and
Experience in the food and beverage sector is considered an asset but is not a requirement.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required


Compensation and Benefits:

$21.00 - $24.00 hourly, dependent on previous experience/co-op level + 4% vacation.

Job Summary:

The Role
Squint is looking for a Software Engineering Co-Op! In this role, you'll help build the Squint platform, contributing across our AI, mobile, web, and backend projects as necessary, all while receiving mentorship from our world-class engineering team. You will make a huge impact on the business, grow significantly as an engineer, and you will get to influence both the product roadmap and product design. You will ship real features to real customers and help us push the business forward.

About Us
At Squint, we're building technology that matters. While many tech companies focus on digital-first industries, we've set our sights on empowering the 80% of the global workforce that keeps our world running: frontline manufacturing operators. From soda cans to tires, toothpaste to chocolate bars, chips to napkin holders, these are the people who build the things you touch and see every single day. Our platform transforms manufacturing operations by putting AI and AR capabilities directly at workers' fingertips, creating what we call "agentic manufacturing" - where every team member has the power to make informed decisions in real-time using practical, applied artificial intelligence tools.

Proven Impact with Industry Leaders
Our technology serves Fortune 500 leaders across Automotive, Consumer Packaged Goods, and Life Sciences industries. These companies trust Squint to capture and activate their essential operational know-how, resulting in measurable improvements: reduced downtime, minimized waste, and optimized productivity at scale.

Backed and Built by the Best
We raised a $40m Series B at a $265m valuation and are backed by elite investors including Sequoia Capital, Menlo Ventures, TCV and The Westly Group. Our co-founders have been recognized on Forbes' 30 Under 30 for Manufacturing and Industry, and Fast Company named us one of the most innovative augmented and virtual reality companies of 2025.

Job Responsibilities:

Join the team at Squint and be part of creating innovative and industry-leading experiences for our customers. As a key early contributor at Squint, you will have the opportunity to:

Ship cutting-edge features across the Squint platform
Collaborate with talented designers and engineers to deliver world-class AI technology and user experiences
Build essential infrastructure and deliver customer-requested features
Build out internal tools that power our rockstar go-to-market team
Make decisions on the technology stack and influence the product roadmap and product design
Collaborate directly with company leadership

Required Skills:

An inclination to build and ship, with minimal structure and direction
Open-minded & team-oriented attitude
Strong CS fundamentals - data structures, algorithms, and a creative approach to problem solving.
Thirst to learn and absorb everything thrown at you
We are looking for individuals with:
Experience in mobile, web, or backend development
Experience with statically typed languages (Swift, Kotlin, Java, etc…)
Solid understanding of software engineering best-practices
Bonus: Experience shipping and supporting AI-powered product experiences in production

Compensation and Benefits:

$50 USD/hr, plus free lunch and dinner every day in the office!

Job Summary:

Klue Engineering is hiring!
We are looking for a Software Engineer Co-op student to join our ML team to deliver high-quality gen AI features from prototype to production.

At Klue, we build machine learning services and data pipelines to automatically extract insights about competitors from both public and internal data sources. Every day, our services process millions of data points, including news articles, press releases, webpage changes, Slack posts, emails, reviews, CRM opportunities, and user actions.

The team is using LLMs to extract competitive insights at scale. You will work at the intersection of LLM-powered agent workflows, retrieval pipelines, and evaluation frameworks. We need people who are excited about processing large amounts of data and driving innovation with LLM agents.

Job Responsibilities:

Collaborate closely with engineers to identify requirements
Create and iterate on prototypes to identify customer value
Productionize prototypes into services that are deployed at scale
Craft and refine LLM agents to extract valuable insights from diverse content sources
Generate labeled datasets for rigorous evaluation
Establish offline evaluation metrics and design iterative workflows for prompt optimization
Prepare comprehensive reports detailing findings and recommended next steps
Implement online monitoring systems to ensure ongoing prompt effectiveness
Conduct investigations of suboptimal AI outputs to identify root causes
Analyze retrieval scores and optimize embeddings and metadata to enhance performance

Required Skills:

Product-focused mindset with a drive for rapid delivery and iterative improvement
Hands-on experience building backend systems using Python
Demonstrated passion for developing LLM-based products, including expertise in prompting, RAG, zero-shot and few-shot learning
Grasp of fundamental ML evaluation metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1 score)
Knowledgeable of text embeddings and semantic search technologies
Eagerness to stay at the forefront of AI and LLM innovations

Compensation and Benefits:

$71,000 - $85,000 annual salary

Work across multidisciplinary engineering teams to produce fully integrated designs

Learn something new every day

Job Summary:

Fable Security is tackling the most critical challenge in cybersecurity: human errors. Human error is the #1 cause of security breaches, yet employees lack effective ways to learn what they need to stay secure. Fable is here to change that.
Fable's mission is to prevent cyber attacks by harnessing AI to transform human behavior and improve human defenses. We use the best practices from GenAI and behavioral systems to automatically identify your employees at risk, curate hyper-personalized Gen-AI video briefings, and deploy at the most relevant time, enabling employees to make the best security choices everywhere they work.

As a software engineer intern, you will work hand-in-hand with our team to ship features to our customers on a fast, weekly cadence. You will build full-stack products, backend services, or data pipelines to integrate with our customers' datasets, enable data scientists to assess employee risks, and build systems to generate gen-AI videos at scale.

If you want to experience building and shipping real features at an early stage startup, Fable is the place for you.

We are an early stage (~30 person and growing quickly) startup, backed by Greylock Partners, the investors behind Palo Alto Networks, Okta, Rubrik, Figma, and others. Our team has built many of the iconic products at Meta, Twitter, Flexport, and more. Our team has alumni from Waterloo, Columbia, Berkeley, Purdue, CMU, Stanford, and USC.

Job Responsibilities:

Projects can include:

Design, implement, and ship end-to-end features for our gen-AI security training platform
Analyze security data and implement data pipelines to improve our employee behavioral profile system
Improve gen-AI video generation system features and scale.
Iterating on customer feedback to improve our product.
You are expected to:
Write organized and well-tested Python code
Work with our founders and mentor engineers to understand product requirements and design systems
Validate your features end-to-end in a production environment
Understand and debug our backend database schemas, data pipelines, etc.
As an intern at an early-stage company, you'll be doing the same work as our full-time engineers and be responsible for shipping real projects to production.

Required Skills:

2+ internships working in a Python backend environment
Takes pride in writing well-factored and organized code.
Solid understanding of backend API development.
Working towards a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or Computer Engineering.
Have shipped projects to production in past intenrships.
Nice-to-have: Experience writing data pipelines and working in a notebook data science environment
Nice-to-have: Experience designing DB schemas and backend for end-to-end applications
Nice-to-have: React and JS web app experience implementation bar
Nice-to-have: knowledge of modern web app practices and components -- REST, GraphQL, relational DB, MVC, ORM framework fundamentals.
Nice-to-have: Experience working in AWS environment

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary $70/hr USD
We will assist with relocation costs for your internship.

Job Summary:

About VGen
We connect creatives and creators to help bring creative visions to life.
Through our no-AI digital art marketplace, we help 100K+ freelance artists from all over the world earn more easily on the internet while helping clients find the artists they want to commission and shop from.

Instagram: Instagram.com/vgen.co

Join us on our mission to create an art-powered digital world where human creativity thrives!

Working in a small, but high performing team, you'll have many opportunities for growth, contributing to projects that drive real impact for our users.

Job Summary:

ABOUT THIS POSITION

We are seeking a UI Programmer Co-op to join our team. In this role, you will be developing and implementing the logic and flow for all in-game UI. You will need to collaborate with design, art and other programmers to understand the UI requirement for a given feature.

WHY WORK AT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Our culture is centered on providing great opportunities to our employees so that everyone feels they are making a meaningful impact. Developing new and existing talent is our long-term focus. We are honored that our work environment has been consistently recognized as one of "Canada's Top 100 Employers". We summon you to join our elite team!

The rewards of joining Digital Extremes include:

Work on a live game and see your contributions in the game!
Work on a AAA game with world class talent and learn from the best.
Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
Virtual access to Dialogue, our mental wellness and healthcare services app.
Mentor Program to provide personal support while transitioning into your role at Digital Extremes.
Access to a range of discounts and savings on attractions, movies, theatres, and much more offered by Perkopolis.
Be part of "Giving Back" through a multitude of fundraising venues at DE.
Virtual events such as team building exercises, games night, live band performances, adult and separate children's holiday and summer parties for global teams!
ABOUT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Founded in 1993 by James Schmalz, Digital Extremes ranks as one of the world's top independent video game development studios. Originating with the co-creation of Epic Games' multi-million unit selling Unreal® franchise including Unreal and Unreal Tournament, Digital Extremes went on to develop Dark Sector®, BioShock® for the PlayStation®3, the BioShock 2 multiplayer campaign, and The Darkness® II. The studio has reached its greatest critical and commercial success with the free-to-play action game, Warframe®, boasting a global community of 75 million registered players on PC, PS4™, PS5™, Xbox One™, Xbox Series X/S™, Nintendo Switch™, and iOS™. The studio's most recently announced project is the much anticipated Soulframe®, an open-world action-fantasy MMORPG title that is currently under development.

Digital Extremes is headquartered in London, Ontario, Canada, and is proud to be selected as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers.

For more information and exciting news related to Digital Extremes, please visit www.digitalextremes.com.

Job Responsibilities:

Develop and implement the logic and flow for all in-game UI
Collaborate with design, art and other programmers to understand the UI requirements for a given feature
Work directly with artists and other programmers to implement efficient and maintainable, modular and reusable UI systems
Develop and maintain UI systems and best development practices
Work with UI artists to develop UI elements
Create custom tools and scripts as necessary to facilitate UI development
Ensure the technical quality and function of the UI through tuning and bug fixing
Contribute innovative and original ideas toward all aspects of the game's production and development

Required Skills:

A passion for video games and understanding of the fun factor.
Working towards a bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or a related discipline.
Strong interest in UI technologies and implementation, especially usability and the presentation of information.

Transportation and Housing:

Work location is on a bus route.

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive hourly wages ranging between $21.00 - $33.00 CAD. Please note, Wages will vary based on factors such as experience, term, qualifications and specific role requirements.

Other perks include subsidized bus passes, in-office meals, and access to Dialogue.

Job Summary:

Who We Are; What We Do; Where We're Going

Magnet Forensics is a global leader in the development of digital investigative software that acquires, analyzes, and shares evidence from computers, smartphones, tablets, and IoT-related devices. We are continually innovating so our customers can deploy advanced and effective tools to protect their companies, communities, and countries.

Serving over 4,000 customers in over 100 countries, our solutions are playing a crucial role in modernizing digital investigations, helping investigators fight crime, protect assets, and guard national security.

With employees based around the world, Magnet Forensics has been expanding our global presence with offices in Waterloo and Ottawa, Canada; Atlanta, GA, Herndon, VA, Westminster, CO; Gothenburg, Sweden and Singapore. As a part of Magnet Forensics, you can expect to make a difference in the world, no matter what role you play. You'll be supported through learning and development, not to mention an incredible team with unbelievable talent and integrity.

If you think you would be the right person to join our team working towards this goal, we would love to hear from you!

Job Responsibilities:

Your Role
At Magnet Forensics, you will be fully integrated into our Software Tools and Services team. You'll build and operate tools and services that our entire Engineering team depends on, day in and day out, to deliver their products. You'll start by getting comfortable with the code and tools, working through bugs and basic features, all the while writing code that will actually be seen in production. As you ramp, you'll be given more complex features just like any other member of the team. In fact, some of the key features of our software were written by our students!

Required Skills:

What We Are Looking For
We hire passionate people who enjoy technical challenges. We love problem solvers who want to keep learning, individually and as part of the team. We want people who collaborate and help others. We foster a team environment where everyone is comfortable sharing their ideas, because we understand that with diversity of thought, we will build the best products.

We're looking for someone who checks off most, but not all, of the boxes. It's more important to us to find a candidate who can display indicators of success through skills they have developed and experience they have been a part of, than to find folks who have "been there, done that". We want to be a part of your development journey, and we'll learn as much from you as you learn from us.

There are a couple must haves, but we will keep that list short:

You are a student working towards a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or a related discipline
You're strong at object-oriented programming (Languages: Java/JavaScript, C#, C++, Python)
You're familiar with at least some of: Build systems, automated test execution, AWS/Azure/GCP, shell scripting, Infrastructure as Code
You are accountable and take ownership of your projects
You like working in a collaborative environment with smart, funny and interesting people

The Most Important Thing

We're looking for candidates that can provide examples of how they have demonstrated Magnet CODE in their previous experiences:
CARE - We care about each other and our mission to make a difference in the world.
OWN - We are accountable for our results - while never forgetting to act with integrity, empathy, and respect.
DEDICATE - We put our heart and soul into meeting the needs of our customers and helping them serve the people they protect.
EVOLVE - We are constantly innovating and exploring new ways to work together to make an impact with our work.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary will range from $22.01/hour to $33.81/hour based on number of completed work terms.

Job Summary:

At RedIron we come to work every day to forge technology innovation for the biggest and best-known retailers in North America. It's our mission to create software products that make the retail store experience modern, effective and enjoyable for customers and retailers alike.

Working at RedIron will give you practical experience and allow you to see how your designs are put in place in production environments.

Job Responsibilities:

As a RedIron engineering student, you will train for and enhance your experience with the technologies we work with on a daily basis: Web Services, SQL, Git, HTML,C# and more. You are guaranteed to get challenging software development experience - and best of all get to see your accomplishments implemented in the real world.

The application you will work on is an enterprise platform with a focus on:

uploading client-side terminal data to server
server side processing / analytical element extraction for
presentation (dashboard)
reporting (views)
post processing events (SMS, SMTP, webhooks).
Your day to day tasks will include authoring design documentation, writing code or unit tests, producing automated builds, and collaborating with the technical and business analysts to deliver quality solutions. You will report to the development lead on your assigned team.
Your daily technical environment will involve Visual Studio,.net core, SQL/Linq, Razor, HTML 5, CSS, SVN, Jenkins.
Web Development Skills: Basic knowledge of web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, JSON, Web hooks, client side scripting and JavaScript is beneficial for customizing the user interface and enhancing the user experience.
Demonstrate experience designing, building or deploying AI-powered agents and productivity tools (e.g. Copilot, ChatGPT or custom LLM-based assistants) to automate workflows and enhance data-driven decision-making.

Required Skills:

Nice to have:

Understanding of RESTful Services: RedIron applications use RESTful web services, so knowledge of how to consume and interact with external RESTful APIs can be valuable.
Performance Tuning: Skills in optimizing and tuning both database queries and application performance for better responsiveness.
Testing and Debugging: Proficiency in testing methodologies and debugging techniques to identify and fix issues during the development process.
Deployment and Maintenance: Knowledge of installing (installers) / deploying applications, managing versions, and handling ongoing maintenance tasks.
Documentation: Good documentation practices to maintain clear and comprehensive documentation for the application's design, functionality, and configurations.
Version Control: Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git, SVN) to manage and track changes in the application code.

Transportation and Housing:

This is remote work but you will be required to travel to London, ON for your first day for onboarding

$28 per hour

Job Summary:

Department: Project Management

Duration: 4 months (May - August)
Location: Cambridge, ON (Onsite)
Range: $20.44 - $30.43

ATS Summary:
Within ATS Life Sciences Systems, what we do matters - we custom design, build and service critical automated solutions for medical device and pharmaceutical companies. Our customers are leaders in their industries and rely on us to deliver what we promise; to bring products to market faster with the highest quality. Together with our broad product range, financial strength, and global footprint, we provide the best automation solutions to our customers. Our Project Management team is looking for a motivated and ambitious student who thrives in a challenging but rewarding environment. Join our team!

Job Summary:
Reporting into Project Management, the Software Toolset Developer Co-op will design, develop, and maintain custom semi-automated tools that improve departmental accuracy and efficiency, specifically regarding project budgeting and forecasting. This role involves gathering requirements, building software tools to solve business problems, and ensuring seamless integration with our other tools, systems, and processes. You will also provide training, documentation, and ongoing support for these tools.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities:

Create user requirement specifications (URS) in cooperation with project management (PM) and other functional departments to define needs of departmental tools and dashboards
Develop, test, and launch custom semi-automated software tools
Collaborate with departmental leaders to understand improvement opportunities and document solutions to continuously improve the existing PM software tools
Create and deliver training/help documentation for the tools
Provide support for internal users and release patches to fix bugs
Document code changes and maintain the software in a version-controlled environment
Understand basics of our JDEdwards ERP system and how our tools interact with it
Interface with IT as needed to resolve API/external issues that affect the tools

Required Skills:

Education:

Working towards a post-secondary degree or equivalent, specializing in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Engineering.

Job Summary:

The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC), North America's third largest transit system and
recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA has introduced its new 2024-2028 TTC
Corporate Plan - Moving Toronto, Connecting Communities which continues the TTC's legacy
of delivering service to hundreds of millions of customers a year. The TTC's new vision and
mission statements also help promote the many environmental, social equity and economic
benefits that the TTC provides:
Vision: Moving Toronto towards a more equitable, sustainable, and prosperous future.
Mission: To serve the needs of transit riders by providing a safe, reliable, efficient, and
accessible mass public transit service through a seamless integrated network to create access
to opportunity for everyone.
At the TTC, our Early Talent programs provide students with the opportunity to work alongside
experts on exciting projects, gain an understanding on the transit industry, develop in-demand
skills and experiences and get an early start to your career. This is your chance to make a
meaningful impact on Toronto's transit!
The full Plan can be viewed on ttc.ca.
Please note: We are pleased to announce now that our co-op roles are now open to all
students! You do not need to be enrolled in a co-op program to apply. Eligibility requirements
include being eligible to work in Canada & enrollment at an accredited Canadian postsecondary
institution
General Accountability
The Information Technology Services (ITS) Department has an opportunity for a student with Information
Technology background. You will be able to expand your understanding of the Software Development
Life Cycle, application development and standards. You will be able to sharpen your analytical skills,
expand your systems design and interpersonal skills. Within a Microsoft Windows / Ubuntu client server
environment using .NET, CORE, C#, ASP.NET, MVC, REST APIs, JavaScript, Java, JQuery, Angular,
Mobile Development (React Native using Visual Studio Code and Android Studio, HTML 5.0/Json/React),
SQL programming, GIS related tools, you will maintain and develop Company Business Applications.
This position will provide practical experience in project methodology (from gathering and documenting
detailed requirements to implementing the application).

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities
- Coding program instructions in one or more of the following Windows and Mobile platforms using
.NET, CORE, C#, ASP.NET, MVC, REST APIs, Java, JQuery, JavaScript, Angular, Mobile
Development (React Native using Visual Studio Code and Android Studio, HTML
5.0/Json/React), SQL programming, Oracle SQL programming in a client server environment.
- Writing, debugging and testing coded programs.
- Establishing program requirements through the analysis of various technical systems, real time
systems and data base systems.
- Providing application documentation to the Development group. This may include documenting
business requirements, functional specifications and other related project documentation.
- Providing application training & operating instructions to the User groups.
- Adhering to the TTC's Software Development Life Cycle and application development policies
and standards
- Working and maintaining Geographic Information System (GIS)

Required Skills:

Skills
- Knowledge of the above mentioned programming languages in Windows and Mobile environment
and implementing applications in the client server environment.
- Practical and theoretical knowledge in spatial analysis; manipulation; data projection and
coordinate conversion,
- Developed communication, interpersonal, problem-solving, analytical and conceptual skills.
- Strong technical writing, language and grammar skills
- Enthusiastic attitude towards work, client relations and working in a team environment
Education and Experience
ENG-Software, ENG-Computer, MATH-Computer Science
Additional Requirements
- This position is best suited for students who work well both individually and with team members.
- Students will be required to complete a criminal background check during the onboarding stage,
satisfactory results will be required.
- You will be working under the supervision of the Supervisor Application Portfolio Management.
- A transportation pass will be provided for free transportation on the TTC system (24/7) throughout
the work term.
- Please include a cover letter with your application

Transportation and Housing:

PLEASE NOTE: Students are required to provide a current Police Clearance Letter prior to start date.
Transportation will be provided via a TTC Employee Pass.

Unrestricted Driver Licence
Security Clearance Required

Salary Scale: $25.61 to $31.98 per hour

Job Summary:

ABOUT THIS POSITION

The Product Designer II, Web will help define the vision for gaming websites, strengthening the current foundation as well as guiding us into the future.

WHY WORK AT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Our culture is centered on providing great opportunities to our employees so that everyone feels they are making a meaningful impact. Developing new and existing talent is our long-term focus. We are honored that our work environment has been consistently recognized as one of "Canada's Top 100 Employers". We summon you to join our elite team!

The rewards of joining Digital Extremes include:

Work on a live game and see your contributions in the game!
Work on a AAA game with world class talent and learn from the best.
Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
Virtual access to Dialogue, our mental wellness and healthcare services app.
Mentor Program to provide personal support while transitioning into your role at Digital Extremes.
Access to a range of discounts and savings on attractions, movies, theatres, and much more offered by Perkopolis.
Be part of "Giving Back" through a multitude of fundraising venues at DE.
Virtual events such as team building exercises, games night, live band performances, adult and separate children's holiday and summer parties for global teams!

ABOUT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Founded in 1993 by James Schmalz, Digital Extremes ranks as one of the world's top independent video game development studios. Originating with the co-creation of Epic Games' multi-million unit selling Unreal® franchise including Unreal and Unreal Tournament, Digital Extremes went on to develop Dark Sector®, BioShock® for the PlayStation®3, the BioShock 2 multiplayer campaign, and The Darkness® II. The studio has reached its greatest critical and commercial success with the free-to-play action game, Warframe®, boasting a global community of 75 million registered players on PC, PS4™, PS5™, Xbox One™, Xbox Series X/S™, Nintendo Switch™, and iOS™. The studio's most recently announced project is the much anticipated Soulframe®, an open-world action-fantasy MMORPG title that is currently under development.

Digital Extremes is headquartered in London, Ontario, Canada, and is proud to be selected as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers, achieving this recognition for the last ten years in a row.

For more information and exciting news related to Digital Extremes, please visit www.digitalextremes.com.

Job Responsibilities:

Participate in the creative process to define the vision for Warframe.com, from research to ideation to execution
Partner with our Lead Product Designer, Web and web team to collaborate on websites, game launchers, or other touchpoints for Warframe and upcoming/unreleased games while maintaining their unique brand, tone, and voice
Collaborate with various departments and teams to align goals and maintain consistency across the Warframe universe
Implement and uphold UX principles for web and mobile
Create flexible, screen-agnostic designs and prototypes in Figma
Other responsibilities as assigned

Required Skills:

Exceptional visual and technical understanding of the creation of graphic/product/web design materials
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for clear, inclusive, and collaborative feedback
Can prioritize and manage multiple workstreams simultaneously
Proficiency in Figma and the Adobe Creative Suite

Transportation and Housing:

Work Location is on a bus route.

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive hourly wages ranging between $20.00 - $27.00 CAD. Please note, Wages will vary based on factors such as experience, term, qualifications and specific role requirements.

Other perks include subsidized bus passes, in-office meals, and access to Dialogue.

ATS Summary:
Within ATS Life Sciences Systems, what we do matters - we custom design, build and service critical automated solutions for medical device and pharmaceutical companies. Our customers are leaders in their industries and rely on us to deliver what we promise; to bring products to market faster with the highest quality. Together with our broad product range, financial strength, and global footprint, we provide the best automation solutions to our customers.

Our Controls Engineering team is looking for a motivated and ambitious student who thrives in a challenging but rewarding environment. Join our team!

Job Summary:
As a member of a highly motivated, multi-disciplined team, you will work together to integrate world-class automation solutions. Duties may include integration of software with electrical and mechanical systems, process verification and acceptance testing of projects. Integration assignments involve leading-edge technologies and processes utilizing PLC's, PC's, robotics, motion controllers, vision systems, and other components.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities:

Perform system integration. This includes testing, configurating and integrating hardware and software components such as robots, analog devices, motion controllers, sensors, vision systems and pneumatic devices.
Assist with developing and updating real-time PLC / HMI control system software for automation equipment.
Use troubleshooting skills to root cause and resolve software and process issues.
Provide thorough validation of machine functionality to verify software program completeness.
Review software and machine functionality for compliance to customer requirements.
Provide accurate documentation for each project.
Work with other members of the automation team to continuously improve methods of integrating controls technology, with the goals being improved schedule, enhanced safety, value added functionality, and reduced cost.
Perform on-site commissioning and startup. This involves demonstrating the system's capability once the equipment has been shipped to the customer's site.

Required Skills:

Education:

Working towards a post-secondary degree, diploma or equivalent, specializing in Mechanical, Robotics, Computer or Systems Design Engineering with an interest in industrial control systems.

Required Skills:
Real-time controls, PLC programming, motion controls, vision programming, and/or robotic controls
HMI development (GUI).
A self-starter with the ability to work as part of a team with minimal supervision.
A drive to succeed and win!

Why Join ATS?
Be a part of a global organization that is an industry-leading automation solutions provider to many of the world's most successful companies.
Work with other bright, talented people and discover opportunities for professional growth
Comprehensive training including formal study and mentoring within your team
Subsidized breakfast and lunch daily; free gourmet beverages - coffee, tea and hot chocolate. Plus, treat day is every other week!
Ability to participate in a variety of charitable events
Receive three vacation days and two personal days
Social club that offers social events throughout the year
Fully equipped production facilities that are clean, quiet and climate controlled
Received the 2023 University of Waterloo Employer Impact on Innovation Award

Job Summary:

Seeking Computer Science Engineering Co-op students with a specialized focus on Artificial Intelligence, proficiency in Python and expertise in TensorFlow, Keras, YOLO, ManageDB, and basic data knowledge.

Job Responsibilities:

As part of our technical team, you will work on AI-related projects involving machine learning, deep learning, and computer vision, using Python as your primary programming language. Your responsibilities will encompass developing and fine-tuning AI models using TensorFlow and Keras, implementing real-time object detection with YOLO, and integrating these models into existing systems. In addition, your understanding of basic data science principles will enable you to analyze and extract valuable insights from datasets.
Knowledge in Power Platform is a plus because we will use Power Apps to create solutions for mobile, Power Automate to create some backend triggered automations and PowerBI to show data in enhanced dashboards. API skills also can be useful to create connectors to others systems running in the Tillsonburg facility.
Moreover, you will gain some experience in Microsoft SQL database management, including data modelling, indexing and query optimization, to support AI-driven applications. This position offers a unique opportunity to apply AI concepts, deep learning frameworks, Python, data science, and MS-SQL skills in a practical setting, making it an ideal starting point for those passionate about AI and the broader realm of data-driven technologies.
Fundamentals of statistical methods for data science are required to handle the information from the production lines. A minimum knowledge of computer networking is required to establish Ethernet connections using FTP, SSH and API applications.
Abide by all company polices including, but not limited to the following: Health and safety, Quality and Environmental Systems, Human resources policies, and Martinrea Employee Handbook
Ensure compliance with all applicable codes, standards and legislation including Environmental Legislation, O. Reg 851 for Industrial Establishments, and the Occupational Health and Safety Act (with emphasis on Section 28, (1) (a)-(d), (2) (a)-(c)).

Working Conditions:
90% Office environment,10% Plant floor (PPE required, we will supply a vest, glasses, safety sleeves, and gloves)
We are required to wear long pants (jeans, khakis, etc...), shirts with sleeves (no low cut or sleeveless), and CSA approved safety shoes. Any shoes are acceptable while in the office area, but the rest of the dress code must be followed throughout the building.

Back-up Duties:
Perform other duties as required

Required Skills:

Knowledge and Skills (Education):
Currently enrolled in a Post Secondary Education (Technical Community College or Undergrad Degree) in the one of the following:
Computer Engineering degree
Computer Science
Able to conduct independent projects
Strong communicator in the English language, both written and oral
Excellent organizational skills, and attention to detail
Strong time management skills
Fluent in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and Powerpoint)

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required

The salary will be in the range between $21 - $26 per hour

Compensation commensurate with CEE co-op earnings guide

Additional Employment Arrangement Location Information:

This is a remote internship position. However, the team meets in person every Wednesday at a co-working space in Downtown Toronto. For interns based in the GTA, attendance at these meetups is encouraged, with at least two in-person Wednesdays per month being mandatory.

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Special Job Requirements:

This job is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP) or Canada Summer Jobs. These programs require that candidates be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

Job Summary:

About Us
OpsLevel is on a mission to help development teams build more reliable software without sacrificing speed or standards. Founded by early engineers from PagerDuty with experience at Amazon and Shopify, OpsLevel was created to solve the challenges of microservices architecture and distributed ownership. From eliminating knowledge silos, helping standardize best practice, to allowing developers to self-service, the OpsLevel developer portal empowers teams to move quickly while maintaining consistency and best practices.

As a fully remote company with team members across North America, OpsLevel values empathy, a growth mindset, intellectual honesty, focus, and simplicity. The company prioritizes work-life balance, encouraging efficiency and quality over long hours.

This is an opportunity to gain hands-on experience at a growing startup with experienced mentors who are passionate about helping teams build better software.

About You:

You have a strong interest in technology and are eager to gain hands-on experience in building high-quality software. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work closely with experienced engineers and learn how a company operates and grows.
While your main focus will be writing software, you'll also have the chance to learn about different aspects of the business, including engaging with customers and helping to define and implement new features. OpsLevel operates with minimal process and structure, so you'll have the opportunity to see how decisions are made and how products are built from the ground up.
If you have side projects or a GitHub or GitLab account, we'd love to see what you've been working on!

Spring 2026, but start and end date can be flexible.

Job Responsibilities:

You'll be working as a software developer on our core product, reporting directly to the Director of Engineering. We're currently focused on upgrading our entire front end to use the latest technologies, improving performance, scalability, and user experience. This is an exciting opportunity to work with modern frameworks and tools while contributing to a high-impact project.

Some of the technologies you could be working with include:

Modern front-end frameworks like Vue.js
UI component libraries such as Ant Design
State management with Pinia and Vuex
Styling solutions like Tailwind CSS and CSS Modules
You'll have the chance to influence technical decisions and work closely with our design and back-end teams to create a seamless and responsive user experience.

Required Skills:

We're looking for candidates who are eager to learn and adapt quickly. While experience with the following technologies is a plus, it's not required, you should be comfortable learning on the job:

Ruby on Rails - our core back-end framework
Vue.js - our primary front-end framework
MySQL - relational database management
Redis - for caching and real-time data processing
GraphQL - for efficient API communication
Terraform - infrastructure as code
AWS / GCP - cloud infrastructure and deployment
Elasticsearch - for search and data indexing
OpenAI ChatGPT - for AI-powered automation and integration
GitHub Copilot - for AI-assisted coding
Git - version control and collaboration

We're more interested in your ability to learn and grow than in your existing experience with these tools.

Additional Information:

Security Clearance Required

The salary depends on the experience level of the intern. Our salary band is $32/hour - $37/hour.

Job Summary:

BDO Digital is looking for a Co-op or Intern, Technology - BizApps to join our Customer Engagement team under our Business Applications practice.

Our team is shaping a new generation of consultants who blend strategic thinking with practical execution. Our work helps organizations elevate customer experiences, refine how work gets orchestrated internally, and activate technologies such as CRM platforms to deliver measurable value. We focus on the sequencing, governance, and flow of work that enables teams to achieve the outcomes that matter most.

As AI transforms the consulting industry, we are committed to a value-driven approach that emphasizes results over billable hours. As part of our team, you will gain accelerated exposure to modern consulting practices, learning how to move seamlessly from strategy design into hands-on implementation. You will contribute to initiatives that improve how customers engage with organizations while helping clients execute in agile, outcome-oriented ways.

This is a net new role and responsibilities will include:

Collaborate with engagement teams to assess and enhance customer journeys, service models, and operational processes
Support development of future-state experience strategies using data, insights, and stakeholder input
Contribute to technology-enabled transformations such as CRM and related systems that improve workflow orchestration
Conduct research, stakeholder interviews, and workshops to gather diverse perspectives and requirements
Synthesize qualitative and quantitative information into structured insights that guide decision-making
Assist in activating strategic roadmaps and supporting agile delivery activities through organized coordination and communication
Create clear, concise deliverables (presentations, process maps, reports, playbooks) tailored to varied audiences including executives
Leverage AI tools to accelerate analysis, improve solutioning, and enhance personal productivity
Navigate ambiguity with a learning mindset, curiosity, and proactive problem-solving
Participate in ongoing skill development focused on consulting fundamentals, leadership growth, and effective team collaboration

Job Responsibilities:

How do we define success for your role?

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect & Collaboration
You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
You identify, recommend, & are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive & engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning & professional development.

Required Skills:

Your experience and education

Are currently working towards an undergraduate degree, focused in Commerce, Engineering, Computer Science, Technology, or other relevant program.
Exceptional communication skills with the ability to structure information logically and deliver it succinctly
Strong analytical thinking with the ability to transform ambiguity into clarity through frameworks and prioritization
Confident stakeholder engagement abilities with professionalism and adaptability across levels
Collaborative mindset paired with initiative and personal accountability
Comfort embracing feedback and addressing challenges constructively
Proficiency in core productivity and collaboration tools; willingness to work with AI as part of daily workflow
Who you are:
Driven to make a real impact early in your career and excited to help organizations improve customer and employee experiences
Curious, ambitious, and energized by solving complex problems that require both creativity and structured thinking
Confident yet humble, able to own your work while asking smart questions and learning from others
Excited by modern ways of working and the chance to influence how consulting evolves alongside AI advancement
Comfortable stepping into new situations, communicating directly, and building relationships with diverse groups of people
Motivated by growth and continuous improvement, always seeking the next skill, insight, or challenge to take on

Why BDO?

Our people-first approach to talent has earned us a spot among Canada's Top 100 Employersfor 2025. This recognition is a milestone we're thrilled to add to our collection of awards for both experienced and student talent experiences.

Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:
We enable you to engage with how we change and evolve, being a key contributor to the success and growth of BDO in Canada.
We help you become a better professional within our services, industries, and markets with extensive opportunities for learning and development.
We support your achievement of personal goals outside of the office and making an impact on your community.
Giving back adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community.

Total rewards that matter: We pay for performance with competitive total cash compensation that recognizes and rewards your contribution. We provide flexible benefits from day one, and a market leading personal time off policy. We are committed to supporting your overall wellness beyond working hours and provide reimbursement for wellness initiatives that fit your lifestyle.

Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Leader, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us.

Flexibility: All BDO personnel are expected to spend some of their time working in the office, at the client site, and virtually unless accommodations or alternative work arrangements are in place.

Our model is a blended approach designed to support the flexible needs of our people, the firm and our clients. It's about creating work experiences that meet everyone's needs and providing flexibility to adjust when, where and how we work to meet the expectations of our role.

Code of Conduct: Our Code of Conductsets clear standards for how we conduct business. It reflects our shared values and commitments and includes guiding principles to help us make ethical decisions and maintain trust with each other, our clients, and the public.

With your consent, BDO Canada may use AI technology (Microsoft Copilot) to transcribe during preliminary conversations, solely for the purpose of note-taking and not for other purposes, such as resume review, evaluation or selection of candidates.

More information on BDO Canada's Privacy Policy can be found here: Privacy Policy | BDO Canada

Compensation and Benefits:

The expected range of compensation for this role is $51,000-$78,000.

Special Job Requirements:

This job is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP) or Canada Summer Jobs. These programs require that candidates be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

Job Summary:

Are you passionate about making a real difference in the transition to a greener economy? Join us at Potentia Renewables, a dynamic, fully integrated renewable-energy company headquartered in Toronto, with roughly 90 employees. Our mission is to develop, own, manage and operate wind, solar and battery-storage assets that accelerate a sustainable future. While we are well-established, we're still nimble, and as an intern you'll get plenty of responsibility and ownership, not just a side seat.

In the role of Data Engineering & Analytics Intern, Asset Performance, you will play an instrumental role in helping us scale the shift toward clean energy. You'll dive deep into our real-time monitoring environment (Inductive Automation Ignition), enhance data pipelines (heavy Python/Pandas into TimescaleDB), and build executive-grade reporting that drives actionable insights. More than just coding, you'll be at the intersection of data engineering, software development and business analytics: automating processes, optimizing our performance, and translating high-velocity data streams into strategic decision-making.

Because we are a compact team in a fast-growing sector, this internship offers broad exposure to many parts of the business. Working alongside experienced operators, analysts, and business managers, you'll apply agile principles to design and deliver your own features and tools. Throughout the term, you'll strengthen your technical toolkit in data engineering, software development, reporting automation, and pipeline optimization, while also deepening your business understanding of renewable-energy technology, asset performance metrics, and executive-level reporting.

If you're a university student ready to learn fast, take initiative and contribute meaningfully to the energy transition, this internship is your chance to gain hands-on experience and real impact.

Spring 2026 - May 11 to August 21, 2026

Job Responsibilities:

Data Engineering & Analytics (~50%)

Enhance Python/Pandas/PySpark/Jython/SQL ETL pipelines that load multi-gigabyte wind and solar datasets into PostgreSQL/TimescaleDB/MariaDB.
Develop automated analytical tools that detect potential performance issues and ensure data completeness, consistency, and reliability across assets.
Investigate data anomalies, perform root-cause analyses, and automate alerting to frontline teams.

SCADA & Ignition Development (~30%)
Design and iterate Perspective dashboards with clean, intuitive UI/UX.
Maintain and optimise Ignition gateways, tag providers, historians, and MQTT/OPC UA data paths to ensure data reliability.
Diagnose communication issues and recommend reliability upgrades that keep turbines and inverters online.

Reporting & Business Support (~20%)
Automate weekly and monthly KPI reports (wind/solar production, availability, energy losses) for senior leadership and other financial stakeholders.
Gather requirements from and share insight with Operations staff, translating business needs into technical solutions.
Document standard operating procedures and present findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
Reconcile SCADA data with ISO market feeds to streamline invoicing and settlement processes.

Note: You will focus on a subset of these responsibilities depending on business priorities during your term.

Required Skills:

Required Qualifications

Education

Major in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering
We're looking for students with a strong academic record.

Technical Skills
Proficient in Python; willing to apply skills in Jython.
Prior experience using Pandas or PySpark is strongly preferred.
Knowledge of basic SQL is a requirement; experience using PostgreSQL and/or time-series databases is an asset.
Prior knowledge of Git version control, agile development, cloud-based infrastructure management (AWS) and/or industrial SCADA protocols is valued but not required.

Analytical & Professional Skills
Demonstrated ability to convert complex data into clear business insights.
Strong written and verbal communication; able to tailor messaging to diverse audiences.
Proven capacity for independent problem-solving, prioritization, and follow-through.
Experience using generative-AI tools (ChatGPT/Codex, Cursor, etc.) to accelerate coding is an asset.

Passion for Renewables
Evidence of interest in wind, solar, or carbon-reduction.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required


Compensation and Benefits:

$22-$24 / hour (plus 4% Vacation Pay), Employee Assistance Program (Telus), Workperks (Venngo)

Job Summary:

Mobile Data Technologies, an Alberta Venture "Fastest 50" Company is seeking a Coop Software Developer to keep pace with expanding sales and product development. The primary responsibility for this position will be to design, create and maintain software systems. This developer will work remotely within Canada.

MDT has become the leader in control systems for a variety of equipment in the oil and gas industry. Using a combination of hardware and software controls, their unique, easy-to-use control interfaces are in high demand. By building on a core framework of control and HMI software, they are rapidly deploying an increasing number of control applications to an expanding market.

What's in it for you?

Great potential for personal growth
An entrepreneurial environment, open to new ideas and expanding technologies
An industry leading software platform with leading edge technologies
Interesting, complex control problems to solve
A commitment to fun (are you the next foosball champion?)
An excellent remuneration package
A dynamic leadership team, fostering success
It's true: this isn't just your typical nine to five job. This position is for someone who is ready to take control over their career. An amazing path is ready and waiting for the right candidate. Is it you?

Job Responsibilities:

Day-to-Day Responsibilities Can Include:

Build industrial control software with cutting-edge technology in real-time embedded systems and windows applications.
Work in a highly team-oriented environment using an Agile SCRUM software development model
Understand our customer's environment and industry to design software that they will love using
Research and prototyping new technologies for application in our control systems
Oversee the architecture and design of the control platform and its services
Work with hardware engineers to mesh hardware and software into an exception control experience
Develop a service-oriented platform with reusable control modules to accelerate future project development
Make tactical updates to company software products with guidance and coaching as a member of the software development team
Design, develop and test system interfaces utilizing various computer languages
Work with customers and/or operators for requirements gathering including operational and functional details
Deliver user-centered, clean, simple, responsive, and intuitive interfaces with optimized code

Required Skills:

Desired Skills & Qualifications:

Skilled in programming using C# (WPF) and C++ in both Windows and Unix environments
Experience with Agile SCRUM software methodology
Knowledge of interface security including SCP, SFTP, FTP, SSL
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to relate effectively with all disciplines at all levels of the company
Motivated self-starter who can manage their time effectively
Personal growth potential that can keep pace with the expanding needs of the company and the business
Have a good understanding of real world electrical sensors and hardware (transducers, A/D input devices, analog outputs, etc.) or a keen interest in learning about them
Experience or knowledge of Real Time Operating Systems (RTOS) and low level protocols (CAN bus, Modbus)

Transportation and Housing:

The job is 100% remote, work from home environment.
Equipment will be 100% employer supplied - laptop, dock, monitors, keyboard, mouse.

Compensation and Benefits:

This is a full time position with an expected commitment of 40 hours per week.
Pay is CAD $27/hour with 3 Paid Vacation days included.

Job Summary:

ABOUT THIS POSITION

We are looking for a Web Developer Co-op to join our team! The Web Developer Co-op will have a passion for creating innovative and engaging web products, day-dream about exciting ways to extend gaming experiences and communities to the web, and will love building and extending websites and interactive experiences.

WHY WORK AT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Our culture is centered on providing great opportunities to our employees so that everyone feels they are making a meaningful impact. Developing new and existing talent is our long-term focus. We are honored that our work environment has been consistently recognized as one of "Canada's Top 100 Employers". We summon you to join our elite team!

The rewards of joining Digital Extremes include:

Work on a live game and see your contributions in the game!
Work on a AAA game with world class talent and learn from the best.
Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
Virtual access to Dialogue, our mental wellness and healthcare services app.
Mentor Program to provide personal support while transitioning into your role at Digital Extremes.
Access to a range of discounts and savings on attractions, movies, theatres, and much more offered by Perkopolis.
Be part of "Giving Back" through a multitude of fundraising venues at DE.
Virtual events such as team building exercises, games night, live band performances, adult and separate children's holiday and summer parties for global teams!

ABOUT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Founded in 1993 by James Schmalz, Digital Extremes ranks as one of the world's top independent video game development studios. Originating with the co-creation of Epic Games' multi-million unit selling Unreal® franchise including Unreal and Unreal Tournament, Digital Extremes went on to develop Dark Sector®, BioShock® for the PlayStation®3, the BioShock 2 multiplayer campaign, and The Darkness® II. The studio has reached its greatest critical and commercial success with the free-to-play action game, Warframe®, boasting a global community of 75 million registered players on PC, PS4™, PS5™, Xbox One™, Xbox Series X/S™, Nintendo Switch™, and iOS™. The studio's most recently announced project is the much anticipated Soulframe®, an open-world action-fantasy MMORPG title that is currently under development.

Digital Extremes is headquartered in London, Ontario, Canada, and is proud to be selected as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers, achieving this recognition for the last ten years in a row.

For more information and exciting news related to Digital Extremes, please visit www.digitalextremes.com.

Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for developing and maintaining our game and company website front end and back end.
Work with marketing team on creation of site and page layout/user interface.
Creation and development of game web infrastructure services (APIs).
Implement web systems using PHP (Laravel) / Javascript / HTML / CSS (SCSS).
Help develop systems related to QA, localization, optimization of sites.
Collaborate with other team members to identify and implement features and functionality that create a unique and superior web experience for our customers.
Contribute innovative and original ideas toward all aspects of the game and company's web presence.
Routine daily maintenance of existing site(s).
Write robust, maintainable code.
Other roles and responsibilities as assigned.

Required Skills:

Rapid web development using PHP (Laravel), HTML, MongoDB, JavaScript, CSS (SCSS), and SQL.
Familiarity with source control systems such as Git.
Working experience in databases, preferably MongoDB.
Understands the benefits of SEO and the development skills to support SEO.
Experience with Apache in a Linux based environment.
Knowledge of security and authentication protocols.
Strong communication skills, work ethic and motivation.
Must be a detail oriented self starter, able to manage multiple tasks and deadlines in a fast paced environment.
Passion for working in the games industry and playing great games.

Transportation and Housing:

Work Location is on a bus route.

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive hourly wages ranging between $21.00 - $33.00 CAD. Please note, Wages will vary based on factors such as experience, term, qualifications and specific role requirements.

Other perks include subsidized bus passes, in-office meals, and access to Dialogue.
