Job Summary:

Interface is looking for generalist founding engineers (ml, data, full-stack) who are scrappy, push boundaries and have a need to win. We need to work hard and build quick to win. We want people to challenge our ideas and build alternatives. LFG!!

real talk:

you'll work with the founding team and customers directly
the users' needs are more important than cool features and/or hype
the whole team works 6 days a week at our office
you'll be in SF: a lot of work, great weather and best tech ecosystem in the world

Interface is the autonomous safety expert for the industrial world. Here's what that actually means: we're building an expert that finds and fixes errors in industrial documentation; in the near future, we'll do the same with digital twins. We're creating an AI-powered auditing platform that fixes errors in regulatory documents, CAD files, and beyond. You'll be working at the intersection of LLMs, computer vision, and data pipelines to automate compliance in industries where failure is not an option.

Join our funded SF-based team working with global industrial partners. You'll help create a product that industrial giants rely on to prevent accidents, save lives, and reshape how they operate. https://getinterface.ai

Job Responsibilities:

what you'll do:

speak to users/customers about their experience / problems / needs
architect systems used daily by thousands of folks at $B+ companies
build agent-swarm data pipelines that autonomously audit millions of documents
maintain infrastructure that scales
ship fast - because perfectionism kills progress.

Required Skills:

soft skills:

make two-way door decisions quickly
fix things before being told they're broken
have built real things that people use
thrive in chaos
hard skills:
be comfortable with our stack (tsx, py, docker, llms, yolo, tesseract, postgresql, aws, react native ...)
product- and insights-driven frontend development (typescript + react native)
experience with LLMs, AI agents, and evals

- $30-70/hr USD.

- Travelling on site to visit customers across the US & Canada

Job Summary:

Arista Networks is an exciting, fast-growing company creating the best software and hardware for running modern datacenter networks. Based in California with a Canadian office in Burnaby, British Columbia. It is run by Silicon Valley veterans and industry titans Andy Bechtolsheim, Ken Duda, and Jayshree Ullal. Arista is developing a new class of integrated network solutions to address the scalability, performance, and reliability requirements of large-scale high performance computing and cloud datacenters. Arista plays a key role in the datacenters of companies ranging from Facebook to Microsoft, from AOL to Comcast, from ESPN to Netflix, from Citigroup to Morgan Stanley.

Check out https://www.arista.com/en/careers/university/engineering-internship to learn more about our internship program.

What's Cool at Arista?
*Cloud* *Software Defined Networks* *Network Virtualization*
Empowered engineers. Our engineers are empowered with full responsibility for their projects. Our management structure is flat and lightweight -- you are in charge of delivering your work from design to code to test to customer shipment.

Insane amount of automation! We have run close to 20 million tests in our mini-data center that operates 24/7. We put a premium on building and using tools that make everyone super-productive. This translates into quicker turn around times on new features and products for increased revenue with smaller teams.

We value openness. No part of the company is off-limits, meaning that our engineers have the chance to work on a variety of different areas. All our interns have the same responsibility as our full timers and get to work side-by-side on important, customer-impacting projects.

Job Responsibilities:

The Job
Software engineers at Arista deliver product features. The core responsibility is writing the code that drives our products. A software engineer is more than just a coding machine; they drive the whole development process including

Deciding the features to build
Driving the design
Writing the code (duh!) and testing
Documenting the feature
Supporting customers in the field

Along the way, you might
Extend and improve the test infrastructure
Hack on our engineering tools, including p4, django, python, rpm, ...
Work with sales and business development

Example Projects
We don't have time for busy work: every project that we do has customers clamoring for it. Along with quick release cycles and an engineer-oriented culture means we always have a slew of interesting projects to tackle. What project you'll work on at Arista will vary a lot depending on our customer demands and your interests. Here are some sample potential projects:

1) Latency Based Routing (Networking Protocol)

Our switches run routing protocols that program the hardware with the nexthop for forwarding packets. The nexthop determination is based on some metric of proximity or cost to the destination. For example, the Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) protocol relies on the Dijkstra's algorithm to minimize the number of hops to reach a destination.

With Latency Based Routing, the preferred path to a destination has the lowest aggregate delay across several hops. Precautions must be taken to ensure that the protocol converges fast on network events and stable to avoid constant changes in the preferred path. This feature is important for latency sensitive applications run by, for example, financial customers who connect to stock exchanges in multiple locations (New York, Chicago, Tokyo) and demand the lowest delays for receiving market information.

2) Redefining Load Balancing for Future Applications (Networking Protocol)

The Internet is glued together by the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) and Equal Cost Multi Path (ECMP) has been the backbone of resilient network topologies by allowing multiple paths to a destination. With ECMP, the failure of a few links have little impact as the traffic transitions to the remaining links.
Customers are now demanding link bandwidth aware traffic load balancing through the Unequal Cost Multi Path (UCMP) extension to BGP which is cutting-edge technology on track to become an RFC standard. The project involves adding ability to match and set/tweak bandwidth advertisements in the BGP policy engine to allow UCMP formation.

3) Shared Strings (Software Infrastructure)

Arista is always concerned about memory efficiency as our switches don't have hard drives, and thus cannot page memory to disk. This means that when you run out of memory, you are hosed. And, as we add more features, we consume more memory. One way we could possibly reduce memory is shared strings. This would be a table per process that contains all unique strings instantiated. Whenever you go to instantiate a new string this table would be checked to see if that string already exists and if so, return a pointer to it. This table would have to be very efficient both in speed and size. Another benefit of this approach is that string comparisons could be very fast: O(1) address comparisons instead of O(length of string) character comparisons.

4) Programmable Operating System on a Switch (Software Defined Networks)

EOS SDK: Arista's EOS operating system is the first truly extensible network operating system on top of Linux. In addition to the standard Linux APIs, the SDK provides a set of higher-level APIs to enable third party developers to write their agents that run in EOS. It's a set of stable, versioned APIs published on GitHub, available both in C++ and Python. Our largest cloud customers leverage EOS SDK to integrate their custom orchestration, automated-management, and provisioning systems with Arista switches.
A significant fraction of today's Internet traffic is delivered to you using custom SDN applications that the largest cloud companies such as Netflix or Facebook built using EOS SDK. Projects here involve significant contributions to the maturing EOS SDK by developing new APIs to configure EOS. Your changes will be on GitHub in our EosSdk repository!

5) Rethinking and Redesigning (The Go Revolution)

Arista has a large C++ and Python codebase. Over the past year we've been implementing a lot of building blocks in Go in order to make this language a third option in our tool box. This project gives you the chance to rethink in pretty fundamental ways how various key software components in EOS work under the hood as Go enables us to easily explore alternate development and concurrency models. Come join the Go revolution at Arista.

6) In-service FPGA Upgrade of Modular Components (Talking to Hardware)

Arista's modular systems have hot swappable components which are inserted or removed on run-time with little performance impact to the system. Such components have FPGAs that are programmed by the hardware team and we would like the ability to easily and reliably upgrade the FPGA image on our products in the field with latest enhancements. This project will give you a chance to get really close to hardware and understand how the system initializes itself.

7) VMTracer ACLs (Cloud Datacenter)

Arista is dedicated to supporting datacenter deployments of our customers. Our integration with a VMWare server keeps the switch informed of the MAC addresses of different virtual machines. The switch monitors the traffic to locate and detect migrations of virtual machines. With this VMTracer capability, an EOS switch can keep specified virtual machines in the same virtual LAN (VLAN) segment.
The VMTracer ACLs project provides the ability to seamlessly migrate Access Control List configuration for virtual machines when they migrate. A simple access control list, for example, allows traffic on port 80 for web-server virtual machines or on port 3306 for MySql virutal machines.

8) KernelNetworkInfo agent (Kernel related)

Initially we had a state machine to pull the interfaces/ip addresses/ARP state from the kernel. This state machine had to be instantiated for each VRF in a lot of agents. The state machine setup a netlink socket with the kernel (for each VRF) which created a lot of contention on a lock in the kernel because we had lots of agents that needed to be notified for each configuration change. To address this, the KernelNetworkInfo agent was created that is responsible for getting the kernel state and pushing it into user address space. This way we only have one netlink socket per VRF in KernelNetworkInfo and all the agents could use the same information to read/react on the kernel state. That helped drastically reduce the contention and solved a lot of issues that were caused by that such as processes getting blocked.

More Info
You can find out more information about Arista on our website at http://www.arista.com/en/careers/university.

Cares about the business too

You have (or want to have) experience with some set of
C / C++

Our mission is to "Connect the World through Games" by building a truly social experience that makes the world a better place. To be successful in this role you will have a passion for games, a high level of integrity, great technical depth and skills, and a strong desire to build successful software.

Zynga developers don't just develop some of the world's largest games, we deliver them on some of the world's largest infrastructures. We blaze trails in all facets of game design, web technologies, and massive scalability. Zynga faces a number of challenges unique to our situation: the large data requirements of online gaming require us to continually push boundaries to discover the best solutions. Our developers are willing to pick up any of the languages, technologies, or methodologies necessary to smite a challenge. If a conventional solution doesn't exist, we innovate as necessary!

However, base pay offered is based on market location, and may vary further depending on individualized factors for job candidates, such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. Job Summary:

About Huawei
With 194,000 employees and operating in more than 170 countries and regions, Huawei is a leading global creator and provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. Integrated solutions span across four key domains - telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services. Huawei is committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

About Huawei Canada
Huawei Canada focuses on fundamental research and development aimed at solving complex technical problems in emerging technologies like 5G, AI, Human Computer Interaction and Autonomous Driving. With ongoing research initiatives with 10 Universities across Canada and strategic collaboration agreements with several Universities, we support Canada's rich research community. In 2020, Huawei Canada ranked among the Top 20 corporate R&D investors in the country with a huge 40% increase in R&D investment year over year. Huawei Canada was established in 2008 and now has a total workforce of 1,200 in our six research

About the team
Founded in 2012, the Noah's Ark lab has evolved into a prominent research organization with notable achievements in academia and industry. The lab's mission focuses on advancing artificial intelligence and related fields to benefit the company and society. Driven by impactful, long-term projects, the aim is to enhance state-of-the-art research while integrating innovations into the company's products and services, including LLMs, RL, NLP, computer vision, AI theory, and Autonomous driving.

Job Responsibilities:

About the job:

Research new style Network Filesystem storage, develop metadata management service and workload-aware data and metadata access optimization algorithm.
Perform system testing for high available and reliable data storage solution.
Develop problem determination solution and drive toward root cause identification and resolution on storage environment.
Work as part of a high performance, startup-like team mainly using Python/C++ for development.

Required Skills:

About the ideal candidate:

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, and registered with the school's co-op program.
Knowledge and experience in AI/LLM and storage system, operating system structures.
Good understanding of file system and LLM processing, such as, metadata layout, LLM inference flow.
Proficient in C, C++, and Python programming.
Strong research capability and ability to learn new technologies/products quickly.
Ability to handle complex tasks by assessing issues and breaking down problems to reach an optimal solution.

Job Summary:

We're searching for an Intern Product Manager for our locations throughout North America who can bring Zynga's games to the forefront of the industry: creating unforgettable social experiences, connecting hundreds of millions of people throughout the world and delighting its users through games. Equipped with user data, the Product Manager will have the creative freedom to provide experience, direction, and measurable performance to the game design process, resulting in creating high quality casual games for millions. This role will work on Words With Friends.

Job Responsibilities:

Zynga's Product Managers are responsible for the full product/game life cycle, from writing specifications, working across multi-disciplinary teams: design, art, and engineering to launch core features within our existing and new games! They must exhibit sound product judgment, ability to formulate product strategy, and present clear measurable objectives that will lead to achieving our business goals. In addition, they will also be expected to provide valuable input into business cases based on in-depth data analysis and demonstrate how that analysis impacts key product metrics. Above all, we want Product Managers who are highly passionate about creating the best experience for our users. This is a highly impactful role where you have an opportunity to change the way the world plays!
Zynga is known for its data-driven culture, its entrepreneurial mindset, and its fast-paced, challenging work environment where each individual can make a difference. We value strong analytical skills, problem-solving and quantitative ex

Enthusiastic, performance-driven self-starter and team player

The pay range for this position in Toronto, Ontario at the start of employment is expected to be between CAD 32 and 37 per hour.

Regular, full-time employees are also eligible for a range of benefits at the Company, including: medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance coverage; 14 paid holidays per calendar year; paid vacation time per calendar year (ranging from 15 to 25 days) or eligibility to participate in the Company's discretionary time off program; up to 10 paid sick days per calendar year; paid parental and compassionate leave; wellbeing programs for mental health and other wellness support; family planning support through Maven; commuter benefits; and reimbursements for fitness-related expenses.

Job Summary:

This employer is an Employer Impact Awards (EIA) winner for Impact in Sustainability.

The opportunity
Do you want to use your technical skills and curiosity about markets to work and build tools for a software-based trading portfolio?
We are Quantitative Strategies and Research (QSR), an innovation-driven team within Capital Markets at Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan. We manage a broad and diversified portfolio, built using quantitative models. Development and maintenance of these models requires a unique combination of investment knowledge and technical software skills. We are looking for an intern to join our technology team this winter for an 8-month term. The technology team is called Capital Markets Investment Analytics (CMIA)and is a sub-team within QSR.

We have varied educational backgrounds and research interests, and we are all passionate about understanding what drives markets and using tools like data science, statistics, and technology to test and run our ideas. We are working on a lot of different projects - whether you are an undergrad curious about quantitative investing or a graduate student with advanced technical abilities, we have something for you!

Who you'll work with
QSR is a team of 15, based in Toronto. You will work alongside investment professionals in a world-class quantitative investment team with a focus on automated algorithmic trading systems and software engineering infrastructure. We work very close together in an open and collaborative research & development environment. We are entrepreneurial, tight knit, and have a performance driven culture. You will be mentored and guided by senior members of the CMIA team.

You will also interact with the Solution Engineering team, who work closely with the QSR team to support their technological needs.

Job Responsibilities:

What you'll do

Improve and work on our internal proprietary investment strategy codebase under the guidance of senior colleagues in CMIA.
The code you will work on directly supports investment functions including but not limited to: proprietary investment strategies, automated algorithmic trading, portfolio management, order management, risk analysis, automated reporting, profit and loss analysis, performance attribution, portfolio analytics, quantitative strategies research & implementation, regression tests, investment reporting.
Proactively look for areas of improvement and bring new ideas to the team through analysis and research.
Investigate and attribute portfolio profit and loss to various strategies and factors.
Work on a variety of datasets (e.g., sourcing, cleaning, visualization).
Work with researchers to create, tune and maintain quantitative models to aid in improved investment outcomes.
Gain experience in one or several asset classes, including equities, fixed income, currencies, and commodities.
Contribute to the development and optimization of our portfolio implementation infrastructure and analytical tools.

Required Skills:

What you'll need

To be enrolled in undergraduate or graduate program in quantitative discipline such as Engineering or Computer Science.
Strong interest in financial markets and quantitative investment.
Strong motivation to learn about systematic investment strategies and automated trading system.
Strong programming skills in a variety of modern programming languages, with a preference for Python, MATLAB, and JavaScript.
Solid understanding of software engineering concepts and techniques, including design patterns, object-oriented programming, database, and version control systems.
Highly creative, entrepreneurial, and resourceful.
You should be returning back to your studies after the work term is completed

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation:
The expected hourly range for this role is $30 - $36 depending on experience and qualifications.

What we're offering

Numerous opportunities for professional growth and development, including lunch and learns
Student led team building events on a monthly basis
Employee discount programs including Edvantage and Perkopolis

Job Summary:

About Huawei
With 194,000 employees and operating in more than 170 countries and regions, Huawei is a leading global creator and provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. Integrated solutions span across four key domains - telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services. Huawei is committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

About Huawei Canada
Huawei Canada focuses on fundamental research and development aimed at solving complex technical problems in emerging technologies like 5G, AI, Human Computer Interaction and Autonomous Driving. With ongoing research initiatives with 10 Universities across Canada and strategic collaboration agreements with several Universities, we support Canada's rich research community. In 2020, Huawei Canada ranked among the Top 20 corporate R&D investors in the country with a huge 40% increase in R&D investment year over year. Huawei Canada was established in 2008 and now has a total workforce of 1,200 in our six research

About the team
Founded in 2012, the Noah's Ark lab has evolved into a prominent research organization with notable achievements in academia and industry. The lab's mission focuses on advancing artificial intelligence and related fields to benefit the company and society. Driven by impactful, long-term projects, the aim is to enhance state-of-the-art research while integrating innovations into the company's products and services, including LLMs, RL, NLP, computer vision, AI theory, and Autonomous driving.

Good verbal & written communication skill is a must.

Job Summary:

Texas Instruments (TI) is the world leader in Digital Signal Processors (DSP), Microcontroller (MCU) solutions and Analog Chips. With these technologies TI is fueling today's fastest-growing markets, from electric vehicles and industrial robots to solar panels and satellites.

Texas Instruments Canada (TI Canada located in downtown Toronto) is looking for early in career talent to join our team. Be at the forefront of software architecture design and gain first-hand exposure to application development through TI's Software Engineering Tools team. The industry leading tools we create help our customers be successful in their markets. Code Composer Studio and our cloud tools portal (dev.ti.com) are key to our customer's development efforts. TI Canada has a small company environment with all the resources of a large multi-national corporation. Our Toronto office combines an exceptional workspace with a dynamic culture that creates many opportunities for its employees. Our casual and dynamic working environment is located in downtown Toronto and is easily accessible by subway, streetcar, and GO Transit.

What You Will Gain:
As part of our software tools design team in Toronto you'll learn the essentials of PC software application development. The PC and cloud-based tools you create will interface with embedded processors giving you exposure to these exciting areas.

You will gain knowledge of the following:

Foundational software development processes and life-cycle
Desktop application software development of a complex, multi-layer system
Your activities may require you work with embedded hardware and associated software.
You will be working closely with the development team to design, implement and test tool features.
We use a variety of technologies with TypeScript, React, and C++ being the most common for the current tools.

Job Responsibilities:

As a developer on our Toronto team, you'll become a contributor where your skills and input impact TI products and customers. In this role your contributions will enable Texas Instruments to deliver quality desktop and cloud products to customers for implementing, debugging and analyzing embedded software solutions. You will gain experience with desktop and cloud-based embedded tooling. Work side-by-side with a team of experienced developers on cutting edge technologies.

Required Skills:

Desired Skills and Qualifications
You must be working towards a University degree from an accredited school in Ontario with a focus on one or more of the following: computer science, computer engineering, software engineering, data science, statistics, mathematics, physics, mechatronics, systems design, AI or other relevant degree.

Demonstrated strong analytical problem-solving skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions
Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery
Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Ability to take the initiative and drive for results
Technology stack includes TypeScript/JavaScript, React, Node.js, C++, and VS Code.
Knowledge and experience working in Windows, Linux and Mac OS environments would be useful

Transportation and Housing:

Student is responsible for own housing and transportation. Relocation bonus may be available.

Additional Information:

Other	local police check required, keep receipt for reimbursement

Compensation and Benefits:

BA - range is $33 to $36/ hour plus full time benefits and pension matching
Masters is $38/hour plus full time benefits and pension matching

Interns receive competitive hourly compensation as well as they receive the same benefits as a full time employee - including 100% employer paid Single Medical, Single Dental, Single Vision and Single Pharmacy coverages. TI also offers a highly subsidized Family plan as well.

Texas Instruments offers a generous Pension Matching program wherein you can begin to build your retirement wealth from an early age. Pension matching is free money that can double your input and work for you in the long run. It is yours to take with you, no vesting or withholding.

Texas Instruments Canada in Toronto is a highly engaged workplace with multiple team events every year including optional, free, weekly sports lunch at the USRC (volley, hockey and soccer on rotation) as well as employee led pool and foosball tournaments. Our employee breakroom is complete with pool table, foosball table and TV with game console as well as an assortment of free candies, cookies, snacks, teas, coffees, pops and juices.

Job Summary:

Altera is hiring! As modern FPGAs become increasingly like a SoC, Altera's IP Systems and Solutions Engineering (IPSS) team develops comprehensive solutions to provide customers easy and efficient access to the capabilities of Altera's FPGA devices. These solutions are provided as highly configurable intellectual property IP cores that are fully integrated with Altera's software CAD tool, Quartus Prime. The IP Cores we develop include Memory Interfaces (such as DDR5, LPDDR5, or HBM), custom chip-to-chip interfaces for high-speed ADC/DAC tiles (for radar processing), and leading-edge transceiver interfaces (to enable Ethernet, PCIe, and other protocols).

Altera's IP cores provide configurable access to these high-speed, high-bandwidth interfaces, leveraging dedicated and specialized silicon subsystems in the FPGA. The constantly rising speed and complexity of memory devices, chip-to-chip, and transceiver interfaces presents a challenging design problem that requires system level knowledge of silicon, software, IP, and customer applications. As an IP Design Engineering Intern, you will work with a team of engineers to develop and verify state-of-the-art memory interface, chip-to-chip, or transceiver-based IP cores. You will be working on advanced device architectures, design definition, implementation, and verification. You will also be developing design examples and simulation models, accompanied by a rich set of technical documentation.

Job Responsibilities:

Your specific responsibilities can include, but are not limited to the following:

Architecture and Design based on the latest protocol specifications for memory, chip-to-chip, or transceiver interfaces
RTL development
Device support and CAD tool integration
Verification (e.g. verification IP, methodologies, frameworks, bus functional models, regression tests)
Hardware power-on and debug
New product release and rollout support, customer technical support.

Required Skills:

The candidate should possess the following behavioral traits:

Strong skills in communication, initiative, innovation, and teamwork
Highly motivated to learn and adapt to fast-changing technologies and environments

At OPTrust, paying pensions today, preserving pensions for tomorrow is our mission and business.

Job Responsibilities:

About the Role
This position offers an exceptional opportunity for an individual with a mindset for learning and continuous improvement to make a significant impact within the Completion Portfolio Strategies team. As part of the Total Portfolio Management, our team develops quantitative strategies and allocates to external investment managers across all asset classes to optimize the Total Portfolio. The successful candidate will employ a wide range of quantitative skills and financial expertise to develop systematic strategies and portfolio construction framework. Training will be provided on OPTrust procedures, systems and work processes. Students will also participate in OPTrust's orientation and campus program.

What You'll Do

Actively contribute to the full research cycle of the systematic strategies, including idea generation, model development, stakeholder collaboration, and model implementation.
Facilitate the portfolio construction for the external manager strategies, including performance & risk analysis, factor attribution, portfolio simulation, and scenario analysis.
Contribute to the R&D of investment infrastructure in combination with alternative data and advanced analytical techniques, to advance decision-making.
Support team in ad-hoc tasks such as data visualization, performance monitoring, and market analysis.

Required Skills:

What You Bring

Senior undergraduate students or master's students in finance, computer engineering, mathematics, or data science co-op program or scheduled to graduate Spring 2026 for a new grad internship.
Broad knowledge of financial markets and some experience in capital markets or investment management.
Demonstrated success in delivering practical solutions to solve problems in financial markets or social science fields.
Proficiency in Python.
A team player with effective communication and time management skills.
Exemplify OPTrust's values: collaboration and teamwork, integrity, respect, flexibility, excellence, and continuous improvement.
Preferred Technical Qualifications:
Working towards the completion of CFA, FRM, or CAIA certifications.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as PowerBI.

The student will contribute to key initiatives, including the development of customized business reports using Power BI, supporting the implementation of a new Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) tool, assisting in IT audit activities, and contributing to IT risk management and internal controls. A self-disciplined and result-oriented approach to meeting deadlines and delivering high-quality work is essential for success in this role. Training will be provided on OPTrust procedures, systems and work processes. Students will also participate in OPTrust's orientation and campus program.

What you'll do

IT Governance, Risk and Control:

Assist with the maintenance and support of our GRC tool, including tasks such as user access attestation, risk register documentation, configuration updates, and issue tracking.
Support the annual review of baseline standards and collaborate with applicable teams to ensure that security and compliance protocols are up-to-date and aligned with industry best practices.
Support IT risk assessments, track mitigation progress, and maintain the IT risk register.
Schedule monthly IT risk management meetings and capture meeting minutes/action items.
Audit Activities:
Assist in annual IT and internal audits, with the opportunity to respond to audit requests from accounting firms (e.g., PwC, BDO).
Collaborate on the remediation of audit findings, actively contributing to the resolution processes, and communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders regarding audit evidence and documentation.
Continue and/or enhance prior year audit evidence working papers in excel and document business processes.
Internal Controls:
Support Change Management and Access Attestation by collecting evidence, reviewing documentation, and assessing the operating effectiveness of IT controls.
Participate in ITOS-driven initiatives or projects related to process automation, process enhancement, and risk mitigation.
Learn about the asset management strategy and support by introducing more controls around the Configuration Management Database (CMDB), building automatic alerts and reminders in ManageEngine, and documenting new controls and processes.
Process Improvement & Project Support:
Support business analysis, project management, and project coordination roles in process enhancement and automation projects
Security Governance:
Assist in evaluating the effectiveness of IT and security operations.

Required Skills:

What you bring

Enrolled in a registered university or college IT, Information Security, Business, Audit, Risk Management, or related co-op program.
Knowledge or coursework in IT General Control (ITGC), Cybersecurity, IT Risk Management, Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC), Change Management, and Access Control is an asset.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including functions such as pivot tables and VLOOKUP, with data analysis capabilities.
Effective analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Experience with GRC tools such as offerings from Workiva, ServiceNow, or AuditBoard considered an asset.
This role can provide approved work experience towards the ISACA certifications (CISA, CRISC).
Exemplify OPTrust's values: collaboration and teamwork, integrity, respect, flexibility, excellence, and continuous improvement.
This posting is for an existing vacancy.

The range of expected compensation for this position is $720.00 to $1,285.00 per week.

Job Summary:

Look under the hood of almost any software project and you'll find a database. In our data-driven world, databases are the invisible engines powering everything: tracking your clicks on the Internet, analyzing genetic sequences, identifying weather patterns, and delivering personalized deals from your favorite retailers. As a software developer, nearly every project you touch will involve a database, so understanding this foundational technology from the inside out is incredibly valuable.

Join our database server team and help build features that our customers rely on. You'll work within the database server contributing to new functionality that enhances the user experience while maintaining strong security and performance standards. Your work will involve diving into a mature codebase to understand how the database operates and implementing features that make a real difference for users. You'll have the opportunity to influence design decisions, giving you real ownership and responsibility for your contributions.

This is a fantastic learning opportunity where you'll gain practical experience with database internals, enterprise software development, and security practices. You'll gain hands-on experience with C++ development, Python testing, and SQL while building valuable technical skills. You'll learn alongside a dedicated mentor who will support your technical growth and help you navigate new challenges.

Join us. We can't wait to see the solutions you'll create.

Job Responsibilities:

In this position, you will:

Dive into a large, mature C++ codebase to implement new functionality
Support your feature by writing comprehensive tests in Python and craft SQL queries as needed
Take ownership of your feature from concept to completion
Build strong skills in database and cloud technologies
Be mentored by skilled developers who want to help you succeed

Required Skills:

We're looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful, innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Successful applicants will have an exceptional ability to learn and the motivation to excel in software design, implementation, and testing.

The following qualifications are required:

Strong programming skills in an industry standard language like C++, Java, or Python
Good oral and written communication skills
Overall average of at least 85%
Ability to work independently and collaboratively

The following are not required but would be valuable:
Knowledge of SQL and relational database concepts
Work experience at a software development company
Software design experience
Significant hobby programming
Strong results in math or programming contests

Compensation and Benefits:

About the SAP Internship Experience Program
The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP's global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:

Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you'll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.
Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don't miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

We build breakthroughs together

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

We win with inclusion

SAP's culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone - regardless of background - feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

SAP believes the value of pay transparency contributes towards an honest and supportive culture and is a significant step toward demonstrating SAP's commitment to pay equity. SAP provides the hourly base salary rate range applicable for the posted role. The targeted range for this position is 23.00 - 35.00 CAD. The actual amount to be offered to the successful candidates will be within that range, dependent upon the key aspects of each case which may include education, skills, experience, scope of the role, location, etc. as determined through the selection process. SAP offers limited benefits for employees hired into hourly or like roles subject to applicable plan/policy terms. A summary of benefits and eligibility requirements can be found by visiting: SAPNorthAmericaBenefits.com

Job Summary:

Job Posting for Parkalytics Inc. - Junior Software & Data Analyst (Engineering Co-op)
Summer 2026 (May 4 - August 28, 2026)
Full-time | $30-$35/hour | Remote (Canada-based)

Parkalytics is a Toronto-based technology company using drones, computer vision, and data analytics to help cities, campuses, and large developments better understand how parking and curbside space is actually used.

Founded in 2023, Parkalytics combines modern software engineering with real-world transportation planning. We work across Canada and the United States on high-profile, complex sites that don't lend themselves to traditional clipboards and spreadsheets.

Our work includes:

Vaughan Mills Mall - one of Canada's largest retail destinations
Town of Breckenridge - one of the busiest ski resort town in the U.S.
Eastern Market - the largest outdoor historic market in the United States

We've collected nearly a million parking observations using drone imagery and custom software, producing highly accurate datasets that inform transportation planning, development decisions, and policy.

Parkalytics is led by a small, senior team. You'll be working directly with the founder, a Professional Engineer and former co-founder of CurbIQ, a leading curbside management software platform used by major cities.


Job Responsibilities:

The Role

As a Junior Software & Data Analyst, you'll support the core systems that turn raw imagery into structured, usable datasets. You'll work across Python scripts, data pipelines, quality control workflows, and internal tools that support real client deliverables.

You'll gain exposure to:

Production data
Real constraints (accuracy, repeatability, timelines)
How software supports planning, cities, and infrastructure decisions
This role rewards curiosity and ownership. If you see a better way to do something, you'll be encouraged to propose it.

Why This Co-op Is Different
You'll work on real projects with real clients - the summer term already has projects lined up that include two more flights in Breckenridge, and a potential flight over a Major League Baseball stadium
Your code and analysis will directly influence delivered studies
You'll gain exposure to how engineering, software, and cities intersect
You'll be mentored by a founder who has built and shipped production transportation software prior to Parkalytics (via CurbIQ)
You'll leave with concrete experience you can talk about in interviews

Required Skills:

What We're Looking For

Required

Current University of Waterloo engineering student (Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or related)
Strong comfort with Python
Working knowledge of Git/GitHub
Interest in data, automation, and problem-solving
Ability to work independently and ask good questions

Nice to Have
Exposure to machine learning or computer vision
Experience with data pipelines, QA, or analytics
Familiarity with PowerBI, Svelte, GIS software, and AWS programs
Familiarity with spatial or real-world datasets
Prior co-op experience on technical projects

Compensation and Benefits:

Full-time | $30-$35/hour

Job Summary:

The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC), North America's third largest transit system and
recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA has introduced its new 2024-2028 TTC
Corporate Plan - Moving Toronto, Connecting Communities which continues the TTC's legacy
of delivering service to hundreds of millions of customers a year. The TTC's new vision and
mission statements also help promote the many environmental, social equity and economic
benefits that the TTC provides:
Vision: Moving Toronto towards a more equitable, sustainable, and prosperous future.
Mission: To serve the needs of transit riders by providing a safe, reliable, efficient, and
accessible mass public transit service through a seamless integrated network to create access
to opportunity for everyone.
At the TTC, our Early Talent programs provide students with the opportunity to work alongside
experts on exciting projects, gain an understanding on the transit industry, develop in-demand
skills and experiences and get an early start to your career. This is your chance to make a
meaningful impact on Toronto's transit!
The full Plan can be viewed on ttc.ca.
Please note: We are pleased to announce now that our co-op roles are now open to all
students! You do not need to be enrolled in a co-op program to apply. Eligibility requirements
include being eligible to work in Canada & enrollment at an accredited Canadian postsecondary
institution
General Accountability
Our Information Technology Services (ITS) Department is looking for a talented Analyst, for
Information Technology Platform Services to join our team! Reporting to the Manager of IT
Platform Services, you will be responsible for ensuring the reliability, scalability, and
performance of TTC's IT platforms.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities
- Your responsibilities will include managing and optimizing IT infrastructure to ensure
high availability, scalability, and security.
- As an Analyst, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement best
practices, offer technical direction to staff, assist in planning, resource assessment and
technology evaluations and contribute to capital and operating budget planning.
- You will be responsible for troubleshooting issues and driving continuous improvement
for various enterprise IT platforms such as Windows OS, Intune, BizTalk, Azure Cloud
Services, Office365, SharePoint, MS Teams, and more.
- You will install, manage, and support IT platforms and perform upgrades, administration,
and maintenance; provide daily incident support and implement service requests.
- This position requires availability during non-business hours (evening and weekends)
and change of regular scheduled work hours on short notice to meet and accommodate
work as needed.

Required Skills:

Skills
-Apply analytical skills
- Assess and manage corporate risk
- Audit systems, processes, and products
-Demonstrate appropriate and effective interpersonal communications through various
media
- Demonstrate knowledge of the industry and / or sector
- Demonstrate specialized expertise and knowledge in the assigned field
- Use office technology, software and applications
Education and Experience
- Familiarity with setting up and administering a .Net environment.
- Understanding of IT infrastructure, operating systems (Windows OS, Linux), cloud
platforms (Azure, AWS), and networking concepts (TCP/IP, DNS).
- Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities for complex IT challenges.
- Knowledge of security best practices, compliance standards, and incident management.
- Familiarity with monitoring tools (TNG, Nagios) for performance and health tracking.
- Experience in implementing security measures and participating in continuous
improvement initiatives.
- Strong problem-solving skills for effective troubleshooting.
- Excellent communication and collaboration abilities for cross-functional teamwork.
- Attention to detail, accuracy, and strong time management skills.
- Adaptability to changing technologies and environments, with the ability to work
independently.
- Customer-focused mindset with a commitment to high-quality service.
- Awareness of industry trends and emerging technologies in IT platform management.
- Exposure to on-call support and off-hour incident response.
- a university degree in Computer Science, or the equivalent, combined with several years
of experience working progressively in IT Platforms and technical support in a major
corporate environment
Additional Requirements
- Please include a cover letter and copy of your unofficial transcript with your application
- Students will be required to complete a criminal background check during the
onboarding stage, satisfactory results will be required.

PLEASE NOTE: Transportation will be provided via a TTC Employee Pass.

Unrestricted Driver Licence
Security Clearance Required

Please note: We are pleased to announce now that our co-op roles are now open to all

include being eligible to work in Canada & enrollment at an accredited Canadian postsecondary

General Accountability
Reporting to the Director / Manager (Project Management Office) of the TTC IT Services Group,
the Junior PMO Analyst Co-op performs and/or coordinates the planning, monitoring, analysis
and evaluation of project, program, and portfolio management functions for the TTC IT Services
Group. The position receives direction from the Director or Manager - PMO to assist in the
overall planning, management and administration of their department's project portfolio to
ensure the ongoing success of the TTC Project Management Maturity Plan.
In addition, the incumbents in the corporate Portfolio Management Office (PfMO) and the PMO
may work together to support consistency in project methodology.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities
Performs and/or coordinates, in support of, the planning, monitoring, analysis and evaluation of
the TTC IT Services Group's project portfolio for efficiency and effectiveness, that may include
coordinating the development, implementation and ongoing monitoring of project, program and
portfolio schedules, cost and scope controls, performance measures and audit/quality
assurance activities to ensure project management governance adherence. Assigned duties will
support:
- Collection of information from stakeholders, including through interviews, and
synthesizes information;
- Coordination of the identification and ongoing monitoring of key issues, including
alignment with strategic objectives and performance measures;
- Execution of various operational analyses and cost/benefit studies;
- Execution of gap analysis (opportunity assessments and assists with action plans and
change management;
- Interpretation of results of studies, and provides insights as to possible alternatives to
correct deficiencies and improve efficiency;
- Preparation of various reports, information and recommendations relating to areas of
responsibility;
- Follow-up on action plans, provide inputs to Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and
prepares analysis of information and reports;
- Integration, documentation, evaluation and monitoring of new and/or revised operating
and administrative policies, rules, standards and procedures, and assists with their
implementation;
- Assistance in the development and assessment of Project Management tools and
templates;
- Assistance with and/or coordinates departmental projects as assigned.
- Provision of advice, direction and interpretation regarding policies, rules, procedures,
standards and performance measures:
- Participation in monitoring adherence to corporate/department policies and standard
operating procedures and pertinent industry and government legislation/regulations, and
identifies areas for improved compliance;
- Participation in feedback monitoring for the Project Management Framework and related
Project Management documentation and activities;
- Coordination of Capital Project Review Committee (CPRC) Meetings
- Participation in monitoring existing projects to ensure timely execution and completion by
closely following project development and tracking that each stage is completed
appropriately and within time and budget.
- Provision of support to the Manager and/or Advisor in the overall planning, management
and administration of the PfMO or PMO;
- Analysis of data and project information to identify critical areas for improvement and
corrective action as well as other improvement opportunities/efficiencies, and assists
with the implementation of corrective action;
- Collaboration with other TTC PMO peers, and liaises with internal/external contacts
related to areas of responsibility;
- Research and preparation of various reports and recommendations related to the work;
- Finding and reporting on opportunities to leverage tools to improve the efficiency and
effectiveness of the Project Management function;
- Contribution to the achievement of TTC's Project Management Maturity (PMM) mandate
and supports the implementation of the Project Management Maturity (PMM) plan; and
- Maintaining awareness of project, program and portfolio management industry trends,
best practices and new technology as related to areas of responsibility;
- Performing other related duties as assigned;
- Demonstration of behaviours that support diversity, inclusion, and a respectful work and
service environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. Helps to remove
barriers and accommodate employees and customers (within their area of responsibility)
in accordance with TTC's commitments and obligations under the Ontario Human Rights
Code (OHRC) and Related Orders, the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act
(AODA), and TTC's policies.

Required Skills:

Skills
Technical project management skills, including:
- requirements management and traceability
- risk / schedule / scope management
- time, budget and cost estimation
- Proficiency in software applications relevant to the work and area of responsibility
(Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Microsoft Project).
Education and Experience
- Electrical/Electronic/Systems Engineering;
- Computer Science or Business Administration with specialty in Information Systems and
Technology
- Experience working in the enterprise or department level Project Management Office
would be an advantage, specifically on: developing and monitoring the use of the project
management framework and its related standards and processes; using the project
management information systems to highlight portfolio issues, risks, dependencies and
continuous improvement opportunities.
Additional Requirements
This position must effectively help interpret information from a variety of sources to help elevate
the project group knowledge and awareness on best practices on project management
information system usage. This position may work with the following:
- Corporate/department objectives, initiatives, policies, procedures, standards, industry
practices and government legislation/regulations, etc.
- Theory, practices, technology and methodology of the project management profession
- Project goals, scope and objectives,
- Budget, cost, schedule information, etc.
- Please include a cover letter and copy of your unofficial transcript with your application
- This position is best suited for students who work well both individually and with team
members.
- You will be working under the supervision of the Supervisor - Application Portfolio
Management.
- Students will be required to complete a criminal background check during the
onboarding stage, satisfactory results will be required.

PLEASE NOTE: Transportation will be provided via a TTC Employee Pass.

General Accountability
The Information Technology Services (ITS) Department has an opportunity for a student with
Information Technology background. You will be able to expand your understanding of the
Software Development Life Cycle, application development and standards. You will be able to
sharpen your analytical skills, expand your systems design and interpersonal skills. Within a
Microsoft Windows and M365 environments, using SharePoint, Power Apps and Power
Automate, PowerShell, .NET, CORE, C#, ASP.NET, MVC, REST APIs, JavaScript, Angular,
SQL programming, Reporting tools, you will maintain and develop Company Business
Applications. This position will provide practical experience in project methodology (from
gathering and documenting detailed requirements to implementing the application).

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities
- Coding program instructions in one or more of the following Windows and Mobile
platforms using .NET, CORE, C#, ASP.NET, MVC, REST APIs, JavaScript, Angular,
Mobile Development (React Native using Visual Studio Code and Android Studio, HTML
5.0/Json/React), SQL programming, Oracle SQL programming in a client server
environment.
- Writing, debugging and testing coded programs.
- Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power BI) deployment and office 365 tools.
- Establishing program requirements through the analysis of various technical systems,
real time systems and data base systems.
- Migrating and upgrading platform technology to a new platform or version.
- Providing application documentation to the Development group. This may include
documenting business requirements, functional specifications and other related project
documentation.
- Providing application training & operating instructions to the User groups.
- Adhering to the TTC's Software Development Life Cycle and application development
policies and standards

Required Skills:

Skills
- Knowledge of the above mentioned programming languages in Windows and Mobile
environment and implementing applications in the client server environment.
- Practical and theoretical knowledge in spatial analysis; manipulation; data projection and

Job Summary:

The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC), North America's third largest transit system and
recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA has introduced its new 2024-2028 TTC
Corporate Plan - Moving Toronto, Connecting Communities which continues the TTC's legacy
of delivering service to hundreds of millions of customers a year. The TTC's new vision and
mission statements also help promote the many environmental, social equity and economic
benefits that the TTC provides:
Vision: Moving Toronto towards a more equitable, sustainable, and prosperous future.
Mission: To serve the needs of transit riders by providing a safe, reliable, efficient, and
accessible mass public transit service through a seamless integrated network to create access
to opportunity for everyone.
At the TTC, our Early Talent programs provide students with the opportunity to work alongside
experts on exciting projects, gain an understanding on the transit industry, develop in-demand
skills and experiences and get an early start to your career. This is your chance to make a
meaningful impact on Toronto's transit!
The full Plan can be viewed on ttc.ca.
Please note: We are pleased to announce now that our co-op roles are now open to all
students! You do not need to be enrolled in a co-op program to apply. Eligibility requirements
include being eligible to work in Canada & enrollment at an accredited Canadian postsecondary
institution
General Accountability
The Toronto Transit Commission, IT Services, End User Devices section has an opportunity for
a student with a desire to expand your problem-solving, analytical, conceptual, and
interpersonal skills. Working in an environment that supports multiple platforms (Windows 7,
Windows 8 and Windows 10 Operating Systems with Microsoft Office Suite).

Desk applications and procedures. Updating the student manual.

End User Devices Technicians.

Job Summary:

Warp: We're Building the Platform for Agentic Development

Warp began with the vision of reimagining one of the fundamental dev tools-the terminal-to make it more usable and powerful for all developers. As AI has advanced, Warp has evolved beyond its terminal roots into the platform for Agentic Development: a workbench for dispatching agents to code, deploy, and debug production software.

With over half a million active developers and revenue that has grown 23x this year so far, we are in a unique position to impact the future of development. We believe that engineers at any level will be "tech leads" for groups of agents; rather than opening a code editor to write code or a terminal to write commands, they will open Warp and prompt their computer to build features, fix bugs, and diagnose production issues.

With its starting point as a reimagined command line, Warp is well-positioned to support agent-first workflows: It sits at the lowest level in the dev stack, has access to all of a developer's context, and is set up for multitasking and long-running processes. In addition, Warp has state-of-the-art code editing features and built-in team knowledge sharing. It's the right interface for the agentic future.

Our mission has remained the same even as AI has advanced: to empower developers to ship better software more quickly, freeing them to focus on the creative and rewarding aspects of their work.

We are looking for outstanding, product-focused engineering interns who want to work on difficult technical problems with the goal of improving developers' lives. You'll be working in Rust and Go with an experienced, kind, and thoughtful team of gifted engineers.

For more information on our team and culture, we highly recommend reading our How We Work.

Job Responsibilities:

Participate in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, unit/integration testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation.
Collaborate closely with the rest of engineering, as well as other stakeholders from our growth, marketing, and product teams, to plan features and build a high quality product that elevates the productivity of all developers.
Improve Warp's performance and reliability by building new features or polishing existing parts of the product.
Prototype ideas and concepts to get quick feedback from internal and external users
Work across the entire technical stack to ensure users have the most efficient and delightful experience using Warp. The features you develop will span all aspects of the user experience, making you an expert on what their needs are.
Provide thoughtful feedback to your peers, and build strong personal connections with your teammates!

Required Skills:

You are passionate about helping developers get more done - would jump at the chance to work on this particular product
You have amazing engineering chops, but are also product- and user-focused
You have great communication and collaboration skills
You're sensitive to developers' needs, and can develop warm relationships with developers
Bonus:
Building native apps in Rust or WASM
Shell or Linux-programming
Server-side programming in go
OpenGL, WebG, or other graphics programming

Transportation and Housing:

We provide a $7,000 relocation stipend if you choose to move to either SF or NYC for your internship.

Compensation and Benefits:

$10,400/month USD

Job Summary:

Overview:
The Quantitative Investment Co-op will play a crucial role in supporting our investment management and product strategy functions. This hands-on opportunity is designed to immerse you in the exciting world of ETFs, investment analysis, and strategic product development. You will collaborate with experienced professionals, contribute to real projects, and gain invaluable insights into the investment management landscape.


About Us:
Global X Investments Canada Inc. ("Global X") is an innovative financial services company that offers one of the largest suites of exchange-traded funds in Canada. The Global X Fund family includes a broadly diversified range of solutions for investors of all experience levels to meet their investment objectives in a variety of market conditions. Global X has more than $48 billion of assets under management and 155 ETFs listed on major Canadian stock exchanges. Global X is a wholly owned subsidiary of the Mirae Asset Financial Group, which manages more than $1 trillion of assets across 19 countries and global markets around the world.

Job Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities:

Market Research and Analysis:

• Assist in researching market trends, macroeconomic indicators, and asset class performance to identify potential investment opportunities.
• Analyze competitor ETF offerings and market positioning to help inform our product strategy.
• Gather and interpret data to generate insights that drive informed investment decisions.

Investment Strategy Support:
• Contribute to the formulation of investment strategies aligned with market trends and client needs.
• Collaborate with portfolio managers and analysts to assess risk-return profiles and portfolio construction techniques.

Product Development:
• Aid in the development of new ETF products by conducting research, financial modelling, and feasibility assessments.
• Assist in creating product proposals, including detailed investment rationales, competitive analysis, and projected financial performance.

Performance Analysis:
• Monitor and evaluate the performance of existing ETF products, generating reports and insights for management.
• Contribute to the identification of potential enhancements or modifications to improve product performance and client satisfaction.

Communication and Reporting:
• Support the preparation of materials for client presentations, internal meetings, and regulatory reporting.
• Contribute to the creation of marketing content and thought leadership pieces related to investment strategies and products.

Industry Awareness:
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends, regulatory changes, and evolving investor preferences.
• Continuously expand your knowledge of ETFs, investment management, and financial markets.

Required Skills:

Skills & Experience

• Current enrollment in a relevant Bachelor's degree program in finance, computer science, mathematics, economics or a related field.
• Strong analytical and quantitative skills with proficiency in SQL, Python and version control software.
• Strong interest in investment management, finance, and the ETF industry.
• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
• Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills.
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and take initiative when needed.
• A passion for learning and a desire to contribute to the success of the team.
• Background checks will be conducted.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required
Security Clearance Required


Compensation and Benefits:

$25 - $30 per hour salary range
A collaborative and supportive work environment
Incredible opportunities for professional development and growth
The opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the financial well-being of Canadian investors

Job Summary:

Please note you may be considered for additional positions

TD Securities offers a wide range of capital markets products and services to corporate, government, and institutional clients who choose us for our innovation, execution, and experience.

With more than 6,500 professionals operating out of 40 cities across the globe, we help clients meet their needs today and prepare for tomorrow. Our services include underwriting and distributing new issues, providing trusted advice and industry-leading insight, extending access to global markets, and delivering integrated transaction banking solutions. In 2023, we acquired Cowen Inc., offering our clients access to a premier U.S. equities business and highly-diverse equity research franchise, while growing our strong, diversified investment bank.

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles, and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:

Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation
Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more

Job Responsibilities:

Principal responsibilities you'll be entrusted with include but are not limited to:

Working closely with sales traders to support clients, assist with client requests, conduct day-to-day activities which facilitate client trading
Allocate client trades to the proper accounts
Conduct research and obtain market data through Bloomberg, Trading systems, and internal databases
Maintain the group's online, client-facing, web portal
Design and implement front-office solutions to optimize trading operations
Assist in multiple marketplace modeling and ad-hoc quantitative research
Coordinate with various groups (middle office, back office, technology, clients) in resolving technical and settlement issues in trading operations
Contribute towards the development of marketplace modeling and ad-hoc quantitative research

Required Skills:

Have a combination of strong financial/analytical skills, excellent communication abilities and be adept at financial modeling and valuation; and,
Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Strong communication skills are mandatory as the job requires you to speak directly with clients.
Ability to communicate and work effectively with others (both with internal and external stakeholders)
Highly-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work independently in a proactive manner
Able to work in a fast-paced environment
Strong attention to detail is a MUST
Experience with Python, SQL, VBA and Bloomberg is a plus (requirement of these skills vary by desks)

Compensation and Benefits:

We're committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with your recruiter and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.

Job Summary:

The National Research Council (NRC) is the Government of Canada's largest research organization supporting industrial innovation, the advancement of knowledge and technology development, and fulfilling government mandates.

The Clean Energy Innovation Research Centre of the NRC creates green and sustainable technologies for clean energy, resource extraction and environmental protection, essential to strengthen and support Canada's future clean economy.

The Co-op Student will contribute to applied research and development involving robotics, control systems, and automated instrumentation. The student will support the design, implementation, and testing of electromechanical systems, gaining hands-on experience with real-world control systems while contributing to innovative technical solutions in a research laboratory environment.


Job Responsibilities:

Assist in the design, implementation, and testing of control systems for robotic or automated platforms.
Support integration of sensors, actuators, and embedded controllers into electromechanical systems.
Develop, test, and debug control algorithms for motion control, feedback, and automation.

Required Skills:

Academic or practical experience with robotics, automation, or control systems.
Knowledge of control theory (e.g., PID control, feedback systems).
Experience with embedded systems, microcontrollers, or PLCs.
Familiarity with sensors, actuators, motors, and motor controllers
Conditions of Coop Work Program:
Students must be enrolled in a coop program. Graduate students and graduates will not be considered under this program.
Linguistic Profile: Reading, Writing and Oral Interaction in English.
Students must possess a minimum of a B average and must submit an unofficial transcript at time of application.
Open to Canadian Citizens or Permanent Residents of Canada. Additionally, foreign national students who meet the eligibility requirements, are studying in a recognized and eligible Canadian educational institution and possess a valid Co-op Work Permit may also apply.
For more information and requirements to work as a coop student or intern, please refer to the website:
https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/study-canada/work/intern.html
Please include citizenship information in your application.
Must obtain and retain a reliability security clearance.

At NRC, we know diversity enables excellence in research and innovation. We are committed to a diverse and representative workforce, an open and inclusive work environment, and contributing to a more inclusive Canadian innovation system.

Priority will be given to the following designated employment equity groups:
Women and Persons with Disabilities.

NRC welcomes all qualified applicants and encourages candidates to self-declare as members of the following designated employment equity groups: women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities.

Please advise of any accommodation measures required to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. They are available to all candidates for further assessment. Related information received will be addressed confidentially.

Additional Information:

Security Clearance Required
Hiring Preference - Canadian

Job Summary:

About Huawei
With 194,000 employees and operating in more than 170 countries and regions, Huawei is a leading global creator and provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. Integrated solutions span across four key domains - telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services. Huawei is committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

About Huawei Canada
Huawei Canada focuses on fundamental research and development aimed at solving complex technical problems in emerging technologies like 5G, AI, Human Computer Interaction and Autonomous Driving. With ongoing research initiatives with 10 Universities across Canada and strategic collaboration agreements with several Universities, we support Canada's rich research community. In 2020, Huawei Canada ranked among the Top 20 corporate R&D investors in the country with a huge 40% increase in R&D investment year over year. Huawei Canada was established in 2008 and now has a total workforce of 1,200 in our six research

About the team:
Founded in 2012, the Noah's Ark lab has evolved into a prominent research organization with notable achievements in academia and industry. The lab's mission focuses on advancing artificial intelligence and related fields to benefit the company and society. Driven by impactful, long-term projects, the aim is to enhance state-of-the-art research while integrating innovations into the company's products and services, including LLMs, RL, NLP, computer vision, AI theory, and Autonomous driving.

Job Responsibilities:

Exploring the Real-Time OS research or development targeting embedded devices, cloud & virtualized computing and automotive domain.
Contribute and help build the next-generation Real-Time OS technology to power a broad range of computer platforms.
Solve some very challenging problems around scheduling, resource allocation, isolation and IPC in very complex systems.
Focus on developing tooling and solutions to performance challenges in the system.

Required Skills:

About the ideal candidate:

Currently enrolled in a university and registered with school's co-op program.
Related coursework or experience in:
The field of real-time operating system design, development and integration,
CPU architecture for system software development,
System software development (mainly C/C++).
Strong ability to research complex topics, distill knowledge into concrete designs and apply to new or existing projects.
Strong communication ability to document and present technical information and solutions effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.

To be discussed with student
