Job Summary:

Department Overview

Exchange Traded Funds Group at TD Securities:
TD Securities is one of Canada's most active dealers in Debt and Equity products. Our Sales and Trading business deals with institutional investors, corporations and governments worldwide in the trading and sale of outstanding and new issue products.

The TD Securities ETF desk sits within Global Equity Derivatives (GED), which hosts a variety of groups including swaps, options and structured notes. Our GED team has operations in London, NY, Singapore, and Toronto. The ETF desk is in charge of making markets on ETFs and facilitating trades on ETFs for various clients including ETF issuers, institutional investors, and TD wealth. The ETF sales and strategy desk is responsible for servicing all of our clients in a variety of ways and adding value with best-in-class research.

At TD Securities, we believe that diversity is the key to our success in the competitive global marketplaces and we embrace people with a wide range of unique experiences and abilities.

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles, and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:

Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation
Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more

Job Responsibilities:

Job Description

How You Will Contribute:

Optimization of TD's signature TD ETF Weekly report, which requires data mining and visualization work
Automating existing processes within the ETF group
Prospecting and compiling information on potential institutional clients and other users of ETFs
Contribute to client presentations and marketing material

Required Skills:

Job Requirements

Qualifications:

Pursuing degree in a quantitative discipline, e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or similar
Experience manipulating and analyzing data in Python, VBA or other equivalent languages
Strong business, finance, mathematics and quantitative analysis skills, or relevant experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Motivation to work hard and gain a better understanding of the ETF ecosystem

Early Talent Requirements
Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages).
We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.
TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangements

Compensation and Benefits:

Range $51,400- $95,000

Epocal-Siemens (Siemens Healthineers) is a leading biochip technology manufacturer of clinical diagnostic products. The products comprise a range of acute-care tests, run on the world's first handheld patient-side blood analyzer. This system is now a well-established tool of the medical profession available worldwide. Epocal-Siemens is committed to delivering high-quality products and services that patients and providers can rely on for consistently accurate and actionable information. We deploy unique innovative technologies that not only transform diagnostic products, but also expand into new platforms and solutions with proven health and economic outcomes.

Under the supervision of the Sr. Software QA Specialist; the SQA Specialist (COOP) is responsible for performing quality assurance and validation activities for Epocal-Siemens Medical Devices:

Host Software (Windows Mobile and Android PDA)
Reader Software (Embedded)
epoc Data Manager Software (eDM) (Web-based application with SQL database)
epoc Data Manager Lite Software (eDM Lite) (Desktop application with SQLite database)
COT's (Commercial Off-The-Shelf) Software
Supporting development and maintenance activities within the software group.
Key Contacts
Reports directly to the Sr. Software QA Specialist
Supports members of software development team
Supports company-wide Quality Assurance initiatives especially related to software

Job Responsibilities:

Job Demands

Developing software Test Plans and Test Cases for the medical industry demands and activities specific to a regulatory environment
Embedded, Android and Windows Mobile OS based PDAs, and desktop application environments (PocketPC, PC, potentially others)
Well organized work habits with attention to detail
Good written communication skills
Self-directed time and task management
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively based on the application that is being validated
Duties & Responsibilities
Assists in Analyzing COTS (Commercial Off-The-Shelf) software
Performs test execution for various projects (internal and external tools)
Create test case libraries and tests cases based on product requirements
Executes test plans and creates Software Tools Validation Report (STVR)
Verifies defect fixes
Scripting of automated testcases in Python
Working with Automation team on automation Framework and side projects
Assists SQA team in testing of Epocal products
Hardware and/or Software testing to assist other Epocal development teams
Documents anomalies and maintains database for tracking defects and historical analysis
Maintains test equipment and test environments
Note: Duties are not limited to those listed above. Additional duties may be assigned as required. However, reasonable accommodations will be made if at all possible under business conditions.

Required Skills:

Skills & Qualifications (Education & Experience)

Currently enrolled in Bachelor's degree in Science, Engineering, or related discipline (and/or an equivalent combination of education and technical experience acceptable to Epocal-Siemens)
Several semesters of related experience
Medical environment experience is preferred. Successful candidate will be trained in software lifecycle development activities
Some knowledge/experience with testing approaches and methodologies
Knowledge/experience with Python

Salary is based on UWaterloo's recommendations for programs and number of completed work terms.

Job Summary:

Campus is on a mission to accelerate the talent of tomorrow and reimagine what college can (and should) be. The problem is clear: college costs have skyrocketed, but outcomes haven't. Traditional college hasn't kept up with the aspirations of today's students-and they can't afford to wait.

At Campus, we've built a two-year, accredited college where students learn from top professors at universities like Princeton, Stanford, and Howard, in live, online classes. Our students graduate with in-demand business and AI skills-ready to launch their careers or transfer to top four-year universities. Our unique approach is grounded in a pioneering technology platform and a heavily-researched student success model that offers students dedicated advisors and on-demand tutoring and coaching. We were also named one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies of 2024.

We're backed by an exceptional investor team that believes deeply in our vision for the future of education, including General Catalyst, Founders Fund, Bloomberg Beta, 8VC, Rethink Education, Sam Altman, Jason Citron, Shaquille O'Neal, and others.
The world has changed. Higher ed needs to catch up, and we're leading the way - come join us!

You will help our team develop new AI-based learning tools, scale our business operations, and deliver the future of EdTech. If you are as passionate about learning and AI as we are, come join us!

Job Responsibilities:

Your responsibilities will include a combination of some of the following:

Implement new learning UI using React and TypeScript
Implement backend system with Go, Python, and AWS/GCP
Work closely with Product and Design to deliver UX improvements
Leverage LLM technologies to create new learning tools
Write scripts to collect large datasets for those tools
Create labelled data sets to evaluate AI systems

Required Skills:

Experience coding with Go, Python and/or TypeScript & React
Experience using Git and Github
Experience using LLM tools
Nice to have: Experience with GCP/AWS
Nice to have: Experience with ML - HuggingFace, Langchain, and PyTorch
Nice to have: Experience with EdTech

Transportation and Housing:

On site in NYC.

Compensation and Benefits:

US$40 - US$50 / hour depending on experience. Macbook Pro provided.

Job Summary:

Dawson Partners ("Dawson"), based in Toronto, is a fast-growing private equity firm focused on accelerating liquidity on private equity portfolios through structured solutions. Dawson seeks to provide customized and flexible liquidity solutions for private equity investors through the use of structured solutions with existing investors or outright purchases of portfolios which are subsequently structured into different securities. Dawson currently has raised over US$19B under management across ten funds. Dawson is seeking diverse, energetic, and dynamic individuals who thrive in a fast-paced, high-performance, entrepreneurial environment.

The Technology & Data team is seeking a Technology & Data Intern Analyst starting in January 2025 with
our Toronto office.

The Technology & Data team is comprised of the following three functional pillars:

Data & Analytics: Enabling advanced analytics, through ML Models, accurate data and automation to provide deep insights to the Firm.
Cybersecurity & Risk: Working across the firm to properly balance security with convenience, we believe that securing the firm requires total team effort. Utilizing a risk-based approach and controls to protect the firm, mitigate risk and provide confidence that our assets are protected.
Infrastructure & Systems: Providing the right sized tools, processes and platforms to support growth and collaboration while also creating space for personal development and mind share.

The intern will gain exposure to all three Technology & Data pillars during their internship period (with a focus on software development). They will also be encouraged to actively participate in firm-wide team meetings, investment committee discussions and projects.

We are looking for self-motivated individuals ideally completing their senior year in 2026 (or 2027) with a degree in Business Administration, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, or Math and have a demonstrated track record of curricular and extracurricular excellence

Job Responsibilities:

Job Description:

Collecting, storing, processing, and analyzing data sets to support business needs, including the build-out and maintenance of data models.
Applying automation and innovation on data platforms and any new development projects/initiatives aligned to business or organizational strategies
Collaborating with various technology/business/project teams to understand business data and provide analysis and requirements to ensure the data design/development initiatives are in line with the planned design and standards.
Develop ML Models, leveraging pretrained models and applications
Develop APIs / tooling / algorithms to be consumed by other Dawson teams.
Assist the Technology & Data team with other ad hoc projects as required.

Required Skills:

Education/Certification:

Expected graduation in 2026 (or 2027)
Exceptional academic record
Extracurricular leadership experience Requirements:
High degree of professionalism and integrity

Requirements:
High degree of professionalism and integrity
Experience with cloud native architectures such as GCP, Azure, AWS
Proven development experience with one or more of:
Python / Java / Ruby / Elixir
React / Angular / Vue / D3.js
SQL
ML & AI: CNN, NLTK, BERT, GPT
Knowledge of DevOps and CI/CD concepts and methodologies considered an asset
Knowledge of Test-Driven Development considered an asset
Experience in other relevant analytical technologies considered an asset (Jupyter, R, Sagemaker, TensorFlow etc)
Experience in automation and pipeline tooling considered an asset
Knowledge of capital markets, private equity, risk management and data concepts considered an asset
Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in work output
Ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure
Willingness to work across the organization in support of ad hoc projects as required
Team player who enjoys a high-performance culture
Interest in the secondary private equity market

Compensation and Benefits:

Participation in Dawson University onboarding and training program
Remote Fridays
Monthly compensation of $5,000

Job Summary:

As a Data Science Intern at Lime, you'll be a fully embedded member of the team, shipping production code, delivering insights, and contributing directly to the products and systems that move millions of riders every day. You'll take on meaningful, scoped projects, learn from a talented team of data scientists, and help tackle complex problems shaping the future of urban mobility.

Throughout your internship, you'll be supported by dedicated mentorship, gain access to tech talks and learning resources, and see your work drive real impact at global scale. You'll join a mission-driven team shaping a cleaner, more sustainable transportation future, while enjoying perks like competitive pay, unlimited free Lime rides, provided equipment, and the potential for a return offer.

Job Responsibilities:

Take True Ownership: Own a meaningful project from initial design through deployment, supported by a dedicated mentor.
Make a Global Impact: Build features or analyses that go directly into production and influence the experience of riders in 250+ cities worldwide.
Collaborate with the Best: Work closely with senior engineers, data scientists, product managers, and designers to solve complex technical and business challenges.
See Your Work in the Wild: Contribute to products and systems that advance Lime's mission to build a future that's shared, affordable, and carbon-free.
Unlock Critical Insights: Apply advanced analytical and machine learning techniques to massive datasets to uncover the "why" behind rider behavior, fleet health, and market dynamics.
Build Scalable Data Solutions: Design and optimize data pipelines, apply analytical and ML techniques, and develop models that transform massive datasets into actionable insights for teams across Lime.

Required Skills:

University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements:

University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program with an expected graduation date between December 2026 - June 2027
Internship Work Period: Must be available to work full-time (~40 hours per week) during a 16 week period starting in May or June of 2026. Specific start dates are shared during the recruitment process.

About you:
Pursuing Bachelor's or Master's in Computer Science with a data science focus
Proficient in at least one programming language (Python, Java, JavaScript, Ruby, Go, etc.)
Strong problem-solving and communication skills
Proficiency in Python and/or SQL
Familiarity with data visualization libraries (D3.js, Recharts, Plotly)
Understanding of statistical analysis or data science concepts

Preferred Experience:
Previous internship or relevant project experience
Experience with web development, cloud platforms (AWS/GCP), or databases
GitHub portfolio or open-source contributions
Passion for sustainability and urban mobility

Compensation and Benefits:

What We Offer
Compensation: CA$30.00
Time Off: Sick leave and holiday pay in accordance with applicable law.
Learning & Growth: Development opportunities working alongside Lime teams.
Note: Interns are not eligible for Lime's full benefits package.

Job Summary:

JOB DESCRIPTION
Omniscient seeks a co-op for our Systems Engineering team. We're looking for someone eager to become a product expert, with the skills to be a shrewd investigator, a resourceful problem-solver, and a supportive team member. Someone with an understanding of the software development process who can embed themselves within the engineering team and put their curiosity and creativity to work. A sense of humour is valued. Bonus points if you already have experience working in medical devices, or other regulated industries.

----

VISION
To enable the world's doctors to treat the brain health of billions through personalized clinical decision support.

SENIOR TEAM

Dr Michael Sughrue | Co-Founder, Director & Chief Medical Officer
Mike built one of the biggest neurosurgery practices in the US. With over 230 articles published in scientific journals and as a world authority in the field of Connectomics, Mike brings an unrivalled understanding of the brain to the business of practical clinical outcomes
Dr Stephane Doyen | Co-Founder, Director & Chief Technology Officer
As the Head Data Scientist with top-tier consultants, Oliver Wyman, combined with a PhD in neuroscience from Cambridge, Stephane is the ideal technical leader to develop our brain/machine-learning software
Stephen Scheeler | CEO & Managing Director
Stephen headed up Facebook's #5 market (ANZ), and was a pivotal figure in scaling Facebook from start up to US$500+ billion giant. Stephen brings the commercial software business leadership to execute our vision

PRODUCT
Clinical decision support software that takes existing rsfMRI brain image, loaded via a web browser that de-identifies on-site, to the Cloud where, through 23 machine-learning steps, we return a functional map and detect anomalies of the patient's brain in one hour. This allows neurosurgeons, neurologists, psychologists and psychiatrists to make more accurate diagnosis and personalized treatment plans for all brain-related disorders.

COMMITMENT TO COOPERATIVE EDUCATION
Over half of our Toronto team are UW and UofT graduates from Co-op and PEY. All of us have worked with interns in the past. We understand how impactful pre-graduation experience is, and we're committed to making sure you get your hands dirty! You'll be working with us side-by-side to deliver our next projects. We need all hands on deck to get where we're heading.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities:

Work closely with the product, development, and test team to understand product design and develop effective requirements
Lead, plan and coordinate New Product Introduction activities and release management.
Plan, coordinate, and execute risk management activities including hazard analysis and FMEA
Lead and participate in design, phase, and post-market trend reviews
Interface with cross-functional teams to facilitate design transfer
Implement tools and processes to facilitate traceability and management of risks and requirements
Contribute to the development of essential quality management processes, including product risk and cybersecurity risk management
Update and maintain Design History Files (DHFs) per quality and regulatory requirements

Required Skills:

KEY REQUIREMENTS

Enrolment in Systems and Biomedical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.
Experience with a high-level programming language, Microsoft Office products, and GSuite products.
Ability to establish and maintain strong relationships within the organization.
Ability to work independently with little or no supervision.

HIGHLY BENEFICIAL
Experience with software development processes and lifecycles
Experience with agile and scrum methodologies
Familiarity with Cloud technologies, Containerization, Web, and APIs
Familiarity with medical imaging, including DICOM conformance and MRI
Experience with hazard analysis, or other risk management techniques and activities

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary: $30 / hour (40 hour work week).

Job Summary:

JOB DESCRIPTION
Omniscient seeks a Quality Systems Engineering co-op for our Quality and Regulatory team in Canada. We're looking for someone eager to become a product expert, with the skills to be a shrewd investigator, a resourceful problem-solver, and a supportive team member. Someone who can embed themselves within a dynamic design and development team and put their creative testing skills to work. A sense of humor is valued.
----
VISION
To enable the world's doctors to treat the brain health of billions through personalised clinical decision support.

SENIOR TEAM

Dr Michael Sughrue | Co-Founder, Director & Chief Medical Officer
Mike built one of the biggest neurosurgery practices in the US. With over 230 articles published in scientific journals and as a world authority in the field of Connectomics, Mike brings an unrivalled understanding of the brain to the business of practical clinical outcomes
Dr Stephane Doyen | Co-Founder, Director & Chief Technology Officer
As the Head Data Scientist with top-tier consultants, Oliver Wyman, combined with a PhD in neuroscience from Cambridge, Stephane is the ideal technical leader to develop our brain/machine-learning software
Stephen Scheeler | CEO & Managing Director
Stephen headed up Facebook's #5 market (ANZ), and was a pivotal figure in scaling Facebook from start up to US$500+ billion giant. Stephen brings the commercial software business leadership to execute our vision

PRODUCT
Clinical decision support software that takes an MRI brain image, loaded via a web browser that de-identifies on-site, to the Cloud where, through a Machine Learning-Enabled pipeline, we return a functional map and detect anomalies of the patient's brain in one hour. This allows neurosurgeons, researchers and clinicians to make more accurate diagnosis and personalised treatment plans for all brain-related disorders.

See https://www.o8t.com/ for more information.

COMMITMENT TO COOPERATIVE EDUCATION

Over half of our Toronto team are UW and UofT graduates from Co-op and PEY. All of us have worked with interns in the past. We understand how impactful pre-graduation experience is, and we're committed to making sure you get your hands dirty! You'll be working with us side-by-side to deliver our next projects. We need all hands on deck to get where we're heading.

Past Co-op Projects:
Designing, automating and validating an ISO 13485-compliant Tool Validation and Supplier Management system in our eQMS
CAPAs and Quality Event BI dashboard design and monitoring
Regulatory impact review and evaluation of design changes for our latest software version.
FDA Cybersecurity attack surface analysis of the software system and driving cybersecurity improvements.
Using Agile methods to overhaul our Continuous Improvement priorities
Planning, implementing and defending new ANVISA requirements in front of an auditor.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities:

Champion and lead various quality system engineering processes including (but not limited to): Continuous Improvement, change management, software validation, tool validation, post-market surveillance.
Prototype and develop internal tooling and processes to accelerate New Product Introduction (NPI) and the Quality Management System (QMS), working with stakeholders to find the best solution.
Define, Monitor, Measure, Analyze and Improve quality processes across the organization.
Own the technical writing of QMS procedures, work instructions, and QMS validation protocols.
Lead, monitor and support Quality investigations into potential defects or issues with our product or quality management system.
Understand, implement and champion internationally recognized design standards/practices to the medical device and organization.
Work closely with the development team to understand system design in order to effectively design, develop, and document the medical device.
You may be required to:
Work closely with the customer success team to understand the pain points and challenges our customers and sales/service personnel are encountering in the field.
Participate in the assessment of potential hazards and brainstorm design and process mitigations of identified risks.
Assist with verification and validation activities (e.g., planning, execution, improvement).
Assist with algorithms development documentation and process planning (ML and Statistical models).
Participate in design reviews and internal audits, as required.
Assist or lead human factors and usability testing.

Required Skills:

KEY REQUIREMENTS

Enrolment in Systems and Biomedical Engineering, Software Engineering, or equivalent.
Experience with a high-level programming language, Microsoft Office products and GSuite products.
Ability to establish and maintain strong relationships within the organization.
Ability to work independently with little or no supervision.
We would love it if you had:
Experience working within a regulated environment and Quality Management Systems (QMS)
Understanding of medical device regulation and development.
Knowledge of the following standards: ISO 13485, IEC 60601, ISO 14971, ISO 62304
Experience with modern software test strategies and python development.
Strong technical writing and communication skills.
Experience with the software development process or working with a software development team.
Basic understanding of web application technologies and machine learning algorithms.
Familiar with key medical device regulation associated with FDA, TGA, Health Canada, EU MDR, UK MHRA, ANVISA and MHLW.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary: $30 / hour (40 hour work week)
Flexible start/end dates.

Job Summary:

Position Summary:
Wellington-Dufferin-Guelph Public Health is dedicated to promoting and protecting the health of individuals and communities in Wellington County, Dufferin County and the City of Guelph. With a vision of health and well-being for all, we strive to address the diverse health needs of our population through innovative programs and initiatives, upstream interventions and collaborative partnerships. From immunization campaigns to disease surveillance and community health promotion, our team of dedicated professionals works to ensure the well-being of everyone in our communities.

As a workplace, WDG Public Health offers a dynamic environment where passion for public health meets professional excellence. Employees have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the health outcomes of our communities while enjoying a supportive and inclusive work culture. With ongoing opportunities for professional development, a commitment to work-life balance, competitive compensation and benefits and a strong sense of community within our organization, WDG Public Health is not only a great place to work but also a rewarding place to grow and thrive in your career.

Read our 2024-2028 Strategic Plan on our Careers homepage for more about our vision, mission, values, goals and priorities.

If you are looking for a rewarding opportunity to use your knowledge and skills to make a difference in the health of our communities, we invite you to apply.

We offer a competitive compensation package including:
• Optional defined benefit OMERS Pension Plan with 100% employer matching;
• EAP wellness program for individuals and family;
• Employer paid parking;
• 35-hour work week;
• Many opportunities for growth and development.

WDG Public Health is a hybrid work environment. Certain employee groups may be permitted to work remotely based on the nature of the position and program.

Hours of Work:
Regular Office Hours: Monday to Friday, 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM (35 hours per week)
A minimum of 3 days per week in the Guelph office is required

Job Responsibilities:

We are seeking an IT Co-op Fullstack Developer to join our dynamic software development team. As an IT Co-op Fullstack Developer, you will have the opportunity to work on real projects and gain hands-on experience in developing software solutions. You will be mentored by experienced team members and work in a fast-paced, agile environment. You will work with content management systems (Drupal, WordPress, Microsoft, Oracle, etc.) with an information security mindset.

Anticipated Projects:
• Developing web-based applications using open source and/or Microsoft 365 technologies.
• Working with our Power BI report server and Power BI service integration.
• Developing a secure in-house web application to provide ongoing access to historical data from an electronic medical record.

Required Skills:

Requirements:
• Enrolled in a Computer Science degree program or related field.
• Previous co-op experience is considered an asset.
• Students must be eligible and enrolled for a co-op placement as part of their program. Students will be asked to provide proof of their eligibility.
• Excellent written and verbal communications.
• Ability to work as a part of a team and independently.
• Ability to prioritize, attention to detail.
• Ability to meet deadlines and manage assignments.
• Experience with programming languages, web technologies, Microsoft Windows and/or Unix/Linux - operating systems.
• Knowledge of Microsoft SQL, MySQL, or other databases would be an asset.
• Knowledge of dashboard tools such as Microsoft Power BI would be an asset.
• Ability and willingness to work a minimum of 3 days per week in the Guelph office.

Closing Statement:
We thank all applicants, however, only individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

WDG Public Health is committed to providing accommodation during the recruitment process for people in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require accommodation(s), please advise Human Resources in advance and we will work with you to meet your needs. The organization will maintain the confidentiality of information related to an accommodation request and will only disclose this information with the consent of the employee or applicant.

WDG Public Health is an equal opportunity Agency. Personal information is collected under the authority of the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, and will be used to determine eligibility.

If successful in the hiring process, it is important to understand that you would be an employee of a health care organization that strongly believes in the importance of immunizations as a necessary public health measure to control the spread of infectious diseases. Subject to any duty to accommodate under the Human Rights Code of Ontario, successful applicants will be required to comply with the Agency's Immunization Policy. This policy is available upon request. Applicants who are unable to be immunized due to a valid medical contraindication must have a Statement of Medical Exemption Form completed by their primary care provider.

Compensation and Benefits:

The salary range is $24.12 - $26.20/hour. The salary is to be determined based on experience and education.

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Special Work Term Start/End Date Considerations:

May 4 to Aug 28, 2026

Job Summary:

Come join our Database Query Processing team. We are responsible for developing cloud-focused database and data analytics functionality that underlies many SAP products. Our focus is on optimizing database performance and our main product is SAP HANA, our flagship, in-memory, database technology. Our team consists primarily of masters or PhD level database researchers and software developers. We have a special passion for mentoring students, sharing our knowledge with them and helping them develop new skills.

We are looking for exceptional students to work on several features designed to improve cloud performance in SAP HANA. Possible work areas include optimizing query execution on cloud-based object storage and enhancing the Apache Spark engine with new features to improve performance.

Depending on your project you may use a variety of languages and tools, including C++, Java, Scala, or Python. Knowledge of cloud technologies including Kubernetes would be a strong asset, as would knowledge of SQL and relational database concepts.

Join us. We can't wait to see what you'll achieve.

Job Responsibilities:

In this position, you will:

Contribute to the design of new database/query processing features
Develop new features using a variety of languages and tools
Write automated tests for your features
Benchmark features to quantify performance improvements
Build strong skills in database and cloud technologies
Be mentored by skilled researchers and developers who want to help you succeed

Required Skills:

We're looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Successful applicants will have an exceptional ability to learn and the motivation to excel in software design, implementation, and testing.

The following qualifications are required:

Strong programming skills in an industry standard language such as Python, Java, or C/C++
Good oral and written communication skills
Overall average of at least 85%
Ability to work independently and collaboratively

The following are not required but would be valuable:
Knowledge of C++, Python, or Scala
Knowledge of Apache Spark or Kubernetes
Knowledge of SQL and relational database concepts
Work experience at a software development company
Software design experience
Significant hobby programming
Strong results in math or programming contests

Compensation and Benefits:

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP's global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:

Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you'll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.
Follow @SAPiXP on Instagram and don't miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

We build breakthroughs together

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

We win with inclusion

SAP's culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone - regardless of background - feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

SAP believes the value of pay transparency contributes towards an honest and supportive culture and is a significant step toward demonstrating SAP's commitment to pay equity. SAP provides the hourly base salary rate range applicable for the posted role. The targeted range for this position is 23.00 - 35.00 CAD. The actual amount to be offered to the successful candidates will be within that range, dependent upon the key aspects of each case which may include education, skills, experience, scope of the role, location, etc. as determined through the selection process. SAP offers limited benefits for employees hired into hourly or like roles subject to applicable plan/policy terms. A summary of benefits and eligibility requirements can be found by visiting SAPNorthAmericaBenefits.com

Job Summary:

About the Role & Responsibilities

Collaborate with data scientists to productionize ML models and AI agents, moving from notebooks to reliable services.
Build scalable inference services/APIs (e.g., FastAPI), containerize with Docker, and automate CI/CD (Azure DevOps).
Deploy to cloud or Kubernetes (AWS, Helm), using model registries (MLflow) and feature stores (e.g., Feast) where applicable.
Implement evaluation and testing (unit/integration, load tests, offline/online validation, A/B or canary releases).
Monitor performance, reliability, drift, and cost with logging/metrics/tracing (e.g., Prometheus/Grafana, OpenTelemetry, Evidently); create alerts and runbooks.
Handle data security and compliance (PII handling, secrets management, RBAC) and follow best practice reliability patterns (blue/green, rollbacks).
For AI agents: integrate orchestration frameworks (e.g., LangChain/LlamaIndex), retrieval (vector DBs like FAISS/Pinecone), prompt/versioning, guardrails, and tool integrations.
Build and maintain UiPath workflows that invoke deployed ML/AI agent APIs via REST/gRPC.
Orchestrate automations in UiPath Orchestrator: assets/secrets, queues/transactions, triggers/schedules, and role based access.
Build custom UiPath activities in .NET/C# when native activities are insufficient; wrap service calls and common utilities.
Write clear documentation and partner closely with engineering, data science, and DevOps to accelerate safe deployments.

Job Responsibilities:

Who We Are
Founded in 1985, Rocket is a Detroit-based fintech platform including mortgage, real estate, title and personal finance businesses: Rocket Mortgage, Rocket Homes, Rocket Close, Rocket Money and Rocket Loans.

With more than 65 million call logs each year, 10 petabytes of data and a mission to Help Everyone Home, Rocket is well positioned to be the destination for AI-fueled home ownership. Known for providing exceptional client experiences, J.D. Power has ranked Rocket Mortgage #1 in client satisfaction for primary mortgage origination and mortgage servicing a total of 22 times - the most of any mortgage lender.

Required Skills:

Minimum Qualifications

Strong Python (pandas, NumPy, scikit learn); solid SQL.
Git proficiency; comfort with code reviews and branching (Azure DevOps).
Knowledge of the ML lifecycle: data prep, training, validation, packaging, inference.
Linux/CLI fluency; scripting mindset and attention to reproducibility.
Fundamentals in testing (unit/integration) and debugging.
Clear written communication; concise documentation.
Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with LLM evaluation, prompt management, and safety/guardrail techniques.
Exposure to AWS (S3, IAM, Lambda/ECS/EKS, SageMaker) or equivalent cloud.
ML Ops tooling: MLflow, feature stores, model registry, experiment tracking.
CI/CD familiarity (Azure DevOps Pipelines/CircleCI) and artifact/version management.
Containers & packaging: Docker, Makefiles, pyproject; REST basics.
Monitoring/observability concepts; experience with Dynatrace.
Data pipelines (Airflow/Step Functions) and eventing (SQS/Kafka).
Security & governance basics: PII handling, access controls, auditability.
Practical experience from coursework/projects/internships-open sourced or well documented.

Compensation and Benefits:

To be discussed with Recruiter during interview.

Job Summary:

The Opportunity

8 month work term starting May 2026
Pay range: $24-35/hr
Existing vacancy
Why You'll Love This Role
This is an excellent opportunity to work in a multi-disciplinary environment and to contribute to the process automation used at Lumentum. In this position, students will help to advance the automated assembly processes used in the final stages of the optical assembly of the WSS and OCS related products. Students will be mentored by senior engineers and together they will develop the processes, hardware and software to enable the targeted alignment improvements. Students will collaborate with the Optical Design, Manufacturing Engineering and Automation Software Development teams throughout their work terms, giving them a broad overview of the many disciplines involved in the design of our products.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Be Doing
The Optical Alignment Automation and Analytics Co-op responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
• Become familiar with Lumentum's optical alignment automation platform and manufacturing data management systems, as required.
• Implement targeted experiments to advance the alignment platform (hardware and processes) under the mentorship of the automation team.
• Debug and field-test processes with end-users and other developers.
• Create, peer review, and release work instructions and other necessary documentation.
• Improve the Python-based process analytics software platform.

Required Skills:

What We're Looking For
The following skills are required for this role:
• Curiosity to engage and understand
• Good problem-solving skills
• Excellent communication skills
• Team player and can work autonomously
• Familiarity with Python script programming or similar.
Practical experience with any of the following would be considered a strong asset:
• Affixing and detaching components with adhesives
• Machine vision processes, hardware, and software
• Robotic gripper processes, hardware, and software
• Pick and place automation processes
• Assembly and test of free-space optical systems
• Version control (any application).
• Tools to query, analyze and present data, such as Excel Pivots and Charts, JMP or Minitab.

Education: 3rd or 4th year: Mechatronics Engineering or related field.

Compensation and Benefits:

Pay range: $24-35/hr

Job Summary:

At onsemi, we help improve lives through silicon and software solutions every day. Our intelligent power and sensing technologies solve the world's most complex challenges and lead the way in creating a safer, cleaner, and smarter world. We are committed to developing strategies and programs to address global climate change and have pledged to achieve net-zero emissions by 2040. We invite you to join our innovative team and truly make a difference in people's lives.

onsemi is a Fortune 500 company and has been named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies by the Ethisphere Institute for the past 7 years in a row. In 2023, onsemi was recognized as one of the Waterloo Area's Top Employers by Canada's Top 100 Employers for the 4th time.

As part of the Software Solutions Team, this position will involve developing software solutions that enable our audio DSP, wireless, automotive and intelligent power solution portfolio of products with a particular focus on Artificial Intelligence (AI) Tool chain development. The ideal candidate for this position has a passion for programming at all levels, good communication skills and the ability to work well both independently and within a team.
We're seeking innovative and creative employees, who can learn quickly, solve new problems, and who are interested in working with us to build their skills.

Job Responsibilities:

Responsibilities include the design and development of features for any of our software products. Examples include:
• AI Tool chain development
• Communication libraries/Middleware
• Scripts used to prepare Software development kits
• Improvements and new features for our continuous integration infrastructure
• Integrated Development Environments (IDEs)
• Complete detailed technical reports and author design documents

Required Skills:

We're looking for candidates with:
• Experience in software development at a variety of levels, including high-level and embedded software
• Strong programming and debugging skills in one or more of Python and C/C++
• Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills
• Creative problem-solving skills
Any of the following is also an asset:
• Deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow
• Experience with continuous integration infrastructure (e.g. Jenkins)
• Familiarity with embedded systems including microcontrollers & microprocessors
Our office culture is one of inclusivity, respect and fun! Enjoy complimentary coffee, bagels and snacks in the kitchen, relax with other co-op students, do puzzles and play video games during your off-time in our lounge, play bass with our office band, and don't forget soccer every Friday at lunch! At onsemi, www.onsemi.com, you will have an opportunity to expand your horizons, work on exciting projects and make things happen!

Compensation and Benefits:

Hourly rates range from $23.50/hr - $34.00/hr, depending on the term.

Enjoy complimentary coffee, bagels and snacks in the kitchen, relax with other co-op students, do puzzles and play video games during your off-time in our lounge, play bass with our office band, and don't forget soccer every Friday at lunch! Job Summary:

Spring 2026 - May 11 to August 21, 2026

Join a team that is changing millions of lives.
Transforming smiles. Transforming lives. Transforming an industry.

At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person's life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever's next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

Role Summary:
Align Technology is seeking a talented and innovative Software Developer and Tester Co-op student. We are excited to offer students opportunities that can launch big careers. With a global reach beyond 1 million consumers, we're the team that's changing lives and making the world a better place through more smiles. We view interns as essential to the ongoing growth and innovation of our company.

Job Responsibilities:

Co-op Program Details

What sets this program apart from others?
You'll be assigned a manager to guide and support you through our individualized GROW Professional Development process. You'll also receive a mentor to provide day-to-day advice as you become the best professional version of yourself.

What kinds of roles are Co-op candidates hired into?
As a co-op student in one of our Software Developer or Testing groups, you'll work on projects essential to the future of our organization. These projects are designed to provide rich, real-world experience as a window into each career field. Software Developer or Testing are available in a variety of groups, including:

Software Development: Work on software and systems engineering projects and programs within the company. Their responsibilities include developing strategies to optimize operations.
Software Testing: Responsible for ensuring that manufactured products meet high-quality standards. A Quality Engineer is responsible for developing processes, testing procedures, and implementing systems to ensure that products and processes comply with safety regulations and meet clients' expectations.
Information Systems: Providing support for cutting-edge technology systems.
Our recruitment team will assess where you may be a best- fit based on your CV and the preferences you indicate during the application process.

How long is the program?
Our co-op program starts in May 2026 and runs through August 2026. You'll contribute to challenging projects with high impact during this 12-week paid co-op program.

Role Expectations:
Be agile, accountable, and customer-centric - These are the values we are built on!
Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced environment
Grow with the support of your team and help others grow by providing meaningful insights and feedback
Build relationships and deliver measurable results within your department
Be given opportunities for tangential learning
Perform additional responsibilities based on the specific role or group

Required Skills:

What we're looking for:

Must be currently enrolled at an accredited college or university pursuing a bachelor's degree with at least one quarter/semester to complete after co-op.
Must be available to work full time during the summer months (May-August)
This position is in the Toronto office and requires in-person attendance at the office 5 days a week from May-August 2026. *Relocation assistance is not provided*.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to work in a team environment
To be detailed oriented and well-organized with great time management skills
Complementary skills :
Involved inside and outside of the classroom
Strong desire to expand skillset and experience
Experience with software development and/or software testing
Knowledge of linear algebra, analytical geometry, or theory of algorithms
Ability to assess code written by someone else
Understanding of 3D-geometry

Transportation and Housing:

Align Technology does not provide any transportation or housing support

Working at 100 Queens Quay East

Key Amenities:

Complimentary Shuttle Service: A convenient shuttle bus is available to help employees commute with ease, connecting key transit points to the building.
Secure Bike Room: For those who cycle to work, the building provides a secure, card-access bike storage facility located on the East Mezzanine level. This space includes bike racks and lockers, ensuring your equipment stays safe.
Showers and Change Rooms: After your ride or workout, take advantage of the on-site showers and change rooms, making it easy to freshen up before starting your day.

$30-32/HR - no benefits

Job Summary:

Radar is geolocation infrastructure for every product and service. The Radar platform handles 1 Billion API calls per day. Companies like Vercel, Panera, and T-Mobile use Radar's geofencing SDKs and maps APIs to power location-based experiences across hundreds of millions of devices worldwide.

This role is in our NYC HQ.

We're looking for Full-stack, Backend, and Mobile Engineers to build customer-facing infrastructure. Radar co-ops can work on the frontend, backend, iOS/Android, and data engineering. Keep in mind, you don't need to be an expert in all of these (and you don't have to work on all of these stacks) but it definitely helps to have experience with in 1-2 areas.
This mode of work would be ideal for an engineer that's interested in acquiring new skills. We find it to be more efficient and interesting than being siloed in 1-2 stacks. We also have a collaborative engineering culture that allows you to learn new and complex things from your team and vice versa. You'll face exciting data and scaling challenges.

Job Responsibilities:

Work on the Radar application built with TypeScript, Rust, ES6, Node.js, Next.js, MongoDB, RocksDB, Redis, S3, Athena, Airflow, Spark, Scala, Kotlin, Objective-C, and Terraform
Learn new layers of the stack you're less familiar with
Build customer-facing features across multiple layers of the application
Continuously search for solutions that have 80% of the impact, but 20% of the cost

Required Skills:

Some engineering experience
Understanding in 1-2 of the following areas: frontend, backend, iOS/Android, data engineering
Perseverance in the face of challenges

Transportation and Housing:

This job is in our NYC HQ. Radar will cover visa and transportation costs to and from NYC at the beginning and end of the semester.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation is $60 / hour
Monthly fitness reimbursement
Free CitiBike membership
Team lunch or breakfast 3 times per week
Company outings

Hiring Preference given to Canadian Citizens and Permanent Residents. Security Clearance required. Fingerprinting is required.

Job Summary:

The National Research Council (NRC) is the Government of Canada's largest research organization supporting industrial innovation, the advancement of knowledge and technology development, and fulfilling government mandates.

The Clean Energy Innovation Research Centre of the NRC creates green and sustainable technologies for clean energy, resource extraction and environmental protection, essential to strengthen and support Canada's future clean economy.

This position has a direct impact on our mission to develop more efficient and sustainable pathways to discover new battery materials. The co-op student will implement advanced AI models to support both the discovery and optimization processes, contributing to the development of a functional decision-making system that addresses real industrial challenges. The co-op student will collaborate with engineers and scientists to develop modular, object-oriented code, train predictive models, and evaluate their performance within realistic discovery and optimization workflows.

The co-op student will have a direct and measurable impact on our mission through data-driven intelligence that accelerates innovation, enhances discovery efficiency, automates decision making, and advances next-generation materials technologies.

This is an opportunity to apply machine learning to real engineering and scientific problems, gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge optimization and control techniques, expand knowledge of advanced ML models, and directly contribute to building a smarter, more sustainable discovery platform for battery materials.

Job Responsibilities:

Develop clean, modular, and well-documented Python code using object-oriented programming principles to support surrogate modeling and control system components.
Implement and experiment with advanced machine learning and optimization algorithms, including Gaussian Processes, Bayesian Optimization, and/or Reinforcement Learning.
Extract, process, and clean data from internal and external databases, then build, train, and evaluate surrogate models to approximate system dynamics-ensuring accuracy, robustness, and scalability for integration into control frameworks.
Design and run simulation experiments to evaluate control strategies, analyze model performance, and contribute to model improvement through iterative testing and refinement.
Collaborate closely with engineers and scientists to understand problem statements, identify modeling challenges, and translate insights into computational solutions.

Required Skills:

Strong programming skills in Python, including experience with object-oriented programming and clean modular code design.
Functional knowledge of machine learning concepts including model training, evaluation, and data preprocessing
Experience with scientific computing libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, and matplotlib.
Familiarity with one or more ML frameworks such as scikit-learn, PyTorch, BoTorch
Strong problem-solving abilities and willingness to learn complex modeling or control concepts.
Ability to communicate technical ideas clearly and work collaboratively with multidisciplinary team
Nice to have basic understanding of Gaussian Processes, Bayesian Optimization, Reinforcement Learning algorithms, Version control tools (Git) and process engineering.
Conditions of Coop Work Program:
Students must be enrolled in a coop program. Graduate students and graduates will not be considered under this program.
Linguistic Profile: Reading, Writing and Oral Interaction in English.
Students must possess a minimum of a B average and must submit an unofficial transcript at time of application.
Open to Canadian Citizens or Permanent Residents of Canada. Additionally, foreign national students who meet the eligibility requirements, are studying in a recognized and eligible Canadian educational institution and possess a valid Co-op Work Permit may also apply.
For more information and requirements to work as a coop student or intern, please refer to the website:
https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/study-canada/work/intern.html
Please include citizenship information in your application.
Must obtain and retain a reliability security clearance.

At NRC, we know diversity enables excellence in research and innovation. We are committed to a diverse and representative workforce, an open and inclusive work environment, and contributing to a more inclusive Canadian innovation system.

Priority will be given to the following designated employment equity groups:
Women and Persons with Disabilities.

NRC welcomes all qualified applicants and encourages candidates to self-declare as members of the following designated employment equity groups: women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities.
Please advise of any accommodation measures required to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. They are available to all candidates for further assessment. Related information received will be addressed confidentially

Job Summary:

Breezy (https://getbreezy.app/) is a 1-stop shop for solopreneurs and SMBs selling services (home services, professional services). We build AI to help professionals market their services and manage customer relationships through an website builder, receptionist, and CRM.

This role will be for a full-stack software engineer that can ship features on our receptionist product and/or our website building product. We are looking for entrepreneurially-minded engineers who can own the entire feature lifecycle from inception through delivery and iteration.

Breezy is founded by Kevin (UWaterloo, Uber, Square) and Saul (Google, Klout), who've shipped together for 6 years across Lime and Kikoff as PM <> EM counterparts, scaling core products from 0 to $60M+ ARR and serving millions of customers. It's a seed stage company that's raised $3MM+ backed by leading early-stage funds (SPC, Kearny Jackson, Scribble Ventures), and subscription product founders.

How We Work
Nimble: Product development has transformed in the past year, and we're excited for what's next. We use AI to build 10x faster with higher quality.
In-person: We need low latency, high bandwidth communication. There's no better way to learn and grow than solving problems shoulder-to-shoulder in our dynamic space.
High agency: Our customers are our core. Everyone talks to customers, understands their problems, and builds solutions they need.

Job Responsibilities:

Product Development
- Build and ship customer-facing features across AI receptionist, CRM, website builder, and payment processing modules
- Implement and optimize user onboarding flows to improve activation and conversion rates
- Develop integrations with third-party services (Stripe, Telnyx, analytics tools)

Analytics & Growth Infrastructure
- Build internal dashboards and analytics tools to track key product metrics (engagement, retention, revenue)
- Implement and debug conversion tracking, event instrumentation, and user behavior analytics
- Write SQL queries for growth accounting, cohort analysis, and feature usage reporting

Technical Operations
- Debug and resolve customer-reported issues across the platform
- Optimize database queries and improve application performance
- Implement A/B tests and feature experiments to drive product decisions

Ownership & Impact
- Take end-to-end ownership of features from design through deployment
- Work directly with the CEO on product strategy and technical decisions

Job Summary:

Summary

Role: Software engineer (backend-focused) at a YC/Accel-backed, high-growth, early-stage startup.

Company: We're a fast-growing, YC-backed startup modernizing one of the world's largest, most complex industries. Construction relies on outdated systems, disconnected tools, and manual workflows. Agave is a product platform providing data infrastructure and workflow automation around the construction ERP. Our founding team has worked together for 10 years, first at Graphiq (acq. by Amazon) then at Amazon.

Why join us?
At Agave, you'll work alongside a team of exceptional engineers where you'll work on hard problems.

Learn 10x faster than anywhere else: from day one, you'll ship code that touches real customers, work closely with our customers, and get direct feedback from seasoned engineers who care deeply about your growth. You'll learn a ton and have outsized ownership.
Solve high-leverage problems: all of our engineers tackle some of the hardest, most rewarding challenges in infrastructure, data architecture, and systems design. You'll help build the infrastructure that powers millions of real-time data syncs across critical tools. We treat co-ops like full-time employees; you'll have the opportunity to work on interesting projects that have a real business and customer impact.
Low risk, huge upside: We're profitable, cash flow positive, scaling fast, and backed by top investors (YC, Accel, founders of Plaid, etc.).
Have fun! This is our second time hosting Waterloo co-ops (our first batch of 3 will actually be joining us full-time after graduation). From baseball games at Oracle park to mini golf to team dinners, we'll do everything we can to make you feel like a critical part of the team here.
Learn more about the industry and opportunity here.

Job Responsibilities:

You'll work on a variety of technical projects spanning these areas:

Unification: we're unifying dozens-to-hundreds of fragmented systems under a single standard that we define. Our unification covers data objects, data models, authentication, account-linking UX, and features like filters and pagination. When designing any new feature, we have to do it in a scalable way. For example, when adding filters, we have to research each system we support (and plan to support) and create a generic, system-agnostic solution.

On-prem systems: we're connecting with many types of on-prem systems (SQL-based, DLL-based, API-based), many built 20-40 years ago. We provide tremendous value to customers allowing them to interface with these systems in a secure, fast, reliable way, as if they're modern, cloud-based products. We need to support real-time communication and webhooks when they don't exist (e.g., using web-sockets).

Scale & speed: we're handling millions of API requests per day and growing daily. For our products that we power with our own API (e.g. Analytics), we need to store and retrieve large amounts of data in an efficient way, building elegant caching layers to reduce latency. We ship code daily and iterate quickly based on actual feedback from paying customers (they share tons!).

Operational excellence: we're creating a reliable API layer on top of many old systems that don't have APIs. It's like building a skyscraper on quicksand, enforced by SLAs. We need to innovate in expanding the depth and breadth of our integrations while simultaneously increasing our development velocity. We need to be very creative in how to continually test our code and integrations, creating scalable testing frameworks that can catch edge cases and bugs across 1k+ endpoints.

Mix of back-end and front-end: we're building front-end apps that dog-food our own APIs (e.g. Sync, Analytics). This helps us build world-class APIs because we suffer any pain present in our API. We're building both the lego blocks and the higher-level lego models: we see what kinds of APIs our SaaS customers want, then also look at the kinds of API niceties we want for our own applications (like a caching layer, advanced filtering) and implement a combination of the two.

Variety: without knowing, you might assume adding a new integration is low-ambiguity and routine. But each integration we launch is special, completely different and posing unique challenges. This requires researching that system and its nuances in great depth before building on top of it. It's part engineering, part archeology.

Required Skills:

Back-end/full-stack engineer
At least 2 co-ops at software companies
Self-motivated, high ownership, low ego. Desire to work on a fast-paced, intense, fun team.
Pumped to work in-person with us in SF 5 days/week.
No need to have: prior experience with our tech stack or at B2B SaaS/dev tools companies

Transportation and Housing:

We will cover the cost of your flight to and from San Francisco. You will be expected to find your own housing.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation:
Cash range: $8-10k USD per month

This job is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP). The SWPP program requires that candidates be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

Job Summary:

Your Impact this Summer:
Make use of your leadership and organizational skills while having an amazing summer camp experience. Join our mission to inspire and mentor children at York Region's first and largest STEAM summer camp! Our camp programs are located across Richmond Hill and surrounding areas for children and youth ages 4-14. Be an engaging leader and create a dynamic and educational STEAM programming for children through…

Supporting staff to provide exceptional camp experiences
Facilitating and overseeing the development of engaging STEAM activities
Promoting teamwork, creativity, and skill development
Managing child development and creating a fun, safe environment
So much more!!
Job Overview:
We are looking for organized and dynamic Program Managers to join our Leadership Team for Summer Camp 2025. In this senior role, you will lead and mentor a team of instructors to deliver engaging, educational, and hands-on programming for children. You will oversee the planning and execution of hands-on science, technology, and engineering projects that promote skill development and inspire creativity. Activities may include coding, robotics, 2D/3D design, woodworking, and more. Your role will be crucial in ensuring that the staff are well-prepared to lead lessons, projects and materials are ready in advance, and that daily operations run smoothly. This role requires strong organizational skills, leadership, and the ability to coordinate multiple teams and projects in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. If you thrive in a leadership role and have a passion for guiding a team to create an exceptional camp experience, this role is for you.

Our Ideal Candidate:
Currently finishing their post-secondary studies or recently graduated in a related field such as engineering, science, or education.
Has experience teaching and working with children, ideally in a camp or recreational setting.
Highly organized, with the ability to plan and manage multiple tasks at once.
Flexible and adaptable, able to thrive in a dynamic and evolving environment.
Excellent time management and communication skills.
Maintains strong rapport with staff, children, and camp families.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities:

Act as a positive role model, providing leadership to instructors and being an active member of our Leadership Team.
Lead training and evaluations for instructors to ensure high-quality lesson delivery.
Support instructors in developing and refining camp lessons and projects.
Ensure that educational programming provides meaningful skill development and fun, hands-on experiences for children.
Oversee the smooth operation of the camp day by creating and maintaining schedules, while ensuring activities are engaging.
Coordinate with the production team to ensure materials and equipment are requested and ordered in advance of each activity, guaranteeing timely preparation and availability.
Lead staff meetings, promoting open communication and a collaborative working environment.
Serve as a liaison between the Leadership Team and instructors to ensure all programming needs are met.
Support the daily schedule by supervising extended care before and after camp when assigned

Required Skills:

Job Requirements:

Completed at least 2 years of post-secondary education in a related field such as engineering, science, or education.
Previous experience in a supervisory or leadership role, ideally in a camp or recreational setting.
Hands-on experience with skills such as digital fabrication, woodworking, robotics, coding, 2D/3D design, or electronics.
At least 1 year of experience facilitating programs for children, emphasizing hands-on engagement and collaborative activities.
Full weekday availability from mid-May to the end of August.

Considered an Asset:
A background or education in teaching, recreation, early childhood education, science, or technology.

Additional Requirements:
Access to a personal device (e.g., laptop) to complete job responsibilities.
Current Standard First Aid with CPR-C (required prior to the start of camp)
Vulnerable Sector Screening Check (required prior to the start of camp)
Valid driver's license and reliable access to a vehicle.

Transportation and Housing:

This is an in-person position and successful candidates must be able to commute to Richmond Hill. Public transit from Toronto is not fast. Please look up our location to ensure you would be able to commit to the commute.

Please discuss your plan for commuting to Richmond Hill in your cover letter, including estimated commuting times and/or public transit routes.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required
Other	Vulnerable Sector Check (upon hire)

Contract Salary Range: $21.00 per hour.

Job Summary:

Your Impact this Summer:
Make use of your creativity and imagination while having an amazing summer camp experience. Join our mission to inspire and mentor children at York Region's first and largest STEAM summer camp! Our camp programs are located across Richmond Hill and surrounding areas for children and youth ages 4-14. Be an engaging leader, teaching, creating, and staying active with children while helping them develop and hone their skills through…

Hands-on building, arts, and science projects
3D printing, coding, robotics, electronics, and woodworking lessons

Job Overview:
We are seeking enthusiastic and dynamic Program Instructors to join our Summer 2026 camp team. Instructors play a crucial role in delivering unforgettable summer experiences by facilitating hands-on, engaging activities and projects for children ages 4-14. Our programs offer exciting opportunities to work with cutting-edge technology and help children develop valuable skills, build confidence, and collaborate. This role requires creativity, energy, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to engage children safely in STEAM activities. If you have experience working with children and a passion for inspiring youth, we would love to have you on board!

(JK - Grade 4)
Responsible for teaching and facilitating Science and Engineering concepts to children in JK-Grade 4 through hands-on learning and building projects. You will help to develop the children's creativity, knowledge, and interest in STEM-related topics. Also responsible for instructing a basic introduction to certain topics including coding, robotics (e.g. lego robotics, dash robots), 3D printing, and woodworking. Instructors for this age group will be involved in the development of lessons, activities, and hands-on demonstrations being delivered during the summer.

(Grade 5 - 9)
Responsible for teaching and facilitating Science, Engineering, Art, and Math concepts to children in Grade 5-9, guiding them through design learning and the science and engineering process. You will also be responsible for leading hands-on activities in topics including woodworking, 3D printing, coding, robotics, making, creating, and more. Instructors for this age group may be involved in the design of lessons and projects being delivered during the summer.

Our Ideal Candidate:
Has experience supervising and facilitating programs for children in a camp, recreation, or educational setting.
Demonstrates creativity, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to adjust teaching methods to accommodate different learning styles.
Has knowledge and experience in STEAM topics, including coding, robotics, 3D printing, engineering, and arts-based projects.
Is collaborative, team-oriented, and passionate about providing an exceptional learning experience for children.
Is enthusiastic about working with children and inspiring them to explore and develop their creativity.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities:

Deliver dynamic and engaging STEAM programming to children ages 4-14, fostering curiosity, creativity, and enthusiasm for science, technology, engineering, arts, and math.
Develop and implement creative, hands-on lesson plans and activities, including coding, robotics, 3D printing, and engineering challenges.
Provide a safe and supportive environment for children during all STEAM-related activities.
Maintain clean, organized, and safe classrooms throughout the day, ensuring program spaces are ready for activities and returned to an orderly state at the end of the day.
Actively engage in camp-wide programs and daily activities to contribute to a positive and exciting camp experience.
Encourage teamwork and problem-solving skills by guiding children through group-based activities and challenges.
Collaborate with fellow instructors, counsellors, and the leadership team to ensure smooth and effective program delivery.
Bring energy and enthusiasm to each session, making learning fun and engaging for all children.

Required Skills:

Job Requirements:

Currently a student in a post-secondary institution or recently graduated (preferably in a science, engineering, education, or art-related field).
At least 1 year of experience facilitating programs for children, preferably in a camp or recreational setting.
A minimum of 2 years of experience working directly with children, with demonstrated leadership and interpersonal skills.
Strong knowledge and experience in one or more STEAM-related areas (e.g., coding, robotics, 3D printing, engineering, arts).
Considered an Asset:
Experience with hands-on skills such as robotics, coding, electronics, 2D/3D design, woodworking, or other STEAM-related fields.
Familiarity with educational tools and software used for STEAM programming (e.g., Scratch, Tinkercad, Lego Robotics).

This would be a 4 month paid contract from May 4 to August 28, 2026.

Special Job Requirements:

Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).

Job Summary:

As an Associate Machine Learning Developer, you will have a chance to work on public sector ML projects and deliver real solutions to our Public Sector Partners including Service Alberta, other departments, and even other levels of government. GovLab AI's mission is to set a global example of how to transform the public sector through applied AI, and is designed to encourage the growth of machine learning and AI skill sets that are in high demand across Alberta and around the world.

Our program experience is unique and designed to give you hands on experience to prepare you for professional success. During the 4-month period you will be placed on a team to work on specific use case(s) identified by our Public Sector Partners. You will work with multiple tools and gain experience in multiple AI/ML and data processing fields. You will also be given resources and mentorship to help with your growth and career advancement. The teams will be led by the Project Delivery Manager utilizing AltaML methodology to create working models for the viable use case(s) and help guide the teams to make recommendations on how best to implement the solution with our Partners.

Our ultimate goal is to set you up for success and have you hired in the future after your internship!

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do:

Participate in team planning sessions and educational presentations
Review the data to understand its overall scope and structure
Identifying the right metric to measure the success of the model and project
Work in teams to pre-process the data for analysis and model development
Uncover trends, insights, and key features to help guide where ML solutions can be applied
Develop models around the available data and suggested set of problems
For viable use cases develop proof of concept working models
Suggest and explore novel solutions to a problem and detailed recommendations for how to integrate the models in business
Communicating and presenting your teams work to AltaML and Public Sector Partners
Get familiarity with various data processing tools and exposure to AI/ML algorithms
Independently researching and connecting with your cohort to gain domain knowledge and learn state-of-the-art techniques
You will work with multiple tools and gain experience in multiple AI/ML and data processing fields. You will be given resources and mentorship to help with your growth and career advancement.

Required Skills:

Minimum Requirements:

Currently enrolled at UWaterloo
General knowledge of and experience developing in Python and data science libraries/packages such as pandas, scikit-learn, matplotlib
Post secondary degree in progress / diploma in a related field, or technical training
Understanding of Machine Learning and software development concepts
Must be able to work 40 hours per week during the internship
Nice to have:
Exposure to version control/Git
Experience with a cloud platform such as Azure, AWS or GCP
Ability to work independently and within a team environment
Well-developed communication skills, with the ability to engage in client meetings and deliver professional presentations

Compensation and Benefits:

This opportunity is funded by Mitacs and offers a $15 - $20k stipend amount for the complete 4-month duration of the program.

Please note: This opportunity is also eligible to be extended to an 8-month term. In your application, please specify whether or not you would also be open to an 8-month term.
