Job Summary:

About Us
YuJa, Inc. is a leading provider of cloud-based digital compliance and accessibility solutions for regulated sectors worldwide. Serving clients in higher education, K-12, government, and healthcare, YuJa enables organizations to meet evolving regulatory demands while delivering engaging, secure, and accessible digital experiences. Our platforms such as Lumina (video), Panorama (LMS accessibility), EqualGround (governance), and Verity (proctoring) are rigorously tested for compliance, audited, and secured.

For over a decade, YuJa has been dedicated to building not only innovative digital compliance and accessibility solutions, but also a workplace where our people can thrive. We invest in our employees by fostering career growth, continuous learning, and opportunities for advancement. Our culture is rooted in collaboration, inclusivity, and belonging, where every team member's contributions are valued and their voices are heard. Just as we help institutions and organizations worldwide achieve their goals, we are equally committed to supporting the success of our people and making a positive impact in the communities we serve. Meet the YuJa family here (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i4by6elkb-s) and see what makes YuJa special!

Job Responsibilities:

About the Role

Support the development and evaluation of machine learning models
Assist with data cleaning, labeling, and preprocessing
Run experiments to benchmark models and tune hyperparameters
Contribute to model deployment and integration into our products
Collaborate on research, technical documentation, and presentations
Explore cutting-edge tools and techniques (e.g., LLMs, embeddings, vector stores)

Required Skills:

About You

You are currently enrolled in a bachelors program in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or related field
Have experience with Python and ML libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, PyTorch, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, and OpenCV.)
Understand ML fundamentals (classification, regression, evaluation metrics)
Have built personal or academic projects involving data science or AI
You are curious, resourceful, and eager to learn in a fast-paced environment
Bonus Points For
Experience with Hugging Face, LangChain, or vector databases
Familiarity with tools like Jupyter, Git, or Docker
Previous internship or research experience in AI/ML is preferred
Participation in hackathons, Kaggle, or open-source ML contributions

Transportation and Housing:

The job location is close to a TTC subway stop. It is also on a frequent TTC bus route. There are multiple ways to commute to our office. There is also free parking at site.

Compensation and Benefits:

The total base compensation is $70,000.00 per year

Job Summary:

At onsemi, we help improve lives through silicon and software solutions every day. Our intelligent power and sensing technologies solve the world's most complex challenges and lead the way in creating a safer, cleaner, and smarter world. We're developing leading-edge wireless enabled MCUs, DSPs and software that sense and connect the world or help manage personal health through body worn or implantable devices. Our world-class ultra-low power solutions contribute to a more sustainable future. We are committed to developing strategies and programs to address global climate change and have pledged to achieve net-zero emissions by 2040. We invite you to join our innovative team and truly make a difference in people's lives.

onsemi is a Fortune 500 company and has been named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies by the Ethisphere Institute for the past 7 years in a row. In 2023, onsemi was recognized as one of the Waterloo Area's Top Employers by Canada's Top 100 Employers for the 4th time.

As part of the Wireless & DSP Firmware team, this position will primarily involve developing embedded software solutions for ultra-low power wireless SoCs. The ideal candidate for this position has a passion for wireless technology, some real-world experience in embedded systems development, good communication skills and the ability to work well both independently and within a team.
We're seeking innovative and creative individuals, who have an eagerness to learn, solve problems, and who are interested in working with us to build their skills.

Job Responsibilities:

Here's are some of the things you will be engaged in:
Developing, debugging, testing wireless sample applications
Working with wireless protocol stacks
Working with system libraries
Lab evaluation using electrical equipment
Using software tools such as Python to automate development tasks
Contribute to our technical documentation

Required Skills:

We're looking for candidates with:

Experience with developing firmware in resource constrained environments.
Good C/C++ programming and debugging skills.
Experience with Python
Knowledge of microcontrollers and microprocessors
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills
Creative problem-solving skills

Any of the following is also an asset:
Experience using basic lab equipment such as power supplies, oscilloscopes, logic analysers etc.
Familiarity with wireless communication protocols (e.g., Bluetooth Classic, Bluetooth Low Energy, NFC, etc.)
Familiarity with hardware peripheral devices (e.g., SPI, I2C, DMA, ADC, etc.)
Knowledge of signal processing
Our office culture is one of inclusivity, respect and fun! Enjoy complimentary coffee, bagels and snacks in the kitchen, relax with other co-op students, do puzzles and play video games during your off-time in our lounge, play bass with our office band, and don't forget soccer every Friday at lunch! You will have the opportunity to interact with colleagues whose work ranges from IC Design to Product Marketing. At onsemi, www.onsemi.com, you will have an opportunity to expand your horizons, work on exciting projects and make things happen!

Compensation and Benefits:

Hourly rates range from $23.50/hr - $34.00/hr, depending on the term.

Our office culture is one of inclusivity, respect and fun! Enjoy complimentary coffee, bagels and snacks in the kitchen, relax with other co-op students, do puzzles and play video games during your off-time in our lounge, play bass with our office band, and don't forget soccer every Friday at lunch! At onsemi, www.onsemi.com, you will have an opportunity to expand your horizons, work on exciting projects and make things happen!

The ideal candidate for this position has a passion for wireless technology and/or audio DSP, some real-world experience in embedded systems development, good communication skills and the ability to work well both independently and within a team.

Job Responsibilities:

We're looking for candidates to contribute to the development of embedded software for our wireless and/or DSP devices. Examples include:
Sample applications
System libraries
Device drivers
Wireless protocol stacks
DSP libraries
Audio signal processing algorithms
Lab evaluation using electrical or acoustic measurement equipment
Use software tools such as Python to automate development tasks
Use software tools such as MATLAB for signal analysis
Contribute to our technical documentation

Required Skills:

We're looking for candidates with:

Experience in firmware development in resource constrained environments
Strong C/C++ programming and debugging skills
Experience with Python and/or MATLAB
Knowledge of microcontrollers and microprocessors
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills
Creative problem-solving skills

Any of the following is also an asset:
Experience using basic lab equipment such as power supplies, oscilloscopes, etc.
Knowledge of signal processing
Familiarity with wireless communication protocols (e.g., Bluetooth Classic, Bluetooth Low Energy, NFC, etc.)
Familiarity with hardware peripheral devices (e.g., SPI, I2C, DMA, ADC, etc.)

Job Summary:


The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC), North America's third largest transit system and recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA has introduced its new 2024-2028 TTC Corporate Plan - Moving Toronto, Connecting Communities which continues the TTC's legacy of delivering service to hundreds of millions of customers a year. The TTC's new vision and mission statements also help promote the many environmental, social equity and economic benefits that the TTC provides:
Vision: Moving Toronto towards a more equitable, sustainable, and prosperous future.
Mission: To serve the needs of transit riders by providing a safe, reliable, efficient, and accessible mass public transit service through a seamless integrated network to create access to opportunity for everyone.
At the TTC, our Early Talent programs provide students with the opportunity to work alongside experts on exciting projects, gain an understanding on the transit industry, develop in-demand skills and experiences and get an early start to your career. This is your chance to make a meaningful impact on Toronto's transit!
The full Plan can be viewed on ttc.ca.
Please note: We are pleased to announce now that our co-op roles are now open to all students! You do not need to be enrolled in a co-op program to apply. Eligibility requirements include being eligible to work in Canada & enrollment at an accredited Canadian post-secondary institution
General Accountability

CADD preparation of electrical building systems and traction power drawings and design under guidance of technologists and engineers.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities

Providing drafting (CADD) services and assisting in calculations/design for commercial/industrial transit facilities including subway stations, substations, bus garages, shops, and carhouses.
Drafting/design of high/low voltage AC power distribution, traction power, protection and control, lighting, transformers, rectifiers, circuit breakers, PLCs, MCCs, panelboards, switchboards, CCTV, and Fire Alarm.
Co-ordination of work with other engineering disciplines.
Assist in performing field investigations and inspections at existing facilities and those under construction.
Retrieve existing drawings and archived information pertinent to current designs and investigations.
Assist in the preparation of studies and investigations under the direction of senior staff.

Required Skills:

Skills

Knowledge of AutoCAD or MicroStation is an asset.
Knowledge of electrical systems theory, normally acquiring by successfully completing relevant University or College courses.
TTC will provide in-house Subway Rule Book and WHMIS training. Must pass Subway Rule Book training to gain track level access.
Education and Experience
Education or related experience in the following fields:
Electrical Engineering
Systems Engineering
Mechatronics Engineering
Energy Engineering
Engineering Science
Engineering Physics
Electrical Engineering Technology
Energy System Engineering Technology
Additional Requirements
Most work will be in an office environment. There will be site visits to existing operating facilities and sites under construction. Training and hazard identification will be provided to ensure safety at all times.
There may be a requirement to climb and descend ladders - training will also be provided to ensure safety.
Normal working week will consist of 35 hours from Monday to Friday, in a Hybrid capacity, working from home 3 days per week
Please include a cover letter and copy of your unofficial transcript with your application
This position is designated Safety-Sensitive under the TTC's Fitness for Duty Policy. You will be required to pass a medical assessment and drug test as part of the certification process.
Students will be required to complete a criminal background check during the onboarding stage, satisfactory results will be required.

Transportation and Housing:

PLEASE NOTE: Transportation will be provided via a TTC Employee Pass.

Additional Information:

Unrestricted Driver Licence
Security Clearance Required


Compensation and Benefits:

Salary Scale: $25.61 to $31.98 per hour

The System Validation Team is looking for an enthusiastic and technical skilled individual to assist with creation of system level hardware and software as well as automation of test suites for pre-silicon and post-silicon validation to ensure compliance with system level requirements and performance.

We're seeking innovative and creative employees, who can learn quickly, solve new problems, and who are interested in working with us to build their skills.

Responsibilities:

Develop characterization platform to perform system validation
Develop automated test systems to collect and report measurement data
Work with associated low-level firmware and interface software
Assess and characterize performance of prototype ICs using lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, function generators, logic analyzers, spectrum analyzers and communication protocol testers

* In-Depth Knowledge of C/C++ and scripting languages including Python. Assembly language is an asset.
* Knowledge of microprocessor architecture, including memory maps, busses, interrupts, interfacing
* Interest in extremely low-level programming (at the hardware level)
* Experience using standard lab equipment for testing, taking measurements, debugging systems
* Interest in semiconductors (ASIC and ASSP)
* Interest in wireless/RF and audio technologies
* Interest or experience in embedded systems (FPGA, hardware, firmware, software)
* Interest or experience in hardware development, including PCBs (schematic design, layout, verification)
* Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills

Job Summary:

Job Summary

Our team of system developers in the IT Portfolio Management Office is currently looking for an enthusiastic, collaborative and highly motivated student to help us build, automate and streamline processes that will support core project management and governance functions at the IT division at HOOPP. Working on a highly dynamic and agile team, you will contribute directly to the development and growth of our program and gain cross-functional skills experience. Developers at HOOPP are supported in their learning and growth throughout their careers and self-motivated, ambitious candidates will come into an empowering work environment that fosters personal development and provides co-ops with the skills and tools that they need to succeed.

Job Responsibilities:

What you will do:

Plan, code, test and deploy incremental changes every week as a part of our agile development team
Collaborate directly with business partners on their roadblocks and goals, from whiteboard to deployment
Craft and deliver automated processes, client facing web components and core reports and dashboards
Proactively identify issues, bugs, and areas for improvement - and follow up with action items
Innovate new solutions that make a difference to the teams we support - this role will have plenty of scope to connect with our partners on the challenges they face day to day, and our co-ops are encouraged to think creatively and use the tools we have available to create innovative new solutions and show off their ingenuity

Required Skills:

What we are looking for:

Currently enrolled in a college or university program in computer science, software engineering or similar program
Knowledge of cloud-based environments, specifically Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Knowledge of object-oriented programming methodologies and JavaScript
Knowledge of Power BI or a similar reporting tool
Experience consuming and working with data through APIs
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work well in a dynamic and fast-moving team environment
High enthusiasm, self-starter and urgency to get things done
Personal interest in data analytics and reporting, recent certifications in Power BI, SQL/NoSQL analytics, or data analytics especially on the Azure cloud platform are considered strong assets
Knowledge of component-based web design (Angular, AngularJS, React or similar) is considered an asset
Knowledge and understanding of the SCRUM and KANBAN Agile methodologies is considered an asset
Tools we use:
ServiceNow, Power Platform/Power Automate, Splunk, Tenable
Microsoft Fabric/PowerBI - Dataflows, Data Warehouse, Reports, Dashboards, Applications
Azure - Function Apps, Logic Apps, Web Apps
Azure DevOps - Agile Boards, CI/CD Pipelines, Git Repos

Compensation and Benefits:

The expected hourly rate range for this role is $21.00 to $31.00

The actual hourly rate offered to the successful candidate may vary based on multiple factors including, but not limited to, individual's expertise and level of experience applicable to the role they are being offered.

Working in a highly dynamic and agile team environment, you will learn the latest technologies and development practices, gain hands-on exposure to the pension Industry, and help make a major difference in the lives of over 400,000 current and future pensioners in our community.

The Modern Workplace team supports technologies that are critical organization wide such as Copilot, Teams, Exchange, and Telephony. There will be an opportunity to write code relating to automation in these technologies as well as learning admin tasks of common AI tools.

Job Responsibilities:

What you will do:

Support the team with Exchange, Teams, Telephony, Microsoft Teams Rooms, Copilot and other Microsoft 365 products.
Collaborating and working closely with team members to support the technologies in the teams' portfolio.
Ensure Azure DevOps boards are updated regularly.
Providing and receiving inputs on system design and code
Current technologies used: VS Code, Azure DevOps, C#, Python, Microsoft Graph, SharePoint Online and Microsoft Power Platform

Required Skills:

What you will bring:

Knowledge of object-oriented languages (C#, Java, C++, or similar), and/or JavaScript
Knowledge of PowerShell or similar scripting language
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and other cloud computing platforms
Passion for learning new technologies and apply new skills
Good verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work well in a dynamic and fast-moving team-based environment
High enthusiasm, self-starter and urgency to get things done

Job Summary

The AI Lab is a small and agile innovation team within HOOPP, focused on experimenting with and building cutting-edge AI solutions for real-world business problems. We build tools, prototypes, and applications that help transform data into valuable insights to support decision making in investment management. Our team values curiosity, collaboration, and a passion for continuous learning.

We're looking for a Student Intern who loves solving complex problems and building scalable, data-driven applications. You'll work closely with our AI engineers and business partners to enhance our existing applications and develop new pipelines and automation tools.

This is a hands-on role where you'll gain exposure to both application development and data engineering in a cloud environment. You'll contribute to proof of concepts and real projects which are already in use by business stakeholders.

Work on enhancing and maintaining existing Python Dash applications
Build and optimize data pipelines that support analytics and AI use cases
Collaborate with AI engineers and business users to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions

Experiment with new models, technologies, frameworks, and data tools to continuously improve our workflows.

Currently pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a quantitative field with relevant experience

full_description:

This is primarily an in-office position in Waterloo with occasional work from home flexibility.

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Job Summary:

This is an opportunity in the exciting and fast-growing transportation technology industry. Public transit is being transformed from a system of static, scheduled fixed-routes, to a dynamic on-demand network, and you'll be one of the pioneers shaping this transformation.

As a Business Data Analyst, you'll be responsible for working directly with clients in face-to-face virtual or in-person meetings, analyzing client operations data, working with project managers on project implementations, running service simulations, assessing key performance indicators, proactively driving client operational improvements, and providing technical systems support for multiple clients. You will develop a deep understanding of urban mobility challenges faced by transit operators. You will become an expert on RideCo's technology platform and data-driven design and operation of transportation services.

Who we are:
http://www.rideco.com

RideCo powers on-demand transit. Public transit agencies and fleet operators use RideCo's cloud-based software platform to provide on-demand shared rides in dynamically routed buses and vans. RideCo is growing rapidly, and it is the most adopted cloud-based on-demand transit software among the ten largest cities in the United States. Our marquee clients include Philadelphia's SEPTA, San Antonio Metro, and Houston Metro.

RideCo's software powers a diverse range of use cases, including paratransit, residential/ suburban travel; first-mile-last-mile connections for transit hubs; and corporate employee transportation. The success of these services is supported by the industry's best customer service, including a 95% plus customer retention rate. We are investing to scale up and capture the growing demand for on-demand shared rides solutions.

Job Responsibilities:

During your work term, your day-to-day responsibilities will include:

Program and client management: Plan and launch client projects as per the project timeline. Support communication and coordination between project stakeholders including transit planners, senior management, marketing, and operations staff. Work closely with the client through the entire project lifecycle and post-launch operations, prioritizing requests and fostering a strong relationship focused on desired customer outcomes and world-class customer experience.
Implement transportation services: Work together with project managers, solutions engineers, and client stakeholders to develop and implement transportation solutions that fit the needs of the customer. Translate client requirements into technical solutions leveraging the RideCo platform. Utilize a keen eye for detail to manipulate service parameters to meet the precise needs and goals of the client.
Support new service launches: Setup, test, and tune system parameters, run simulations, oversee training, soft launch, monitor KPIs on launch week and make ongoing system changes as needed.
Data analysis and performance reporting: Perform ad-hoc data analysis tasks to compare service performance against goals, evaluate trends, and proactively identify areas for improvement. Collaborate with data engineers to design performance analysis reports spanning rider user-experience, driver user-experience, marketing, operating efficiency, and unit economics. Review the performance reports with stakeholders and the client operations team on weekly face-to-face client meetings to generate insights and actions. Collaborate with project managers to develop end to end executive business review presentations for senior stakeholders.
Run simulations and optimize service design: Perform simulations to analyze performance and operational KPIs. Iterate on the service model by tuning and optimizing dozens of parameters such as dynamic routing engine settings, vehicle count and mix, supply positioning, service frequency, location and density of potential stops, and demand models. Collaborate with the client, operations managers, and other key stakeholders throughout this process. Support the client in setting targets and KPIs for the service prior to launch.
Provide technical support: Provide ongoing technical systems and analytics support to operations managers. Advise them on using the system's dashboards and interpreting the data. Perform system configuration changes based on feedback from operations staff, drivers, and passengers.
Drive continuous improvement: Collaboratively develop weekly/monthly actions to drive continuous improvements, and to achieve the service's objectives (e.g. user experience, ridership, operating efficiency, financials, etc.).
Improve internal processes and tooling: Identify ways to further automate and systematize our internal processes. Collaboratively champion internal process/tooling improvements.
Support product improvements: Expand your knowledge of the transportation industry, understand clients' pain points and identify gaps/opportunities in the product. Share your insights with the product team and assist the product management team in designing new features/improvements to RideCo's platform.
Educate and document: Continuously expand the collective knowledgebase of the company through multi-disciplinary learning, knowledge sharing through live demos, and updating/creating documentation on our knowledge management system.
Client Support: Answer technical support tickets from clients in a timely manner, providing exceptional customer service to client queries and issues. Perform adhoc administrative tasks when required.

Required Skills:

- Major in Math/Business/Economics
- A cumulative average of greater than 70%
- Proficient with Microsoft Excel and pivot tables
- Comfortable with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Word)
- An innovative/entrepreneurial mindset
- Strong written/oral communication and presentation skills
- Nice to have: Knowledge of relational databases with the ability to read and write SQL. Experience with Power BI.

Transportation and Housing:

We provide our KW-based employees and co-op students a complimentary commuter service (home-to-office and return within Kitchener and Waterloo) as part of the on-going service testing of our transit platform.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salaried position with competitive salary - to be discussed during interview
Flex-time work schedule
Bi-weekly lunches ordered into the office
Social events
Generous supply of snacks
Casual dress code
Convenient centrally located office space

Job Summary:

Datacurve is a data partner to the foundation model labs (e.g., Meta, DeepMind) to progress model capabilites. We're building a gamified developer platform where tens of thousands of engineers create high fidelity datasets that push LLM frontiers. We've raised $17.5m as a 1.5 year old startup with a growing team of 11. Investors include Y Combinator, the founders of Cohere, Vercel, Replit, and researchers from OpenAI, Deepmind, and Anthropic.

This engineering role owns the technical lifecycle of data pipelines for product engineering -from defining new data formats with partner labs to shipping the tooling, environments, docs, and QA that make those formats real at scale. You will build developer tooling and pipelines for developers that directly drive 6 to 7 figures of revenue.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do
Own projects end-to-end, from initial prototyping to ongoing maintenance, bug fixing, and iteration based on feedback.
Product engineering: Fullstack product engineering work to make the platform world-class like Leetcode or Kaggle.
Own developer experience pipelines end-to-end: Prototype tooling for collecting new data formats → productionize workflow → iterate from developer experience
Design and build delightful developer experience: Create clear, concise guidelines and documentation to empower our data contributors and ensure high-quality inputs for your projects.
Quality & governance: Develop and manage the quality standards for your projects, which includes training and aligning content reviewers to ensure data consistency and accuracy. Implement automated checks, eval harnesses, reviewer workflows, and data quality bars; be hands on and in the weeds to align with reviewers on standards.
Maintain & iterate: Monitor, debug, and continuously improve reliability, latency, and contributor success rates.
What You'll Do Sometimes
Define Frontier data formats: Co-author specs/RFCs with frontier lab researchers; design schemas, metadata, and versioning for new task/trajectory formats.
Build developer tooling & environments: Ship tooling, sandboxes, CLIs/SDKs, and capture/instrumentation to make contribution flows fast and safe.

Required Skills:

You'll Succeed Here If You Have
Excellent written communication skills, with a proven ability to explain complex concepts to a less technical audience.
An organized and process-oriented mindset - you enjoy bringing structure to ambiguous problems and are meticulous about quality.
Foundational full-stack skills, with experience in React and at least one modern backend language (e.g., Python, Node.js, Go).
Strong technical judgment and a pragmatic mindset - you know how to balance speed with quality, recognizing the need for a scrappy solution versus when to invest in a robust architecture.
A deep resourcefulness with AI - you are highly adept at prompt engineering and using AI tools to find the fastest path to a solution.
Characteristics we're looking for
Curiosity, pride in your work, desire to push the frontiers
Nice to Have
Experience designing or running evaluations for LLM outputs to measure and track quality, accuracy, or other performance metrics.
Familiarity with building tools for other developers, such as CLIs, SDKs, or internal dashboards.
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS), Docker, and CI/CD pipelines.

Transportation and Housing:

Housing + transportation stipend: $1500 USD / mo

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation: $55 - $70 USD / hr + $1500 USD / month of stipend (housing + transportation)

Free, unlimited lunch and dinner meals daily
Fully covered health insurance, dental and vision insurance
Front-row seat at the frontiers of AI
Cupboard of office snacks
Transportation and housing stipend
Fully covered flights
Personalized welcome gift when you join!

Job Summary:

BDO Digital is looking for a Co-op or Intern, Technology - BizApps to join the Business Applications team. This is a net new role and responsibilities will include:

Learn the implementation methodology and best practices during ERP and Customer Engagement Implementations.
Assist with documentation as required as it relates to understanding client requirements, and ensuring the delivery of quality solutions.
Develop and execute test plans and test cases for client solutions.
Collaborate with our development teams to ensure the delivery of client solutions while gaining exposure to the full-stack of Microsoft technologies
Apply analytical and problem solving skills to solve challenging client problems

Job Responsibilities:

How do we define success for your role?

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect & Collaboration
You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities; clients describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
You identify, recommend, & are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive & engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning & professional development.

Required Skills:

Your experience and education

Candidate for Business Admin, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
Ability to work in a team environment, and possibly remotely (at home) using BDO provided hardware.
Why BDO?
Our people-first approach to talent has earned us a spot among Canada's Top 100 Employers for 2025. This recognition is a milestone we're thrilled to add to our collection of awards for both experienced and student talent experiences.

Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:
We enable you to engage with how we change and evolve, being a key contributor to the success and growth of BDO in Canada.
We help you become a better professional within our services, industries, and markets with extensive opportunities for learning and development.
We support your achievement of personal goals outside of the office and making an impact on your community.
Giving back adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community.

Total rewards that matter: We pay for performance with competitive total cash compensation that recognizes and rewards your contribution. We provide flexible benefits from day one, and a market leading personal time off policy. We are committed to supporting your overall wellness beyond working hours and provide reimbursement for wellness initiatives that fit your lifestyle.

Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Leader, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us.

Flexibility: All BDO personnel are expected to spend some of their time working in the office, at the client site, and virtually unless accommodations or alternative work arrangements are in place.
Our model is a blended approach designed to support the flexible needs of our people, the firm and our clients. It's about creating work experiences that meet everyone's needs and providing flexibility to adjust when, where and how we work to meet the expectations of our role.

Code of Conduct: Our Code of Conduct sets clear standards for how we conduct business. It reflects our shared values and commitments and includes guiding principles to help us make ethical decisions and maintain trust with each other, our clients, and the public.

With your consent, BDO Canada may use AI technology (Microsoft Copilot) to transcribe during preliminary conversations, solely for the purpose of note-taking and not for other purposes, such as resume review, evaluation or selection of candidates.

More information on BDO Canada's Privacy Policy can be found here: Privacy Policy | BDO Canada

Compensation and Benefits:

The expected range of compensation for this role is $51,000-$78,000.

Job Summary:

DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW

TD Asset Management Inc. (TDAM) is an Investment Management firm with leading market positions in active, quantitative and passive portfolio management serving a large and diversified client base including pension funds, corporations, institutions, endowments, foundations and high net worth individuals. We also offer private money management services and manage retail mutual funds.

Job Responsibilities:

JOB DESCRIPTION

We are seeking a front-office Data Analyst to join us on the Portfolio Research & Analytics team to build cutting edge portfolio management and reporting tools. In this role, you will work directly with Portfolio Managers and Traders to automate data flows and develop dashboards for periodic reporting using technologies such as SQL, Python, and Business Intelligence tools. The tools built by the Portfolio Research & Analytics team are directly used in the daily management on monitoring in hundreds of billions of dollars in assets.

Why you should be excited about applying for this role:

A chance to see the results of your work have immediate real-world impact
One-on-one mentoring
Co-op events (networking events, leader talks, personal development sessions)
Downtown location right by Union Station
Students will have the opportunity to work on several projects, communicating with multiple teams in the front office and gaining a deeper understanding of their data needs. Students will gain experience working with large datasets, creating dashboards, backend development and significant hands-on SQL database experience.

Required Skills:

REQUIREMENTS

Must be enrolled in an undergraduate degree (Math, Engineering, CS, Economics) with the intent of going back to school at the start of your work term.
Strong SQL (or similar database) skills, ability to work the large dataset and effectively communicate ideas are essential work success in this position.
Previous experience developing dashboards (Superset, Tableau, PowerBI) or other data visualization tools is preferred.
Strong communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.
Coursework or interest in finance will be considered an asset

Compensation and Benefits:

the range is 48K-68K for Wealth Co-ops.

Job Summary:

Who We Are
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.

TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you've got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we're here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing - and so will you.

DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW
Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles, and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:

Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
Connect and Learn on topics such as Innovation
Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more

TD Asset Management Inc. (TDAM) is an Investment Management firm with leading market positions in active, quantitative and passive portfolio management serving a large and diversified client base including pension funds, corporations, institutions, endowments, foundations and high net worth individuals. We also offer private money management services and manage retail mutual funds.

Job Responsibilities:

We are seeking a Full Stack Developer to join us in the Portfolio Research & Analytics team to build cutting-edge portfolio management applications using technologies such as Python, JavaScript - especially React & Redux frameworks, and SQL.

The web applications developed by the Portfolio Research & Analytics team are directly used in the daily management and monitoring of hundreds of billions of dollars in assets.

Why you should be excited about applying for this role:

A chance to see the results of your work have immediate real-world impact
One-on-one mentoring
Co-op events
Students will have the opportunity to work on several projects independently and see their code used in production. Students will gain extensive web and/or backend development experience, exposure to single page application architecture; Python programming experience at the application layer; and significant hands-on SQL database experience.

Required Skills:

Currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree majoring in relevant technology programs, such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar
Must be enrolled in an undergraduate degree with the intent of going back to school at the start of your work term
Strong software development skills, the ability to learn new technologies and business concepts quickly are essential for success at this position. Previous experience with the following technologies will be preferred:
JavaScript (especially React and Redux frameworks)
REST API's, MVC frameworks
Python
SQL and database design (with any major RDBMS).
GIT version control
Familiarity with software development in a Linux-based environment.
We will consider candidates with strong technical backgrounds that do not necessarily have direct experience with the specific technologies used on our team.
Attributes that are beneficial to the role are: self-starter, analytical and attention to detail.
The ideal candidate should be comfortable working in a team environment.
Some coursework or interest in finance will be considered an asset.

Compensation and Benefits:

Pay Details:
48K - 68K

We're committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with a member of our HR Team and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical, and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs. Learn more

Additional Information:
We're delighted that you're considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we're committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.

Job Summary:

Brookfield Asset Management Inc. is a leading global alternative asset manager with over US$1 trillion of assets under management across real estate, infrastructure, renewable power and transition, private equity and credit. Brookfield owns and operates long-life assets and businesses, many of which form the backbone of the global economy. Utilizing its global reach, access to large-scale capital and operational expertise, Brookfield offers a range of alternative investment products to investors around the world-including public and private pension plans, endowments and foundations, sovereign wealth funds, financial institutions, insurance companies and private wealth investors. Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. (BAM) is a public company listed on the New York (NYSE: BAM) and Toronto (TSX: BAM) stock exchanges. Brookfield Corporation is a public company listed on the New York (NYSE: BN) and Toronto (TSX: BN) stock exchanges.

Our investment strategy is simple: utilize our global team of investment professionals, our vast network of employees across our operating businesses, and our industry partners to identify and acquire high quality assets at favorable valuations and finance them on a long-term, low-risk basis.

Why Brookfield
Aligned with our 'grow from within' talent strategy, our internship program is available to students for a fall, summer or winter work term. Students have the opportunity to demonstrate their experience, aptitudes, leadership and teamwork towards potential full-time employment.

Job Responsibilities:

The Data Analyst will apply data analytics techniques across compliance, operational, financial, SOX and IT audits under the direction of the Manager, Data Analytics. The Data Analytics team supports all business groups across Brookfield and team members have the opportunity to interact with all levels of the organization and learn about its various lines of business.

Note: This is a fully in-office role

Execute on data analytics projects within the Audit Plan
Investigate data analytics test results and prepare reports to support auditors in summarizing findings
Identify and develop new analytics methods to support the Audit Plan, continuous monitoring program and business intelligence initiatives
Perform and document data validation testing on workflows, reports, data models and templates
Conduct data extraction, transformation and loading using various business intelligence tools such as Alteryx and applicable programming languages
Develop dashboards and design metrics for business intelligence projects using Tableau or PowerBI
Explore advanced techniques such as machine learning, process mining, robotic process automation and generative AI to enhance analytics and reporting
Perform other job-related duties as required, which may include providing support to audit engagements and Brookfield's SOX program

Required Skills:

Currently enrolled in a relevant undergraduate degree program
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and other Microsoft Office products
Preference will be given to applicants with proficiency in Alteryx, Excel, SQL, Tableau, PowerBI, PowerQuery or VBA
Experience with Python or R would be considered an asset
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and techniques would be considered an asset
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
Superior communication and interpersonal skills
Exceptional organizational skills and ability to prioritize competing tasks and deadlines
Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment

Compensation and Benefits:

$52,000/year

Job Summary:

About the Role
As an Associate Software Developer, you'll play a hands-on role in building and scaling our agentic platform - an intelligent, adaptive system designed to automate workflows and power smarter decision-making. You'll collaborate with engineers, product managers, and designers to develop clean, efficient code that drives both reliability and innovation.

Your work will span frontend and backend development, from fixing bugs and resolving integration challenges to developing new features and improving platform performance. You'll also have the opportunity to work directly with AI and agentic solutions, leveraging these tools to optimize development, accelerate delivery, and shape how intelligent systems interact with one another.

This role is ideal for someone who's passionate about modern software development, eager to deepen their technical foundation, and excited to contribute to a platform at the frontier of AI and automation.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do:

Develop and maintain high-quality, well-documented code across both frontend and backend systems.
Troubleshoot and resolve bugs, integration issues, and performance bottlenecks in production and staging environments.
Implement new features and enhancements, particularly those that improve dashboard usability and data visibility.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate technical requirements into scalable solutions.
Leverage AI and agentic development tools to automate testing, improve code efficiency, and streamline CI/CD pipelines.
Contribute to technical documentation, code reviews, and agile workflows to ensure strong engineering practices and maintainable codebases.
Stay current on software trends, frameworks, and architectures - bringing new ideas to strengthen our agentic infrastructure.

Required Skills:

Minimum Requirements:

Currently enrolled at UWaterloo, progressing toward a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.
Proficiency in one or more modern programming languages such as Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, or Node.js.
Solid understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies.
Exposure to version control/Git
Familiarity with frontend frameworks (React, Vue) or backend technologies (APIs, databases, microservices, or cloud infrastructure).
Exposure to machine learning concepts or experience working with agentic systems is an asset.
Strong problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills, with a focus on clean, maintainable code.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to learn quickly in a dynamic, evolving technical environment.

Compensation and Benefits:

This opportunity is funded by Mitacs and offers a $15-20k stipend amount for the complete 4-month duration of the program.

Please note: This opportunity is also eligible to be extended to an 8-month term. In your application, please specify whether or not you would also be open to an 8-month term.

Job Summary:

At Mechanical Orchard, we specialize in safely rewriting the most critical and complex business applications-the software that runs the world as we know it today-so they're ready to adapt quickly and easily to market challenges and opportunities. Our approach emerged from observing the decades-long failure patterns in modernization efforts and is designed to eliminate the risks and disruptions that characterize most projects.

Our background in software development and the impact on the industry is well known: we've literally helped write the book on XP and other impactful Agile practices. We're applying the same thoughtfulness and rigor in applying AI pragmatically where it helps. We believe in the durable principles behind Agile, and embrace the power of cross-functional teams, collective ownership, test driven development, short feedback loops, and continuous improvement.

We're bringing joy to beleaguered IT teams everywhere. Together, we're seeing how applying craft, expertise, and technologies we're building can fundamentally transform the way companies operate, innovate, and win.

Our values are: Do the right thing. Do what works. Be kind.

Job Responsibilities:

As a Software Engineer Intern at Mechanical Orchard, you will be expected to:

Work as part of small, cross functional XP teams building production applications for customers or for Mechanical Orchard using Elixir or other modern programming languages
Pair program with other engineers and collaborate closely with other roles such as product managers and designers
Learn and apply XP engineering practices such pair programming, test-driven development, refactoring, continuous integration and continuous delivery
Operate and support production applications as a team in the context of the agile DevSecOps model
Continuously learn about relevant emerging technologies or practices and foster the growth of the organization through mentorship, tech talks, and other means

Required Skills:

Actively pursuing a Bachelor's, or Master's in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field
Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrated software engineering experience through previous internships or co-op programs, work experience, coding competitions, publications, etc.
Has some exposure or passion for XP practices such as pair programming and test driven development
Comfortable as a full stack developer, and have expertise in at least one modern programming language and application framework
Strong communication and collaboration skills as well as empathy are essential for working closely with the development team, customers, and others at Mechanical Orchard.

Compensation and Benefits:

Depending on your work term, the range of this role is $30 CAD - $50 CAD per hour

As a student software developer you will be involved in the designing, writing, and testing software for Crypto4A's QxEDGE and QxHSM line of products, the world's first, hardware and software-defined security platforms that optimizes, protects and consolidates critical business applications by leveraging a next generation Hardware Security Module (HSM) inside a single, tamper-proof appliance.

The position calls for a student software developer with some experience and knowledge developing for, and building/configuring Linux platforms, and security-focused Java and web-based services that run on top of them. Experience developing in C on embedded platforms is also an asset.

Crypto4A Technologies Inc. is a Canadian cyber security firm offering a platform for organizations requiring High Assurance across complex networks, applications and devices. Our QxEDGE platform provides HSM-as-a-Service capabilities and simplifies the challenges of managing security infrastructure with ease of deployment and remote management. Within the appliance is a next generation hardware security module that encapsulates sensitive information within the cryptographic boundary while assuring quantum computing readiness.

Job Responsibilities:

Utilize Java or C code to develop and test new security software for the Crypto4A QxEDGE and QxHSM products and services.
Apply established development processes and assist in process improvement.
Analyze requirements and propose design alternatives.
Develop test software and procedures.
Generate complete and accurate user and design documentation.
Provide input to architecture, design and code reviews.
Provide input and evaluation of new technologies and products.
Provide task breakdowns and accurate estimates for project planning.
Review and validation of software releases.

Required Skills:

Required skills include:

Software development skills in one or more of Java, C and Python programming languages.
Familiarity with web services technologies and best practices.
Understanding of cryptographic principles, standards and protocols.
Strong sense of responsibility, commitment to quality and achieving deadlines.
Knowledge of software engineering processes and standards.
Experience in the following is expected:
Software configuration management tools.
Software defect tracking tools.
Software debugging tools.
Good written and verbal communication skills.

Compensation and Benefits:

Returning to Previous Employer (5047) 10/17/2025
We offer competitive salary based on industry norms.

Salary is $26-$36 CAD based on student experience and skillset. No health and medical benefits are included for students, but are standard for regular full-time staff. Students are granted 4 vacation days / term which is paid as salary at the end of the term if not used.

Standard work week is 40 hours / week, somewhat flexible timing assuming availability during core hours from 10am-4pm.

Job Summary:

At SPS Commerce, we strive to deliver a workplace where people feel valued and challenge each other to excel. Our teams are self-managing, and collaborative, and work without hierarchy or ego. Within the SPS System Automation Team, our mission is to seamlessly link a diverse array of ERP systems, catering to small, medium, and enterprise levels. In joining this team, you will have a fantastic opportunity to use new technologies and patterns to build and manage several enterprise-level production services. You will join a team full of engineers who are not afraid to ask "why" and dig into the details. Our sprint team is distributed between Brampton, Ontario, and Minneapolis, Minnesota, collaborating closely on a daily basis.

Does this sound like you?

You like solving challenging problems
You like learning and working with modern technologies, patterns, and skills
You like working in an agile environment
You want to be treated like a co-worker - not an intern
You're highly collaborative - you believe the best solutions come from working together
Why SPS?
You will have an excellent opportunity to learn and grow
Our office is a modern, open-concept, collaborative environment
Co-ops are treated like full-time team members - the same expectations, the same workload, and the same training
We provide many opportunities for growing your technical skills including tech meetups, lunch and learns, and other hands-on training
You'll have lots of opportunities to grow your collaborative and presentation skills through hackathons, internal tech conferences, programming guilds, happy hours, and employee groups like our Women in Tech and Diversity and Inclusion groups.
Work closely with a team of developers through the use of pair programming. The team is always there to have your back.
We all share an understanding that we win as a team, we lose as a team. No egos, no heroes.
You will be welcomed into a friendly, social atmosphere
We have a dedicated games room with gaming consoles, foosball, and bubble hockey
We play a variety of board games over lunch and occasionally after hours
Our location is across from the Bramalea mall
There is plenty of shopping, free parking, a gym, and a variety of restaurants
Affordable housing options are plentiful
Public transit (buses and GO terminal)
Hybrid Work Environment

Our tech teams are currently working from home, coming into the office once a month.

Job Responsibilities:

You won't be bored! As a Software Engineering Intern, you will work closely with your team and others to understand, design and code deliverables. You will be part of a scrum engineering team tasked with introducing new concepts and technologies into the product. You will have the tools and team to deliver fully functional code to our production environments. That means you'll have an understanding of how the stack works, gaining experience in all facets of development and making you a better developer. You'll gain experience with all the modern tools for software engineering in a cloud environment.

Attend your team's daily scrum meeting to exchange progress and plan what you are going to do for the day
Work on the same tasks as the rest of the team - we do not have "co-op projects"
Develop, deploy and verify your code - we embrace a DevOps mentality of ownership over the whole kit and kaboodle
Share your excitement and ideas about new technology

Required Skills:

Desired:

Enrolled in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent
Experience with modern programming languages (Kotlin/C#/React)
An eagerness to learn
The ability to communicate and collaborate with others

Bonus Points (but NOT required):
Experience with AWS cloud infrastructure (S3, IAM, Lambda, Cloud Formation)
Experience in cloud-based data stores (RDS, DynamoDB)
Specific development experience using Kotlin/C#/React
Experience in an Agile/DevOps environment

These are the kinds of things you'll be doing during your work term. If you don't have experience in them, don't worry! We'll provide ample training to get you that experience.

Transportation and Housing:

Our office is located close to public transit (buses and a GO terminal are nearby). For those travelling by car, free parking is available.

Compensation and Benefits:

We treat our interns and co-ops like full-time employees - that includes compensation. Expect to be paid within the same pay band as our new hires. We will pay between $29/hr and $37/hr depending on the number of work terms.

This job is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP) or Canada Summer Jobs. These programs require that candidates be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

Job Summary:

ABOUT PARITY:
Buildings in our beautiful cities, where we live and work, are producing 40% of the CO2 going into our atmosphere and contributing to climate change. We need to HEAT, VENTILATE, and AIR CONDITION our buildings 24/7. Most of the energy consumed in a building is for our comfort, but 50% of it is wasted! This is because buildings have little to no technology to control this.

Parity is a Remote HVAC Optimization as a Service company. We remotely control and optimize HVAC systems 24/7/365 to deliver automatic energy savings and revenue to multifamily residential buildings and hotels. Using advanced algorithms, Parity can predict the amount of energy needed ahead of time to operate a building to meet its occupants' demands and adapt the building's systems and machinery in real time. We save our customers:

Time - we automate setpoint adjustments and demand response protocols. Our Pi (Parity Insights) dashboard provides early alerting services when things go down.
Money - Parity contractually guarantees the savings that we expect to deliver to our multifamily customers. We also provide quarterly and annual energy savings reports.
CO2 Emissions - we reduce a building's emissions by optimizing its HVAC systems and reducing energy waste.
THE ROLE:
We are seeking an enthusiastic and detail-oriented Energy Reporting Co-op Student from the University of Waterloo to join our dynamic M&V team as part of Service Delivery. This role offers a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience at a quickly growing disruptor in the otherwise stable high-rise residential energy management sector, working with the team as a whole, supporting the creation of energy savings reports and contributing to the improvement of processes and workflows in the service side of our business. This position is ideal for a proactive learner eager to apply their analytical skills to real-world challenges in a fast-paced, scaling-focused environment, contributing to Parity's M&V (Measurement & Verification) function and our commitment to delivering guaranteed savings.

Job Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities:
Reporting & Data Support

Assist in the collection, processing, and validation of utility bill data, helping to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Support the Energy Reporting team in the creation of monthly, quarterly, and annual energy savings reports by preparing data and performing initial checks.
Learn and assist in applying basic data analysis techniques, potentially including aspects of weather normalization, under supervision.
Help with quality control checks on data and report components to ensure accuracy and adherence to established protocols.
Identify opportunities for automation.
Process Improvement & Scaling Support
Contribute to the documentation of reporting processes and methodologies for Parity's internal knowledge base.
Assist in researching best practices and tools for process improvement in energy reporting, customer support, and data management.
Support the generation, organization, and management of Asana entities for involving the Energy Reporting team.
Provide general support for other scaling activities within the team as needed, including data organization and administrative tasks related to reporting, customer support, and contract management.
Collaboration & Learning
Collaborate closely with the Energy Reporting Coordinator, Specialists, and Managers to understand reporting requirements and contribute effectively.
Participate in team meetings and contribute ideas for improving workflows and efficiency.
Assist in liaising with internal teams for data clarification or to support reporting queries under guidance.

Required Skills:

Qualifications & Experience:

Currently enrolled in a relevant co-op program at the University of Waterloo (e.g., Engineering, Environmental Studies, Building Science, GIS, Data Science, Mathematics, Business, or a related field).
A proactive approach to independent and collaborative work. As a potential team member in a start-up this is a major differentiator.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail. We are always looking for new opportunities with the data we already have or can get.
Proficiency in Google Sheets and/or Microsoft Excel (e.g., formulas, data sorting, basic charting). Most of our work requires this.
Eagerness to learn about energy management, utility data analysis, reporting methodologies, and customer support. This is the context for much of our work.
Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks with support. As a start-up, scope of work and priorities change often.
Effective written and verbal communication skills. We strive to create high quality documentation of our work and clear, effective communication is essential.
Nice to Have (but not required):
A demonstrated interest in energy management, building engineering, or cleantech.
Familiarity with basic databases, data analysis concepts or tools (e.g., SQL, APIs, Snowflake, Sigma)
Previous co-op experience in an analytical or data-focused role.
Familiarity with project management tools like Asana.
Understanding of IPMVP principles and/or experience with generating regression analyses (opportunity to learn).

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation and Benefits

Pay is $22-$28/hour depending on experience and qualifications.
Hybrid work schedule
Relaxed dress code
Enjoy complimentary snacks and drinks when in the office

Job Summary:

About 8090
At 8090, we identify inefficiencies in enterprise operations and deliver AI-powered solutions tailored to each problem. Co-founded and led by Chamath Palihapitiya, we're building a Software Factory that can generate complete software solutions from initial concepts-eliminating the bloated complexity and overhead of traditional software development.

About the Role
We seek an exceptional, full-stack software developer with high technical competency and intellectual curiosity to join our team. To succeed, you must enjoy thinking in systems and possess some combination of DevOps, data engineering, or ML/data science experience. Most engineering roles are customer-facing, requiring strong soft skills to design and articulate well-engineered solutions to ambiguous problems.

Although this is a co-op position, you'll be treated like a full-time Member of Technical Staff and contribute production code within your first week. Our goal is to equip you with the skills and confidence to work in a modern AI engineering team. As a fast-paced startup with countless interesting problems to solve, we guarantee you won't be bored!

Job Responsibilities:

Responsibilities

You will help develop parts of our Software Factory itself and help build customer solutions with Software Factory. Our software engineers are responsible for the complete lifecycle of the software they create, including development, testing, operation, maintenance, and support.
As a member of our technical staff, you must constantly challenge yourself on which software paradigms are evolving with advances in AI and how you can best leverage AI tools to improve your own practices and the team's productivity. We call this building AI with AI.

Required Skills:

Required Skills

Expertise and experience with full-stack web development is a must - we use Python/FastAPI, Typescript, React, Postgres, Data Structures, and AWS
Owning problems end-to-end and are willing to pick up whatever knowledge you're missing fast to get the job done
Ability to work effectively within a highly dynamic and intelligent team by maintaining the values that 8090 was founded on: engineering excellence, insatiable curiosity, a bias for action, ownership, agency, honesty, and radical candor
Excellent verbal and written communication abilities to collaborate and convey ideas effectively internally and to customer stakeholders
What Sets a Candidate Apart
Experience in leveraging AI tools (e.g. Cursor, Claude Code, Amp Code.) to effectively and efficiently develop, deploy and test software
Professional work experience in DevOps, security, and cloud infrastructure - We use GitHub Actions, Docker, and AWS CDK extensively
Expertise in data engineering, ML engineering, or data science. Examples are integrating LLMs into products, fine-tuning models, creating evaluations, or hosting AI/ML infrastructure at scale

Compensation and Benefits:

$35-$50/hr

Perks

Mentorship from experienced builders including Chamath and engineering leaders from Google, Amazon, and Tesla
Monthly budget for AI tools above and beyond our main tools.
Catered lunches via Doordash
Potential team offsite or visits to our Menlo Park office

At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we're up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we've created leading eCommerce experiences in the loyalty, online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces.

Do you love the thought of working on Canada's Largest and Most Loved Loyalty Program - PC Optimum? Yes? We want to hear from you! We are building Canada's #1 Loyalty experience and want to transform and simplify how customers shop. We need big ideas, enthusiasm and lot of diverse ideas to come together and make this a reality.

The impact you'll make:
As an Associate Product Manager for PC Optimum, you'll have the opportunity to work along side the design and engineering teams to develop and launch new features for Canada's largest loyalty program. ?If you're enthusiastic about user experience, technology, business and Loyalty Programs this is where you belong!

You've got a growth mindset - you know there's always a better way to do things and are willing to disrupt yourself or the status quo

Job Summary:

Sequence exists to empower the next industrial revolution with applied AI.

We are building a new kind of holding company that acquires and operates traditional businesses, and rebuilds them with AI and cutting edge technologies. Think of us as Blackstone meets Palantir.

Ownership is our superpower. When you own the business, you can align incentives, eliminate inertia, and redesign operations from first principles. That is what makes us the ultimate applied AI company.

We are not another AI roll up, and we are not stitching together small scattered assets. We acquire businesses that matter and elevate them through deep transformation, turning incumbents into AI native leaders.

The ambition is nothing less than a generational company, and we will not stop until we achieve our mission. We are building the Berkshire Hathaway of the AI era.

The Team

We've assembled an exceptional team for an enormous opportunity:

- CEO and Co-Founder: Michael Lee was previously the Head of Private Investments at Lone Pine Capital, an $18 billion investment firm.
- Co-Founder: Alex Rubin is a former product and engineering leader at Scale AI, where he led the Code RLHF business and co-led the International Public Sector business.
- Investment Team: Deep transaction experience from top-tier firms including Centerbridge, TPG and Silver Lake.
- Engineering: Technical talent from high-velocity, forward-deployed environments like Scale AI and Palantir.

Why Ownership Matters

- Ownership drives real change: Companies inherently resist significant change. Consultants and software vendors are blocked by internal politics. By owning businesses outright, we bypass organizational friction and rapidly execute deep, meaningful transformations.
- Transformation creates significant equity value: Early AI adoption drives step-function improvements in margins and multiples. Ownership ensures we capture the entirety of this equity value creation-rather than just collecting recurring SaaS fees.
- Build better agents: Effective AI requires ground-truth data. Unlike software vendors who must accept messy client data, full ownership allows us to redesign data collection and incentive systems from scratch. This enables recursively improving AI agents that continuously enhance performance and compound in value.

What We're Building

- Autonomous AI agents: We build agents tailored to specific industry workflows-autonomously performing tasks, learning from proprietary data, and proactively optimizing processes without human intervention.
- Scalable AI infrastructure: A unified platform and standardized data stack that connect every company we acquire, making integration fast and repeatable. This allows us to deploy AI solutions quickly, reuse capabilities across the portfolio, and compound improvements as the system learns from each transformation.
- The Compute-Driven P&L: We are shifting industries from human-heavy operating models toward scalable, compute-driven structures. This frees up capital for innovation, better customer experiences, and aggressive reinvestment.

Why Competitors Struggle

- Private equity limitations: Traditional PE is constrained by short-term horizons and a lack of technical DNA. They struggle to attract elite engineering talent or execute genuine operational change, often settling for financial engineering over technological transformation.
- Incumbent constraints: Whether public or private, established companies are paralyzed by inertia. They view AI as a simple software add-on rather than a fundamental operational overhaul. Furthermore, they lack the cultural DNA to attract elite technical talent, leaving them unable to execute the complex, ground-up transformations required to survive.

You Should Join If

- You are deeply motivated by real world impact. You recognize that AI's potential is often trapped in flashy, but non-substantive pilots, and are motivated to find ways to build and deploy technology that genuinely transforms the physical economy. In exchange, we'll help you directly capture the equity value you create.
- You are eager to take extreme ownership. You don't just want to write code; you want to influence organizational change and business outcomes.
- You're interested in working hard with an ambitious and a world-class team seeking to upend how companies currently compete.

The Culture

We work hard and hold ourselves accountable. Extraordinary outcomes demand sustained effort from exceptional individuals dedicated to ambitious goals.

Here is what we expect:

- Work 6 days a week (Mon-Fri In-person; Sun Remote).
- No egos. The best idea wins.
- We value individuals who find a way to get things done, regardless of blockers.

Our investors

We have raised ~$30 million from top tier investors including:

- Conviction (Seed co-lead)
- 8VC (Seed co-lead)
- Chris Re (Founding advisor)
- Avenir

Job Responsibilities:

Partner with clients to deeply understand their challenges and define AI-driven solutions
Build agents, LLM applications, and API integrations that automate real workflows
Participate in customer engagements, including occasional travel
Scope out and build end-to-end AI applications into production, leveraging computer vision, language models, including fine-tuning and optimization

Required Skills:

Experience with backend technologies (Python, FastAPI) and frontend technologies & frameworks (React, Typescript)
Experience with LLM frameworks: LangChain, vector databases, etc.
Familiarity with cloud-based platforms (e.g. GCP, AWS)
Understanding of training/fine tuning and data quality
APIs, Docker/Kubernetes, cloud (AWS/GCP/Azure), CI/CD, observability

Compensation and Benefits:

$10,000 - 12,500 (USD) / month + $2,000 (USD) / month for housing

Lunch and dinner covered.

Job Summary:

Abstract of the Project:
With the increasing application of DC microgrids-for instance, in hospitals and data centers, as well as in industrial settings and, increasingly, in isolated power systems-the demands on the stability of these networks are growing. At the same time, the rising integration of renewable energy sources into the electrical grid is leading to the replacement of centralized power plants with a multitude of decentralized generation units (DGUs). The volatile nature of these units intensifies the need for stabilizing the overall system, as every connection or disconnection, and every fluctuation in power input, can significantly disrupt grid dynamics. Stabilizing these microgrids through DGU control is one of the focal research topics at the Institute of Control Systems. Within the present project, already developed DGU-controllers shall be compared in simulation-based benchmark studies. The focus of this comparison will extend beyond mere controller performance, which has already been analyzed to a certain extent. Instead, the objective is to identify or develop new metrics that evaluate the applicability of the controllers with respect to system integration. These metrics may include, for example, the required control energy, line currents, or similar indicators. An essential part of the work package will involve configuring the controllers in a way that ensures a fair and meaningful comparison, while also addressing and critically discussing the comparability criteria themselves.

Job Responsibilities:

Tasks:

Training in modelling of DC microgrids and DGUs
Introduction to the DGU controllers
Development of metrics evaluating the feasibility and quality of the integration of the DGU controllers
Controller configuration and development of comparability criteria
Benchmark study design, execution and analysis
Learning Outcomes:
Professional Skills by: using Matlab and application of control engineering knowledge to research problems; designing an experiment; participating in ongoing research activities
Intercultural competences and social skills by: collaborating in an international team; absolving an internship abroad
Problem solving skills by: taking responsibility for a work package and developing strategies to successfully complete it

Required Skills:

Requirements:

Knowledge in Electrical Engineering is required
Knowledge in Systems and Control Engineering is required
Knowledge in Electrical Power Systems may be helpful but it is no prerequisite
Software skills:
Knowledge in Matlab/Simulink is helpful but no prerequisite
Knowledge in Latex is strongly desirable
Other skills:
The ability to independent problem solving is desirable
