Job Summary:

Abstract of the Project:

One-Sentence-Summary: Develop and demonstrate a stability-aware, machine-learning-based thermal model for individual apartments, enabling scalable, modular integration into smart heating control systems.

Heating in residential buildings consumes substantial energy, leading to high costs and significant greenhouse gas emissions. Retrofitting insulation or upgrading heat generators can be effective but is often infeasible or prohibitively expensive for existing buildings. As a complementary and near-term measure, smart, networked sensing and control, such as zone temperature sensors combined with smart valves, can reduce heat demand at comparatively low cost and later be enhanced with envelope or producer improvements.
Within the D2HeaTEC project, 70-100 apartments will be equipped with multi-zone sensing. The resulting dataset will capture apartment-level thermal dynamics and occupant comfort preferences. In parallel, dynamic parameters of the production and distribution systems will also be measured. Among other applications, this data is expected to support the design and operation of highly efficient room temperature controllers. We plan to investigate a model predictive control (MPC) approach, which requires accurate and scalable models, hence we will focus on modeling initially.

To ensure scalability for large deployments, we pursue a modular architecture: a physics-based, first-principles model for production and distribution will be combined with a machine-learning (ML) model for each apartment. The per-apartment model must be (i) stable (ideally passive) by design, (ii) compatible with supervisory control, and (iii) easy to integrate with other network modules.

This project focuses on the design and demonstration of the per-apartment ML module. The student will analyze available data, define consistent input/output interfaces, select and justify a stability-aware ML structure (e.g., port-Hamiltonian or dissipativity-cons trained models), and build a training and evaluation pipeline that supports modular composition, scalability, and continuous or repeated (re)training. The final results should be a small demonstration using preliminary data, showcasing how the learned apartment model can be trained efficiently, evaluated for performance, and integrated with other network models.

Job Responsibilities:

Tasks:

Plan the ML structure
Define modular interfaces by specifying input/output signals for the apartment model, ensuring compatibility with existing plans for other network components.
Select and justify a stability-aware ML approach that enforces at least stability, and ideally passivity (e.g., Port-Hamiltonian networks, Lyapunov/dissipativity-constrained models).
Implement the chosen ML model structure.
Design a scalable training pipeline
Include preprocessing steps such as time alignment, noise handling, and missing data treatment.
Develop a strategy for incremental or continuous retraining as new data becomes available.
Ensure the pipeline supports modular integration with the overall network model.
Implement a minimal demonstration
Train and evaluate the ML model on preliminary data.
Compare performance against simple baselines (e.g., RC models; some implementations are available).
Document performance metrics and verify stability properties.
Document and present results
Prepare a technical report summarizing the approach, findings, and limitations.
Deliver reproducible, version-controlled code.
Give a short presentation.
Learning Outcomes:
Technical skills:
Understanding of heating systems and thermal building modeling and dynamics.
Setup of machine learning structures for dynamical systems (stable RNNs, Neural ODEs, physics-informed ML).
Understanding Control theoretic concepts (passivity, modularity, MPC basics).
Tools and workflows:
Usage of a standard ML Framework (e.g. Pyhton/NumPy/Pandas/PyTourch/JAX or Jula/Flux.jl/DiffEqFlux.jl)
Application of git for version control.
Usage of typesetting systems for scientific reporting (e.g. LaTeX).
Professional skills:
Intercultural collaboration and communication.
Project Management.
Problem-solving in open-ended research tasks.

Required Skills:

Requirements:

Some background knowledge in Control Systems and/or System Dynamics.
Foundational understanding of Machine Learning, ideally for time-series or dynamic systems.
Mathematical skills (linear algebra, ODEs).
Software skills:
Programming in at least one high-level language (Python or Julia preferred).
Familiarity with at least one ML framework (PyTorch/JAX/Flux.jl) preferred
Git for version control.
Some scientific typesetting tool (LaTeX or Typst preferred)
Other skills:
Ability to handle pseudonymized personal data responsibly.
Technical writing and visualization.
Self-directed learning and time management.

Job Summary:

Abstract of the Project:

The energy transition requires participation at all levels of society, especially households are encouraged to increase investments in energy efficiency and sustainable behaviour around energy use. However, available housing types, energetic renovation of the existing housing stock, tariff offers, and energy use patterns are all decisions that are inevitably influenced through the policy context! The optimal choice of incentive is one main way to manage energy consumption, as it can incentivize demand flexibility in the form of shifts, reduction or substitutions. While demand for energy is considered to be already flexible, we need to understand how to stir this flexibility to make load management more efficient.
The goal of this project is to conduct a systematic literature review that will examine the advantages and disadvantages of the individual intervention types. Specifically, by pooling upon the findings from existing studies, an estimate will be created that can shed light on the likely percentage savings per incentive type in a given context. The acceptability of a particular incentive type can also vary across different user groups depending on socio-economic characteristics and lifestyles. Thus, this context needs to be considered for the effectiveness of any type of incentive.

In a first step, you will analyze the existing literature in order to identify different intervention types for energy consumption. This list will then be used to establish a classification according to demarcations and overlaps. Next, the different social and behavioral contexts will be taken into account in order to identify the advantages and disadvantages of the individual intervention types in each context. The studies from the literature can then be pooled to establish an estimation of percentage savings per incentive for the respective adequate contexts. If possible, combined effects with financial incentives can be highlighted.

Job Responsibilities:

Tasks:

Systematic literature review
Create a typology of incentives
Establish effect sizes across the different studies
Estimation of pooled effects
Quantification of energy savings per incentive type
Learning outcomes:
Performing a systematic literature search
Analyzing and synthesizing scientific literature
Using citation tools
Academic writing

Required Skills:

Requirements

Interest in social science topics (especially energy tariffs and user behavior) and empirical research (e.g. decision making, surveys)
Willingness to work independently
Ideally existing skills in working with citation tools (e.g. Zotero) or conducting literature reviews
Software skills: MSO, Citation tool (Zotero etc.), Statistics (e.g. R)

Other skills: Synthesis of literature, connecting ideas, interpreting results, academic writing, statistical analysis

Job Summary:

Abstract of the Project:
The energy transition requires participation at all levels of society, especially households are encouraged to increase investments in energy efficiency and sustainable behaviour around energy use. However, available housing types, energetic renovation of the existing housing stock, tariff offers, and energy use patterns are all decisions that are inevitably influenced through the policy context! The optimal choice of incentive is one main way to manage energy consumption, as it can incentivize demand flexibility in the form of shifts, reduction or substitutions. While demand for energy is considered to be already flexible, we need to understand how to stir this flexibility to make load management more efficient.

The goal of this project is to program an economic decision experiment and to implement it online. The experiment will empirically examine participant's preferences for different energy options. Specifically, the experiment is to be hosted on an online platform and assess participant's choices through a number of tasks. In a first step, the efficient choice design for the experiment will have to be programmed. Second, a first pilot study can be run online. Then, the empirical data will have to be prepared for subsequent analysis.





Job Responsibilities:

Tasks:

Programming of the experiment
Running of the online experiment
Preparing the collected empirical data using a statistics program, e.g. R
Writing of the report
Learning Outcomes:
Conducting an online experiment
Analyzing and interpreting empirical data
Applying programming in specific tools such as the lighthouse studio software
Academic writing

Required Skills:

Requirements:

Interest in social science topics (especially energy tariffs and user behavior) and empirical research (e.g. decision making, surveys)
Willingness to work independently
Ideally existing skills programming experiments with e.g. lighthouse studio
Ideally existing skills in statistical data analysis and statistics programs (e.g. R)
Software Skills:
MSO, first insights into basic programming languages e.g. Python, R
Other Skills:
analytical thinking, attention to detail, interpreting results, academic writing

Job Summary:

Abstract of the Project:

The power grid is undergoing a fundamental transformation: from a centralized structure towards a decentralized, renewable-driven energy driven supply. With solar, wind, storage systems and new distributed loads rapidly increasing, the challenges for tomorrow's grids are clear: stability, durability, and reliability under ever-changing conditions.
At the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT), we are addressing these challenges by building the High Power Grid Lab (HPGL) - a unique large-scale research infrastructure with a power rating of up to 40 MVA. It will provide a controlled environment to test innovative grid components and operation strategies in the MW and kV range, based on flexible modular multilevel converters (MMCs) that can be interconnected to emulate real-world grids.
As a preparation step, a scaled system with 40 kW has now gone into operation at the Institute of Electrical Engineering (ETI). It enables the testing of signal processing, control, and operation strategies in a realistic setting. The results will directly feed into the design and development of the HPGL. As part of the project, you will work on cutting-edge grid technologies and contribute directly to the realization of the 40 MVA High Power Grid Lab.

Type of Research Project: Power electronics for PHiL applications

Job Responsibilities:

Tasks:

Carry out measurement campaigns and system tests on the demonstrator
Develop and validate signal processing, control, and operation concepts
Contribute to the design, sizing, and engineering of subcomponents for the large-scale system
Support the testing and verification of these subcomponents in an integrated setup
Learning Outcomes:
Professional skills in using state-of-the-art software tools
Project management and practical experience in switch cabinet construction
Problem-solving skills through assembly and commissioning of electronic and power hardware
Hands-on training in testing, commissioning, and analyzing power electronic systems
Experience in signal processing and control implementation for MMCs
Understanding of the design and development process of a multi-MW research infrastructure

Required Skills:

Requirements Basic: knowledge in electrical engineering and electrical hardware assembly
Software Skills: Matlab & Simulink, Altium, MS Office
Optional: Vivado, Quartus, Inventor Other Skills Work and exchange in a team

Job Summary:

About the role
You will work directly with the founding team at Parametric to build full-stack/AI apps in the healthtech industry. You'll have the opportunity to develop full stack applications, combining frontend and backend technologies with advanced AI and machine learning capabilities. This role offers hands-on experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining software services, with a focus on healthcare solutions. We are looking for motivated students eager to learn and apply web development, ML technologies, and healthtech domain knowledge through rapid application and experimentation. You'll receive guidance from mentors and team members as you tackle challenges in areas such as medical data analysis and patient care optimization. This is an excellent opportunity for those passionate about leveraging technology to improve healthcare outcomes and eager to gain practical experience in a dynamic startup environment.

Languages/Frameworks:

TypeScript, React, Next.js, shadcn
NestJS, Serverless functions (edge), Python
Supabase, PostgreSQL

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do

Ship end-to-end features: from UI/Frontend (Next.js) through backend (NestJS || Serverless) down to DB (Postgres/Supabase)
Own production-grade products: past co-ops built full service full-stack applications, conversational AI applications, and a fine-grained RBAC system - for real users
Automate yourself out of grunt work: pair with Claude Code, Codex, ChatGPT Pro, Cursor to cut boilerplate and speed reviews
Collaborate with a tight-knit team: evaluate, prototype, and roll out the smartest tech for each problem - be it a new AI library, cutting-edge serverless runtime, or a design-system upgrade

Required Skills:

Looking for ai-native software engineers (good domain of AI tools for productivity, not LLM or AI experts)

Full-stack experience or a strong appetite to become full-stack fast
Product-first mindset: optimizes for end-user value and guides yourself as your own PM. Iterates on live data and user feedback, not just tickets
Treats UI/UX quality as a first-class engineering metric, right alongside test coverage and performance
Habit of reaching for AI tools (Claude Code, Codex, ChatGPT, etc)

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation, Benefits and Perks

$25-40/hourly based on skill and experience
Mental health and wellness support
Learning & development stipend

Job Summary:

We're looking for one exceptional intern dead set on learning as much as they can by building and shipping real products protected by hard patents. You'll directly work with our founders and senior leadership which include former GM/Principal/Distinguished Architect-level leadership from the likes of Amazon and Airbnb. If you contribute materially to the invention of new processes and technologies as we build and extend our platform and associated technologies, we'll be honored and delighted to include your name on the patent claims we'll file.

The types of problems you can contribute to are wide-ranging by intention and informed by the intersection of what you're passionate about and what needs building: we'll tackle everything from machine learning infrastructure and pipelines (from ingestion to preprocessing to model training to deployment), to backend architecture and API endpoints, scaffolding vertical specific LLM applications, as well as envisioning, designing, and implementing web experiences for end users.

Finally, you'll be given both tremendous autonomy and hands-on coaching as we, together, work at the edge of what has been possible and what could be possible. We're looking for individuals with tremendous enthusiasm, a passion to build their body of work and brand, while serving alongside a brilliant team of deeply committed engineering, science, and product leadership.

"Working at storytellers has accelerated my growth as a developer and allowed me to build things at speeds I didn't know I could. The work is meaningful, the team is super fun, and they genuinely care about your experience. Everybody must experience a coop like this one - very rare to find too." - Jaimil Computer Science - Class of 2026

"Working at Storytellers has been a truly meaningful experience. The high level of work autonomy fostered real problem-solving and independent thinking. Most valuable of all was the opportunity to learn directly from experienced senior developers. This internship has been instrumental in developing both my technical skills and professional growth." - Peter Computer Science and Business Administration - Class of 2028

Job Responsibilities:

Build features and infrastructure for our emerging ML/AI/LLM services platform
Build and test our tech on real world problems, including by building predictive modeling or LLM projects across diverse subject domains for real clients
Develop scalable, repeatable operational pipelines for machine learning and AI workflows

Required Skills:

Adept problem-solving skills + effective, proactive communicator
Enthusiastic, motivated, adaptable, entrepreneurial
Growth mindset
Experience with machine learning concepts and workflows, including model definition, training, evaluation, deployment, and performance monitoring
Experience training and evaluating different types of models across diverse domains / subject areas (inside or outside of coursework)
Sound understanding of probability & statistics fundamentals
Expertise in at least one programming language (preferred: python)
Experience with cloud computing services, such as cloud storage (e.g., S3, GCS), serverless computing (e.g., Lambda, Fargate, Cloud Run), and relational databases (e.g., Redshift, BigQuery)
Familiarity with machine learning workflows, including model definition, training, validation, deployment, and performance monitoring
Experience with React, generative AI (e.g., transformers), web development, UX design, scalable/high performing backend a plus
* This internship is for leaders with at least 3, ideally 4, internships completed. For interns with fewer than 3 internships, please consider our Software Engineering Internship.

This position is 100% remote

$35/USD

Our mission is simple: build a set of ML/AI supported technologies which can autonomously identify, develop, then deploy every beneficial predictive or analytical model a client or customer needs.

If it sounds ambitious and difficult, it is.

If you're wondering how much progress we've made, here's a few sentences that should help illustrate:
First, we hold over 50 approved patent claims with the US Patent Office for our machine learning technology and expect 100 or more claims over the next few years (and your name can be listed prominently on several of them if you work with us… we like to share credit).

Second, though we've been 100% bootstrapped for 4 years, we've deployed machine learning models in approaching a dozen verticals (from bleeding edge media companies to government contractors), control our own destiny as founder-owners, and were listed as one of Inc Magazine's fastest growing companies in the United States.

Third, though we're grateful for the years we've had, we're raising a round of funding to hypercharge our product and feature development.

Job Summary:

About Us
YuJa, Inc. is a leading provider of cloud-based digital compliance and accessibility solutions for regulated sectors worldwide. Serving clients in higher education, K-12, government, and healthcare, YuJa enables organizations to meet evolving regulatory demands while delivering engaging, secure, and accessible digital experiences. Our platforms such as Lumina (video), Panorama (LMS accessibility), EqualGround (governance), and Verity (proctoring) are rigorously tested for compliance, audited, and secured.

For over a decade, YuJa has been dedicated to building not only innovative digital compliance and accessibility solutions, but also a workplace where our people can thrive. We invest in our employees by fostering career growth, continuous learning, and opportunities for advancement. Our culture is rooted in collaboration, inclusivity, and belonging, where every team member's contributions are valued and their voices are heard. Just as we help institutions and organizations worldwide achieve their goals, we are equally committed to supporting the success of our people and making a positive impact in the communities we serve. Meet the YuJa family here (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i4by6elkb-s) and see what makes YuJa special!

Job Responsibilities:

YuJa Canada is hiring talented Software Developers for our Toronto office to design and implement our latest product suite that includes YuJa Lumina Video Platform, YuJa Panorama LMS Accessibility Platform, YuJa Verity Test Proctoring Platform, YuJa EqualGround Accessibility Governance Platform, and many other tools set the standard for delivering engaging digital experiences in the regulated sector. YuJa aims to equip regulated sector clients with solutions to deliver compliant digital experiences.

In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain features across YuJa's product suite and collaborate with senior R&D staff to solve complex technical challenges and implement innovative solutions.

Required Skills:

Job Requirements

Strong Software Design and Development skills
Ability to recognize software problems and develop creative solutions within a fast-paced environment
Strong programming experience with one or more of the following stacks: Java (J2EE), Objective-C/Swift, C# and .Net.
Expertise with one or more of the following operating systems: Windows, MacOS, Android, iOS
HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, React, WebRTC
Relevant experience with mobile software development including iOS and Android platforms
MySQL database experience including Java connectivity through JDBC
Experience in designing web-based portals using HTML, HTML5, JavaScript, XML, CSS, React, WebRTC technologies, and other Web 2.0 tools.
Exposure to AI technologies
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
Other Desirable Skills
Building distributed software systems including some experience with network protocols - HTTP, HTTPS, and TCP-IP
Industry or project experience with audio/video streaming technologies, e.g., HLS, RTMP, SIP
Experience working with both Windows Server and Linux-based server systems

Transportation and Housing:

The job location is close to a TTC subway stop. It is also on a frequent TTC bus route. There are multiple ways to commute to our office. There is also free parking at site.

Compensation and Benefits:

The total base compensation is $70,000.00 per year

Job Summary:

About Vooma

Enterprise software is in the midst of a revolution. The world is shifting from "systems of record" to "systems of automation" - LLM powered agents and orchestrators that perform complex business tasks on behalf of and in concert with humans, with increasing levels of autonomy.

Vooma's mission is to build the AI orchestration platform for the $800+ BN trucking industry. Everything we touch in the physical world is moved on a truck - it's the backbone of the economy. Yet logistics today is still extremely manual, which makes it one of the hungriest industries for the shift toward AI Agents.

At Vooma, the products you'll build will help freight brokers and trucking companies win more business and seamlessly execute freight. Our AI agents operate across voice, email, and text to automate critical workflows across the load lifecycle.

Vooma is backed by top-tier investors including Index Ventures, Craft Ventures, Y-Combinator, and CEOs, founders, and executives from the logistics industry. Our team

Job Responsibilities:

About the role

We're looking for someone who can solve problems and drive progress across our entire software stack. On a typical day, you might find yourself designing and running experiments to improve AI performance, deploying new cloud infrastructure to better scale the product, or developing a new frontend component to improve the user experience.

At Vooma, you will:

Deploy and optimize AI-heavy services with high availability and performance requirements.
Maintain secure, scalable infrastructure for AI-powered agents in production.
Design and implement user experiences that leverage the power of the latest AI.
Build automation pipelines, along with the data and processing infrastructure to scale with our customers.

Required Skills:

About you

You're a talented developer with an appetite for working at a startup. You're fluent in Python or TypeScript and have experience writing and shipping code in a production environment. Above all, you're eager to wear multiple hats, lead new initiatives, learn new technologies, and get it done; whatever it is.

You've done one or more of the following:

Helped build and scale a web-based product.
Designed, iterated, and scaled web-based user experiences.
Contributed to UI and product design cycles.
Worked extensively with Large Language Models.
Deployed an ML product or feature in the wild.

You count one or more of the following among your strengths:

Cloud infrastructure platforms: AWS, Azure, or GCP. Infrastructure as Code experience is an asset.
Frontend frameworks: Next.js, React, Tailwind.
Backend development: GraphQL, TypeORM, PostgreSQL.
Building products with deep neural networks, including data and training infrastructure.

Compensation and Benefits:

Monthly salary will range from 7000 USD to 11,000 USD based on experience and ability.

Job Summary:

This position is a 4-month work term and will commence May 4 2026 to August 21 2026.

WANT TO SHAPE THE FUTURE OF BANKING?

Have you ever wondered how North America's most successful companies develop some of their most innovative ideas? If so, consider exploring TD Invent, the bank's enterprise approach to innovation, creating the products and services of the future.

TD Invent is our approach to transforming experiences for customers, colleagues, and the communities we operate in. Behind TD Invent is a community of innovators, patent filers, designers, researchers, developers, and partners who come together to build today's solutions with tomorrow's mindset. TD Invent will introduce you to areas and topics that may make you rethink what it's like to work in financial services.

DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW

Within TD Invent is the TD Enterprise Innovation team where our highly collaborative pods of Product Owners, Designers and Developers work together to ideate, explore, and validate innovative solutions that will change the way the bank thinks about its customers - one sprint at a time. Make your mark in a setting where every day operates like a well-funded start-up, while helping TD shape the future of banking.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as an individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:

Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
Lunch & Learns on topics such as Innovation, Diversity & Inclusion, Personal Branding and so much more

Job Responsibilities:

As a User Experience Designer Intern/Co-op within Enterprise Innovation, which includes TD Lab, explore emerging technologies and work with pods to explore concepts and test with users on how we might improve customer experiences.

Job responsibilities include:

Exploring user & business needs through design, prototyping, and testing ideas with customers
Answering critical user and business questions using TD's Innovation Framework, which incorporates Business Design/Design Thinking and Agile methodologies
Conducting user research and interviews to help understand customer problems
Developing storyboards, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate design ideas
Executing UX and visual design requirements as part of a team
Working closely with product owners and pod members to bring a solution to life

You will receive one-on-one mentorship with the Enterprise Innovation and TD Lab's user experience designers and have the chance to work on multiple projects throughout the term. You will have the opportunity to act like an intrapreneur and flex your creative muscles, bringing impactful ideas to life while taking on challenging design tasks. You can read about our co-op experience from one of our former co-op employees here: https://medium.com/td-lab/my-internship-with-td-labs-73675b3e2fb5

If you are a self-starter, like to think outside the box, and are looking for a challenge - this job is for you!

Required Skills:

JOB REQUIREMENTS

The basics (required to be considered):

Must have a visually clear resume with a clear link to your portfolio. Your resume should be easy to read & clearly explain your past roles and experience.
Must have a portfolio, with at least 2 UX case studies (more details below).
Knowledge of design tools, specifically Figma and Figjam.

The extras (nice to haves):
Demonstrable passion and curiosity for design & learning more about UX
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, & takes initiative in their work, as demonstrated by extracurriculars, class projects, etc.

HOW WE EVALUATE CANDIDATES

Your resume and portfolio should work together to showcase why you are the right person for this role.

What makes a strong UX Resume:
Highlight relevant work or classroom experience
Tell us about the impact you've had in past roles
Identify the tools and practices you've had exposure to
Be visually appealing (consider things like alignment, spelling, etc.)
Provide a link to your portfolio (don't rely on embedded links!)
Be 1-2 pages, maximum

What makes a strong UX Portfolio:
Be easy to access and read - treat your portfolio like a UX Design project and try to consider accessibility, consistency, usability, etc.
Contain at least 2 UX case studies so we can better evaluate your experience & design process

Have some relevant work, but not sure how to build a case study? That's OK - this role is open to students of all experience levels, and we encourage you to apply. Here's a guide to what we look for:
Project context / background and timelines
Your role and responsibilities & project timeline
The core problem you're solving, from a user's perspective
The methods used for primary and/or secondary research - and the key findings from your research
Your final design solution, showing how it solves the problem you identified
Reflection on what you learned from the project

Please note that applications without a portfolio will not be considered.

Compensation and Benefits:

We're committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. The salary range for this role is between $45,700 to $74,400 CAD. The exact rate will be dependent on the successful candidate's work terms and school terms completed at the time of offer.

We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.
TD is committed to providing you with the best candidate experience and internship. As such, work location and start dates are subject to change

TEAM CULTURE
One of the things that the TD Enterprise Innovation team prides ourselves in is our team culture. It's not uncommon to see kiddos or pets pop into video calls or for a team member to take a meeting while walking their dog. In the warmer months, there's usually a few of us outside for meetings. We have a weekly "Fundatory Friday'' event where we play games together. There's at least one messaging channel dedicated to pictures of pets and babies. We celebrate how terrible we are at March Madness Brackets.

LOCATION
Physically centered in either Kitchener or Toronto. Our teams are currently operating in a Hybrid model, with the expectation that employees are present in either our Kitchener or Toronto offices a minimum of four days per week on our specified anchor days. TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of working arrangements.

HOURS
Monday-Friday, standard business hours.

INCLUSIVENESS
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve.

ACCOMODATION
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you'd like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Employer will be contacting you directly to make interview arrangements.

Job Responsibilities:

As a Software Developer Intern/Co-op within Enterprise Innovation, which includes TD Lab, you will explore emerging technologies and work with pods to explore concepts and test with users on how we might improve customer experiences.

You will truly learn, apply, and experience lean concept and app development by:

Focusing on the right thing through design, prototyping, and testing ideas with customers
Answering critical business questions using TD's Innovation Framework, which incorporates Design Thinking/ Business Design and Agile methodologies
Working with Enterprise Innovation and/or TD Lab pods to rapidly develop the vision of a solution into functional prototypes (for web and/or mobile)
Investigating the potential of emerging and enabling technologies (e.g., gen AI, big data, platform features)
Refining presentation skills by pitching sprint demos, concepts and apps to business partners and executives
Sharing developer insights with other teams just as eager to learn

Enterprise Innovation and TD Lab's Software Developers will mentor and guide you through our end-to-end design and development process. You will work on projects throughout the term and be exposed to the latest in modern technologies. You will have the opportunity to work as an intrapreneur, bringing impactful ideas to life while taking on challenging technical tasks. Required Skills:

Key skills and assets include:

Must be enrolled in an undergraduate degree as of the start of, and during, the work term
Experience with object oriented programming languages (Java, C++, Swift, etc.)
Web development experience (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, etc.)
Machine learning experience (Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, GenAI)
Proficient in technology evaluation and feasibility analysis
Strong research skills with a focus on user-centered design
Experience with RESTful APIs (NodeJS, Express, etc.)
Experience with databases and backend systems
Experience with Git version control
Mobile experience is an asset (Flutter, iOS, Android)

Job Summary:

Friendlier is the leading clean-tech in Canada dedicated to simplifying the switch from single-use to reusable packaging. With our innovative turnkey reusable packaging solution, we aim to revolutionize the way businesses approach packaging, by making sustainability easy and accessible. Our mission is to drive positive environmental impact while offering convenience and cost savings to our clients.

About the Role: As the Software Development Co-op you will work closely with our team to improve the design and functionality of our mobile apps, process tracking system, and other web apps. All projects will be guided by a lean start-up model, where product development, testing, and analysis happen in rapid iterations. You will have a significant impact on our product and processes during a really exciting time for our company. This position is for students who are looking to have an involved and meaningful co-op term.
We are looking for someone who will stand by our mission and work with us toward our vision.

Why You Should Join Us: This is a challenging opportunity that will allow you to learn a lot and have significant impact on a fast-growing start-up. You will have the chance to get involved in many areas of the business and work with a tight-knit team.

Theme - Computing: Software Development
ENG - Software Engineering
ENV - Business, Enterprise and Development

Opportunity to make a meaningful impact by driving positive environmental change through innovative solutions.
Collaborative and inclusive work culture that values diversity, creativity, and continuous learning.

We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees feel valued and respected. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are dedicated to providing equal opportunities for everyone, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, or 2SLGBTQI+ identity. Be part of a team that celebrates diversity and promotes an inclusive environment for all. Please let us know if you require an accommodation due to a disability and we will work with you to address your needs.
We receive government funding for co-op wages, so you must be a Canadian Citizen, permanent resident, or refugee.

Job Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities: We are a start-up, so you will be involved in a number of different projects and get exposed to a lot of different areas. Job responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

- Identify opportunities to improve UI/UX of the mobile and web apps
- Modify and improve multiple code bases
- Collect and analyze business-related metrics for internal and external use
- Analyze mobile and website app data for opportunities and areas of improvement


Required Skills:

Must Haves:
- Web development experience, or experience with web-related technologies;

JS, Typescript, CSS, HTML
Frameworks, Vue, Nuxt, React, Next, or Angular,
- Mobile development experience, IOS, Android, or a combination frameworks like Flutter/React Native
- Cloud Infrastructure Experience, GCP, Azure, or AWS
- Comfortable working in a fast-paced, minimally structured environment
- Highly intuitive and curious
- Self-motivated and independent
- Highly adaptable and resourceful

Nice to Haves:
- Experience with AI Technologies: Building, Training, or Tuning models
Experience with data analysis
Development of data pipelines from various sources
Curation and population of various data reports
Accurate and effective data visualization construction
- Experience with IAC technologies, Terraform, or similar
- C, Go, Rust and/or similar experience lower level languages
- UI/UX Experience and skill, portfolio expected & appreciated
- General knowledge of business activities in a variety of areas
- Interest in expanding your current realm of knowledge

Friendlier does not provide Housing or transportation.

Other	Student provides their own Laptop.

Additional Employment Arrangement Location Information:

This role is remote anywhere in Canada. We have engineers across Santa Clara, Austin, Princeton, and Toronto - and we would be happy to set up opportunities to meet our substantial engineering presence in Toronto.
We support both 4 and 8 month work terms.

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Job Summary:

EnCharge AI is a AI chip startup building radically efficient analog in-memory-compute chips to power AI models on the edge - we aim to unlock state-of-the-art frontier models to run on robotic systems, mobile devices, laptops, autonomous vehicles etc. that all have strict power limits. You can read more about our analog technology at https://www.enchargeai.com/technology and about the launch of our first-generation accelerator at https://en100.enchargeai.com/.

Professor Naveen Verma (our CEO)'s lab at Princeton University spent 6 years developing the analog circuitry that eventually led him to found EnCharge along with our other co-founders Kailash Gopalakrishnan (ex-IBM Fellow) and Echere Iroaga (ex-VP MACOM).

We recently closed an oversubscribed Series B ($100 million) and are backed by Tiger Global, Anzu Partners, TSMC's VentureTech Alliance and the US Department of Defense's DARPA Program.

We're building a custom compiler for our silicon to take arbitrary PyTorch models and lower them to custom assembly for execution on EnCharge hardware. We run post-training quantization to compensate for analog noise, N-dimensional axis tiling to spatially and temporally partition large layers, algorithms to prefetch and split large frontier models larger than the size of chip memory, and more. This is a chance to work at the intersection of machine learning, compilers, and optimization alongside experienced engineers and researchers.

We are hiring for two different focus profiles - both deeply technical, but with different strengths.

Job Responsibilities:

Profile 1: Algorithms and Performance
We are looking for an algorithmically-inclined engineer with an interest in solving abstract problems across scheduling, placement, and allocation. Prior experience with hardware is not required (and we'd argue is not a strong indicator of success) - instead, we're interested in folks with an intuition for building approximations/heuristics for NP-hard problems within our scheduler as we maximize the utilization of our chip to run new models.

To give a flavour, we run multiple large N-dimensional constrained resource optimization problems and several pathfinding algorithms to guide mapping.

Capable of solving resource allocation and scheduling problems (supporting new constraints or new operators, owning the support for a new architectural feature etc.)
Analyze our cycle-level performance output from the simulator to identify new performance opportunities to improve pathfinding
Proficient in Python and C++

Profile 2: Programming Language Design
We are also looking for a systems/programming language-inclined engineer to contribute to IR design in our compiler backend.
- Contribute to the compiler backend MLIR representation for our next-generation accelerator
- Build static-code-analysis / parsing tools in MLIR to identify / implement optimizations
- Contribute to further designing our high-level and low-level programming interface (think CUDA vs PTX) to make new operator bringup faster
- Write new compute / memory kernels in our hardware instruction set, and contribute to co-design efforts to grow the instruction set (ISA)
- Proficient in LLVM/MLIR (C++)

Required Skills:

Profile 1: Algorithms and Performance
Strong intuition and knowledge around algorithmic design (from research, coursework, previous internships etc.). Our languages are Python and C++.

Profile 2: Programming Language Design
Proficiency in C++ and specifically with LLVM/MLIR Dialects would be ideal

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive salary and benefits for our undergrad, masters, and PhD internship programs.
$50 - $55 CAD / hour, dependent on candidate and the subteam.

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Job Summary:

Are you a software developer who wants your work to make a meaningful impact? At Guelph Eye MD, you'll be part of a small, passionate team using technology to improve vision care, helping to preserve and restore sight for patients in Guelph, Waterloo Region, and beyond.

Your work will help improve the lives of thousands of patients and families in our community.

We provide advanced medical and surgical care for eye conditions such as cataracts, glaucoma, and macular degeneration. Alongside that clinical work, we're developing the digital tools we wish we had, and putting them into action every day.

Why join us?

Your work will make a difference from day one. You'll be part of a small, agile team where you'll have real ownership, close mentorship from a serial entrepreneur and software engineer, and the chance to directly shape how technology supports patient care. Furthermore, the tools you help create will have an immediate impact on patient care, and we're actively exploring how to share them more broadly - potentially as open-source projects or commercial products.

Help us make this a place you'd take your grandmother - with systems that are thoughtful, reliable, and genuinely caring.

For those considering a future in optometry or medical school, there's an optional opportunity to shadow and work alongside our medical team. You would get direct experience assisting with diagnostic testing and patient care - a unique combination of technical and clinical exposure.

Guelph Eye MD is a women-owned clinic led by racialized physicians. We are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and equitable team. We strongly encourage applications from individuals who identify as racialized, LGBTQ2S+, Indigenous, disabled, newcomers to Canada, and members of other equity-deserving communities.

Job Responsibilities:

Collaborate with our software lead and medical staff to design, build, and refine software used daily in a live clinical environment
Improve clinical workflows - especially for eye injections and surgeries - by developing full-stack features that reduce errors and save time
Prototype and integrate hardware tools like StreamDecks and Raspberry Pis to support automation and enhance staff experience
Write clean, maintainable code and contribute to rapid, iterative development through design discussions and code reviews
Share ideas and help shape the direction of our tools - many of our best features began as suggestions from the team

Required Skills:

You're someone who's always creating, who enjoys thinking through complex systems, and who takes pride in building things that are polished and reliable. You care about code quality, enjoy learning through iteration, and like seeing things through to completion. If that sounds like you, you'll fit right in.

We work with the following technologies. Experience with some is helpful, but not all are required:

Backend: Go (Golang), with some Python & Flask on specific microservices
Frontend: TypeScript/JavaScript, React, Tailwind CSS
Architecture: Hybrid architecture
Central monolithic server to handle core functionality
Independent microservices to handle specialized tasks (ex. desktop automation, document generation)
DevOps: Docker for containerization, GitHub for version control and continuous integration / deployment
IT Infrastructure: Linux, Windows Server, Hyper-V
Hardware & Interfaces:
Raspberry Pi-based IoT devices for rapid prototyping
StreamDeck-driven physical interfaces used for interacting with clinical workflows, primarily programmed using TypeScript
Inter-Component Communication: REST APIs for most communication, WebSockets for real-time updates from/to hardware interfaces
You'll have the opportunity to work across the full stack and beyond, from user-facing tools to hardware-integrated backend systems, in a fast-paced clinical environment where your work is used daily.

Transportation and Housing:

If you're planning to move to Guelph for the term, here are some housing resources:
Places4Students
The Cannon Housing Listings

For public transit, the 11 Willow West bus line stops directly in front of the clinic, and Gordon Street is a popular area with frequent bus service.

For students who drive regularly, you will be provided with a parking pass. If you will only be driving occasionally, we will provide you with validated parking tickets as needed.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary: $20-30/hour, depending on experience, compensation will be specified in your ranking
Mentorship & Learning: Direct support from a software engineer and serial entrepreneur, with hands-on experience in full-stack development, clinical technology, and product design
Work Environment: Hybrid setup with one preferred in-clinic day per week for collaboration, testing, and optional clinical shadowing for those interested in healthcare careers
Team Culture: Supportive, tight-knit team with break room snacks, occasional baked goods from grateful patients, casual staff socials, and an end-of-term holiday party

Job Summary:

Cimento AI is revolutionizing cybersecurity training by using AI to build resilient, security-conscious teams. We're fortunate to be backed by exceptional investors, including operators and angels from Cloudflare, Palo Alto Networks, CrowdStrike, Tenable, Snyk, Fastly, Groq, Okta, Mandiant, and others. We're looking for motivated and curious Software Engineer Interns to join our dynamic team.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work alongside experienced engineers on our core platform, contributing to real-world projects that help organizations defend against human-targeted threats like phishing and social engineering. This is a unique chance to apply your academic knowledge and gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge technologies.

What We Value:

Creative spark: You generate ideas, not just code.
AI-native: For you, applying AI isn't a strategy, it's a reflex.
Context is king: Overcommunicate.
High agency: You bend reality instead of waiting on Jira.
Unusual edge: Autodidacts, indie hackers, and dropout builders are welcome.
Truth-seeking over credentialism: We care more about your blog or open-source project than your resume.

Job Responsibilities:

Design and build adaptive phishing simulations that leverage LLMs to evolve based on user risk, role, and behavior.
Develop infrastructure for ingesting and analyzing real-time behavioral signals, such as decision latency and user telemetry.
Create intuitive user interfaces that empower security teams to visualize, understand, and act on human risk data.
Collaborate directly with the founding team and early customers to rapidly iterate on the product, turning feedback into features.
Write, test, and ship clean, scalable, and well-documented code across the full stack with mentorship from senior engineers.
Participate in code reviews and our agile development process to learn best practices and contribute to a high-quality codebase.
Utilize AI-powered tools to accelerate your workflow, allowing you to focus on high-impact design, creative problem-solving, and shipping features.

Required Skills:

Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.
Solid understanding of computer science fundamentals, including data structures, algorithms, and software development principles.
Proficiency in at least one programming language, such as Go, TypeScript.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with a keen attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative, team-oriented mindset.
A genuine passion for technology and an eagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced startup environment.
Bonus Points:
Previous internship or project experience in cybersecurity, AI/ML, or enterprise software
Experience with our tech stack: Go, TypeScript, React, Postgres/SQL, AWS, Cloudflare
Familiarity with AI/ML concepts, large language models (LLMs), or AI Coding Tools (Cursor, Claude Code)
A portfolio of personal projects (e.g., GitHub, personal website) that showcases your skills and creativity.

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive Compensation: A competitive hourly rate (CAD 30-50) based on your experience.
Direct Mentorship: Work 1-on-1 with the founding team and learn directly from experienced entrepreneurs and engineers.
High-Impact Work: Ship code that directly impacts our core product and customers from day one.
Professional Development: Gain exposure to our network of world-class operators and investors from leading tech companies.
Remote Office Stipend: A stipend to help you set up a comfortable and productive home office.
Flexible Work Environment: We focus on results, not rigid hours.
Path to Full-Time: High-performing interns will be strongly considered for full-time roles upon graduation.

Video Interview Instructions
As part of your application, please record a short video (10-12 minutes) answering four questions. This helps us get to know you beyond your resume.
Questions

Please describe your most technically challenging project, including the factors that contributed to its difficulty, the methods employed for resolution, and the resulting outcome. (Approximately 3 minutes)
Recount an instance where you were required to solve a problem with minimal guidance. What aspects were unclear? What steps did you take to overcome the obstacles, and what was the result? (Approximately 2-3 minutes)
Share a piece of valuable feedback you have received, either in a professional or team environment, and explain the specific behavioral changes you implemented as a result. (Approximately 2 minutes)
What were the key factors that attracted you to Cimento? (Approximately 2 minutes)
Guidelines
Keep it conversational - no slides needed, just you talking.
Aim for the suggested times, but don't stress if you're slightly over or under.
One take is fine. We care about how you think, not production quality.
Be specific. Concrete examples beat general statements.
Submission
Use Loom (free) or any video recording tool. Paste the link in the application form and make sure it's viewable without login.
Deadline
01/20/26
Questions?
Reach out at eric@cimento.ai

Job Summary:

Expediter Job Description
Ever wondered how that box of cereal appears on the shelf in the store every day? Or how we can move nearly 1 billion units of product from one of our 3,000 vendors, through one of our 24 distribution centers, to one of our 2,300 locations across Canada, and into the homes of millions of Canadians each year with the precision of a well-oiled machine?
Supply Chain at Loblaw is the engine which drives the business, and we want to show you how it all works and have you help us make it stronger, more efficient, and faster!
In this role you will plan and perform expediting activities to ensure the timely delivery of purchase orders to distribution facilities for service to customers. If you enjoy facilitating the flow goods through various departments inside and outside the organization within the scope of business plans, consider applying!

Job Responsibilities:

What you'll do:

Liase between teams - implement new reporting.
Use the database application to complete tracking of past due and delayed POs consolidating and documenting reasons
Partner with vendors, buyers, transport leads, DC leads, outside carriers to resolve issues of past due and delayed POs quickly
Communicate to impacted teams for any Service Level protection actions - picking up earlier, improve performance of responsible parties.
Ad hoc problem solving, data analysis and investigation of issues related to vendor production and shipping delays and solution creation
Create truck and resource utilization plans that align with business priorities (promotional and high margin product) to mitigate equipment disruptions.
Maintain reporting metrics regarding vendor readiness, pick up progress and delivery timelines.
Create action plans in coordination with partner departments using key drivers in service level detractors and the requirements to fulfill service level metrics.
Provide daily and weekly updates to business leadership on key areas of focus where support is required
Analyze issues and data to find opportunities for system optimization and present results to leadership
Through the evolution of the role, build reporting capabilities based on business requirements
Establish relationships with vendors, buyers, transport leads, DC leads and outside carriers for the successful execution of initiatives
Project: App Maintenance consulting / project management
Work with internal Supply Chain team to identify app requirements, data inputs and storage
Lead project timelines, key achievements, project updates and involvement of key business units
Support system project of database app creation towards ensuring that the functional design and delivered solutions meet business requirements
Lead joint decision making and functional design with supply chain functions on the build and delivery of the application
Ensures Loblaw Technology and Supply Chain system experts jointly build Loblaw Technology business requirement documents, functional designs, and testing strategies
Ensure standardized configuration, process, reporting in systems delivery and documentation
Provide regular updates to key business partners
Lead the maintenance of standardized database documentation, business operational definitions, data identification and sourcing, educational and training material for application solution

Required Skills:

What you'll need:

1-3 years' experience in Supply Chain or business operations role would be an asset
University or College degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management or related
Demonstrated success with the planning and execution of system projects with multiple teams or business partners
Analytical and organizational skills; committed to meeting deadlines and targets
Comfort working in a highly flexible environment independently and collectively
Thorough with strong organizational, project and time management skills with ability to adapt to change
Ability to problem-solving, conduct and identify root cause analysis.
Strong communication abilities
Experience with spreadsheet software and inventory management tools
Microsoft Power Platform - Experience with Microsoft Power Automate a strong asset
Dynamic 365, VBA
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Visio etc.)
Curious Mindset - trouble shooter - Logical Thinking
Solution focused, creative and technical capabilities to fulfill unique business demands
Comfort working various levels of leadership

Compensation and Benefits:

$19.5-$25.5/hour

Job Summary:

At Leap Tools, we are building the world's most advanced solutions for the interior décor industry. With customers in 80+ countries, our clientele includes Fortune 500 companies such as Home Depot, local retailers such as Alexanian's, and everything in between. We have been recognized as one of the fastest-growing tech companies by Deloitte for multiple years in a row, and we are looking for ambitious challenge-seekers to fuel our momentum and help us create an iconic global tech company.

About our product
Our technology lets you see products in your own room before you buy. Imagine you want to redesign your home and have been searching for new tiles for your kitchen, or a new rug for your living room. You definitely want to make sure it will look good in your space. We enable that through cutting-edge computer vision technology, presented in an extraordinarily simple and accessible way. Try our rug demo now! Simply upload a picture of your room using your mobile phone, and slide the rug under your coffee table:

https://www.roomvo.com/rugdemo/

About You
You have a passion for solving complex problems and working on products used by millions of people. You like to understand the big picture when it comes to complex systems. You are not afraid to dive into the details and trace a request through dozens of calls. Join us and you will work directly with our talented engineering team to push our product to new heights.

About our Stack
JavaScript, Next.js, React/Redux
Python, Django, PostgreSQL, AWS

About our culture

We're a remote-first company that encourages our employees to work from where they're most productive.
We work in tight-knit teams to cultivate an ownership mentality.
We cherish curiosity and an obsession for details because we know these details are invaluable over the long run.
We're hyper-focused on our achievements and our ability to execute our promises. We act with urgency.
Your birthday (and our company's birthday) is a day off!
Take the Leap. Apply now.

Our demo, in case you missed it:
https://www.roomvo.com/rugdemo4r

Job Responsibilities:

Build customer-facing products and improve the performance of our platform.
Flex your TypeScript/React muscle to design/develop robust applications
Work with Python/Django in a microservices architecture
Implement APIs over HTTP and gRPC

Required Skills:

Strong computer science fundamentals demonstrated through coursework in computer science or engineering
Experience with TypeScript, React, Next.js and single-page web applications (HTML5, CSS3)
Python/Django development
Linux, git
Exceptional attention to detail and focus on quality

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive salary based on your experience and interview performance: $30-40/h

Job Summary:

About Redcan
Redcan is at the forefront of building agentic AI products and tools that enable our customers to scale their product deployment capability by orders of magnitude, transforming their business and accelerating time to value while reducing cost and complexity of delivering enterprise software products.

As a UX / UI Product Designer, you'll create experiences that streamline complex workflows, advocate for user needs, and shape a more robust Agentic AI system.

Job Responsibilities:

What you'll do

Design high quality deliverables and assets such as wireframes, mockups, prototypes (code or gma), UI components, layouts, and design system elements.
Collaborate around solving user problems using design thinking methods.
Conduct user research, including usability testing, interviews, and surveys, to inform decisions.
Present your work to others, collaborating with other designers, product managers, engineers, a researcher, and stakeholders to improve your work as you go.

Required Skills:

What we look for

Currently enrolled in a Canadian co-op or internship program, available Jan-Apr 2026
Interest in building Agent AI tools and understanding the value and role of design systems.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
User-obsessed and passionate about creating products that drive business results.
Fundamental knowledge of Figma (Auto Layout, Components, Prototyping), UX/UI principles.
Exposure to HTML/CSS or front-end development (not required, but helpful).
A portfolio showcasing design thinking, UI/UX skills, and visual design work.

Compensation and Benefits:

We offer competitive base salary, commensurate with experience ($30-$40/hr), and term by term salary increases for returning co-op students. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to gain exposure to a multitude of business models in software and digital business through interactions with venture capital or private equity investment portfolio companies that Redcan partners with.

Job Summary:

Who we are:
Geotab ® is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified "Great Place to Work™." We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.

Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotab's open platform and Geotab Marketplace ®, offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.

Our team is growing and we're looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what it's like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram. Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news.

Who you are:
We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking an Vehicle Systems Engineering Intern who will focus on growing Geotab's world class vehicle support by researching new vehicles, reverse engineering their systems and automating the process with software tools. If you love technology, and are keen to join an industry leader - we would love to hear from you!

What you'll do:
As a Vehicle Systems Engineering Intern your key area of responsibility will be to gain access to vehicles both in person and remotely across the world, to reverse engineer vehicular systems. This includes electrical, hardware and communications systems, protocols and legislation. In the past, students have developed software tools in C# and python, built big data dashboards using Google Big Query, reverse engineered vehicles from scratch using our in house CAN analysis software, helped diagnose vehicle issues… the list goes on! You will need to work closely with all development teams across Geotab and implement new initiatives across Big Data, Firmware, Software/ Mobile development and Hardware teams.
To be successful in this role you will be a self-starter with strong written and verbal communication skills and have the ability to quickly understand complex, technical concepts. In addition, the successful candidate will have strong analytical and project management skills with an ability to identify needs, develop effective solutions, and manage projects through completion. The successful candidate will also be able to manage multiple timelines and contrasting priorities to ensure timely results.

The opportunity:

4 - 8 month work-term beginning May 2026.
Full-time, paid internship: Monday - Friday, 37.5hrs/week.
Your first week at Geotab begins with 'GEO Launch' - a one-week Employee Orientation. Click hereto learn more!
Learn more about the Geotab Campus Program here.

Job Responsibilities:

How you'll make an impact:

Reverse engineer vehicular systems including electrical, hardware and communications systems and protocols.
Document and design methods to collect data from vehicles in a way that is digestible by Geotab's hardware and software teams.
Support the global reverse engineering vision and process by contributing to the use, design and implementation of the software tooling.
Use Cloud-based data warehouses (e.g. BigQuery and Google Cloud compute) for automated analysis of vehicle data and identify vehicle support gaps from our products.
Assist in the product development cycle through proof of concepts and the execution of beta testing.

Required Skills:

What you'll bring to the role:

Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mechatronics, Electrical, Automotive, Systems Engineering or a related field.
CAN and CAN bus related experience is an asset.
General code gurus with a knack for picking up new languages.
Useful Languages: C#, Python, SQL, MATLAB.
Other useful software experience: CANalyzer, Simulink.
Multidisciplinary background.
Good understanding of vehicle architectures, including hybrid/ electric vehicles.
Hands-on vehicle experience is an asset (Can you diagnose a problem with your car?)
Self- starter and results- oriented.
Strong time management and fantastic communication skills.
Interest in new mobility technologies, telematics and vehicles.
Experience or interest in hybrid and electric vehicles and/or green technologies is an asset.
Have a valid driver's license with at least 1 year's driving experience.
If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role! Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply.

Additional Information:

Other	G2 or G license required

Compensation and Benefits:

$24.00 - $33.00 /hour CAD (Compensation can be discussed with the HR recruiter)
Free lunch at Oakville head office daily, and some days at our Waterloo and Toronto offices
Virtual and on-site intern socials
Lunch & Learns with Geotabbers
MyLearning - an online platform offering a variety of free courses and modules for you to choose from based on your interests
Intern Innovation Challenge (Summers only)

Job Summary:

Traba is building the autonomous future of industrial staffing.

We are a technology company reinventing how industrial businesses manage labor by developing fully autonomous, orchestrated multi-agent AI workflows to connect businesses with vetted workers to meet their staffing needs. Our mission is to build a world where the global supply chain operates at peak efficiency. We're proud to be backed by some of the world's best investors, including Founders Fund, Khosla Ventures, and General Catalyst.

We're excited to open our doors to a motivated and innovative co-op to join our team as a full-stack engineering co-op. This role is a unique opportunity to help shape and develop our core products from the ground up, including the React Native worker mobile app, the React/Node.js business web app, and a suite of React/Node.js tools for our operations team. Collaborating closely with our CTO, you'll have a significant impact on our product roadmap, take ownership of product decisions, and lay the groundwork for our technology platform.

Job Responsibilities:

About You:

Voracious learner. You love diving into new areas and exploring new languages, frameworks, and technologies, and can discuss product with a UX designer one minute and deployment infrastructure with tech leads the next.
Value clear communication. You recognize the importance of clear communication, documented planning, and transparent, frequent feedback.
Sweat the small stuff. You have strong opinions on design patterns, IDEs, tabs vs. spaces-you understand that how you do one thing is how you do everything, so you care about the details.
Experience with or desire to learn React Native. You have the front-end chops to build beautiful performant apps and love creating products that delight users.
You Will:
Develop and review high-quality, efficient code for our suite of applications, including our React Native mobile app, React/Typescript web apps, and Node.js/PostgreSQL APIs.
Work with designers to create pixel-perfect, visually appealing UIs.
Implement CI/CD workflows using tools like Docker & GitHub Actions.
Contribute to the development of our core systems-from real-time job matching algorithms to autonomous worker vetting pipelines powered by ML and AI agents.
Enhance our apps with analytics and monitoring to gain insights into user experiences and application performance.
Play a versatile role in a dynamic founding team committed to redefining the future of staffing for light industrial work.

Required Skills:

You Are:

Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, with exposure to Typescript, Javascript, React Native, React, Node.js, and/or PostgreSQL.
Experience from internships in an engineering environment, showcasing your ability to navigate ambiguity and initiate action.
A genuine interest in leveraging technology to help people find work that is meaningful and fits their lifestyle.

Transportation and Housing:

We offer train commuter benefits for the duration of the term.

Compensation and Benefits:

The compensation for this role is around $8,000 USD per month.

Benefits:

Dinner Provided via Grubhub & stocked kitchen for NY employees
Commuter benefit
Gym pass Benefit

Job Summary:

About Parsons
Founded in 1944, Parsons is a digitally enabled solutions provider focused on creating the future of critical infrastructure. Whether designing iconic bridges, transforming transportation, or advancing industry leading environment solutions, we've shaped progress for over eight decades and continue to work to make the world smarter, safer, and more connected.

We're a company of thinkers and innovators. Our people don't just generate big ideas, they bring them to life. We operate across services and markets around the globe, which means that, although we're one company, there are many possibilities for growth and development. As an intern, you'll have the opportunity to engage and grow your network with fellow interns and colleagues, explore our company, attend events, obtain a mentor, apply your skills in real world experiences, and more. You aren't just here to learn what we do, you're here to contribute to our culture, elevate your career, and imagine next with us.

Location
Toronto, ON preferred, following a flexible hybrid schedule (1 to 2 days per week) depending on project needs and your location. Occasional travel to local project sites or nearby Parsons offices in Southern Ontario (e.g., Oakville or Markham) may be required.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll be Doing
You'll join the Chief Technology Organization (CTO) Innovation Group in Infrastructure North America (INA) at Parsons, where we:
Track emerging technology trends and conduct market scans relevant to our business (e.g., new AI tools, digital engineering methods)
Drive the practical application of new technologies in real projects, helping pilot and implement innovations across our infrastructure business
Facilitate the adoption and development of new tech capabilities and processes within INA, coordinating of training, change management, and roll-out of best practices to staff
Introduce and optimize digital processes and automation to enable staff to deliver work faster and more consistently (e.g., improving workflows through software tools or scripts)
Establish and manage relationships with technology vendors and partners, engaging with them to explore solutions and coordinate demos or evaluations
Foster a culture of innovation and transformative thinking by championing new ideas, helping organize events, and sharing success stories within the company
Facilitate collaboration between the CTO Innovation Group and other teams to drive joint innovation and efficiency efforts
Support innovation proposals and knowledge sharing by contributing to preparing proposal materials, case studies, and internal playbooks that communicate our innovation initiatives and lessons learned
Empower our nearly 6,000 colleagues within INA to #ImagineNext
Exciting initiatives you may support
Conducting pilots of artificial intelligence (AI) solutions for both internal operations and client use cases (e.g., prototyping an AI tool to automate design tasks or deploying a machine learning model on a project), helping test viability, gather user feedback, and document results
Driving the adoption of digital delivery best practices globally across Parsons, contributing to the INA Digital Delivery Playbook and supporting training or implementation efforts so project teams worldwide can use improved digital workflows
Researching and preparing business cases for emerging tech, strategic partnerships, or new product/service ideas, which could involve market analyses, cost-benefit assessments, and presenting recommendations to leadership on whether to invest in or adopt a solution
Applying data analytics to measure and evaluate Return on Investment (ROI) of innovation initiatives (e.g., tracking the performance metrics of a pilot project to quantify time saved or quality improvements)
Contributing to client-facing project delivery in different technical domains; you could be embedded in a transportation project, an environmental study, or a smart city pilot, helping apply your skills to deliver real project outcomes while injecting innovative ideas

Required Skills:

Who We're Looking For
Excellent Communication Skills
You'll be collaborating with, and at times representing, our team to different stakeholders, from software developers and data scientists to senior executives, clients, and external partners. You must be able to explain technical topics to non-technical audiences and adjust your communication style to suit your audience.
Strategic and Analytical Thinking
You're comfortable working at the intersection of people, process, and technology to tackle strategic business challenges. This means you can think big-picture about innovation's role in an organization, but also break down problems analytically. You enjoy using data and logic to solve problems and you can grasp how different parts of a system interrelate (e.g., how a change in process might impact people's workflows and tech tools).
Independence and Initiative
We're looking for a self-starter who takes ownership of their work. You'll be given your own responsibilities and will often need to drive tasks with minimal supervision, whether it's leading a meeting or drafting a report. Don't wait to be told what to do - if you see an opportunity or have an idea, run with it. We encourage you to ask questions, suggest improvements, and be proactive. Show initiative and you'll get ample opportunities to lead and contribute.
Creativity and Adaptability
Innovation is by nature dynamic. New priorities can emerge and we often navigate uncharted territory. You should be adaptable, organized, and able to manage changing tasks or objectives without losing focus. At the same time, bring your creativity! We value fresh perspectives and bold ideas. Don't be afraid to think outside the box and challenge the status quo.
Preferred Qualifications & Skills
It's not expected that you have all of these, but the more the better!
Familiarity with artificial intelligence (AI) concepts (e.g., prompt engineering, large language models like GPT, and machine learning techniques)
Experience or coursework in digital twins or 3D modeling in an infrastructure context
Exposure to CAD and modeling software (e.g., AutoCAD, Civil 3D, Bentley OpenRoads) used in engineering design
Knowledge of GIS or geospatial technologies for mapping and spatial analysis
Interest or experience in drone operations as used in surveying or inspections
Understanding of software architecture or systems design/integration and how different tech components fit together in a solution
Skills in data science, business intelligence, or analytics (e.g., familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI or basic Python/R for data analysis)
A design thinking mindset with understanding of user-centred design and iterative problem-solving methods to develop client-focused solutions
A valid, unrestricted driver's license and willingness to travel occasionally; you may need to visit field sites or nearby Parsons offices in Southern Ontario (e.g. Oakville, Markham)

Additional Information:

Unrestricted Driver Licence


Compensation and Benefits:

$23-$26 hourly
