Job Summary:

About Hamming

Humans make billions of calls/day. We think a majority of these will be handled by AI built by thousands of companies tackling every single vertical.

Making these AI voice agents reliable is hard. A small change in prompts, function call definitions, or model providers can cause large changes in LLM outputs.

Hamming automates testing for AI voice agents. With one click, 1000s of our voice agents call our customer's voice agents using different accents, tones, cadences, and personalities.

Why work with us

We're growing extremely quickly and are hiring uWaterloo co-op students to help us win faster. We're backed by YC, AI Grant and top-tier investors.

Sumanyu (CEO) previously helped Citizen (backed by Founders Fund, Sequoia, 8VC) grow its users by 4X as Citizen's Head of Data and grew an AI-powered sales program to 100s of millions in revenue/year at Tesla as Senior Staff Data Scientist. Sumanyu is ex-SYDE.

Our engineering team ranks #1 on https://workweave.dev/ (engineering benchmarking tool). See post here: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7354568510842290177/

Sam Altman gave us a shoutout for burning 100B tokens at OpenAI's Dev Day. See LinkedIn post: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/sumanyusharma_openaidevday-activity-7381718141455859712-OPhA?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAAAh-eI0Bl3EbQhXGlnjcZ4TbyeByvoh32hg

Who we're looking for

You're someone entrepreneurial looking to 10x your skills and ship features and products that are actually used by customers. We'll help you level up and provide whatever you need to win and get things done.

Quotes from past co-ops;

Dominik (Waterloo) - "I literally doubled my knowledge and changed the way I write software. The team moves incredibly fast."
Gurvir (Waterloo) - "The first month was overwhelming because of how many tools the team uses but by the end of my co-op I was cranking out 8 linear tickets / day. The Hamming team is cracked."
Jivan (Waterloo) - "I joined Hamming because I want to build my own company one day, and this was the closest thing to founder training I've found - high ownership, high standards, and real customers using what you ship. Getting access to the YC ecosystem and events on top of that made it an unfair advantage."
Duc (Northeastern) - "I relearned everything and pushed way past my comfort zone. Working with this team showed me what it actually takes to deliver good software - the bar is high and the growth is real."
Darwin (Harvard) - "Every day Hamming pushes me to level up. The pace is intense but the team's energy is contagious. It's hard not to be motivated when everyone around you is shipping."

How Hamming uses Devin: https://devin.ai/customers/hamming

Job Responsibilities:

Here's what you'll do:

0 to 1

Build new products extremely quickly that make our customer's voice agents more reliable. Our customers want new features, and we don't have enough time to satisfy current demand.
1 to N
Scale current products and infra to support 100x growth. This includes optimizing and productizing processes that humans currently do.

Required Skills:

TECH STACK

Essentials: Next.JS, TypeScript, Python, Tailwind
AI: OpenAI, Anthropic, STT, TTS, etc.
Infrastructure: PostgreSQL

LET'S CHAT IF YOU

You've previously co-op'ed at an early stage startup or have tried starting a company yourself.
Are a power user of Claude Code, Devin, Windsurf, Cursor, Zed, etc., and started using code-gen tools before they went mainstream.
Have deep intuition about what the current gen LLMs are capable of and what kind of tasks that are hard now will become easier in the next model.
Are fast at 0 to 1, but also thoughtful about how your technical decisions will scale over time.
Want to grind with us, staying close to customers to iterate fast and solve their problems.
Think independently and do whatever it takes to get things done while maintaining a high-quality bar.
Are excited about making AI voice agents reliable.
Have shipped LLM projects / apps that people use.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation: $40 - $60 CAD / hour for 40 hour weeks
Applicants should note that this company will require you to work as an independent contractor, and not as an employee.
Learning stipend for courses / books
Fully paid Claude Code, Codex, Devin, Windsurf, Cursor, etc.
Hack weeks
Mentorship by CEO
We'll do public shoutouts and post your work internally within YC and on our socials. Our goal is to help you elevate your brand.

Job Summary:

MAJOR DUTIES:
As a member of the Controls Engineering Department you will develop and design industrial control systems for automated assembly systems. You will be required to produce custom electrical designs to meet customer control specifications. The challenge is to develop world-class control systems that meet or exceed our customer's requirements. As a member of our control systems team you will gain experience in the design of industrial control systems using the latest commercial control products, including PLC's, human machine interfaces, motion control (servo, AC, DC, VFD), robot, I/O, transducer and various sensor products.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:
Under the supervision of an experienced Control Systems Hardware Designer, you will:
· Use AutoCAD and proprietary ATS electrical design software to develop electrical drawings for custom automated assembly systems. This includes design of all electrical aspects of the automated system from electrical distribution to low voltage DC control.
· Use commercial third party equipment design an integrated system that solves the customer's motion control (servo, DC, VFD, AC/DC), safety monitoring and control, distributed I/O and analog control requirements.
· Specify correct sensors (photoelectric/inductive/capacitive) and analog transducers (pressure/load/ position/temperature) for automated systems. May work in conjunction with supplier's technical representative to achieve a functional and cost effective solution.
· Specify electrical enclosures and provide layout drawings of electrical equipment for ATS electrical shop.
· Work with mechanical and software designers to ensure that the control system will meet safety, performance, reliability and functionality requirements.
· Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the ATS Code of Business Conduct.
· Adhere to all health and safety rules and procedures.

PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE) REQUIREMENTS
· Due to arc flash and shock hazards, voltage-rated gloves and 100% cotton, long-sleeve shirts must be worn at all times when working on live panels.
· Employees must comply at all times with the specific PPE requirements identified on the ARC Flash and Shock Hazard Warning Labels (see below for your information.) These will be posted at Switchgear locations, breaker panels, bus ducts and equipment related power drops.
· Please refer to the Workplace Electrical Safety Program for specific details.

Job Responsibilities:

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:
Under the supervision of an experienced Control Systems Software Designer, you will:

Develop real-time control system software for automated assembly systems. This includes the programming of PLC's, Servo Controllers, Robots and Vision Systems.
Develop human machine interfaces. These interfaces can be commercially available industrial products, SCADA nodes or custom GUI's written in Visual Basic or Visual C++.
Work with mechanical and electrical designers to ensure that the control system will meet performance, reliability and functionality requirements.
Perform system integration.This includes the testing of all system hardware and software, the configuration and calibration of intelligent devices and the verification of the assembly process.The goal is to meet all customer quality, functionality and safety requirements.
Perform on-site commissioning and startup.This involves demonstrating system's capability once the equipment has been shipped to the customer's site.
Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the ATS Code of Business Conduct.
Adhere to all health and safety rules and procedures.
PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE) REQUIREMENTS
Due to arc flash and shock hazards, voltage-rated gloves and 100% cotton, long-sleeve shirts must be worn at all times when working on live panels.
Employees must comply at all times with the specific PPE requirements identified on the ARC Flash and Shock Hazard Warning Labels (see below for your information.) These will be posted at Switchgear locations, breaker panels, bus ducts and equipment related power drops.
Please refer to the Workplace Electrical Safety Program for specific details.

Required Skills:

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education:
· Electrical, Computer or Systems Design engineering student with an interest in industrial control systems.

Experience:
· Electrical Distribution (3 phase) and Electrical Codes (CSA, NEC, IEC etc.).
· PLC's, motion controllers, servo systems.
· AutoCAD.
· A self-starter with the ability to work as part of a team with minimal supervision.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required

$20.44 $22.72 $24.79 $26.60 $28.72 $30.43

MAJOR DUTIES:
Works with electrical designers to detail electrical drawings and makes minor design changes from "Red Pen" modifications. Works with Technicians using electrical schematics during debug stages of the build process to verify designs and troubleshoot.

Job Responsibilities:

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:
Under the supervision of an experienced Jr. Electrical Designer, you will:
· Use Eplan or AutoCAD and proprietary ATS electrical design software to develop electrical drawings for custom automated assembly systems. This includes design of all electrical aspects of the automated system from electrical distribution to low voltage DC control.
· Use commercial third party equipment design an integrated system that solves the customer's motion control (servo, DC, VFD, AC/DC), safety monitoring and control, distributed I/O and analog control requirements.
· Specify correct sensors (photoelectric/inductive/capacitive) and analog transducers (pressure/load/ position/temperature) for automated systems. May work in conjunction with supplier's technical representative to achieve a functional and cost effective solution.
· Specify electrical enclosures and provide layout drawings of electrical equipment for ATS electrical shop.
· Work with mechanical and software designers to ensure that the control system will meet safety, performance, reliability and functionality requirements.
· Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the ATS Code of Business Conduct.
· Adhere to all health and safety rules and procedures.

PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE) REQUIREMENTS
· Due to arc flash and shock hazards, voltage-rated gloves and 100% cotton, long-sleeve shirts must be worn at all times when working on live panels.
· Employees must comply at all times with the specific PPE requirements identified on the ARC Flash and Shock Hazard Warning Labels (see below for your information.) These will be posted at Switchgear locations, breaker panels, bus ducts and equipment related power drops.
· Please refer to the Workplace Electrical Safety Program for specific details.

Required Skills:

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education:
· Electrical, Computer or Systems Design engineering student with an interest in industrial control systems.

Experience:
· Electrical Distribution (3 phase) and Electrical Codes (CSA, NEC, IEC etc.).
· PLC's, motion controllers, servo systems.
· EPlan or AutoCAD.
· A self-starter with the ability to work as part of a team with minimal supervision.

Please only apply if you have reliable transportation to the work location.

5 days in office is a requirement.

Job Summary:

Cresta is on a mission to turn every customer conversation into a competitive advantage by unlocking the true potential of the contact center. Our platform combines the best of AI and human intelligence to help contact centers discover customer insights and behavioral best practices, automate conversations and inefficient processes, and empower every team member to work smarter and faster. Born from the prestigious Stanford AI lab, Cresta's co-founder and chairman is Sebastian Thrun, the genius behind Google X, Waymo, Udacity, and more. Our leadership also includes CEO, Ping Wu, the co-founder of Google Contact Center AI and Vertex AI platform, and co-founder, Tim Shi, an early member of Open AI.

Join us on this thrilling journey to revolutionize the workforce with AI. The future of work is here, and it's at Cresta.

About the role:

As a full-stack software engineer, you will have the options to work on different products at Cresta. Cresta Opera, the no-code AI command center for contact centers. Cresta Platform, the core engineering platform that enables all Cresta features. Cresta Studio, the one-stop-shop for call analysis, building, evaluating, and deploying conversational AI models. The products leverage the latest LLM technologies to build differentiated product suites.

You will join a collaborative but highly autonomous working environment in which each member has a defined role with clear expectations, as well as the freedom to pursue individual projects.

Job Responsibilities:

Responsibilities:

You will join a collaborative but highly autonomous working environment in which each member has a defined role with clear expectations, as well as the freedom to pursue individual projects.
Collaborate with senior engineers on the team to write and push high-quality code efficiently for both the frontend and backend.
Build exciting products in which ML/AI is applied at the core as a major differentiator for the product. You'll work closely with ML engineers on such features (you do not need to be an ML engineer yourself; we do not expect any experience with ML)
Identify and leverage opportunities to improve general engineering productivity.
Integrate with various tools for CI/CD, test automation, monitoring, logging, documentation

Required Skills:

Qualifications We Value:

Experience coding in modern programming languages like Python, Go, Java for backend and JavaScript, TypeScript for frontend.
Understanding of the modern front-end ecosystem and experience applying frameworks/tools (React.js, Webpack, and Node.js) and patterns to complex, production web applications.
Comfortable defining and building robust APIs with a strong understanding for different protocols like REST, RPC frameworks, Websockets etc.
Experience with database schema design and an understanding of query performance that translates to performant, scalable, and reactive products.

Compensation and Benefits:

Perks & Benefits:

$30-$50 per hour subject to taxes
Lunch and dinner can be expensed (up to $25 each) while working in the office.
PTO: 4 days
This posting will be used to fill a newly-created role.

We have noticed a rise in recruiting impersonations across the industry, where scammers attempt to access candidates' personal and financial information through fake interviews and offers. All Cresta recruiting email communications will always come from the @cresta.ai domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Cresta via other sources should be ignored. Job Summary:

Cresta is on a mission to turn every customer conversation into a competitive advantage by unlocking the true potential of the contact center. Our platform combines the best of AI and human intelligence to help contact centers discover customer insights and behavioral best practices, automate conversations and inefficient processes, and empower every team member to work smarter and faster. Born from the prestigious Stanford AI lab, Cresta's co-founder and chairman is Sebastian Thrun, the genius behind Google X, Waymo, Udacity, and more. Our leadership also includes CEO, Ping Wu, the co-founder of Google Contact Center AI and Vertex AI platform, and co-founder, Tim Shi, an early member of Open AI.

Join us on this thrilling journey to revolutionize the workforce with AI. The future of work is here, and it's at Cresta.

About the role:

We are seeking curious, detail-oriented students to join our AI Delivery team as AI Quality Assurance Interns.
This is a hands-on role where you will evaluate the behavior, accuracy, and reliability of Cresta's AI Agents and Agent Assist systems.
Unlike traditional QA, this work sits at the intersection of:

AI behavior analysis
Intent recognition evaluation
Conversation quality assessment
Model output auditing
Light prompt testing and refinement

Job Responsibilities:

You will help ensure our AI systems act as intended, follow correct business logic, and provide accurate and safe outputs to end users.

As an AI Quality Assurance Intern, you will:

Execute structured test plans for AI Agent implementations
Validate that intents, entities, and workflows trigger correctly
Identify behavioral inconsistencies, misclassifications, or hallucinations
Review and validate AI-generated suggestions, summaries, and classifications
Provide actionable feedback to improve intent models and redaction/PII handling
Run bias, redaction, and transcription accuracy checks
Spot patterns or emerging issues across test sets
Contribute ideas for improving internal QA processes and tools

Required Skills:

Qualifications We Value:

This is an excellent fit for students interested in:
AI/ML, NLP, or chatbots
Product quality and user experience
Linguistics, conversation analysis, or human-AI interaction
Exploring a career in AI evaluation, AI ops, or product QA
No advanced ML experience is required - just strong analytical thinking and curiosity about how intelligent systems behave.

Compensation and Benefits:

$30-$50 per hour subject to taxes

Job Summary:

About Us
At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

About Cloudflare's Engineering Teams
Anytime we push code, it automatically affects the millions of Internet properties (powering websites, remote teams, APIs, mobile apps, etc.) running on our global network. Cloudflare's network is one of the largest in the world and spans over 330 cities in more than 125 countries. What's more, Cloudflare operates within 50 milliseconds of 95% of the Internet-connected population globally (for context, the blink of an eye is 300-400 milliseconds!). We are passionate about making the Internet more secure, reliable, and faster for everyone.

Cloudflare's Engineering teams build and run the software that handles the massive amount of traffic that flows through our network. We also have teams that build the UI and control plane for our software, using modern patterns and libraries in a microservices-based architecture. Technologies include: Typescript/Javascript, Go, Rust, C/C++ and Python.

About the Internship Program
The ideal summer intern is passionate about making the Internet a better place. You will work alongside experienced engineers. You will push code this summer that touches hundreds of millions of web surfers. We like to get things done, so we are looking for interns who are curious, proactive, and able to complete projects. This is a great opportunity for engineers who want to learn to develop at Internet scale.

Job Responsibilities:

What would you do as a Cloudflare intern?

Ship and deliver projects over 12-16 weeks with autonomy and support.
Work cross-functionally with various teams.
Work closely with a mentor to guide you through the internship and help with career goals.
Build your network across the company through our various in and out of office socials, networking programs, Employee Resource Group (ERG) programs, and Activity Groups.
Present your project to the entire company at the end of the internship.
Connect and learn from our executives and leadership team including our co-founders.
Learn and develop skills through our professional development workshops.
Write for our Cloudflare blog and be featured on Cloudflare.tv sessions.
You can check out our internship blogs to learn more about our program and hear directly from our past interns.

Required Skills:

Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience

Currently pursuing a degree or program in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or relevant field to the role.
Demonstrated critical thinking skills and drive to learn and adapt new technologies.
Curiosity, empathy and ability to get things done.
Ability to commit to a minimum 12 week summer internship.
In office 3-5 days a week in Austin, TX.
Bonus: Demonstrated passion for software development, such as personal projects, open-source contributions, or experience with our developer platform using Cloudflare for Students.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary USD $45/hr and relocation stipend

Job Summary:

About CodeRabbit
CodeRabbit is an applied AI company on a mission to redefine how developers build software. We're creating the next generation of Gen AI-powered code reviewers - intelligent systems that collaborate with humans to accelerate engineering, improve code quality, and reduce cognitive load.

Founded in 2023, we raised a $16 million Series A in late 2024 led by CRV, with participation from Flex Capital and Engineering Capital. Our team has quickly grown to over 20 engineers across the U.S. and India, and we're scaling fast to meet demand from forward-thinking dev teams around the world.

At CodeRabbit, we combine large language models with robust engineering to deliver practical, high-leverage tools for real-world workflows - not research demos. We're building extraordinarily productive human-machine collaboration systems that empower developers to work smarter, faster, and with greater clarity. If you're excited about the intersection of AI and developer experience, you're in the right place.

Role Overview
We're looking for an ambitious and capable software engineering intern to join our team for Winter 2026. You'll work on a focused set of product and platform initiatives that meaningfully shape how developers interact with CodeRabbit. These projects may span backend systems, ephemeral state management, user feedback tooling, public-facing product experiments, and more.

You'll operate like a full member of the team - proposing ideas, writing production code, and collaborating across engineering and product. Ideal candidates are pragmatic builders who care about the developer experience and thrive in ambiguous, high-ownership environments.

Why Join Us?

Build the Future: Help shape the next generation of AI-powered developer tools.
Real Ownership: Interns at CodeRabbit take on real projects - not mock work.
Collaborative & Innovative Environment: Join a tight-knit team of builders who care deeply about the craft.
Professional Growth: Gain exposure to thoughtful technical mentorship and a fast-moving, high-leverage team.
Competitive Compensation: Strong internship pay + potential return offer consideration
Hybrid Work Culture: Join us in-person in the Bay Area 3x weekly
Our Values
Collaborative Humans: Prioritizing collective intelligence
Fearless Innovators: Turning obstacles into growth opportunities
Persistent, Passionate Developers: Thriving on complex, long-term challenges
Impact-Driven Creators: Crafting intuitive tools for developers
Rapid Learners and Un-learners: Adapting quickly in our fast-paced technological world

Job Responsibilities:

Responsibilities

Design and implement high-leverage features that improve CodeRabbit's product and feedback loops
Own scoped projects end-to-end: from technical design to release
Collaborate with engineers and PMs on tooling, product flows, and internal infrastructure
Participate in code reviews and technical discussions with a senior engineering team
Bring product awareness and clear thinking to early-stage concepts and experimental work

Required Skills:

Qualifications

Currently a top student in 3rd or 4th year of an Honors Computer Science or Software Engineering degree (or related)
2 previous internships, ideally with backend or full-stack experience
Strong knowledge of software fundamentals (data structures, APIs, web systems)
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
A product mindset - you think critically about the user experience and implementation tradeoffs
Ability to independently navigate ambiguity, propose solutions, and iterate quickly
Bonus Points
Experience building production software using TypeScript / Node.js (or comparable stack)
You've contributed to open source software
You've built developer tooling or productivity infrastructure
You're familiar with Redis, GCP, or cloud-native architectures
You've shipped a side project, dev tool, or browser extension you're proud of

Transportation and Housing:

Finding housing is handled by yourself - I would suggest looking at Trulia or Craigslist, and then you can research online or ask for opinions related to neighborhood. San Francisco neighborhoods vary a lot, so make sure to do research and ask questions if you need to.

Transportation to/from the SF office will depend on your location. The BART train system is useful for getting to/from San Francisco. Other than that, it is your responsibility to find your way to the office at least 3x a week.

Compensation and Benefits:

- $45 - $60 USD/hr full-time compensation
- $500/month stipend for housing
- Airfare to/from Toronto area

We design, engineer, and manufacturer commercial & industrial (C&I) battery energy storage systems at our facility in Cambridge, Ontario. The student is expected to be onsite typically 4 days/week. Occasional work from home is supported, but we expect the student will get the most out of the experience from being onsite.

4 month work term

Special Job Requirements:

This job is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP) or Canada Summer Jobs. These programs require that candidates be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

Job Summary:

We are Generac, a leading energy technology company committed to powering a smarter world.

Over the 60 plus years of Generac's history, we've been dedicated to energy innovation. From creating the home standby generator market category, to our current evolution into an energy technology solutions company, we continue to push new boundaries.

At Generac, our people help make the world safer, brighter, and more productive. We are united by our efforts to inspire change for a better world; impact our people and community; influence and achieve positive results; and innovate the industry. Our shared goals allow people with diverse backgrounds and points of view to work together, bringing our global customers peace of mind through reliable products and exceptional support.

The Electrical Engineering Assistant - Energy Storage is responsible for integrating components and controls to drive commercial & industrial (C&I) energy storage system design. This role provides electrical system engineering expertise to battery energy storage systems (BESS) product development projects by interfacing with the cross functional team including Engineering, Product Management, Manufacturing and Sourcing.

Job Responsibilities:

Design, validate, and contribute to new energy storage system product design and development through electrical component integration and system operation
Apply power and control integration knowledge to create design documentation
Create high level electrical drawings and model designs, then collaborate with others to complete detailed drawings utilizing CAD (Computer Aided Design) such as AutoCAD or Creo
Contribute to design reviews
Evaluate BESS design overall effectiveness, including cost/benefit analysis, reliability/risk analysis, and functional safety
Define system test plans
Operate units onsite via our microgrid test center, to test & validate units prior to shipment
Translates technical information to varied audiences through written communication and presentation skills

Required Skills:

Product design experience in electrical systems integration and manufacturing support
Hands on involvement with troubleshooting, testing, and validating AC/DC electrical systems
Experience with CAD software
Passion for cleantech, battery energy storage, microgrids, distributed energy resources
Experience with controls and control panels is an asset - ability to integrate system controls using Modbus (TCP/IP or RTU), CAN bus, or other communication protocols to varied PLC platforms
Strong conceptualization, visualization, and creativity
Effective time management with prioritization

Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 - 50 pounds. Specific conditions of this job are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision and ability to adjust focus.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Compensation and Benefits:

$30-33/hr, depending on previous experience and work term

Final compensation for this role will be determined by various factors such as a candidate's relevant work experience, skills, certifications, and geographic location.

The University of Waterloo has compiled guidance and frequently asked questions for co-op students planning to work in the U.S. Please review this important information before deciding to apply for a U.S. work term.

For specific information on the USA visa process that affects co-op employment, refer to our USA Work Permit/J-1 Visa webpage (opens in a new window).

Job Summary:

Crater is a next generation email client that predicts the emails you want to read, and the actions you want to take before you think to do them.

We strongly believe that the most durable, interesting problems to work on, are those that convert "user preference feedback-loops" into action. We also believe that email, as a source of context for billions remains an underrated place to build product.

We're hiring our founding team, with specific emphasis on research engineers who will be directly responsible for our intuitive inbox recommendation algorithm, improving loops round retrieval/hybrid search. Backgrounds in tooling, eval-driven development, or product are highly favored, but nothing is a must.

Eventually, we hope to use the ranking of emails as proxy for understanding the pieces of work people care about, and have our client become an interface for managing "agents" that passively improving parts of your life. If you're specifically interested in workin on this project, email directly w/ reference in the subject line.

If you share this belief, whether as an early engineer or simply interested in learning more, don't hesitate to reach out at hello@crater.so.

Job Responsibilities:

You'll work on a team of less than 8 to build, improve and productionize either 1) "intuitive inbox", our ranking algorithm for email, or 2) a central rlhf loop on hybrid search. Expect lots of eval-driven development, experimentation, and testing in prod.

We are an engineering-first org, with no non-technical roles or managers.

Required Skills:

All we ask is that candidates have a track record of building and shipping great products. Whether you're working on research, infra, or client, we ask decisions to be made with users in mind.

We're a small, talent-dense, lean team. All of our engineering hours are on recommendations, search, and product. Flat org, with lots of ownership and autonomy. Apply if you want to solve hard problems and see your solutions put into production.

Transportation and Housing:

North Beach office, housing, transportation and meals covered, with $1500 housing stipend for short-term rentals within walking distance of office.

Compensation and Benefits:

$120-150k annualized/cash compensation (scaled for 4 month term).
North Beach office, housing, transportation and meals covered, with $1500 housing stipend for short-term rentals within walking distance of office.

JOB LOCATIONS
Kids Great Minds works in partnership with municipalities all across the GTA to provide computer courses in local libraries and community centres. You will be assigned teaching locations based on where you live, whenever possible. In June you will be working in a hybrid format (with some teaching in the locations outlined below). In July and August you will be working on-site from Monday to Friday.
We teach courses throughout York, North Peel, Durham and Simcoe regions. We are looking to hire a few candidates in each region specifically 1) York/Simcoe (Markham, Richmond Hill, Vaughan, Barrie, Aurora, Newmarket, Georgina, East Gwillimbury) and 2) Durham (Ajax, Whitby, Scugog).

Work in Multiple Regions.

This job is funded by either Canada Summer Jobs or the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP). The SWPP program requires that candidates be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

ACCESS TO A VEHICLE IS A MUST to transport equipment during the summer period.

Job Summary:

JOB DESCRIPTION DETAILS
Kids Great Minds (KGM) provides fun computer education for the next generation. We offer a unique learning experience that is non-traditional and built specifically for children, teens and their learning styles.

KGM co-op students have a unique blend of professionalism and experience with programming languages and/or children. Our co-op students will work closely with supervisors, lead teachers, and other KGM/camp staff to ensure a safe and rewarding experience for all participants. Finally, our co-op students are flexible, patient, energetic, and ready to have fun!
WHERE WE TEACH
At this time, we have courses and camps scheduled for in person, from June-August. Kids Great Minds brings computer education camps to our municipal partners all over the GTA. Classes are taught in community centers, libraries and schools around the York, Durham, and Simcoe regions. Where you teach will be based upon where you live.

Job Responsibilities:

CORE INSTRUCTIONAL & SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
Work directly with the KGM supervisors, instructors and children.
The first portion of the co-op, you will aid in curriculum development (where applicable), and facilitation of program manuals.
Utilize the curriculum and resources provided by KGM, ensuring a fun, organized, and rewarding experience for all students.
Aid students in groups or one-on-one with any questions they may have in a camp setting (July and August).
Take part in staff meetings (online or in person), to occur before and/or after camp/program on a designated day.
Take part in team building activities.
May be asked to lead games and activities during camp break times.
Engage with students during breaks and lunch to ensure they are safe and having fun (for camps).
Assist with classroom setup and turnover.

Required Skills:

QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge in some computer software is necessary, the ideal candidate for this job will have basic knowledge and/or the ability to quickly learn new software, hardware or languages in one or more of the following categories: robotics, game design and development, 3D modeling & design, animation, programming, app development and virtual reality. Experience with children or a camp setting is a bonus but not a must.
IMPORTANT NOTES:
KGM will provide intensive training prior to start of teaching.
PRE CAMP TRAINING & CERTIFICATION
Obtain Standard First Aid & CPR-C Certification at least seven-fourteen days prior to start of camp.
Complete a Vulnerable Sector Screening (VSS) seven-fourteen days prior to start of camp.
Complete all online and onsite trainings.
Complete all contracts, paperwork and hiring packets prior to start date.
HighFive Principals of Healthy Childhood Development Certificate (highly recommended).

Transportation and Housing:

ACCESS TO A VEHICLE IS A MUST to transport equipment during the summer period.
Complete a Vulnerable Sector Screening (VSS) seven-fourteen days prior to start of camp.

Additional Information:

Unrestricted Driver Licence
Own Transportation Required
Other	Vulnerable Sector Check

Compensation and Benefits:

COMPENSATION
KGM is committed to competitively compensating staff. Pay ranges are based on qualifications, experience, and topics being taught. If you are selected for the interview process we will provide pay rates/ranges at that time. Please note that KGM will follow the school's payment guidelines.

Between: $20 to $23, 38 paid hours a week

Job Summary:

Discipline: Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics or Computer Science

Student Level: Intermediate or Advanced Co-op student

Time Frame: Spring 2026 work term: May - August

Reports To: Director of Engineering

Organizational Profile: Arcturus Networks Inc. is a Canadian company that designs embedded hardware and software solutions for industrial and commercial markets. We combine open-source and proprietary technologies to create advanced products for real-world use. We focus on vision AI software for low-power edge devices, supporting applications in industrial inspection, safety, transportation, and security. Our customers are industrial developers, manufacturers, and OEMs who integrate our solutions into their own systems.

Role Profile: We are seeking highly skilled and motivated students to join us in building the future of vision AI. You'll work on advanced analytics, MLOps lifecycle tools, and edge AI fleet management software that power real-world applications in safety, security, and automation. Our team has developed a novel embedded edge AI architecture and smart camera stack optimized for low-power edge processors - and now we're taking it further.

As a co-op student, you'll play an active role in this work, applying machine vision, machine learning, and embedded systems to real-world challenges. This is a hands-on opportunity to contribute directly to cutting-edge projects, gain valuable experience with next-generation technologies, and learn from experienced engineers, while helping to shape the future of AI-powered systems.

What will this job do for you? This coop internship will give you all the experience and knowledge necessary to call yourself an MLOps engineer. An MLOps engineer has a deep understanding of both the Machine Learning and Software Engineering domains, as well as experience working with cloud infrastructure, containerization technologies, and data processing frameworks. Add to that the exposure you'll gain to embedded AI.
We don't require you to be an expert in this field. We will make you an expert, if you are ready to be challenged and committed to doing your best during this internship.

Please visit our website www.arcturusnetworks.com to learn more about our company.

Job Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product management, software engineers, and business stakeholders, to identify machine learning model requirements
Develop, maintain and refine machine learning models using various Machine Vision algorithms and techniques
Develop, adapt, port and integrate Machine Vision applications onto Edge AI embedded microprocessors powered with various types of AI/ML accelerators
Train and validate machine learning models using datasets of all types and sizes, and optimize their performance by augmenting the datasets and retraining to improve their accuracy and effectiveness
Champion MLOps initiatives across the company. Research, design and implement best practices to develop MLOps processes and infrastructure
Develop and maintain data pipelines and infrastructure to support deployment of models in production environments.
Develop runtime metrics that can be used to identify model performance effectiveness and degradation over time
Continuously monitor and refine machine learning models to ensure that they remain accurate and effective over time and create methods to redeploy with improvements in production environments
Stay up-to-date with the latest Machine Learning and MLOps techniques and technologies and apply them to improve the production applications

Required Skills:

Key Requirements:

Ability to learn and adapt to new technologies quickly is essential for success in this job
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, GO, C and C++
Multi-threaded and distributed software applications experience
System-level software development experience under Open Source systems and Linux environments
Advanced experience using Docker, Kubernetes and related containerization and orchestration technologies
Familiarity with microservices architectures
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
Strong interest in becoming an MLOps expert
Familiarity with data processing, experimentation and model deployment frameworks such as MLflow
Experience working with embedded microprocessor hardware modules
Wide experience working with databases and data models
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
The candidate should have completed a minimum of two years towards a B Sc. degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Software Engineering

Compensation and Benefits:

We offer competitive compensation based on work term number. Please ask during interview and we will provide specific salary information.

The internship will be located at INITs headquarter in Karlsruhe, Germany. The work will be closely linked to Grand River Transit (GRT) in the Region of Waterloo. The internship will be split between GRT (1 week) and INIT (15 weeks).

Students must ensure they are eligible to obtain a work permit/visa for Germany. Canadian Citizens have had success using International Experience Canada visa for Germany: Work and travel in Germany: International Experience Canada - Canada.ca

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Special Job Requirements:

This position is located outside of Canada. It is the student's responsibility to ensure they are eligible to work in the destination country, and that they have/obtain the necessary documentation required to participate in this co-op work term. The University may provide procedural guidance and a Letter of Support to support a student's application for this documentation, but cannot provide specific immigration advice or arrange for this documentation on a student's behalf. Ensure you have read and understood the eligibility requirements outlined here: https://uwaterloo.ca/co-operative-education/work-abroad/before-you-go/co-op-requirements/

If you are matched to a job outside of Canada, you may apply for international travel awards/scholarships via SAFA. Please see more information at https://uwaterloo.ca/student-awards-financial-aid/undergraduate-awards/international-experience-awards

Job Summary:

INIT is the worldwide leading supplier of integrated planning, dispatching, telematics, and ticketing systems in public transport. For more than 40 years, INIT has been assisting transport companies in making public transport more attractive, faster and more efficient. With more than over 1400 customers worldwide, INIT provides integrated solutions from back office applications to equipment on stations and in vehicles to ticketing and booking apps for passengers.

The internship will focus on incident management in public transport operation control. The aim will be to work on a prototpye for automating incident management in cases of disruptions such as accidents, delays or weather events impacting public transport. The internship will be located at INITs headquarter in Karlsruhe, Germany. The work will be closely linked to Grand River Transit (GRT) in the Region of Waterloo. The internship will be split between GRT (1 week) and INIT (15 weeks).

Job Responsibilities:

Requirements analysis for automated dispatching and operation planning for Incident management in public transport operations control
Data analysis of operational public transport data and on how disruptions are currently handled
Conceptualization of a prototype application
Closely interacting with the development team and with public transport operator

Required Skills:

Technical field of study such as Computer Science, Engineering, Planning or other related discipline
Ability to structure complex problems, creating specific outcomes and requirements, based on technical principles
Basic knowledge in SQL, Python and/or R preferred
Interest in public transit operations and systems
Enjoy working in an international setting with multiple stakeholder and project partners
Proactive and independent working style as well as ability to work in a team

Transportation and Housing:

INIT will cover housing costs in Karlsruhe

Compensation and Benefits:

Monthly salary of 1000 € for the internship plus housing costs in company own apartments will be provided
If you are matched to a job outside of Canada, you may apply for international travel awards/scholarships via SAFA. Please see more information at https://uwaterloo.ca/student-awards-financial-aid/undergraduate-awards/international-experience-awards

Job Summary:

Snowflake started with a clear vision: develop a cloud data platform that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Snowflake developed an innovative new product with a built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. We are now a global, world-class organization with offices in more than a dozen countries and serving many more.

We're looking for dedicated students who share our passion for ground-breaking technology and want to create a lasting future for you and Snowflake.

What We Offer:

Paid, full-time internships in the heart of the software industry
Post-internship career opportunities (full-time and/or additional internships)
Exposure to a fast-paced, fun and inclusive culture
A chance to work with world-class experts on challenging projects
Opportunity to provide meaningful contributions to a real system used by customers
High level of access to supervisors (manager and mentor), detailed direction without micromanagement, feedback throughout your internship, and a final evaluation
Stuff that matters: treated as a member of the Snowflake team, included in company meetings/activities, flexible hours, casual dress code, accommodations to work from home, swag and much more
When return to office in effect, catered lunches, access to gaming consoles, recreational games, happy hours, company outings, and more

How to build enterprise grade, reliable, and trustworthy software/services
Exposure to SQL or other database technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop)
Understanding of database internals, large-scale data processing, transaction processing, distributed systems, and data warehouse design
Implementation, testing of features in query compilation, compiler design, query execution
Experience working with cloud infrastructure, AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud in particular
Learning about cutting edge database technology and research
Possible Teams/Work Focus Areas:
Various areas of our Product Platform (Billing & Monetization, Application Collaboration Frameworks, Database Security, Privacy, and Governance, etc..), our Data Platform (Data Pipelines & Streaming, Metadata, Storage & Data Lake, etc..), and our Service Runtime (Inc'l Snowpark & SnowPandas, Container Services, etc..)
High performance large-scale data processing
Large-scale distributed systems
Software-as-a-Service platform
Software frameworks for stability and performance testing
Snowflake is growing fast, and we're scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

How do you want to make your impact?

What We Expect:

Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college/university program during the time of the internship

Job Summary:

Mission

At Liftoff, we're reimagining the way people stick to fitness. Our mobile app turns working out into a gamified experience, ranking user lifts like a video game and visualizing progress through interactive features such as levels, streaks, quests, and an in-app shop.
We're a fast-moving software startup backed by real traction and involved users, growing a community of over 1 million users across the globe with 4.9 App Store rating. Our decisions are metrics-driven and supplemented by community feedback, allowing us to double down on what works. If the idea of shaping the future of fitness while shipping fast and learning even faster excites you, keep reading.

Work hours
35h/week

Work term
12 weeks

Job Responsibilities:

At Liftoff, you will:

Design mobile and web screens with strong UX and aesthetic clarity using Figma
Implement your designs directly into products using React, React Native, Tailwind CSS, and Skia
Bring interactions to life with Rive, Reanimated, Lottie animations and After Effects
Build reusable, responsive components that look great across different screen sizes and platforms
Collaborate closely with founders, engineers, and the marketing team to ship features that are viral by design
Create graphics for in-app features, landing pages, and social media (when needed)
Help expand and maintain our design system to keep the visual language consistent, and scalable

Required Skills:

You'll be a great fit if you:

Have experience building apps using React, Next.js, React Native, Expo, Tailwind CSS

At Liftoff, we're reimagining the way people stick to fitness. Our mobile app turns working out into a gamified experience, ranking user lifts like a video game and visualizing progress through interactive features such as levels, streaks, quests, and an in-app shop.
We're a fast-moving software startup backed by real traction and involved users, growing a community of over 1 million users across the globe with a 4.9 App Store rating. If the idea of shaping the future of fitness while shipping fast and learning even faster excites you, keep reading.

Job Summary:

What We're Tackling
Rundoo's mission is to build cutting-edge software that helps building materials suppliers enhance their businesses. Think of your local hardware store or mom and pop shop-these are our clients who we partner with across the U.S. (& Canada in due time). From paint to hardware to flooring, stores across these industries sell over $1T of building materials annually using outdated, on-prem systems. We're aiming to change that by being the first in the industry to empower independent supply stores with best-in-class technology.

Compensation & Benefits
$2300/week USD & benefits (see more below)

How We've Fundraised
We've raised $18m across three rounds:

$2m pre-seed led by Kent Bennett (Bessemer) + participation from Plug & Play, Quiet Capital, Sequoia.
$5m seed led by Caitlin Bolnick Rellas (CRV).
$11m Series A led again by Bessemer and CRV.
Why Waterloo is our primary engineering hiring channel
At Rundoo, hiring Waterloo students for co-ops who come back full-time after graduation is our primary new grad hiring strategy. Waterloo's unique blend of rigorous academics and meaningful co-op experience produces engineers who have immediate impact and grow quickly.

We've seen Waterloo grads thrive on our team-taking on ownership early, delivering impactful work, and growing into leaders. That's why we're committed to hiring more and more Waterloo co-ops each term and building our engineering team around you.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Achieve with Us: Real Software Engineering Work
This isn't about internal tools or intern projects that never see the light of day-you'll be building core systems and shipping real product every day!

API Design & Development - Build and maintain scalable APIs in Go (Golang).
Database Optimization - Tune queries in Postgres & our in-memory search DB for speed and scalability.
Feature Development - Design, implement, and test new features that matter to customers.
Frontend Engineering - Contribute reusable React components and modern front-end architecture.

Required Skills:

Hard requirements

You've completed 4 or 5 co-ops with primarily EXCELLENT and OUTSTANDING evaluations.
You're a self-directed top performer motivated by working hard with other top performers.
You give in-the-moment feedback to your teammates and enjoy receiving the same.
You'd be excited to return for future co-ops (if applicable) and full-time if we both enjoy working together.
Nice to have
You are proficient in technologies that overlap with our stack (Go/Postgres backend, TypeScript/React/React Native frontend).

Transportation and Housing:

Transportation & Housing

Our office is located in Redwood City, CA, an 8-minute walk from Caltrain.
Dog-friendly office!
There are plenty of housing options available nearby.
We'll cover your flight from Canada to the U.S., including up to 2 pieces of luggage.
We'll also handle your J-1 Visa sponsorship.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation & Benefits

Salary: $2,300/week USD
Health: $100/month gym stipend
Meals: Free daily in-office lunch (~$1,000/3months)
Learning: Book/course stipend, Libro.fm audiobooks, Coursera access
Culture: Fast-paced, collaborative, product-focused

What We Stand For
Our values:
(R)elentless: When we believe a challenge is worth pursuing, we don't quit unless our underlying conviction changes.

Job Summary:

About Capital One Canada

For over 20 years, we've been on a mission to change banking for good and build relationships by making credit accessible, simple, intuitive and rewarding. We want to help Canadians succeed with credit, because we believe in people - in our customers, in our associates, and in talent like you!

About the Team

Join the fast-growing Capital One Travel team, as we seek to transform the way customers book travel. Capital One Travel is a fast-moving, highly innovative business within Capital One's Digital Commerce & Innovation organization. We aim to grow an industry leading travel booking platform that customers love and that delivers unique, differentiated benefits to our millions of customers while also powering the headline marketable benefits of our credit card products. As a Mobile Software Engineer in Capital One Travel, you'll have the opportunity to be on the forefront of driving a major transformation within Capital One.

Job Responsibilities:

About the Role

Our iOS and Android platforms at Capital One are recognized as an opportunity to reach our customers in unique, personal and engaging ways. In this role you'll be joining a team based in our Toronto office that is building native iOS and Android features using Swift, SwiftUI, Kotlin and JetPack Compose to support Capital One Travel customers in all aspects of their journey - from inspiration to booking to the in-transit experience and beyond.
Our engineers are provided with top of the line Macbook Pros, high-end monitors, and the necessary tooling to develop the best possible products with the least amount of friction.

IDE: XCode, Android Studio
Language: Swift. SwiftUI, Kotlin, Jetpack Compose
Monitoring Tools: NewRelic, Splunk
CI/CD: Jenkins, OnePipeline (Capital One's innersourced CICD pipeline)

Your Responsibilities:
Work as part of a dynamic team throughout the software development life cycle
Develop code to meet story acceptance criteria
Conduct design and code reviews to ensure high-level quality output
Ensure adherence to continuous improvement practices as required to meet quality, and time to market imperatives
Participate in Agile ceremonies, design and brainstorming sessions
Collaborate with Product and Design partners to implement enhancements or new applications
Learn and build iOS/Android features on the job
Have fun with the team!

Required Skills:

Basic Qualifications:

Will obtain a Bachelor's degree or higher from August 2026 or later
Familiarity with iOS or Android application development, specifically with Swift or Kotlin
Good communication, presentation, and writing skills
Good understanding of testing fundamentals
Able to work within a team setting and actively participate and collaborate in team discussions
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with SwiftUI or JetPack Compose
Experience with version control technology i.e. Git

Compensation and Benefits:

$23 to $43 per hour

Please read our Privacy Statement.

Enjoy a hybrid work environment, with 3 days in the office. Build a comfortable workspace with our one-time, Work From Home allowance and enjoy our head office located conveniently across the street from Union Station.

Acquisitions Decisioning team owns the Canadian Pre-approval application Quick Check through which customers can check which card they will be 100% approved for and the Dynamic App through which the customers can apply for a specific credit card. The team is currently on a journey to create a streamlined and cohesive end to end customer shopping experience through advanced technology investments for its pre-approval and decisioning capabilities which will provide the customers a better experience while searching and applying for a credit card without impacting their credit history. You will be involved in building infrastructure, feature development, testing (unit test, component test and integration test), deployment, monitoring and fixing cyber security and vulnerability fixes.

Job Summary:

The Financial Risk Analyst (FRA) will be responsible for tasks and projects undertaken within the Risk Management Division ("Risk Operations Team" or "Data Analytics & Enterprise Risk Management Team"). The project(s) will be tailored to the FRA's background and technical experience. The FRA will also undertake some of the team's daily reporting requirements.

Career Development and Training:
The FRA will gain experience and background in the valuation of fixed income instruments and related investment products, including options, swaps, bonds, money market instruments, and others. The intern will receive hands-on experience with financial risk management and elements of portfolio performance measurement, and experience in enterprise risk management. Through technical research project/projects, the FRA will learn cutting edge ideas in modern finance, may gain hands-on experience with statistical methods and financial engineering, and have an opportunity to present their findings to an audience of peers. Through interaction with other OFA staff, the FRA will have opportunities to learn other aspects of capital market activities and financial reporting. Most importantly, the FRA will learn how to perform in a professional environment.

Job Responsibilities:

The FRA will work on different projects spearheaded by the Risk Management Division (RMD) at the OFA, under the supervision of their manager and other senior staff members. Some of the anticipated projects may include: dashboard reporting, portfolio composition/benchmarking, fixed income maturities analysis, and data modelling and analysis, data validation, financial engineering, enterprise risk management. The FRA will also work with other team members to learn about their reporting procedures and documentation and improve upon them where appropriate.

Finally, the FRA will be trained and be responsible for running and distributing operational reports (daily/weekly/monthly) produced by the RMD teams, some on a rotational basis. The FRA will also be responsible for checking data inputs and other elements of monthly reports produced by other staff. Once trained, the FRA will be expected to work on these reports independently. The FRA may also have the opportunity to produce some monthly reports under the supervision of a senior staff member.

Required Skills:

Strong quantitative skills, primarily math/statistics. Excellent data analysis skills. Microsoft Office, primarily Word/Excel and MS Access, Power BI. Strong technical and programming skills including: Python, VBA, and SQL. Ability to summarize detailed information and analysis. Excellent written and spoken English language skills. Ability to carry out multiple assignments within tight time frames. Knowledge of finance and financial instruments, and understanding of domestic and international capital markets is a plus.

Transportation and Housing:

The analyst MUST reside in Ontario.

Compensation and Benefits:

The salary range for the position is $656.97 - $875.96 per week, dependent upon work experience.

Job Summary:

The Software Developer (Co-op) will work alongside experienced engineers to design, build, and deploy scalable backend services and data-driven front-end applications. Our tech stack is centered around modern development practices using Python with FastAPI for APIs, PostgreSQL and MongoDB for persistence, Redis for caching, and RabbitMQ for asynchronous messaging. The role includes contributing to development pipelines, writing automated tests, and supporting the continuous integration and delivery of cloud-native services.

This opportunity is ideal for students looking to strengthen their skills in modern backend development, distributed systems, and DevOps workflows. You'll gain hands-on experience with tools such as Docker, GitHub Actions, Cypress, Selenium, and Jenkins, and get exposure to frontend frameworks like Flutter for full stack understanding.

Support and optimize production services by identifying performance bottlenecks, resolving issues quickly, and contributing to overall platform stability and resilience.
Design and implement automated test suites using tools like Pytest, Postman, and Cypress to ensure system integrity and accelerate deployment cycles.

Analyze test results, identify defects, and work closely with the development team to resolve issues before they reach production.

Familiarity with RESTful API design, asynchronous programming, and message queues (e.g., RabbitMQ)

For over 20 years, we've been on a mission to change banking for good and build relationships by making credit accessible, simple, intuitive and rewarding. We want to help Canadians succeed with credit, because we believe in people - in our customers, in our associates, and in talent like you!

About the Team

Capital One is more than you think. We're a data-driven tech company that just happens to do credit cards. We focus on customer-first solutions, and we're united with this common goal. We have all the advantages of a startup, with the resources of a big company. Working here means you're curious, innovative spirit will be encouraged as you push boundaries and try new things, while your career is nurtured and supported. Previous intern experience

Job Summary:

Background

At Yuzu, we're building the next-generation health insurance company. We are NOT building a digital brokerage or an AI wrapper - we are going deeper to build the foundational infrastructure required to power tomorrow's health plans. We believe that software can unlock the ability to build health insurance that is affordable, adaptable, and scalable. Yuzu's platform will be core to this future.
So how does this actually work? Over 70% of employer-sponsored health plans are self-funded, meaning the employer acts as the insurer and directly covers employees' healthcare costs. This allows companies to customize benefits, gain flexibility, and save money. Self-funded employers partner with a Third-Party Administrator (TPA) to handle the behind-the-scenes plan administration, like processing claims and managing benefits.
The TPA industry is a $500bn sleeper industry that has historically been seen as a services business, bogged down by manual processes and legacy systems (for context, our team couldn't even access these on our Macs).
Yuzu is a vertically integrated & tech-enabled TPA, currently servicing thousands of employees. We differentiate by helping innovative health plans come to life by facilitating new ways to pay for and access healthcare covered by insurance. Yuzu's goal is to make it as easy for any business to create and manage a custom health plan as it is to create a storefront on Shopify.
We're backed by top VC firms and 10+ unicorn founders, including leaders at Stripe, OpenAI, Brex, Deel, Mercury, and Notion, and we're building a formidable team to tackle the massive opportunity ahead.
Our Commitment to You
You will have significant ownership. Both equity and autonomy.
We will invest in your learning and forgive your mistakes along the way.
We will trust you and tell you everything you want to know about the business.

Job Responsibilities:

Role

As an early-stage startup, Yuzu's top priority is to ship software fast. We believe that the best way to ship code fast is to invest in clean code, strong CI/CD automation, and a delightful developer experience.
Write in Typescript using modern frameworks like SvelteKit and Nestjs
Write all of our infrastructure as code, improving security, modularity, and readability
Build on top of best-in-class healthcare APIs including Stedi and Flexpa to handle the intricacies of healthcare-specific data structures.
Have a clean and new codebase, with little-to-no tech-debt or internal tools with steep learning curves
As an early employee you will
Contribute across the entire codebase
Set a large part of Yuzu's company culture
Direct the focus of our product from an engineering perspective

Required Skills:

Qualifications

Experience building successful software projects, ideally independently or as a part of a small team or early-stage startup
In-person 5 days/week in Flatiron NYC office required
Self-directed, curious, fast-paced personality with strong communication skills
Nice to Haves
Experience with Typescript, CDK, and/or AWS
Experience in healthcare or fintech infrastructure

Compensation and Benefits:

$140k to $260k annual salary, plus a meaningful equity component commensurate with the level of role at a Series A company in NY/SF.

Job Summary:

Great Circle Solar Management Corporation manages one of the largest portfolios of operating solar assets in North America, with over $3 billion under management. Our Operations team ensures these projects perform efficiently, reliably, and sustainably.

We are seeking an Electrical Engineering Co-op student to support the design, and production of our solar projects. This role is ideal for students with strong CAD skills who want to gain hands-on engineering experience in a professional environment.

Job Responsibilities:

Develop and optimize electrical system designs for solar installations using CAD tools, including single-line diagrams, string layouts, and cable sizing.
Produce technical drawings and engineering documentation such as wiring diagrams, bill of materials, and equipment schedules.
Perform detailed electrical analysis of various solar sites using eTAP software.
Collaborate with the operations and engineering teams to support project development, and day-to-day engineering tasks for solar projects.
Participate in field visits to solar farms to support commissioning, performance verification, and maintenance activities.
Carry out additional tasks as required to support electrical engineering, and field operations for solar energy projects.

Required Skills:

Required Skills:

Self-driven engineer with a strong work ethic and a proactive approach to solving design and field-related challenges in solar PV projects.
Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills, with careful attention to detail in electrical layouts, calculations, and documentation.

Project management skills with the ability to manage tasks and deadlines effectively
Preferred Skills:

Familiarity with eTAP software.

Job Summary:

Adaptron Inc. is researching, designing and developing leading edge general-purpose robotic control software using unique artificial intelligence algorithms. We are working with a world and robot simulation application which communicates with the AI application for perception, action control and reasoning. Both applications are written in Python.

This is an opportunity for you to apply your knowledge, skills, and ideas in the fields of software development, cognitive science and artificial general intelligence (AGI).

We are looking for practical, analytical and organized individuals who can think outside the box, express their ideas verbally and visually and efficiently manage their work and time.

This job requires your onsite presence in Ottawa to work in the team of four.

For further information about the company, visit our website at: www.adaptroninc.com

Job Responsibilities:

The job includes:

Learning about and understanding how humans behave and think by researching subjects such as cognitive science, psychophysics and motor and process control,
Iteratively inventing mechanistic, functional, and deterministic theories and models of artificial general intelligence,
Analysing, designing, programming and testing software that proves these models and duplicates intelligent behaviour, and
Helping to deliver these software solutions to customers for integration into their products.

Required Skills:

An understanding of cognitive science or psychology,
Experience designing and developing software in Python,
An ability to communicate well in English.
Canadian citizen or resident
Desirable requirements:
Some education in the fields of cognitive science, psychology, artificial intelligence, or neuroscience,
Optional requirements:
Experience with robotics

Please note that as a federal government department, students who work with us on an approved co-op/intern or FSWEP program are eligible to be offered a temporary or permanent position within 18 months of graduation.

Hiring Preference given to Canadian Citizens and Permanent Residents. Security Clearance required. Fingerprinting is required.

Students are responsible for ensuring they are eligible for an 8-month work term before applying. Please discuss your work/study sequence flexibility with your academic advisor as soon as possible.

Job Summary:

Defence Research and Development Canada (DRDC) is the research arm of the Department of National Defence (DND). We perform strategic science research and technology development, and provide advice and technical solutions to the Canadian Armed Forces, as well as the public safety and national security communities. DRDC - Toronto Research Centre is a centre of excellence for intelligence, influence, and collaboration; human effectiveness; operational health and performance. One of our strengths is our broad-based and multidisciplinary approach to research. Located adjacent to the Sheppard West Subway Station in Toronto, we are easily reached by car or TTC.

We are looking for an industrious student with interest in biomedical research and development to join our team for a 4-month term starting in May 2026, with a possible extension for another term. Reliability security clearance is required. Preference will be given to Canadian citizens before non-Canadian citizens - any qualified Canadian citizen will be made an offer before any non-Canadian citizen. We prefer those who meet the qualifications of relevant courses and experience as well as excellent academic achievement. We are an equal opportunity employer and promote a harassment/smoke free working environment. For examples of recent research and development activities conducted at the Centre, see our web page at http://www.drdc-rddc.gc.ca. Twitter: @DRDC_RDDC.

Job Responsibilities:

The student will be primarily working on the data science aspects of a larger project investigating combat casualty care and medical interventions.

Working with a team of defense scientists and hospital/academic collaborators in the fields of transfusion medicine, trauma care and AI data science, the student will be involved in AI algorithm implementation and predictive model development for personalized transfusion for trauma care, using simulated and/or real clinical data. Furthermore, participation in data engineering, data visualization framework development and deployment are also expected. Additionally, the project may also include Python-based web application development for interactive data inspection, AI model training, deployment, inference and report generation.

The student will prepare written progress reports, give presentations and pipeline demonstration for project meetings.

Required Skills:

Knowledge and skills in AI data science, computer programming, biomedical sciences and technologies are required. Familiarity with Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLM) is valued. Experience in Python-based web application development and distribution, mathematical modeling, processing and analyzing biological samples (e.g., human blood, plasma) is an asset.

Essential skills
(AI data science skills)
- Knowledge in data engineering and manipulation with Excel, R, Python and shell languages
- Knowledge in supervised, unsupervised and semi-supervised machine learning principles
- Knowledge in Python for data science, including (but not limited to): Python data and collection types, pandas, numpy, tensorflow/pytorch, scikit-learn
- Knowledge in Python visualization using libraries such as Matplotlib and Seaborn

(Computer science skills)
- Experience in Unix/Linux environment
- Experience in version control and coding collaboration with Git

(General professional skills)
- Strong time and schedule management skills
- Strong ability to work either independently or in a team setting

Asset skills
- Knowledge in statistics and mathematical modelling, such as parametric and non-parametric tests (t-test, ANOVA, ANCOVA), regression modelling
- Knowledge in Python/R statistical programming language
- Experience in Python web application frameworks: Django, Flask
- Knowledge in NLP and LLM

Transportation and Housing:

•DRDC - Toronto Research Centre has free parking available and is also located adjacent to the Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) Sheppard West station subway line.
•The student is responsible for transportation and housing. The student is also responsible for access to high-speed internet if required to work from home during the work term.

Additional Information:

Security Clearance Required
Hiring Preference - Canadian


Compensation and Benefits:

Government of Canada - terms and conditions of employment for students: https://www.tbs-sct.gc.ca/pol/doc-eng.aspx?id=12583.

Rates of pay for post-secondary school students are determined by the directive specified in https://www.tbs-sct.gc.ca/psm-fpfm/pay-remuneration/rates-taux/student-etudiants-eng.asp.

Job Summary:

Verily's co-op position is a paid opportunity for students in a cooperative education program who are interested in working at the intersection of technology, data science and healthcare.

Verily is a subsidiary of Alphabet that is using a data-driven approach to change the way people manage their health and the way healthcare is delivered. Launched from Google X in 2015, our purpose is to bring the promise of precision health to everyone, every day. We are focused on generating and activating data from a variety of sources, including clinical, social, behavioral and the real world, to arrive at the best solutions for a person based on a comprehensive view of the evidence. Our unique expertise and capabilities in technology, data science and healthcare enable the entire healthcare ecosystem to drive better health outcomes.

Check us out at verily.com!
You can also learn more about our most recent external engagements.

Verily Canada operates from offices in Kitchener-Waterloo and Toronto, and is home to many full-stack software projects. Notable potential project areas relevant to this internship include:
- Precision Health Platform - a modular, composable, and interoperable platform for storage and processing of precision health data across Verily products.
- Verily Workbench - a scalable, secure research platform, jointly developed by the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, Microsoft, and Verily to help biomedical researchers accelerate scientific discoveries.

This role is hiring for the Kitchener-Waterloo office.
Applicants will be expected to work from the office at least 3 days per week (typically Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday).
Start and end dates to align with recommended UW dates(Monday May 11th - Friday August 21st, 2026), although could start earlier or end later upon request.

Job Responsibilities:

Work closely with the development team to design, develop, and deliver new software features across the Verily tech stack.
Come up with ideas to technical design problems, compare options, and propose solutions.
Develop using industry-standard tools including GitHub, Google Cloud, Golang, React, Docker, and Terraform to name a few.

Required Skills:

Minimum Qualifications

Expected graduation date in 2026 or 2027
Currently enrolled in university as a full-time student in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field.
Authorization to work in Canada.

Preferred Qualifications
Personal projects, volunteer projects, etc. in software development, above and beyond work experience.
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, Objective-C, Go, Python, or JavaScript.
Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively.
Previous exposure to healthcare or life sciences is a nice-to-have.

Additional Information:

Security Clearance Required


Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation Range: $40 - 43 CAD / hour

Benefits: Standard Verily employee benefits i.e. dental; medical; vision, etc.
