Work Term Duration:

Special Work Term Start/End Date Considerations:

TERM DATES:
The 4-month term starts on May 11th and ends on August 28th, 2026.

ORIENTATION:
Co-op students will be required to attend a TMMC Orientation session for the first 2 days of the work term (May 11th and 12th). Please note this is a required activity that all new co-op students must attend.

HOURS OF WORK:
40 hours per week with the ability and willingness to support overtime and weekend work required. An overtime rate is paid after 40 hours worked in a week.

Job Summary:

ABOUT US:
Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada (TMMC) is a world-class automotive manufacturer with three state-of-the-art facilities located right here in Cambridge and Woodstock, Ontario. As Canada's top-producing automotive manufacturer, we build the Toyota RAV4, Lexus RX and Lexus NX.

At TMMC, we're more than just a leading employer - we're a proud member of the community. Recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers and one of Canada's Greenest Employers, we strive to be a good corporate citizen. We're committed to sending zero waste to landfill every year and actively support local nonprofit organizations through philanthropic efforts.

Join a supportive team that values innovation, sustainability, and community leadership. Push boundaries and achieve more than you ever thought possible - right here at home.

TOYOTA BUSINESS PRACTICE:
The Toyota Business Practice problem-solving methodology is our unique way of approaching a challenge by finding the root cause. As a co-op student, you are trained on this problem-solving method, which can be applied, not only at work but also in our everyday life.

TOYOTA PRODUCTION SYSTEM:
The world-famous Toyota Production System, a philosophy of continuous improvement and on-going training, enables each co-op student to work towards their highest potential. The results of our company stem from hiring committed, self-motivated team members, with the ability to work together to achieve team goals.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:
Ownership: Take the lead on your term project and learn all about what is involved from start to finish.
Impact: Know your work is being implemented and will support the production of our quality vehicles.
Challenge: Break down a complex project and narrow in on a specific idea, becoming an expert.

PRODUCTION CONTROL - PACKAGING:
New Model Packaging Development:

Benchmark Toyota "best practice" packaging through systematic comparison and recommendation
Support packaging design, stakeholder review, approval management and production requirement procurement
Lead packaging review meetings with project management focus and KPI adherence
Daily Operations Management:
Monthly requirements calculation, order adjustment planning and production requirement procurement
Shortage investigations, abnormality management and root cause analysis & countermeasure
Engineering change analysis with packaging modification / production requirement procurement.

Job Responsibilities:

CO-OP ROLE:
The co-op student will provide an opportunity to understand Toyota's extensive supply chain network related to returnable packaging development, procurement and management. By working closely with our Daily Operations, New Model and Systems Support Analysts, project activity will focus on abnormality identification, root cause analysis, systematic improvements and the implementation of short/long term sustainable solutions.

CO-OP PROJECTS:
Support the Packaging team with systematic improvements to our current Packaging Systems:

Engineering Change Instruction (ECI): development of ECI control system for data collection, change management and stakeholder communication
Abnormality Claims: development of data collection method, benchmarking analysis, calculation of current condition and stakeholder communication
Daily Change Management Control: development of a daily change management system with linkage between multiple processes for real time analysis. reporting and stakeholder notification.
Focus on Project Management principles such as Project Scope and Timeline development, Standardized Work and Operational Flow creation, KPI management and status reporting.
Additional Projects / Assignments focused on abnormality identification, root cause analysis, countermeasure proposals and sustainable solutions.

Required Skills:

YOU ARE:

A critical thinker and motivated problem solver
Willing to learn with a positive attitude
Results-oriented and take ownership
A collaborative team member with strong interpersonal skills
Detail-oriented with solid organizational skills
Passionate about your field of study
A self-starter with the ability to work in a multi-disciplined environment with minimal supervision

Transportation and Housing:

TRANSPORTATION:
Possessing a valid driver's licence and having access to a vehicle is an advantage. TMMC is not located on a continuous public transit route. Applicants should have the ability and willingness to travel between TMMC's Cambridge and Woodstock locations.

Additional Information:

Unrestricted Driver Licence
Own Transportation Required


Compensation and Benefits:

COMPENSATION:
Pay rate will be confirmed during the interview process, range is $20.57-$31.26 per hour.

Job Summary:

Particle News (Mina Labs) is a venture-backed startup based in beautiful and sunny Larkspur, California. We've built a news app that reimagines daily news, and now we are building a new experience to help financial professionals make decisions. We're looking for a Software Engineering intern to join our backend infrastructure team.

You'll be joining a small, product-minded team with backgrounds from leading tech companies like Twitter, Tesla, Periscope, GitHub. We value clarity, curiosity, and speed in our work. This position reports directly to Particle's CEO (who is a UW alumni!)

Download Particle News from the App Store to take a look at what we've working on.

Job Responsibilities:

In this role, you will work directly with our CTO, other engineers, designers, and team members, to:

Expand Particle's data ingestion sources, pipelines, structures
Integrate with 3rd-party APIs and services
Implement features and APIs for the Particle service
Implement and improve AI prompts and agentic workflows
Be a critical member of the team contributing ideas on product, architecture, and direction

Required Skills:

Successful candidates will possess some or all of the following:

Backend Engineering: Experience building services using Go, Java, C, or Rust.
Data & Infrastructure: Understanding of relational databases (PostgreSQL/MySQL) and event-driven architectures (Kafka/PubSub/SQS).
DevOps (Bonus): Familiarity with modern deployment tools like Docker and Kubernetes.
AI/ML (Bonus): Interest or experience in Generative AI, including Prompt Engineering and RAG workflows.
Experience with Financial Markets (Bonus): Interest or experience with financial modeling, prediction markets, market microstructure, options
Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment
Self-starter who takes ownership and initiative in project areas

Transportation and Housing:

Our office is conveniently located within walking distance from the 101, the Richmond Bridge, the Larkspur SMART Train station, and the Larkspur Ferry Building. We are also walking distance from the lovely Marin Country Mart, an upscale shopping and dining destination. We will provide a relocation stipend. Some of our previous interns have lived Marin County, or in San Francisco and commuted via ferry. We also welcome remote candidates.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required


Compensation and Benefits:

Hourly Rate: $45 USD per hour
Flexible working hours

Job Summary:

Where Greatness Grows
The greatest achievements in history are borne from the greatness within people - where human potential meets vision, and passion fuels evolution. Unlocking this potential is the most important thing we do at Bird.
As a leader in Canadian construction for over 100 years, the impact of our team is etched deeply within the core of our legacy. Beyond Bird, this impact is felt in the fundamental aspects of our everyday lives. From the critical infrastructure we depend on, to the energy and resources that keep us moving - we are powering our communities and shaping Canada's skylines coast-to-coast. Entrenched in the foundation of a culture built more than a century ago is an enduring quest to reimagine what is possible. Our impact is greater than ever, and we are looking for those who seek to redefine their story.
We are a dynamic team of over 5,000 with a range of professions, backgrounds, and areas of expertise. This breadth of diversity in people and opportunities is one of greatest aspects of building your career with Bird. Every trajectory looks different. At Bird, you hold the pen, and you write your story. As you unlock your potential, you are surrounded by a team that supports you every step of the way.
Be a part of our team, where we pride ourselves on the quality of our work and the way we treat each other and our partners. You will build a career and long-lasting relationships based on respect, collaboration, and a solution-focused mindset. Bird is a place where you will unlock your potential and achieve your goals.
Our internships and co-ops are designed to provide you with a business relevant project that will allow you to independently manage your own area of responsibility, while receiving support from an assigned Supervisor and Technical Mentor. We'll help you discover your strengths and development areas in a challenging, fun, and supportive work environment.

We are seeking a student to join us for a 4-month co-op position starting in May 2026. This position will be based out of the Mississauga or Calgary office.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Be Working On

Extract, transform, and load data from diverse data sources for data analysis and reporting used
Ensure data quality and perform data cleaning as needed
Experience creating and maintaining reports, and dashboards in Power BI an asset
Assist in analyzing historical construction data and improving data quality where needed
Assist in data strategy efforts, including updating data flowcharts
Support data science efforts by identifying machine learning and Python automation opportunities, sourcing and preparing data, and developing models and workflows for construction activities
Complete data related courses
Other duties as assigned by the Project Data Analyst

Required Skills:

Who We Need On Our Team
You are currently enrolled in a post-secondary undergraduate or master's program, in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a closely related discipline such as Information Systems, Engineering, or Data Analytics
You will complete at least one more semester of education following your internship and possess a GPA of 3.0 or higher
Ability to lead and operate within an environment where change happens frequently
Ability to forge, grow and maintain positive relationships Exemplify the Ideal Team Player - Hungry, Humble, Smart Highly developed interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills
Sense of urgency and strong commitment to achieving goals Ability to work collaboratively with a positive attitude
Residency, or a valid work permit which would allow you to work for Bird Construction or one of our wholly owned subsidiaries
All applications must include a current transcript
If you are selected for a role with client specific requirements, you may be required to successfully complete a pre-employment Medical and/or Alcohol & Drug testing.
All applications must include a current transcript

Job Summary:

ABOUT US:
Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada (TMMC) is a world-class automotive manufacturer with three state-of-the-art facilities located right here in Cambridge and Woodstock, Ontario. As Canada's top-producing automotive manufacturer, we build the Toyota RAV4, Lexus RX and Lexus NX.

At TMMC, we're more than just a leading employer - we're a proud member of the community. Recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers and one of Canada's Greenest Employers, we strive to be a good corporate citizen. We're committed to sending zero waste to landfill every year and actively support local nonprofit organizations through philanthropic efforts.

Join a supportive team that values innovation, sustainability, and community leadership. Push boundaries and achieve more than you ever thought possible - right here at home.

TOYOTA BUSINESS PRACTICE:
The Toyota Business Practice problem-solving methodology is our unique way of approaching a challenge by finding the root cause. As a co-op student, you are trained on this problem-solving method, which can be applied, not only at work but also in our everyday life.

TOYOTA PRODUCTION SYSTEM:
The world-famous Toyota Production System, a philosophy of continuous improvement and on-going training, enables each co-op student to work towards their highest potential. The results of our company stem from hiring committed, self-motivated team members, with the ability to work together to achieve team goals.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:
Ownership: Take the lead on your term project and learn all about what is involved from start to finish.
Impact: Know your work is being implemented and will support the production of our quality vehicles.
Challenge: Break down a complex project and narrow in on a specific idea, becoming an expert.

INNOVATION LAB:
Our Innovation Lab Team connects the Manufacturing and High-Tech industries by executing innovative projects and trialing potential solutions. Each year the Innovation Lab works on new Industry 4.0 software solutions, and hosts the innovation showcase for Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada.

Job Responsibilities:

CO-OP ROLE:
At TMMC we give our Systems Engineering co-op students experience with the full software development life cycle. The Innovation Lab co-op students will be working on a variety of manufacturing software solutions, both existing and new, alongside a team of software developers. We allow our students to work on the backend, frontend, database, etc. as a full stack developer. We provide mentorship and guidence and allow you to show us what you can offer to the team. Your decisions and code can impact thousands of customers on a daily basis giving you the utmost job satisfaction in knowing you made a difference at Toyota.

CO-OP STUDENT PROJECTS:

Innovation showcase
Previous Innovation Lab Projects: Prototyping with microcomputers, measurement data collection system (AI / ML related), full-stack projects

Required Skills:

YOU ARE:

A critical thinker and motivated problem solver
Willing to learn with a positive attitude
Results-oriented and take ownership
A collaborative team member with strong interpersonal skills
Detail-oriented with solid organizational skills
Passionate about your field of study
A self-starter with the ability to work in a multi-disciplined environment with minimal supervision
TECHNICAL SKILLS:
Knowledge of object oriented programming, software design patterns, UI design principles, machine learning / AI concepts & algorithms, databases, RESTAPIs
Languages (should have experience with at least one): C#, Javascript, Typescript or other OOP languages
Concepts/Tools (experience with these is an asset): Angular, .NET, Postgres, Redis, Docker, Test driven development, data analytics, NodeJS, React

Transportation and Housing:

TRANSPORTATION:
Possessing a valid driver's licence and having access to a vehicle is required. This position will require travel between our Cambridge and Woodstock locations.

Additional Information:

Unrestricted Driver Licence
Own Transportation Required


Compensation and Benefits:

COMPENSATION:
Pay rate will be confirmed during the interview process, range is $21.71 to $32.21 per hour.

Job Summary:

We are seeking a motivated Entry-Level AI Agent Developer to join our team in designing, building, and refining intelligent agents using LLMs, APIs, and automation frameworks. You'll work closely with our machine learning engineers, product teams, and AI strategists to develop agents that can reason, plan, and act across diverse domains.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do

Build and test AI agents using frameworks like LangChain, CrewAI, AutoGen, or similar tools
Integrate LLMs (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, or open-source models) into task-oriented workflows
Design agent prompts, memory management, and action strategies
Collaborate on API integrations and external tool calling (e.g., web scraping, RAG pipelines, function calling)
Prototype agent behaviors and evaluate performance in simulated or real-world use cases
Document workflows and help improve internal agent development playbooks

Required Skills:

Bachelor's degree (or in progress/final year) in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field
Familiarity with Python and basic software development practices (Git, debugging, etc.)
Exposure to AI/ML concepts, especially natural language processing (NLP)
Interest in LLMs and frameworks like LangChain, OpenAI functions, or agentic architectures
Strong problem-solving mindset and eagerness to learn
Excellent communication and documentation skills
Nice to Have (Not Required)
Experience with prompt engineering or fine-tuning LLMs
Familiarity with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, FAISS, Chroma)
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Previous work with chatbots, virtual assistants, or AI-driven automation

100% Remote

Compensation and Benefits:

$22 per hour

The software will complete transform the construction industry and empower architects, engineers, contractors and developers to build buildings faster and more sustainably.

Headquartered in Toronto, Canada, we are a global team of brilliant, kind and collaborative engineers, scientists and designers. We are located across Canada, Italy and the US, making our workplace a remote-first and distributed environment.

Job Summary:

At Decoda Health, we're building the first AI-native operating system for medical practices - where intelligent agents don't just assist, they do the work. Our platform automates scheduling, payments, communications, charting, and day-to-day operations so providers can focus on delivering exceptional care. Join a high-ownership, fast-moving team shaping how modern clinics operate.

Job Responsibilities:

What you will do

You'll help design and build the systems and interfaces that power AI-driven practice operations:
Build scalable backend infrastructure, APIs, and data pipelines that support real-time decisions across clinics.
Develop intuitive, modern UIs in React and Next.js that surface agent activity and streamline workflows.
Build production grade AI workflows across our stack.
Write clean, maintainable, well-tested code and contribute to design and architecture discussions.
Ensure reliability, observability, and performance across the platform.
Work directly with clients and help design the future of care.

Backend

GCP (or other cloud equivalent), PostgreSQL (or other relational databases)
Frontend

React & Next.js, React Query, Tailwind
Experience shipping beautiful, intuitive UIs to real users
Bonus
Experience building with AI Agents in production interacting with real users.
CI/CD, testing frameworks, Kubernetes, Pub/Sub, Elastic search.
Very strong design instincts.

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive salary
High impact, high ownership role at a YC-backed company
Work on meaningful problems at the intersection of AI and healthcare
Build real, production AI systems used daily by clinics across the US

Job Summary:

SafetyKit is a team of builders-engineers, operators, and problem-solvers from every background-working to bring AI into the world's largest companies, faster than anyone else.

AI is changing everything, and we don't plan on watching from the sidelines.

We work with some of the biggest companies in the world, at massive scale and under high expectations. For us, impact isn't abstract-it's measured in real results, real customers, and real change. It's working-our technology already powers decisions for some of the world's most influential companies.

Whether you're studying computer science, economics, design, psychology, business, or anything else, there's room for people who are curious and ambitious. We offer internships and new grad roles where you'll be thrown into meaningful work from day one.

You'll be joining an exceptionally talented group-people who are not only brilliant but relentlessly driven, the kind you'll learn from every single day. It's an environment of ownership, collaboration, and ambition, where you're expected to rise to the challenge and supported by teammates who push you to do the best work of your life.

Job Responsibilities:

Design and build scalable, high-performance infrastructure.
Design architectures that allow both engineers and language models to quickly create, test, and deploy application code.
Create reliable monitoring, logging, and alerting systems to ensure platform stability and performance
Collaborate with AI and product teams to translate complex requirements into elegant technical solutions
Use codegen models to move 10x faster than you did two years ago
Turn language models into useful, functional, and beautiful products.
Scope and implement entirely novel applications of AI agents (adversarial webcrawling, weapons identification, red-teaming, ingredient extraction, etc.)
Architect and implement workflows that power SafetyKit's risk AI agents
Design and conduct rigorous experiments to evaluate models' relative strengths, weaknesses, and optimal use cases

Required Skills:

Experience building products and shipping production-ready code
Deep familiarity with modern LLMs and AI systems
Strong engineering fundamentals
Operational judgment
High autonomy and ownership
Comfortable talking to customers

Compensation and Benefits:

$130,000 - $180,000 USD per annum

Job Summary:

INTRODUCTION
Imagine being part of a professional team - the kind of team that starts every action with Customer Experience as the starting point, earns trust through professional expertise, and produces quality work. We are curious by nature and dive deep to understand the How's and Why's of every project to ensure innovation is at the forefront of everything we do. At Algal, we make a difference by delivering a professional service to help other businesses succeed at what they do best. We are looking for a Co-Op Student who has a strong work ethic, demonstrates integrity, and can be depended on as we continue to offer best-in-class Engineering and Energy Consulting Services.

Algal Engineering has three divisions: Building Services, Power Systems and Utilities and Nuclear Process Engineering. During your Co-Op term you will be part of each division, by rotation. This will give you a tremendous opportunity to be exposed to an extensive area of engineering expertise. You will be exposed to a variety of different projects, as well as help with various tasks at all points of the project, both in the design phase and the implementation, installation and construction phase.

Algal's culture is to develop and maintain a family-like organization that integrates all our talents into a great lucrative and friendly environment. We are proud to call this Algal's family and we hope to have you as a part of the family during your co-op term and beyond.

COMPANY
Algal Engineering Ltd., is a multi-discipline firm providing Electrical/Mechanical Engineering Services to public and private sector clients since 1992. The Company's expertise is related to Power Utilities, Building Systems Design and Field Services, all in accordance with the Ontario Building Code, Electrical Safety Code and all other applicable Standards and Regulations.

Inside Algal, we work hard to provide a service that we are proud of. Our Company structure ensures that the best professional team is brought together to deliver all stages of the project with a high standard of excellence. Every member of our team brings knowledge, professionalism, and quality in everything they do. Collectively, we make great things happen.

POSITION
Algal Engineering Ltd. is seeking a Co-Op Student to join our growing team. This is an exciting opportunity for learning and growth. As we grow, we need someone who wants to own and be hands-on with their work. We are a high performing organization of specialized professionals, and we encourage an accountability mindset. If you want to be a part of great team of professionals, we want you to apply!

Job Responsibilities:

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

ADMINISTRATION (20-40% of Time)

Provide support to the Office Manager on regular office administration tasks
Organize project electronic filling
Participate at preparation of technical submissions for Proposals.
TECHNICAL SERVICES (60-70% of time)
Provide support to senior electrical engineers
Participate at site investigation along with the supervising engineers
Collaborate with electrical engineers on preparation of specifications and drawings
Participate at technical review meetings
CUSTOMER SUPPORT (5-10% of time)
Involve on preparation of contract documents
Under the supervision of the Office Manager and supervising engineer respond to customer queries.

Required Skills:

JOB REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS

Currently enrolled in an Engineering program at a University
Previous work experience in an engineering firm is an asset
Understands the meaning of hard work and can demonstrate a strong work ethic.

Transportation and Housing:

Personal car for transportation is preferred, however it is not mandatory. The company pays for mileage when the personal car is used for business purposes. The cost for transportation from home to the office and back is not arranged nor paid for by the company.
Algal Engineering does not offer housing. The candidate has to arrange his/her accommodation.

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive compensation based on candidate qualifications and experience. It will be discussed and agreed upon as part of the interview process.
Possibility to obtain a permanent position after the graduation.

Job Summary:

Bloomberg software engineers develop impactful solutions to complex, real-world problems. This is no different for our co-ops. Engineering co-ops take ownership of their projects under the mentorship of full-time software engineers. We are looking for top computer science students who are passionate about technology and eager to learn in our high energy, fast-paced environment.

As a co-op, you'll become an expert on the Bloomberg Terminal and gain a deeper understanding of technology and finance. In addition to your technical projects, you'll be immersed in Bloomberg culture and have the chance to participate in NYC exploration, attend tech talks and wellness events, and network with other co-ops.

Job Responsibilities:

We'll trust you to:

Take ownership of projects under the guidance of your mentor
Be a collaborative member of your team

Job Summary:

This is an in person Coop for a backend-heavy role for a Software Engineer at Atomus located in San Francisco, CA. This team is 5 days/week in person and reports directly to the cofounder of the company.

About Atomus
Atomus' mission is to provide world class cybersecurity for the world's most critical organizations. We build security compliance software delivered as managed services sold directly, with relevant professional services and support. Examples of our commercial customers include hypersonic aircraft companies, satellite and space mission systems companies, AI and software companies, among many other companies serving primarily the aerospace and defense industry.

At Atomus we are hardworking, we move fast, and we put our customers first.

Job Responsibilities:

Primary Duties:
As part of the engineering team at Atomus, you will be building key infrastructure to scale the foundations of critical products like multiplatform applications (Windows, MacOS, Ubuntu) to help alleviate risk and build compliance and security program for the customers. You will work closely with the Co-Founder and the Customer Success team to build products to support security and compliance for growing customer infrastructure.

Building Infrastructural backend engines on cloud-based platforms like Azure and GCP
Scaling infrastructure to support multiplatform applications (Windows, MacOS, Ubuntu)
Maintaining a deep understanding of the customer's and market needs
Architecting engineering processed to enable and inspire security-first thinking
Support customer-facing web-based platforms (NextJS, TypeScript, Postgres)

You'll also lay the groundwork for engineering and product processes, ensuring that our team can continue to build quickly and serve our customers for years to come. Our stack leverages NextJS, TypeScript, Postgres, Azure, Go, and Electron. We firmly believe that exceptional engineers can master any tech stack, so lack of experience with our specific tools should not deter you from applying. We focus on the ability to ship code quickly and continuously.

Required Skills:

About You:
You have experience in software engineering, specifically in either web-based customer SaaS platforms or multi-platform desktop applications and agents.
Strong knowledge of best practices in modern software development such as deployments, CI/CD, Operating Systems, and Databases.
Experience working with modern technologies such as NextJS, Postgres, and Azure.

You might be a good addition if you:
Have worked on security or compliance-based value driven product.
Have experience working on large-scale desktop-based applications with cloud-based infrastructure problems.
Enjoy understanding the nitty gritty of technical domains deeply.
Comfortable with building on all three operating systems.
You move quickly, are self-motivated, can roll up your sleeves and are comfortable with ambiguity.

Compensation and Benefits:

$13,000 USD/month. We have company sponsored dental, vision, and health insurance as well.
We do offer additional housing/relocation assistance.

Job Summary:

The Treasury Office analyzes and makes policy recommendations with respect to the Corporation's reserves and Development Charge Bylaw, property taxes and inter-governmental revenues. The Treasury Office invests the Corporation's surplus funds and acquires, when necessary, appropriate cost-effective external financing. The office also manages the Corporation's financial underwriting and banking relationships. Treasury Office consists of five units:

Growth Economics and Finance
Cash and Investment Management
Development Financing and Administration
Financing and Reserves
Tax and Inter-governmental Revenues
This analyst position will be reporting to the manager of Growth Economics and Finance. This unit is responsible for providing strategic advice regarding the impact of growth on the Region's finances. Key files managed by the unit include: updating Region's development charge background study and bylaw, conducting long-term development charge collections forecast, modeling the impact of legislative changes on development charges, and conducing policy and legislative research regarding new revenue sources. From time to time, this analyst may also support other treasury functions.

This position could be extended to 8 months.

Job Responsibilities:

Reporting to the Manager, Growth Economic sand Finance, the Analyst will:

Make improvements to the Region's long-term development charge collections forecast model (an Excel model with VBA components) to make it more robust and efficient
Assist with tasks required by other units within Treasury Office on an as-needed basis
Support the development, review and coordination of Departmental deliverables, including reports to Committee and Council
Conduct research and prepare presentations, briefing notes, memos, and other documents as required using various software applications
Support the department in research and financial analysis efforts, including the development of financial models, data collection and analysis
Manage information in accordance with legislation and corporate standards

Required Skills:

QUALIFICATIONS:

Currently enrolled on a full-time basis in Applied Math, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Public Administration, or related program.
Advanced knowledge of financial modeling using Excel, including familiarity with VBA programing
Knowledge and skills in areas pertinent to the position, including public policy and administration, finance, economic analysis, financial modeling
Knowledge of and demonstrated ability in corporate core competencies, including customer service, communication, teamwork, initiative/self-management and accountability, and flexibility/adaptability.
Computer literacy utilizing MS Office software applications and aptitude for technology and willingness to learn new software applications.
Organizational skills to set priorities, manage tasks, work independently, and meet stringent deadlines in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.
Strong verbal and written communication skills to accurately and clearly convey information and direction.
Strong interpersonal skills to liaise with staff at various levels of the organization.
Strong analytical and research skills.

Compensation and Benefits:

Depending on year of study, $19.28/hour - $28.07/hour

Job Summary:

About Daylight
Daylight is the decentralized energy company. We're building a protocol that converts distributed solar and storage systems into yield-bearing infrastructure. These assets are deployed behind the meter in American homes and businesses, generating electricity revenues that flow onchain as a single, liquid yield token. Our ambition is to build the economic engine for energy abundance-where capital fuels power, and power fuels everything.
Our team brings together energy and crypto veterans who believe in a future where communities power themselves. Backed by a16z, Framework, and other industry-leading investors, we're building the infrastructure to make that vision a reality. Learn more at godaylight.com

The Role
As a Backend Software Engineering Intern (Waterloo Co-op) at Daylight, you'll work closely with our engineering team to build and improve backend services that power our mobile app, internal tools, and partner integrations.
You'll contribute to real production systems written in Python and Django, gaining hands-on experience with API development, data modeling, and distributed systems in a fast-moving startup environment. Your work will directly support how homeowners monitor, control, and optimize their energy usage while participating in our decentralized energy network.
Because Daylight is an early-stage company, interns are treated as full members of the engineering team. You'll be exposed to architectural decisions, product discussions, and the realities of building scalable software from the ground up.
This role is ideal for students who are excited about software engineering, clean energy, and crypto, and who want meaningful ownership over their work during their co-op term.
In-person hybrid role in our New York City office

Job Responsibilities:

Responsibilities

GraphQL & REST API Development
Design and build robust GraphQL queries and mutations that power our mobile app and are tailored for mobile performance
Architect, develop, and maintain scalable API endpoints that support vendor/partner integrations
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship innovative features
Continuously monitor performance and resolve bottlenecks and bugs across all endpoints
Champion code quality, automation, and comprehensive testing practices
CRM & Internal Tools Development
Leverage and extend Django's admin interface to build a feature-rich internal CRM and administration portal
Customize the Django admin site to meet evolving business and workflow needs
Work with stakeholders to refine internal processes and drive user-friendly administrative solutions
Technical Architecture & DevOps
Optimize the application stack for maximum speed and reliability
Write clean, readable, and well-tested code
Participate in code reviews and learn industry best practices
Gain exposure to cloud infrastructure, CI/CD, and production systems

Required Skills:

What we're looking for
| Must Haves

Currently enrolled in a Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related program (University of Waterloo co-op eligible)
Experience programming in Python (through coursework, internships, or projects)
Familiarity with backend concepts such as APIs, databases, and client-server architecture
Experience using Git for version control
Strong problem-solving skills and eagerness to learn
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, ambiguous startup environment
| Nice to Haves
Experience with Django, HTMX, PostgreSQL, or Redis
Exposure to REST APIs or GraphQL
Interest in or familiarity with crypto, blockchain, or distributed systems
Interest in energy, climate tech, or sustainability
Personal projects, hackathons, or open-source contributions

Pay schedule: Paid bi-weekly
Meals: Daily catered lunches provided in-office

Job Summary:

About CoLab
At CoLab, we help mechanical engineering teams bring life-changing products to market years sooner.

CoLab is a cloud based platform for engineering design collaboration and review. We make it easy for subject matter experts (SMEs) across your business to access, evaluate, and comment on 2D drawings and 3D models. Our built-in AI peer checker, AutoReview, scans designs for common errors or non-compliance with your standards and guidelines. AutoReview creates markups and comments on your files, in context - just like a human checker.

With CoLab, human SMEs and AI work together to help you make better decisions and improve designs faster. We automatically capture knowledge from across your global business that would otherwise be buried in emails, spreadsheets, slide decks, and unknown locations in Sharepoint or PLM. Then, we make sure every lesson learned and every design guideline is applied exactly when it matters.

Companies like Johnson Controls, Komatsu, Schaeffler, and Polaris have launched products 40% faster, cut BOM costs by 50%, and reduced quality escapes by 15% in 1 year.

Develop, test and ship critical user-facing features on a regular basis
Participate in code reviews and help your team deliver high-quality software
Champion all aspects of the user's experience, with a focus on clarity and speed
Contribute to company and product vision, ideation and planning

Job Summary:

The Institute for Quantum Computing (IQC) is a multidisciplinary research institute at the University of Waterloo, bringing together researchers from Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Chemistry, and Engineering to explore many different facets of quantum information science. Part of our commitment to quantum research is to make sure that the results are accessible and understandable. The Scientific Outreach & Events team develops resources and activities for a variety of audiences, as well as hosting a variety of events, workshops, and class visits.

The Quantum Outreach and Education Research Assistant will work with the Senior Manager of Scientific Outreach and Scientific Outreach Officer at the Institute for Quantum Computing (IQC) to develop and maintain IQC's world-class outreach program teaching quantum information science to a variety of audiences. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to deliver workshops on quantum technologies to student audiences, coordinate impactful projects and events, and work with a variety of laboratory technologies, building an essential skillset for science communication, project management, and quantum research. The candidate will contribute to the successful implementation of the Undergraduate School on Experimental Quantum Information Processing (USEQIP), the Quantum for Educators (QEd) teacher workshop, the Quantum School for Young Students (QSYS), and other activities.

Job Responsibilities:

Building demonstrations for quantum education

Assemble, modify, and fine-tune lab activities relating to quantum science and its supporting principles (e.g., optics, spin)
Ensure proper working order and robustness through benchmarking tests
Design and test components using 3D printing and electronics
Build plug-and-play extensions to core components for educational experiments
Outreach and education
Assist with the Undergraduate School on Experimental Quantum Information Processing (USEQIP) and Quantum School for Young Students (QSYS), including maintaining and assisting with labs for USEQIP and leading tutorial sessions for QSYS.
Research and co-develop lesson plans for introducing quantum science to middle- and high-school students
Deliver workshops on quantum technologies to elementary and high-school students
Help prepare and run in-person activities for public and student audiences
Assist with the planning and setup of various educational and public-facing events and workshops
Develop ideas for further hands-on educational demonstrations
Events and Special Projects
Co-ordinate workshops and events with visiting classes and other groups
Assist with event logistics, including supporting attendees, coordinating with vendors, and some administrative duties
Due to the scheduling of outreach events, some weekend and evening work will be required, which will be planned well in advance. Any hours worked outside of regular hours can be taken off during the normal work week.

Required Skills:

Education

Pursuing a university degree in a discipline with links to quantum information science (e.g., physics, mathematics, CS, chemistry, engineering)
Experience
200-level or above quantum mechanics and/or optics courses are strong assets but not required
Prior experience in a physics, chemistry, or engineering laboratory is an asset but not required
Prior experience teaching and/or facilitating workshops (either paid or volunteer) is an asset but not required
Prior experience managing events and projects (e.g., for clubs or societies) is an asset but not required
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Familiarity with concepts in quantum physics, e.g. superposition, entanglement
Ability to communicate scientific ideas effectively to broad audiences
Ability to work independently, manage time, and show attention to detail
Ability to leave detailed and legible lab notes and reports for both supervisors and future users
Able to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team
Pre-existing knowledge of programming in Python, Mathematica, or related languages is an asset (but not essential)
Pre-existing knowledge of experimental design and acquisition software, such as AutoCAD, Fusion 360, LabView, and Arduino interfacing, is an asset (but not essential)
Physical and Sensory Demands: Lasers, electronics, and machine-shop equipment will be used, and proper safety precautions must be taken. Some lifting and transport functions may arise. Lab work often requires extended periods of standing.

Working Environment: Split between an office environment and a laboratory. If the applicant desires, a teaching and public outreach component can be emphasized. All UW employees must follow current health and safety regulations

Transportation and Housing:

Must be able to work in-person on the University of Waterloo campus. Some local travel may be required.

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation ranges from $3,000 to $4,000 per month, depending on how many work terms the successful candidate has completed prior.

Job Summary:

The National Research Council (NRC) is the Government of Canada's largest research organization supporting industrial innovation, the advancement of knowledge and technology development, and fulfilling government mandates.

The Clean Energy Innovation Research Centre of the NRC creates green and sustainable technologies for clean energy, resource extraction and environmental protection, essential to strengthen and support Canada's future clean economy.

This position has direct impact on our mission to develop more efficient and sustainable processing pathways to produce battery materials from raw and recycled source materials. The co-op student will implement advance AI models for the optimization and control process, contributing to building a functional decision-making system that has immediate relevance to real industrial problems. The co-op student will work with engineers and scientist to develop modular and object-oriented code, train predictive models, and evaluate their performance under realistic process conditions.

The co-op student will have a direct and measurable impact on our mission through data-driven intelligence to accelerate innovation, improve process efficiency, automate decision making and advance next-generation technologies.

This is an opportunity to apply machine learning to a real engineering problem, gain hands-on experience with cutting edge optimization and control techniques, expand the knowledge of advance ML models, and direct contribute to the development of smarter, more sustainable industrial processes.

Job Responsibilities:

Develop clean, modular, and well-documented Python code using object-oriented programing principles to support surrogate modeling and control system components.
Implement and experiment with advance machine learning and optimization algorithms, including Gaussian Processes, Bayesian Optimization and/or Reinforcement Learning.
Build, train, and evaluate surrogate models to approximate the dynamics, ensuring accuracy, robustness and scalability for integration into control frameworks.
Design and run simulation experiments to evaluate control strategies, analyse model performance and contribute to model improvement through iterative testing and refinement.
Collaborate closely with engineers and scientist to understand the problem statement, identify modelling challenges and translate insights into computational solutions.

Required Skills:

Strong programming skills in Python, including experience with object-oriented programming and clean modular code design.
Functional knowledge of machine learning concepts including model training, evaluation, and data preprocessing.
Experience with scientific computing libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, and matplotlib.
Familiarity with one or more ML fireworks such as scikit-learn, PyTorch, BoTorch.
Strong problem-solving abilities and willingness to learn complex modeling or control concepts.
Ability to communicate technical ideas clearly and work collaboratively with multidisciplinary team.
Nice to have basic understanding of Gaussian Processes, Bayesian Optimization, Reinforcement Learning algorithms, Version control tools (Git) and process engineering.

Additional Information:

Security Clearance Required
Hiring Preference - Canadian

Job Summary:

Do you dream of doing an internship at BRP in the Eastern Townships, but the distance is holding you back? Our Campus BRP* program is for you (exclusive to interns)!

Here are the benefits covered by BRP that you can expect if you obtain a Campus BRP scholarship:

Accommodation in the Eastern Townships;
A relocation allowance;
A bus pass (if applicable);
A carpooling program;
Activities that will allow you to get to know your colleagues and discover the region.
Selection process:
Have a successful interview with a manager at BRP in Canada;
Receive an email from the internship team with the application form to apply;
The internship will give you a positive or negative answer, before submitting the rankings on your university platform.
*Please note that obtaining an internship at BRP does not guarantee a place in our Campus BRP program, as places are very limited. You can be selected for the internship, but not for the Campus BRP program. If you are not selected for the program, we will provide you with references to help you find accommodation, at your expense.

THE EXPERIENCE OF A LIFETIME
The BRP internship program stands out for its unique character. Each year, nearly 300 interns from diverse backgrounds, skill levels, and professional fields join us. Often, this experience leads to full-time employment, as investing in talent and supporting them in reaching their full potential is one of our priorities. At BRP, interns have the opportunity to collaborate with an experienced team, contribute to exciting projects, and make a real impact. Will you be the next generation? Apply today! For more details, visit the internship page: https://careers.brp.com/ca/fr/kickstart-your-careers

Job Responsibilities:

Your mandate:
Support the development of mechatronic and electrical accessories for Can-Am Offroad side-by-side vehicles.

As a member of the Offroad accessory team, your role will be to calibrate and validate the variety of products in development. To do so, the intern will have the opportunity to manage multiple projects from functionality suggestions to final testing.
Here are some of your challenges in your internship:

Calibrate the electrical accessories in real conditions
Troubleshoot electrical problems on a variety of systems such as audio systems and electrical modules
Contribute to the electrical design of accessories such as an electrical flip windshields
Perform tests (on vehicle or on test bench) to validate new functionalities

Required Skills:

Become our next generation if you have these skills and qualities:

Interest in off-road vehicles
Experience in electrical troubleshooting
General knowledge of electrical harness
Ability to read Simulink code is a plus
Resourceful and organized
Creativity and initiative (We love to see your projects and things you have made)
French speaking and written ability are a plus

Transportation and Housing:

Location not accessible by public transportation; car (or carpooling) required.

Compensation and Benefits:

Any benefits? There's no shortage of them for our interns!

Competitive salary and a bonus for returning to the internship: we know how hard you work, so we offer you what you deserve.
Flexible working hours: whether you're in the office or working from home, you'll always be supported by your team.
The most stimulating work environment: progress doesn't come from standing still. You'll have the chance to learn and be challenged by tomorrow's top talent.
Social activities: the cohort of 100 interns is never bored with a full calendar of
activities organized by the social committee!

Job Summary:

We are a growing local startup working on a medical device for women's health. We create a pelvic rehabilitation system for women with pelvic based cancers and diseases. We are looking for a manufacturing intern who loves to tinker, create and problem solve for our connected, modular device that has a combination of mechanical, electrical and software components. This intern will have experience creating hardware with design background and understanding of mechanics as well as has an understanding of electronics, sensors and has done some manufacturing and prototyping in the past. You are crafty, are able to make quick prototypes that demonstrate value and can offer up unique suggestions to help solve problems as they arise through the prototyping phase.

- Following existing Work Instructions with an eye for potential improvements
- Testing devices during production assembly phases and final testing
- Documentation of activities
- Investigation and troubleshooting of issues and nonconformances
- Assembly process improvement

- Good communication and documentation skills.
- Ability to be "hands on" to demonstrate processes using tools and small equipment.
- Work with little supervision, highly motivated.

Job Summary:

Aerospace Co-Op Student Opportunities
We are looking for skilled students with a passion for aerospace to join our unique Hybrid eVTOL program, based in Lindsay, Ontario. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of technology and customer experience to deliver something that has never been done before. We are a fast-moving organisation that promotes a hands-on approach, supporting each other through the tough spots, generating a close-knit team with a family feel.

Job Responsibilities:

Roles on offer.
We are looking for Co-Op placements in:

Electrical / Avionics Engineering
These roles will all be working on our X7 Hybrid eVTOL full scale demonstrator, giving the successful candidates a rare opportunity to work on a brand-new aircraft product. As we're a small team, there is significant scope for you to learn about adjacent disciplines, and potential for long term career opportunities with Horizon Aircraft.
What we do here is hard, but then very few things worth achieving are easy. By joining Horizon, you will have the opportunity to work with our world-class entrepreneurial team who are passionate about delivering something special.

Required Skills:


What we need you to bring.
Your Day- to-Day:

Conduct trade studies of the product technologies, determining the best route forward for the platform. This includes assessing what's available from suppliers and industry
Development of product architectures, requirements, and detailed design / analysis
Implement requirements for the system, sensors, and algorithms into the design
Develop creative solutions to verify complex systems and software
Implement and test the detailed designs of the team
Write and publish detailed reports for the area of your role / product
We are looking for people that will have the following qualifications and experiences: current university student with strong research and analytical skills, a desire to learn, and an ability plan and execute tasking in a timely manner under appropriate supervision. We are looking for someone with a desire to work in cutting edge aerospace projects, with attention to detail, a high level of integrity and a solid technical understanding of the technical role applied for.
Check us out at www.horizonaircraft.com and we look forward to hearing from you!

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required

$25-$30/hr based on experience.

Job Summary:

At CoLab, we help mechanical engineering teams bring life-changing products to market years sooner.

CoLab is a cloud based platform purpose built for fast, effective design review. Using CoLab, multiple engineers, designers, and other stakeholders can review designs together and build off one another's feedback. Engineers at companies like Ford, Komatsu, and Johnson Controls use CoLab to review designs faster, prevent mistakes, and build the next generation of innovative products.

As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Software Engineering Co-op student to join our Product Development team. In this role, you will work with a multidisciplinary team to design, build and ship critical product features and improvements to our valued customers on a regular basis. You will work with a group of talented Developers, Product Managers, Designers, Engineering Managers, and QA specialists to take new product ideas all the way from a concept, to production features that our users love.

Job Responsibilities:

What you'll do:

Understand complex customer problems and requirements and collaborate in a team to build a solution that adds value for the customer and the product as a whole
Integrate with leading industry products
Develop, test and ship critical user-facing features on a regular basis
Participate in code reviews and help your team deliver high-quality software
Champion all aspects of the user's experience, with a focus on clarity and speed
Contribute to company and product vision, ideation and planning

Required Skills:

What you'll need:

Active enrollment in an engineering co-op program
Hands-on frontend/backend web development experience
Proficient with JavaScript, HTML and CSS
Hands-on React, GraphQL, and Python experience would be considered an asset
Experience with GitHub or other Git workflows (pull requests, code reviews)
Passion for working in teams with emphasis on respect and continuous improvement
Experience with front-end tools such as Webpack, Vite, NPM and unit / functional testing frameworks would be considered an asset
Attention to details and empathy for the user experience would be considered an asset
Exposure to CAD or PLM applications considered an asset
Success measured by:
On time delivery of new product features and changes
Promotes clean and maintainable code and software development best practices
Clear communication within team
Self directed, takes ownership of tasks, stays informed of broader team's work
Extra Details
This is a full-time, co-op position with a competitive compensation package.
Our main office location is in St. John's, NL where we offer a hybrid opportunity but this position is open to remote candidates in Canada as well.

$25-$30/hr

Job Summary:

Are you interested in working for a company with a long heritage of excellence and commitment? St Marys Cement celebrates its 114th year of operation with a legacy of participating in such landmark projects as the CN Tower, Ripley's Aquarium, Roy Thompson Hall, Maple Leaf Gardens and the Darlington Nuclear Station, as well as countless other engineering, civic and residential projects that significantly contributed to the growth and prosperity of the region.

Join St Marys Cement as a Systems Engineering student who will assist the Systems Engineer in ensuring the plant's technological changes in electrical, process control and computer systems remain current.

Job Responsibilities:

The Systems Engineering role will partner with the electrical maintenance team to troubleshoot system and equipment challenges; make necessary PLC and HMI programming changes; update AutoCAD drawings; prepare designs, drawings and programming for equipment changes and new installations; collaborate with IT to maintain and improve networking systems; ensure systems reliability through project documentation; review project proposals; and ensure technological changes are profitable.

Required Skills:

Language skills: ability to read, analyze and interpret general business documents, professional journals, technical procedures, or government regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals

Mathematical skills: ability to work with mathematical concepts sucha s probability and statistical inference and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.

Reasoning ability: ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram forma nd deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

Desired skills: strong technical knowledge of automated manufacturing systems and the ability to work with AutoCAD drafting, Visual basic programming, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, SQL server and Rockwell PLC programming.

Transportation and Housing:

The town of St Marys does not have a public transportation system. Therefore, your own transportation is required.
There is housing available in St Marys and contact information may be shared upon request.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required

Job Summary:

BitGo is the leading infrastructure provider of digital asset solutions, delivering custody, wallets, staking, trading, financing, and settlement services from regulated cold storage. Since our founding in 2013, we have focused on enabling our clients to securely navigate the digital asset space. With a global presence and multiple Trust companies, BitGo serves thousands of institutions, including many of the industry's top brands, exchanges, and platforms, and millions of retail investors worldwide. As the operational backbone of the digital economy, BitGo handles a significant portion of Bitcoin network transactions and is the largest independent digital asset custodian, and staking provider, in the world. For more information, visit www.bitgo.com.

We're seeking a highly motivated Product Management Intern to join our team for summer 2026. This internship offers hands-on experience in the fast-paced world of institutional digital assets, where you'll work alongside experienced product managers to shape the future of crypto infrastructure and financial services. As a Product Management Intern, you'll contribute to real product initiatives, conduct market research, analyze user data, and help drive product decisions that impact millions of dollars in digital asset transactions daily.


What You'll Gain

Mentorship from experienced product managers in the digital asset industry
Deep understanding of institutional crypto infrastructure and custody solutions
Exposure to product management best practices at a leading fintech company
Hands-on experience with real products serving institutional clients
Networking opportunities with leaders across product, engineering, and business teams
Potential for full-time conversion upon graduation

Our Culture
BitGo values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We're building the future of finance in an industry that's evolving rapidly, and we're looking for curious, driven individuals who want to be part of that journey. Our team is passionate about digital assets and committed to building products that meet the highest standards of security and compliance.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do

Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, design, sales, compliance) to support the development and launch of new product features
Conduct competitive analysis and market research to identify opportunities in the digital asset ecosystem
Gather and synthesize feedback from institutional clients to inform product roadmap decisions
Analyze product metrics and user behavior to identify trends and opportunities for improvement
Create product requirement documents (PRDs), user stories, and specifications for new features
Assist in prioritizing features and maintaining product roadmaps based on business impact and customer needs
Present findings and recommendations to product leadership and cross-functional partner

Required Skills:

Required:

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Economics, or related field.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Genuine curiosity about cryptocurrency, blockchain technology, and digital assets

Preferred:
Previous internship experience in product management, consulting, or technical roles
Familiarity with blockchain technology, cryptocurrency, or financial services
Experience with data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Tableau, or similar)
Understanding of API products or developer tools
Technical background or ability to communicate effectively with engineering teams

$45.00/hr CAD

Job Summary:

Production technology offers a diverse range of exciting challenges and opportunities. Our department at the Institute of Machine Tools and Production Technology focusses its work on the automation of assembly and manufacturing processes. Our technical centre offers a wide range of machines that can be used for this purpose. Serial articulated robots, parallel robots or multi-robot applications are available. Digital services, such as digital twins, are used to speed up processes and make them transparent. The systems and digital applications therefore offer a wide range of questions and problems that need to be analysed. Collaboration between the systems, but also self-administration of the systems, play a role here.
The aim of the planned cooperation is focussed on the expansion and development of digital twin applications and the investigation of possible new potentials.

Job Responsibilities:

The selected student will work closely with our dynamic team in the pilot lab and gain hands-on experience by contributing to various industrial projects. These include:

Development and improvement Python-libraries and applications for ese on the digital twin: Software libraries are used to ensure that the various applications are developed as quickly and independently of the machine as possible. These are to be further developed and improved. It is possible to implement your own ideas and vision and to learn how the description and interaction between systems and digital twins currently works.
Programming and operating industrial robots and controls: Working with robots and control systems is also necessary. The primary aim here is to learn how to interact with and programme systems. This is followed by the step-by-step implementation of applications for the digital twin.
Carrying out tests to validate applications of digital twins: The applications for the digital twin are the central focus. Functions such as condition monitoring are also part of these considerations. To validate this application, it is necessary to identify and specifically analyse borderline cases on the systems.
What you'll gain:
This internship provides a broad insight into the development and application of digital twins for systems in the field of production and systems engineering. The aim is to analyse and improve the infrastructure, implement applications and validate these applications. This will be validated and tested in various applications at the IWF technical center. Supervision is provided by a versatile and interdisciplinary team. Close co-operation with industrial companies will provide initial insights into the field of production technology.

Required Skills:

We are looking for motivated Bachelor's or Master's students in the fields of Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering or Software Engineering who are eager to deepen their practical knowledge in industrial production technology.
Candidates should bring:

Programming experience: Most applications in the field of digital twins are programmed in Python - corresponding experience is desirable
Experience in the field of production machines: Basic understanding and experience in the field of production machines and digital twins.
Technical interest: General understanding of and interest in technical processes and procedures in the field of production technology
Analytical abilities: Carrying out analysis procedures for the statistical evaluation and validation of applications in the field of digital twins.
Personal skills:
Enthusiasm for experimental, hands-on work in production technology.
Team-oriented mindset with the ability to work, discuss, and learn collaboratively in an interdisciplinary team of doctoral students, master and bachelor students, and technical staff.
Strong communication skills, including participation in weekly team meetings to present progress, set goals, and coordinate with supervisors.
This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain practical experience along the development process of digital twins in production technology, preparing you for future roles in industrial or academic environments.

Transportation and Housing:

Braunschweig is a charming and historic city in Northern Germany, easily accessible by train and well-connected to other major cities. Within Braunschweig, most destinations can be reached on foot, by bicycle, or via the city's efficient public transportation system.

For international travel from Canada, the nearest airport is Hannover, located just 45 minutes away by train. Alternatively, you can also consider flying into Frankfurt or Berlin, both of which offer convenient train connections to Braunschweig.

While we are unable to provide housing directly, the International House of our university has been very supportive in the past. They can assist you in finding affordable accommodation options to suit your needs.

Compensation and Benefits:

The student receives a student assistant position over 4 months (2026, May 1 to August 31) with approx. 500 EUR/month.

As an enrolled student, you can enjoy the advantages of inexpensive student meals and the opportunity to travel cheaply by bus and train with your student ID.

If you are matched to a job outside of Canada, you may apply for international travel awards/scholarships via SAFA. Please see more information at https://uwaterloo.ca/student-awards-financial-aid/undergraduate-awards/international-experience-awards

Job Summary:

Focus: Asset-Backed Credit Cards
Funding: $250+ million, Series E
Headquarters: Campbell, CA | Bay Area
Team: 75
Website: https://www.aven.com/about/

About Us
Aven is already the most efficient bank in the world (generating over $3MM in revenue per employee) - and we are rapidly making progress on building the world's first Machine Bank. We are starting with reinventing the $1T credit card market. We massively reduce the cost of capital by using technology to easily tap into people's assets. Our first product is the world's lowest APR credit card - backed by home equity. Using many patented technologies, we sped up a process that usually takes 4-6 weeks and thousands of dollars down to as fast as 15 minutes and $0 to get. If you are a missionary that gets excited to work on huge problems with wicked smart people to have a massive impact - then Aven would love to get to know you.

Who are we?
We are a well-capitalized (over $250MM in equity funding) team of technology (Square, Microsoft, Facebook) and finance (Discover, CapitalOne, and Goldman) executives with top-tier investors -- Founders Fund, Khosla Ventures, Max Levchin, NYCA, Sequoia, SciFi VC, Caffeinated Capital, etc. In the next decade, we believe we will reduce the cost of consumer credit in the world by half. Our team includes people who have built:

Financial products (Square/CashApp, the earliest CapitalOne credit cards)
Consumer products (Facebook, Xbox)
Technology infrastructure (C++/C#, Visual Studio, Windows & Azure)

We are missionaries who like to work hard on important problems - and build products that become an infrastructure for society. We believe that using technology to lower the cost of capital for consumers is one of these problems - and if we can do it, it could have an infinite impact on people's lives.

Job Responsibilities:

Who are you?
We are looking for an experienced engineer who can dig deep into all aspects of a system. You will be digging into performance issues of a web application, debugging race conditions across client/server boundaries, and controlling robots across the continental United States (yes, really).

You will also be responsible for the architecture of the system, design reviews and code reviews. This role will evolve into having tech leadership responsibilities.

You can expect to work on:

Anything and everything. At this early stage, you will find yourself:
Building a best in class credit card, mortgage, and other financial products
Building it using the advanced technology available from machine learning / AI to high precision sentinel systems - and bringing it to bear on one of the oldest & most important problems in human society.
Building a best in class audio/video notarization solution
Helping us execute world-class growth & engagement tactics
Architecting product & infrastructure across a wide surface area of products & services
Weighing in on strategy. Every voice is important to help inform our decisions
Defining our culture. As a large % of the team, who you are shapes who we become.
Become an expert in our product space, such that you're able to define how products should work end-to-end

Required Skills:

You should join us if:

You have led large technically complex projects with a lot of moving parts
You have experience with a lot of disparate systems design problems
You have worked on production-grade deep technology - compilers, operating systems, large distributed systems, and production grade machine learning infrastructure You can jump into a new environment and hit the ground running without much hand-holding
You're fine with us not having answers yet. You want to be part of figuring out the answers
You enjoy diving into the deep end and feel like that's where the greatest personal growth happens
You thrive in highly collaborative environments and are down to riff with us on anything from company mission to software architecture to user research
Our Tech Stack:
AWS
PostgreSQL
Typescript
Python
VueJS (web)
Swift (iOs)

Transportation and Housing:

We will provide a $2,500 USD relocation bonus.

Compensation and Benefits:

Co-ops will be salaried at an equivalent of $80 USD hourly rate + equity. This additional equity will be granted on top of the equity for the full-time role and will vest on your first day of full-time employment.

Job Summary:

Biotechnology offers a diverse range of exciting challenges and opportunities, especially in the development of pharmaceutical products. Our group, Medical Biotechnology, at the Institute of Biochemical Engineering focuses, among other topics, on studying the risks associated with nosocomial biofilms and potential treatment strategies. For this purpose, cultivations with ESKAPE pathogens (including P. aeruginosa) are carried out in a bioreactor specifically
designed for this project. The aim is to determine to what extent isothiocyanates (ITCs) can reduce the mechanical properties (e.g., strength) of nosocomial biofilms and how they influence biofilm stability.

In addition, the group works on the production of bacterial cellulose (BC), a naturally occurring polymer produced by Komagataeibacter species. Due to its favorable physicochemical properties, BC is a promising biomaterial for various applications, especially in the biochemical field. Custom-designed bioreactors are used to optimize the cultivation and production processes of BC for these purposes.

Our lab is equipped with a wide range of state-of-the-art technologies to support the entire bioprocessing workflow. This allows us to establish and improve suitable production processes. This can include the development of custom-made bioreactors, e.g. a new tubular reactor for studying the mechanical stability of nosocomial biofilms or membrane-based bioreactor for the biofilm-associated production of bacterial cellulose.

The objective of the proposed co-op term is to gain hands-on experience in the characterization, subsequent cultivation, and analysis of bioprocesses

Job Responsibilities:

The selected student will work closely with our dynamic team in the pilot lab and gain hands-on experience by contributing to various industrial projects. These include:

Development and characterization of Bioreactors: The student will assist in the further development, improvement and characterization of a continuous-flow tubular reactor or membrane-based bioreactor
Cultivation in bioreactors: From inoculum preparation to process optimization in the bioreactor, the student will be involved in the entire production workflow, learning how to monitor and control key parameters for optimal culture conditions.
Online and offline monitoring and analysis: The student will utilize modern analytical tools and techniques, such as chromatography, microscopy and real-time sensors, to assess microbial performance.
What you'll gain:
This internship provides an excellent opportunity to develop a comprehensive understanding of bioprocess development. With access to state-of-the-art equipment and guidance from an experienced, interdisciplinary team, this experience will prepare you exceptionally well for a career in the biopharmaceutical industry.

Required Skills:

We are looking for motivated Bachelor's or Master's students in the fields of Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, Bio- or Chemical Engineering, or Biotechnology.

Candidates should bring:

Programming skills: Experience with programming, particularly C/C++, for embedded systems or automation tasks.
Automation and design interest: A strong interest in mechatronics, system design, and building/optimizing hardware.
High-data applications: Familiarity with data acquisition, control loop mechanisms, and handling data from automated systems.
Technical interest in Bioprocesses: (Preferred) A biological/biotech background or a genuine interest in applying engineering solutions to biopharmaceutical workflows.

Personal skills:
Enthusiasm for experimental, hands-on work in biotechnology.
Team-oriented mindset with the ability to work, discuss, and learn collaboratively in an interdisciplinary team of doctoral students, master and bachelor students, and technical staff.
Strong communication skills, including participation in weekly team meetings to present progress, set goals, and coordinate with supervisors.
This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain practical experience across the biotechnological value chain, preparing you for future roles in industrial or academic environments.

Transportation and Housing:

Braunschweig is a charming and historic city in Northern Germany, easily accessible by train and well-connected to other major cities. Within Braunschweig, most destinations can be reached on foot, by bicycle, or via the city's efficient public transportation system.

For international travel from Canada, the nearest airport is Hannover, located just 45 minutes away by train. Alternatively, you can also consider flying into Frankfurt or Berlin, both of which offer convenient train connections to Braunschweig.

While we are unable to provide housing directly, the International House of our university has been very supportive in the past. They can assist you in finding affordable accommodation options to suit your needs.

As an enrolled student, you can enjoy the advantages of inexpensive student meals and the opportunity to travel for free by bus and train through germany with your student ID.
