Job Summary:

We create fair, effective, and simple financial pathways to help 100M Americans reach their financial goals, and we can help you kick off your career as a Software Engineer!

You will be working with serial entrepreneurs who have built strong consumer brands and innovative products. We are backed by some of Silicon Valley's top VCs, including GGV capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Female Founders Fund, and others. We value extreme ownership, clear communication, a strong sense of craftsmanship, and the desire to create lasting work and work relationships.

Job Responsibilities:

As part of a fast-moving team, you will work closely with the rest of the team to solve real problems:

Own projects end-to-end; from design, to prototype, to release
Design and implement models, views, and endpoints
Build tools and scripts to simplify tasks
Ensure quality of the overall product and features
Develop engineering best practices

Required Skills:

We are open to using new and emerging technologies. Our stack includes AWS, Ruby on Rails, React, and Flutter.

Don't worry if you do not have any experiences in the above, any of these will help:

Passion for early stage products and startups
Strong coding fundamentals and enthusiasm for code correctness
Previous internship experiences
Experience with backend frameworks (Django, Express, Ruby on Rails, Play)
Experience with frontend frameworks (React, Angular)
Mobile frameworks (Android, iOS, Flutter)

Transportation and Housing:

Flight to US covered
Up to $1000 USD per month housing stipend
Up to $400 USD transportation stipend for commute purpose (from / to the office)

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary information

$65/hr USD

Free lunch / dinner at the office
Participation in team events / off-sites

Job Summary:

Essos is a seed-stage startup backed by top-tier investors including Saga Ventures (founded by Max Altman) and Sound Ventures.
We're on a mission to build the operating system for global healthcare - connecting patients to internationally accredited clinics through a seamless, trusted digital platform.
We're addressing a $150 billion and growing global market by creating the infrastructure that makes receiving high-quality, affordable care abroad simple, transparent, and accessible.
As an early engineer, you'll work directly with the CEO and the founding team, gaining exposure to every part of the business - from product and go-to-market to customer experience - with real ownership and the ability to see your work come to life quickly.
You'll have the opportunity for international travel as we expand into new markets and geographies.

Job Responsibilities:

Full-Stack Development: Build and deploy patient-facing and internal tools across the stack, focusing on performance, reliability, and a great user experience.
Product Ownership: Drive projects end-to-end - from shaping requirements to delivering scalable, production-ready solutions.
Technical Architecture: Help design and implement scalable systems across the web, APIs, and cloud infrastructure.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product, operations, and design teams to translate real-world healthcare needs into technical solutions.
Culture Contribution: Help build a fast-moving, collaborative, and high-ownership engineering culture.

Required Skills:

Technical Expertise:
Strong software development skills with experience in modern web technologies and frameworks
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and scalable infrastructure design is a plus
Problem-Solving Ability:
Strong bias toward action; ability to balance scrappiness with technical rigor
Entrepreneurial Mindset:
Thrives in fast-paced, ambiguous environments; motivated to build 0 → 1 products
Communication & Collaboration:
Clear communicator who works effectively across technical and non-technical teams
Cultural Fit:
Values open debate, direct feedback, and collective ownership of outcomes

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation: $30 - $40 per hour, depending on experience
Bonus: Eligible for a discretionary bonus (in either cash or equity)
NYC Perks: Office in downtown Manhattan with team lunches, offsites, and an energetic in-person culture
Real Ownership: Work side-by-side with the CEO and founding team on high-impact problems from day one
Visa Sponsorship: We are open to sponsoring Canadian/U.S. work visas for exceptional candidates
Career Acceleration: This is a rare opportunity to help launch a company from the ground up, with mentorship, autonomy, and the chance to build something meaningful at scale

Job Summary:

The Institute of Vehicle Concepts researches, develops and evaluates new vehicle concepts and technologies in the light of future demands on transportation systems.

As a systems institute, we develop and demonstrate innovative, application-based solutions for road and rail vehicles, thereby contributing to the design of a sustainable and cost-effective, user-oriented, secure and networked mobility concept. Our contributions range from design and planning to construction, calculation and simulation through to the manufacture of research demonstrations, components and vehicles.
The Institute's guiding vision is one of successful scientific cooperation for efficient vehicle concepts where the fields of energy and transportation meet. The development of future technical systems based on regenerative energy carriers and energy conversion/storage in the vehicle of the future as well as progressive architectures and fuel technologies for road and rail vehicles is supported by a prospective, comprehensive vehicle system analysis and technology evaluation.

In the Innovative Drive Systems working group at the Institute of Vehicle Concepts, we are researching emission-free, holistic traction concepts. Among other things, we are developing eddy current brakes and their supply in battery-electric vehicles.
The German Aerospace Centre (DLR) is conducting research into an innovative high-performance eddy current brake for railway applications. The aim of this work is to carry out an installation space assessment of the high-performance eddy current brake for an OEM. The implementation of this technology should not only improve the safety and efficiency of railway systems, but also protect the environment by reducing emissions of particulate matter. In this context, we are looking for a dedicated and experienced professional who would like to support us in the development and optimisation of this ground-breaking technology as part of your internship.

The applicant is responsible for the visa. You must ensure that you can obtain the authority to stay and work in Germany for the work term.

Canadian Citizens can explore the International Experience Canada Youth Mobility Visa for Germany:https://canada.diplo.de/ca-en/consular-services/visa/working-holiday/2653142

Job Responsibilities:

Your tasks are in detail:

Familiarisation with existing knowledge
Identification of requirements and boundary conditions
Design of the eddy current break with the help of design tools developed at DLR
Conception and design of a variant of the high-performance eddy current brake suitable for the OEM

Required Skills:

Required: CAD knowledge, interest in practical activities and experiments, Matlab knowledge, High level of initiative, independent and structured way of working, experience in design

Nice-to-have: Ansys Mechanical, Maxwell knowledge (or similar Software of numerical Simulation), CATIA V5 knowledge,

Education: Enrolled student in following programs (Bachelor or Master): Mechatronics Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering

Transportation and Housing:

Include insight into local average monthly costs for:

Food: 200 €/Month
Housing: 380 €/Month Student accommodation (University of Stuttgart)
Local transportation: Public transport 50 €/monthly or bicycle (100 -200 € for a second-hand bicycle)

Compensation and Benefits:

If you are matched to a job outside of Canada, you may apply for international travel awards/scholarships via SAFA. Please see more information at https://uwaterloo.ca/student-awards-financial-aid/undergraduate-awards/international-experience-awards

Salary: 992,00 € monthly
Workplace meals are subsidised and a standard lunch meal is available for about 5,50 €
International student community organizes frequently events (movie theater, sports)

Job Summary:

As part of a dynamic and highly motivated team, you will have the exciting opportunity to dive into the cutting-edge world of electric drive technology. Our collective mission is to revolutionize the field by developing state-of-the-art electric drives that push the boundaries of what's possible. To support this endeavor, various specialized tools for designing and analyzing electrical machines have already been crafted as part of previously completed theses. These tools serve as the foundation upon which we aim to build even more robust and efficient systems.

Your primary responsibility will be to take these existing software tools to the next level. To achieve this, you will embark on a journey of discovery and innovation, beginning with thorough literature research to deeply understand the intricacies of the topic at hand. Following this, you will immerse yourself in the existing software tools, gaining a comprehensive understanding of their functionalities and limitations.

With a solid grasp of both the theoretical background and practical applications, you will then identify sensible expansion options that align with our strategic goals. Once potential improvements are pinpointed, you will meticulously incorporate these extensions into the existing software tools, ensuring seamless integration and enhanced performance.

To make these advanced features accessible and user-friendly, you will also develop intuitive graphical user interfaces. By doing so, you will play a pivotal role in transforming complex data and processes into easily navigable and visually appealing formats, empowering users to harness the full potential of our innovative technologies.

This role offers a unique blend of technical challenge and creative problem-solving, providing you with invaluable experience in the realm of electric drive development. Join us on this thrilling journey as we shape the future of sustainable and efficient energy solutions together.

Job Responsibilities:

Orientation with the topic through literature research
Orientation with the existing software tools
Identification of sensible expansion options
Incorporation of extensions into existing software tools
Development of graphical user interfaces

Required Skills:

Ongoing scientific university studies in the field of computer science, computer engineering, automotive engineering, electrical engineering, mechatronics or similar courses of study in the natural and engineering sciences
Interdisciplinary understanding and knowledge
Basic knowledge of programming, preferably with Python
Basic knowledge in the field of electrical machines
Very good team player
Ability to work independently and implement innovative ideas

Transportation and Housing:

E-mail contact: poststelle@stw-thueringen.de

Please contact us for further accommodation options

Job Summary:

	To support the research and analysis of data to inform the development and implementation of the strategic, operational and business planning needs of the Ontario Science Centre.

Support conducting the research, analysis and reporting of sector and market research data and other research critical to decision making in the development of the Ontario Science Centre business and operational plans as well as strategic planning.

Quantitative and qualitative data analysis methods and techniques to conduct analysis of economic and social trends, industry best practices and directions in the innovation, culture and tourism industries findings and to develop communication and roll out plans to support planning initiatives.

Job Summary:

Federato is on a mission to defend the right to efficient, equitable insurance for all. We enable insurers to provide affordable coverage to people and organizations facing the issues of today - the climate crisis, cyber-attacks, social inflation, etc. Our vision is understood and well funded by those behind Salesforce, Veeva, Zoom, Box, etc.

Federato is the only AI-native platform that spans the full policy lifecycle and changes the way insurance work gets done. Better decisioning is built-in, not bolted on: insurers' unique portfolio goals, strategies, rules, and appetite are part of the workflow so underwriters win the right deals, faster. From the moment a submission hits an underwriter's inbox, AI is put to work, triaging submissions with a focus on high-appetite business, delivering real-time feedback on the portfolio, and consolidating workflows into a single proven system. Federato drives better business outcomes.

Job Responsibilities:

Partner with other FDE's and Technical Program Managers to implement Federato
Collaborate and work with cross-functional teams to provide a strong delivery experience for our customers
Develop and own and leverage project plans to effectively and proactively communicate program status, issues, and risks to stakeholders
Partner with cross functional teams to drive technical analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and post implementation phases
Drive internal and external process improvements across multiple teams and functions including reducing the manual efforts through automation

Job Summary:

Polaris Intelligence is an innovative company developing cutting-edge online data analytics applications for businesses to gain market and consumer insights. Our online analytics platform provides businesses with indispensable strategic consumer data, as well as spatial and analytical intelligence for sustainable growth. Our clients range from individual franchisees, to Fortune 500 retailers, to real estate companies and international consulting firms. Ideally, the co-op will have web development experience and work on web development. At a minimum the co-op student will do some QA.

We strongly encourage collaboration and sharing, informally and formally.
Our quick twice-a-day Stand Up meetings are an opportunity to briefly share what we are working on, ask questions, discuss some challenges.
Our weekly Code Review sessions are meant to encourage team members to show their work to the team, ask questions about the code and best practices, and let the team offer suggestions.
During our biweekly Code Base Architecture sessions, a full-time team member walks our software team through a piece of our code base and we discuss how that fits into the overall platform, as well as best practices to use.
During our weekly Demo/Presentation sessions, someone on our client team walks the whole team through a presentation, demo, or use case that we worked on recently, so that our whole team can see the business applications of our company, as well as the business applications of individual components our team members work on.
Our Tech Stack
We use JavaScript in a Symfony framework. We are using some React. Bring your toolkit of skills and help us make choices about our environment going forward.

To learn more about the Polaris co-op experience, read what a previous Waterloo co-op wrote about her time with Polaris: https://www.polarisintelligence.com/3-takeaways-as-a-quality-assurance-intern/.

This position will be 100% in-office in Toronto.

Job Responsibilities:

Co-ops get the opportunity to make a large impact. Previous co-ops have worked on features in our full codebase like a full-time employee, modernized the look of our webapp, developed a regression testing framework in Python from scratch, built on existing code to create new data products, written blog posts, and written the user manual that all new employees and clients receive.

Possible Responsibilities

Learn from and share knowledge in weekly code reviews, biweekly codebase architecture meetings, weekly demos
Software QA
Refactor code
Improve our user manual
Write monthly release notes for our webapp to communicate new features, capabilities, and offerings
Ad hoc support as needed

Required Skills:

Who are you?

You have programming experience.
You are high-energy, eager to learn, excited by new challenges, and a self-starter. Ambiguity doesn't scare you, and you're not afraid to ask questions when you need help.
You like finding bugs and you are thorough.
You will also have the opportunity to wear many hats and get involved in many aspects of a business.

Compensation and Benefits:

The specific amount will depend on the role, the candidate's skills, experience, and alignment between the candidate and the role.

Job Summary:

About Dasens
Dasens is transforming the world of intellectual property and innovation management through the power of artificial intelligence. Our mission is to make patent generation, R&D planning, and SR&ED tax credit management smarter, faster, and more accessible for innovators.
We're developing an AI-driven platform that automates patent drafting, prior art search, patentability analysis, and technical illustration generation - empowering companies to protect and manage their intellectual property with unprecedented efficiency. Beyond patents, our technology extends into SR&ED optimization, digital marketing, and innovation data management, helping businesses stay ahead in a rapidly evolving landscape.

Position Summary
As an AI-Based App Developer Intern, you will work on cutting-edge AI tools for patent generation and automation, contributing directly to how innovation is documented and protected. You'll collaborate on projects involving:
AI-powered patent drafting and analysis - integrating LLMs, RAG, and knowledge graphs to assist in intelligent IP creation.
Ontology-driven reasoning - enabling smarter document understanding and classification.
Workflow automation and testing - supporting our R&D tax credit and innovation management platform.
Digital marketing intelligence - applying AI to enhance visibility and communication for innovative companies.
This is a hands-on opportunity to build, test, and deploy intelligent applications that combine machine learning, automation, and domain-specific reasoning to simplify complex innovation workflows.

What You'll Gain
Experience developing real-world AI applications with cutting-edge technologies (LLMs, RAG, knowledge graphs).
The opportunity to work on AI-driven patent generation, a fast-growing frontier in legal tech and innovation.
Mentorship from AI engineers and IP experts passionate about bridging technology and innovation management.
A collaborative, startup-like environment where creativity and initiative are valued.

Under exceptional circumstances and backgrounds, we would also consider 4 months period as well.

Job Responsibilities:

What Makes This Opportunity Exciting
Work on real AI tools, not just prototypes - your code will contribute directly to live projects.
Gain hands-on experience with frameworks like Flask, Docker, LLMs, RAG, and knowledge graphs.
Collaborate with a supportive team of AI engineers and innovators who are eager to mentor.
Explore how AI, automation, and IP management come together to drive innovation.
Join a fast paced startup environment that values creativity, initiative, and learning by doing.

Key Responsibilities
Patent Drafting & Management
Build tools that automate patent and IP claim generation using AI-driven "idea-to-draft" pipelines.
Apply ontology-based reasoning for prior art analysis, classification, and portfolio management.

Ontology-Based Reasoning & Framework Development
Develop and refine ontologies for R&D, IP, grants, and marketing domains.
Integrate RAG + Ontology + LLM pipelines to enable semantic understanding and intelligent content generation.

Full-Stack & System Development
Develop and maintain Flask-based web applications for AI and automation workflows.
Use Docker to containerize, test, and deploy AI microservices and backend systems.
Collaborate on API integration, testing, and optimization for scalability and performance.

Digital Marketing & Customer Interaction
Automate and maintain digital marketing workflows for outreach and engagement.
Interact with potential customers to demonstrate tools, gather feedback, and identify improvement opportunities.

What You'll Gain

Practical development experience with AI and full-stack technologies.
Exposure to cutting-edge research and real-world applications in patent automation and innovation tech.
Mentorship and skill development in both technical and product-oriented thinking.
The opportunity to make a tangible impact in a company at the forefront of AI-driven innovation.

Additional Employment Arrangement Location Information:

This co-op is in person, located on the University of Waterloo campus. We are flexible about specific working arrangements (working from home several days per week, etc.), but expect the candidate to live in Waterloo (or closeby) and attend weekly meetings on campus.

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Special Work Term Start/End Date Considerations:

Accommodations related start and end date will be considered for exceptional candidates.

Job Summary:

The Socially Embedded Machine Intelligence (SEMI) Lab, located at the University of Waterloo's Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, is an interdisciplinary research group focused on the responsible development and deployment of cutting-edge AI systems. As a research assistant at SEMI, you will develop data exploration and explainability methods for Large Language Models (LLMs). The goal is to build tools that help interdisciplinary researchers understand how LLMs represent documents from their training data (e.g. correlation structures between documents on similar topics). You will contribute to an ongoing interdisciplinary collaboration between SEMI and The Digital Democracies Institute (DDI) at Simon Fraser University. The DDI investigates the impacts of mis- and disinformation on society, including investigating the biases and effects of homogenization in language models through data influence functions.

Both of these labs are collaborating on a research project that involves tracing the influence of communities, documents, and social relations within the massive text corpora that shape the behaviour of foundation models. Building on previous and concurrent work done in influence functions and graph representation learning, you will develop and improve upon the technical challenges of storing the large corpora behind foundation models (Wikipedia, FineWeb, The Pile, etc) in a graph-augmented data-lake architecture. This project will seek to detect communities online and measure the influence they contribute to specific linguistic axes at different levels of foundation models, and create an interactive dashboard to provide humanities researchers with an exploratory visualization to give cultural-linguistic meaning to those axes. You will also assist in writing these findings to be presented in various AI/NLP publications and conferences.

We encourage all applicants to apply, especially from equity-deserving groups. Our team is deeply invested in advancing equity for groups that have been historically underrepresented in research design, outcomes, spaces, and activities.

Education: Preference will be given to undergraduate students in Years 2-4 in the Faculties of Engineering and Math

Job Responsibilities:

- Report to supervisor Prof. Elliot Creager in weekly meetings, and work collaboratively with researchers at the Digital Democracies Institute. Present ongoing research to lab mates and write an end-of-term report summarizing experimental results.
- Produce a literature review surveying emerging techniques in data exploration aimed at making open-weights LLMs more interpretable.
- Attend weekly project meetings and lab meetings to discuss project updates, and broader trends in Machine Learning research.
- Build visualization tools and data harnesses for open-weights LLMs.
- Use and adapt open-source research code and models (e.g. pre-trained LLMs).
- Draft a paper submission for publication in a peer reviewed ML conference or workshop (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, EMNLP, FAccT, …).
- Be open-minded about receiving training and upskilling opportunities in new fields, including in advanced research methods and software

Required Skills:

Required Skills:
- Strong written and oral communication skills
- Programming in Python and familiarity with deep learning libraries such as Pytorch
- Familiarity with basic command-line utilities (ssh, etc.)
- Basic understanding of key concepts in machine learning and natural language processing

Assets:
- Coursework on ML and related foundational topics (linear algebra, statistics, etc.)
- Ability to read and summarize research papers, and identify related works
- Familiarity with reference and data management software such as Zotero
- Familiarity with cloud computing environments (AWS, OpenStack, etc.)
- Interest in building data-lake and graphical database architectures, and building visualizations for these data-intensive applications
- Ability to use and adapt open-source research code in frameworks like PyTorch
- Prior use of GPUs to train and evaluate ML models
- Experience with systematized use of prompting to interact with LLMs

Transportation and Housing:

The co-op will take place on the University of Waterloo campus.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary range between $10,800 - $11,800 for 16 weeks (hours per week to be negotiated), plus benefits and vacation time as per U Waterloo's recommended rates.

Hours: 35 hours/week

Job Summary:

Job Summary
Green Infrastructure Partners (GIP) is one of Canada's largest and most diversified infrastructure companies. We de-risk the most challenging parts of construction by offering vertically integrated infrastructure solutions for public and private projects of every scale. For over 40 years, our teams have been designing, delivering, and maintaining infrastructure for Canada's growing cities. From excavating and demolition to foundations, paving, and the production of materials, we have the unique ability to complete an entire project without the need for subcontractors. Green is in our name because we believe in the necessity of sustainable solutions. We're leaders in energy efficiency and we're at the forefront of incorporating recycled and reused materials. Green Infrastructure partners is currently hiring Site Coordinator. Reporting to the Project Manager and/or Sr. Project Coordinator, the Site Coordinator will be responsible for assisting organizing crews and equipment, supervising installations, and keep records of such activities. They will provide the controls and mechanisms necessary to support effective communications, as well as ensure a safe working environment. They are responsible for the facilitated control of the site and all employees and contractors upon the site.

Job Responsibilities:

Job Duties:

Assist the Project Superintendent in Managing and coordinating on-site operations;
Assist in establishing and monitoring construction work schedules including "look ahead" schedules
Liaison with General Contractors and Owners;
Communicate operational objectives with the Project Superintendent on a daily basis;
Keep and maintain the daily diary and appropriate records to fulfil the requirements of the contract and provide detailed history of site events and history;
Ensure all works meet contract document requirements and meet or exceed all applicable standards
Ensure compliance with all Federal, Provincial and local laws, particularly applicable Occupational Health & Safety Acts / Construction Safety Act regulations and environmental requirements
Provide input on site operations, in order to increase production or solve problems;
Support the implementation and maintenance of safety plans and tactics;
Ordering site-specific materials and supplies;
Conducting and documenting regular health and safety meetings;
Assist the Project Superintendent in the investigation of any incidents or complaints and preparation of reports;
Responsible for compliance and enforcement of all Company policies and procedures with regards to all employees and contractors;
Work closely and diplomatically with all personnel to maximize overall operational harmony, productivity and efficiency that will ultimately better serve the clients;
Such other duties and responsibilities as assigned by his/her Supervisor;

Required Skills:

Qualifications:

Currently enrolled in an Engineering degree/College Diploma or satisfactory combination of training and experience
Ability to read and understand construction drawings and contract documents;
Professional attitude and superior communication skills;
Possess excellent organizational, time management skills, foresight, accuracy, attention to detail and commitment to objectives and responsibilities
Pro-active and able to manage multiple priorities
Excellent organizational, time management skills, foresight, accuracy, and commitment to objectives and responsibilities;
Proactive and able to manage multiple priorities;
Effective problem-solving skills, with the ability to make good decisions that will meet or exceed project targets;
Exceptional conflict resolution, negotiation, and objection handling skills;
Ability to combine a focus on the big picture with a keen attention to detail, while working in a fast-paced environment;
Strong work ethic and positive team attitude, along with a commitment to staff privacy;
Strong organizational, written, and verbal skills.

Additional Information:

Own Transportation Required


Compensation and Benefits:

$19 to $27 per hour based on experience.

Job Summary:

Join OpenText's IT & Cloud Operations
Be part of the OpenText's Digital Organization- IT and Cloud Operations team, where you'll work with leading technologies to keep our cloud running smoothly. In this fast-moving, innovative environment, your ideas and contributions will help power the systems that keep global business running.

Your Impact
As a Full-Stack Digital Developer Intern at OpenText, you'll join a collaborative development team and help shape the digital experience our customers rely on. You'll gain hands-on experience building responsive web applications, working on both front-end and back-end components, and contributing to real projects that directly impact our products and users. This is a chance to learn, grow, and make a tangible impact while exploring the full-stack development world.

Job Responsibilities:

What You Will Do

Collaborate in an Agile team with other developers to design, develop, and maintain web applications.
Build responsive, accessible user interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Participate in sprint planning, code reviews, debugging, and performance optimization.
Work on both client-side and server-side components for seamless integration.
Support platforms including content management systems, digital asset management, and cloud servers.
Contribute ideas to improve architecture, code quality, and overall user experience.

Required Skills:

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (Year 3+ preferred).
Strong understanding of web development fundamentals: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Familiarity with front-end frameworks (React, Angular, Vue.js) and back-end technologies (Node.js, Python, Java, .NET).
Experience with version control systems such as Git.
Passion for creating accessible, user-friendly digital experiences.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
Nice to Have:
Previous co-op or internship experience in software development.
Knowledge of RESTful APIs, databases, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Familiarity with content management systems and digital asset management systems.
Git references of school or co-op projects.
One Last Thing
You'll join a team that values curiosity, creativity, and collaboration - where you can learn from experienced developers, contribute to real projects, and make a tangible impact on the digital experiences of OpenText customers.

Job Summary:

About ITpipes
Our cities are facing the enormous challenge of managing aging infrastructure with limited resources. At ITpipes, we're redefining how municipalities, contractors, and engineers manage their infrastructure with cutting-edge pipeline inspection software technology. This involves cloud and mobile applications, and major investments in AI technologies like computer vision. Our mission is to empower clients to streamline the process of inspecting, managing, and reporting on pipeline conditions, ensuring their infrastructure stays ahead of the curve. By joining ITpipes, you'll be part of a forward-thinking company that's driving innovation and helping communities thrive.

Your Job
As an intern joining our Seattle-based engineering team, you will get a chance to dive into real-world projects that impact the safety and longevity of essential city infrastructure. You will be a vital member of a dynamic team, directly contributing to our state-of-the-art cloud and mobile inspection platform. If you're passionate about learning, eager to build a career in high-impact software, and excited by the intersection of AI and infrastructure technology, ITpipes is the place for you.

Job Responsibilities:

Cloud-Native Development: Working on our scalable AWS infrastructure, utilizing modern services to deliver high availability and performance.
Mobile Application Architecture: Contributing to our cross-platform mobile solutions used daily by field engineers.
Applied AI/ML: Directly integrating computer vision models into production workflows to automate and enhance pipeline defect detection.
Full-Stack Exposure: Getting exposure to our entire technology stack, from front-end user experiences to back-end services and data pipelines.

Required Skills:

We are looking for motivated and curious individuals who meet the following requirements:

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.
Proven foundational knowledge in at least one modern programming language (e.g., Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, C#, Java).
Familiarity with software development best practices, including version control (Git) and agile methodologies.
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to tackling technical challenges.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills. You should be comfortable asking questions and sharing your ideas.
Bonus Points for Experience with:
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Frontend frameworks like React.
Basic understanding of machine learning concepts or exposure to ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Database technologies (SQL/NoSQL).

Transportation and Housing:

As part of this internship, we provide a housing/transportation stipend that fully covers monthly rent during the internship period.

Compensation and Benefits:

A paid, full-time internship (12-16 weeks) in our vibrant Seattle office.
Direct mentorship from Principal and Senior Software Engineers.
Regular 1:1s and feedback sessions designed to accelerate your growth.
Exposure to the business side of a fast-growing B2B SaaS company.
A collaborative and inclusive company culture with regular team events.

Job Summary:

Company Introduction
Founded in 2012, Ziyutec Inc. (EC Master Inc.) is a multidisciplinary engineering consulting firm in Richmond, BC, specializing in mechanical and electrical engineering services.
Ziyutec has successfully delivered hundreds of projects nationwide, serving clients across diverse sectors including government, commercial, residential, institutional, healthcare, life sciences, transportation, manufacturing, and industrial industries. We provide a full range of engineering services, including fire alarm and security system upgrades, tenant improvements, service upgrades, MEP design, feasibility studies, and commissioning.
Ziyutec is looking for a passionate Junior Software Developer to join our team and support our growth in the engineering consultancy industry.

Job Responsibilities:

Core Responsibilities

Participate in the development and maintenance of the company's full-stack products, writing high-quality, maintainable code using the designated technology stack and frameworks.
Deliver the full lifecycle of work based on business requirements, from technical solution design to implementation, deployment, and ongoing maintenance.
Continuously optimize API performance and improve both frontend and backend code quality to enhance system performance and user experience.
Proficiently use AI coding tools and apply them flexibly to real business scenarios to improve development efficiency.
What You Will Work On
Maintaining and enhancing Ziyutec's existing ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system.
Designing, developing, and implementing AI-powered applications to support engineering consultancy workflows.
Participating in the development of Ziyutec's renewable energy digital platform

Required Skills:

Qualifications

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering, or related fields
Strong proficiency in React, with extensive experience using hooks and building components; familiar with Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and related libraries. Preference may be given to candidates who are additionally familiar with UX/UI design.
Familiar with NestJS or other backend frameworks; practical project experience is a plus.
Strong familiarity with web hosting services.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office/Adobe Acrobat.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with a strong sense of ownership and responsibility; able to proactively drive projects forward and ensure high-quality delivery.
Ability to work independently on assigned tasks while collaborating effectively with the team.

Nice to Have
Experience using Python and related LLM frameworks for RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) development and optimization.
Strong IT/Network security/Network design skills.

$22-24/hr

Job Summary:

Why Ivo?
Contract negotiation is the most time-consuming, costly, and difficult component of the contract lifecycle-and it hasn't gotten much easier since the days of fax machines.

Large language models have unlocked the ability to solve many contract negotiation problems at scale. Our product is best-in-market (we have an 85%+ h2h trial win rate) and used by some of the leading companies in the world.

Overview
We are looking for motivated and curious Engineers who can help us make our users' lives better. You'll be working closely with the founders.

Job Responsibilities:

Role
Engineers at Ivo design, create and deploy generative AI products. Recent problems we solved include:

1. Representing contracts as merkle trees to avoid redundantly querying LLMs about clauses which have been copied between contracts (many such cases)
2. Building a communicating sequential processes library in JavaScript so we can share code and data between our frontend and backend, while pretending we're writing in go.
3. Writing an AI agent that generates regular expressions on the fly, to speed up automatic metadata extraction

Ivo might be a good fit for you if you:

You love writing code, but you love having impact more: We're a team of engineers at heart, but our #1 goal is building the best possible product. That means making pragmatic choices and looking for 80/20 solutions.
Would describe yourself as being relentlessly resourceful.
You have a strong internal sense of urgency. You have a bias towards doing things *today*, rather than tomorrow.
Experience working in a startup environment is preferred but not required.
Are excited about the adventure of building a company!

Required Skills:

Your Qualifications

Pursuing bachelors in software engineering/computer science/math.
Bonus if you have experience with Applied AI
Strong ability to learn new technologies and be productive in unfamiliar domains
Bonus points: Previously founded a startup
FAQ
How far along are we?
We launched in early access in 2023. Since then, we've had an incredible response from the market and are growing rapidly. We 6x'd in ARR in the last 12 months. Our clients include companies like Uber, Reddit, IBM, Canva, Pinterest, WordPress, and more. We're happy to share more details with candidates who go through our interview process.

Can I work remotely?
We require candidates to work with us in-person 5 days a week in our San Francisco office.

Is this a chill gig?
Startups are very hard, especially if they're growing fast. You'll have a ton of responsibility, and there's always an enormous amount of stuff to do. It's hard work but the payoff is uncapped.

Tech stack:
React / Redux Toolkit / Next.js / Node.js / OpenAI / Pytorch / Firebase / Azure

Compensation and Benefits:

USD $7500 per month and a USD $5k relocation bonus.
House Search Assistance

Job Summary:

Join OpenText's IT & Cloud Operations
Be part of the OpenText's Digital Organization- IT and Cloud Operations team, where you'll work with leading technologies to keep our cloud running smoothly. In this fast-moving, innovative environment, your ideas and contributions will help power the systems that keep global business running.

Your Impact
As a Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) Intern on our Cloud Operations team, you'll play a hands-on role in keeping OpenText's cloud platforms stable, secure, and high performing for customers around the world. You'll gain valuable experience working alongside experts in cloud computing, automation, and systems management, learning what it takes to support global-scale technology. Your curiosity and fresh ideas will help us continue to improve how we deploy, monitor, and maintain our cloud environments.

Job Responsibilities:

What You'll Do

Support the deployment of OpenText products across major cloud platforms.
Troubleshoot and resolve real-world operational and deployment challenges.
Assist with automation initiatives that make our systems smarter and more efficient.
Participate in upgrades, maintenance, and new implementation activities.
Learn how to build and manage virtual machines and Kubernetes clusters.
Get hands-on with Infrastructure-as-Code tools like Terraform and configuration management tools like Ansible.
Practice scripting and automation using Python, PowerShell, or shell scripting.
Collaborate with engineers and teams across Cloud Operations to ensure our systems run seamlessly.

Required Skills:

What It Takes

You're currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
You have a strong interest in cloud technology, DevOps, or site reliability engineering.
You're familiar with Linux or Windows operating systems.
You've explored scripting languages like Python, PowerShell, or shell scripting through coursework or projects.
You're analytical, collaborative, and eager to learn from others.
You take initiative, communicate clearly, and enjoy solving technical challenges.
One Last Thing
This is your opportunity to gain real-world experience in cloud operations while working with cutting-edge technology and talented professionals who want to see you grow. If you're ready to learn, contribute, and make an impact - we can't wait to meet you.

Depends on the program and work term number.

This job is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP) or Canada Summer Jobs. These programs require that candidates be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

Job Summary:

About FirstPrinciples:
FirstPrinciples is a non-profit organization building an autonomous AI Physicist designed to advance humanity's understanding of the fundamental laws of nature. Our goal for the AI Physicist is to achieve a breakthrough that unifies quantum field theory & general relativity and to explain the deepest unresolved phenomena in our universe by 2035. To do this, we're pioneering a new approach to scientific discovery by creating an intelligent system that can explore theoretical frameworks, reason across disciplines, and generate novel insights. We're a non-profit that operates like a tech start-up by moving quickly and continuously iterating to accelerate scientific progress. By combining AI, symbolic reasoning, and autonomous research capabilities, we're developing a platform that goes beyond analyzing existing knowledge to actively contribute to physics research.

Job Description:
We're seeking Machine Learning / AI Engineering Co-ops for a full-time, 4-month term (May-August 2026). This remote role can be based anywhere in Canada, with the need to travel to Toronto for an in-person team event during the term (travel expenses will be covered). As a co-op, you will join a team focused on challenges at the intersection of scale, intelligence, and reasoning, contributing to the development of next-generation AI models and agentic frameworks for scientific discovery.

Job Responsibilities:

Depending on your strengths and interests, you might work on:

Building and optimizing large-scale data and model training workflows for pre-training pipelines.
Experimenting with reinforcement learning from human feedback, reasoning benchmarks, and alignment methods for fine-tuning and evaluation.
Designing and scaling multi-agent systems that coordinate reasoning tasks across specialized models for model orchestration.
Contributing to internal frameworks that enable persistent, memory-augmented AI agents.
Exploring neural-symbolic architectures and applying LLMs to computational math problems.
Developing distributed training, inference, and evaluation systems for scale infrastructure.
Augmenting, designing, and inventing various tools within the ecosystem with interactive user interfaces for UI, graphics, and event-driven programming.
You will own a well-defined project and be treated as a full contributor, with your code potentially going into production and your experiments informing papers and deployed systems.

Required Skills:

We are looking for engineers looking to work on intellectually stimulating projects who are pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics, or a related discipline. Ideal candidates will have:

Hands-on experience with Python, PyTorch, CUDA or Warp or JAX, React, TypeScript, WebGL.
Interest in, or comfort with, distributed or large-scale training environments.
Curiosity about model internals, reasoning, and systems at scale.
The ability to thrive in ambiguous, fast-moving research environments and enjoy turning ideas into running code.
Experience with personal or research projects in ML, LLMs, reinforcement learning, or infrastructure systems.
Bonus points for contributions to open-source ML frameworks, experience with fine-tuning pipelines, or building tools around reasoning, math, or symbolic systems.

Transportation and Housing:

Students will be fully remote except for occasional travel travel to & from Toronto for all-hands and workshops during the work term period, which will be covered by FirstPrinciples.

Compensation and Benefits:

Our Compensation and Benefits are aligned with the standard Co-op Earnings Guidelines commensurate with the work term & Faculty of Science, Mathematics and Engineering as set forth here: https://uwaterloo.ca/co-operative-education/about-co-op/co-op-earnings

Job Summary:


The Associate Software Engineer co-op will be an entry-level member of a team focusing primarily on API development patterns, adoption and ecosystem integration. The co-op will use their software engineering prowess and experience to help create and implement new APIs using Sun Life's API ecosystem, provide API platform and onboarding support to new API developers, and help to create reusable libraries and patterns.

Job Responsibilities:

What will you do?

Collaborate with skilled Agile team members to develop, deliver and maintain high quality applications.
Develop efficient, high-quality, documented code.
Complete coding, testing, debugging and implementation activities as required
Manages or coordinates small to medium prototypes from ideation through planning, requirements, construction and presentation
Develops an understanding of the business and technical needs of a project
Identifies gaps in their own knowledge and actively seeks out assistance from senior team members in order to effectively deliver high quality solutions and services in a timely and efficient manner
Ensures that solutions meet both business and technical requirements, including performance, maintainability and stability

Required Skills:

What do you need to succeed?

Competencies:

A self-starter and self-motivated
Good organizational, multi-tasking and time management skills
Ability to quickly ramp-up on new technologies
Results focused - able to understand and act based on requirements & needs
Analysis and problem solving - ability to break down an idea, articulate the requirements into more detail in order to create a working proof-of-concept and/or prototype
Teamwork - ability to work collaboratively with others (technical and non-technical partners or team members) within an Agile team structure
Strong communication and presentation skills (written and verbal) - ability to express ideas, thoughts and questions so that they can be understood by various audiences, technical and non-technical

Technical Skills and qualifications:
Studying towards a university degree in Computer Science or a related field
The ideal candidate will have complementary experience with some/several of the following: Agile methodology, Object oriented analysis and design
Experience in web application development using some or all of the following technologies: Java, J2EE, Spring Boot, AWS Lambda

What's in it for you?
At Sun Life, you will be joining a purpose driven organization focused on helping Canadian's achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives.
As a student, you'll make a real impact by contributing to meaningful work, gaining valuable experience and actively working towards your team's goals.
You'll join our unique student culture, designed to help you grow both personally and professionally beyond your role.
We offer professional development workshops, student awards, socials and many more exciting opportunities.
We are honored to be recognized as Canada's Best Employers for Recent Graduates and Canada's Best Workplaces by Great Place to Work in 2025.
Your student journey is just the beginning and we're proud to help many who choose Sun Life to transition into permanent roles after graduation.

Range 50-65k

Job Summary:

Full-Stack Developer - University Co-Op Student:
We like to call Signiant one of Ottawa's best-kept secrets in the technology sector!

You already know our customers. They are brand-name, internationally recognized leaders in media and entertainment, including:

TV Broadcast: A+E, BBC, Discovery, Fox, NBC
Web, Mobile & OTT: Apple iTunes, Rogers Anyplace TV, Netflix
Studios & Production: 20th Century Fox, Disney, Marvel, NBC Universal
Media Services: BT Media & Broadcast, Deluxe Digital Studios, Technicolor
Sports: ESPN, NBC Olympics, NFL Network, NHL
Game Publishing: Electronic Arts, Ubisoft, Xbox
Used today by more of the world's top broadcasters, studios, media service providers, sports networks and game developers, Signiant delivers intelligent software solutions that facilitate the movement of file-based media between systems, applications and users from pre-production content and mobile news to finished-format movies, trailers and TV episodics. And with the acquisition of two companies in 2021, Signiant has moved well beyond fast file transfer. Headquartered in the U.S with offices and partners worldwide, Signiant is the company with the technology, people and industry experience trusted for fast, secure and managed media movement.

Signiant is growing, and we need motivated, innovative and passionate co-op students who want to play a significant role in building a better Signiant.

Signiant provides mission-critical products to leading companies in the Media and Entertainment industry. We are looking for a co-op student who would be focused on Agile story work within a full-stack development team, primarily developing in Javascript (Node) and React.

You aren't given special "student" tasks here at Signiant - you'll be working on SaaS features and functionality that will be put into production for use by some of the biggest names in the Media and Entertainment industry. You'll work in a fast-paced, modern, agile development environment where we use the latest tools and technology, including software from the biggest cloud vendors in the industry.

Signiant:
Used today by more of the world's top broadcasters, studios, media service providers, sports networks, and game developers, Signiant delivers intelligent software solutions that facilitate the movement of file-based media between systems, applications, and users from pre-production content and mobile news to finished-format movies, trailers, and TV episodics.

Headquartered in the U.S. with offices and partners worldwide, Signiant is the company with the technology, people, and industry experience trusted for fast, secure, and managed media movement.

Position Details: This co-op position is available in Ottawa (Kanata), Ontario.

Job Responsibilities:

Participate in Agile story development while gaining hands-on experience in JavaScript, React, AWS, and test automation tools.
Work as a member of a team to define and architect product features
Collaboratively develop product features while gaining experience in various languages and technologies.
Write unit and automated tests to ensure the correctness and quality of your code.
Build and deploy your code to production in a Cloud-hosted environment.
Work effectively within our Agile software development team.

Required Skills:

Technical Aspects of Working Environment:

Use Node.js and AWS services (including Dynamo DB) to build back-end services with a focus on micro-service architecture.
Build front-end interfaces using the latest tools and technologies such as React and Material UI.
Integrate with various cloud services such as AWS's DynamoDB, S3, Lambda, and Step functions.
Test and document with tools such as Swagger, Junit, Mocha, Percy
Learn how to deploy tested code into AWS production environments and how to set up proper monitoring for a world-class, scalable software solution.

Compensation and Benefits:

$28 to $38 per hour

Job Summary:

NeuroFlex is an award-winning medical device software start-up based in Canada & Australia. We develop a cloud-based software solution leveraging Virtual Reality (VR) and spatial computing to monitor brain health. We are seeking a driven, results-oriented web and vizs NeuroFlexer to contribute to our software release effort and help us deliver value to our end users.

Working closely with the development team that includes engineers and software developers, the successful candidate will employ his/her problem-solving skills to help us develop and implement new user experiences for our NeuroFlex® clients, maintain and develop a collection of consumption analytics and monitoring dashboards for our installed base. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge biomedical technologies and to watch their work improve people's lives and revolutionize brain health. We are a small and highly interactive organization, so interpersonal skills are a must.

Job Responsibilities:

We are looking for a candidate interested primarily in harnessing Tableau data visualization platform to deliver insights. The ideal candidate will also collaborate with other team members to maintain our new UI components and UI experience, while also not being afraid to take ownership of their work. You will be heavily involved in ensuring visually appealing front end displays and implementing efficient workflow. The main responsibilities for this role will include:

Develop and maintain Tableau Dashboards and Visualizations as required
Contribute to Front end of our AWS-hosted dashboard application
Contribute to Front end of our laptop-hosted VR-enabled assessment application

Required Skills:

Experience working with Tableau
Experience working with Django or other similar frameworks
Experience working with one of the following frameworks Angular, React, NextJS, or Flutter.
A solid understanding of SQL, rational databases, and normalization.
Nice-to-have: Advanced knowledge in mathematics, statistics, or data analysis. Prior exposure to software as a medical device regulated environment and HIPAA requirements
Education: Working towards bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science or equivalent industry experience.

Up to 30$/hr

Cobrand is a small team based in Toronto, united by a shared passion for music. We help artists and record labels build deeper connections with their fans while empowering them with data-driven insights and tools to run effective marketing campaigns. By providing a holistic view of social and streaming data, we enable artists to make informed decisions that fuel their growth. Our focus is to combine creativity with technology and redefine how music reaches and impacts audiences worldwide.

We are in office at King & Bathurst in downtown Toronto.

Work Term Duration:

4 month work term

Job Summary:

We are looking for a motivated Frontend Engineering Co-op or Intern to join our engineering team. You will work closely with experienced engineers and designers to build the user interfaces and interactive experiences that power our core products. This is a hands-on role where you will learn how production-grade applications are built using modern web technologies such as React, TypeScript, Tailwind, and Next.js while shipping features used daily by artists and their teams.

Job Responsibilities:

Build and maintain user-facing features using React, TypeScript, and modern frontend tooling.
Collaborate with designers to implement polished, responsive, and accessible UI components.
Work closely with backend engineers to integrate APIs and improve end-to-end product experiences.
Help improve frontend performance, reliability, and code quality.
Contribute to design system components and reusable UI patterns.
Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and product planning.
Debug issues, fix UI bugs, and help improve overall user experience.
Learn best practices for production frontend development at a fast-moving startup.

Required Skills:

You are currently enrolled in a Computer Science, Engineering, Design, or related program.
You have experience building web applications using JavaScript or TypeScript.
You are familiar with React or similar frameworks. Experience with Next.js is a plus.
You understand HTML, CSS, and responsive design principles.
You have an interest in UI and UX and enjoy creating clean and intuitive interfaces.
You enjoy solving problems and learning new technologies.
You take initiative, ask good questions, and enjoy collaborating with others.
Bonus: You have an interest in music, music technology, or data-driven products.

Transportation and Housing:

We don't provide transportation or housing.

Compensation and Benefits:

$30k - $40k for the term depending on experience.
Real-world experience building production web applications.
Mentorship from experienced frontend and full-stack engineers.
Exposure to a modern tech stack including React, Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind, and Django APIs.
The opportunity to ship features used by real artists and record labels (Fred Again, Dom Dolla, Sam Smith, Olvia Dean, Sienna Spiro)
A collaborative and creative environment where your contributions matter.
Flexible working hours and paid lunch in the office.
